updates.update_content: Dear backers, we hope that this update finds you well and in good spirits. Here at the Free League HQ things are hectic as always. The Symbaroum team has just sent Alberetor - The Haunted Waste (part five in The Throne of Thorns for the original game line) to print, and are preparing to distribute PDFs to pre-purchasers. At the same time, the RoS 5e team has reviewed a first draft of the entire Gamemaster's Guide and can conclude that the text is not far from being finished. Also, the Player's Guide has been laid out from start to finish - sure, there are still some gaps to fill, some tweaking and polishing to be done, but... Well, it would surprise us if we couldn't get the Alpha to you BEFORE Q4 2021. :-)

A certain emptiness consumes us, dear backers... This was three such amazing weeks that we will miss the daily interaction with you and seeing the continuous progress we made together. But that is how it is with Kickstarters, and luckily we can fill the void with fun work and dreams of the future. We will try to keep you updated on our progress, and you can always visit our forum where Jacob drops a note from time to time - currently about the task of converting the creatures of the Symbaroum Monster Codex to fit the Ruins of Symbaroum Bestiary. :-)

... or rather, it could have been the end, were it not for you, our amazing backers! Because of you, this is instead a beginning, hopefully the beginning of something that comes close to being as great as this Kickstarter experience has been.
It is late here in Sweden, so we hope you will forgive us for waiting until tomorrow with a more lengthy summary of the campaign. Right now we are all smiles and fuzzy feelings, which  was probably pretty evident in the Youtube countdown which ended a few minutes ago.  You can see the rerun anytime you like by clicking the image below.

updates.update_userinfo: WE HAVE EMPTIED THE DIG SITE!
updates.update_content: Or, more accurately, YOU have emptied it, dear backers! We hope that you are as happy about the thirty-two finds as we are, for the value they have added to your pledges, and for what they will add to your upcoming sessions at the gaming table. :-)

First, dear backers, amazing work while we napped! You blew past the folder in a hurry (yay!) and here we find ourselves closing in on the expanded ruins map. Will we also see the second art print in the bag before the end!? Either way, looking at the SGs uncovered, we hardly know what to say anymore...

Yes, dear backers, by this time tomorrow we will be crossing the finish line; we will have emptied this ruin of finds; we will have reach the bittersweet end - sweet, because of the awesome outcome; bitter, because... well, because this great journey has to stop. Since yesterday at about this time, we have been travelling with great speed, so chances are that we will reach the finish line running.

It was a while since we said it "out loud", but with 34 hours to go it is high time to repeat how incredibly grateful we are for the support and assistance you have given this project, dear backers. Thanks to you, Ruins of Symbaroum 5E will not only transform from idea to reality; it is already an immediate success that launches with readymade supplements, such as the GM's Screen, the two adventure books and the VTT-modules. We cannot thank you enough, but let us at least share another stunning art piece from the Bestiary with you!

That, dear backers, was the sound of us exploding, from joy that the base setting bundles will come to be fitted into super nice, Kickstarter exclusive slipcases! Honestly, that we (meaning you) managed to salvage this find little more than an hour after the reminder email started circulating… we did not see that one coming. Hence, all the more reason to rejoice, and to explode. :-)
Were it not so late we would surely grab our shovels and get back to work, since we will hardly be able to claim the adventure map of Kurun and Sarli just by standing around with these blissful smiles upon our faces.

Because you're worth it, dear backers! :-)
Call us overly confident, but since we now are quite sure that we will reach all the way to kr4.000.000 before the end, why take any chances with the slipcases? In other words, stretch goal #28 and #29 have swapped places, meaning that the slipcases are next on the list. We want you to have them! And, yes, we are quite keen on them ourselves...  :-)

campaign.story:
Sidequest Decks are system agnostic tabletop RPG plot outlines & maps. They  are perfect to pull out when your players unexpectedly take a casual  comment for a story hook and you need an adventure idea, or for planning  what dangers lurk in your kingdom. You may even chain several together for an entire campaign!
Each poker-sized card has a map on one side and a mini-adventure outline on the other side. The outline starts with a short description for the GM.  (Skim these to find an adventure that fits the circumstances.) Choose  between a couple of story hooks to get the adventure started. Next several encounter ideas move the game along. Customize them to match what your players do (drop some, change them to fit circumstances). Finally each card wraps up with one or two follow-up adventure ideas.
We've made 11 of these decks over the past few years, and now we're planning four more:
Stretch Goals
Friendly Shipping
We have friendly shipping for the US, Canada, EU, UK, Australia, and NZ thanks to distributors in those countries. See "Shipping" below for details.
More About Each New Deck
Over 50 cards of Monster Hunts & Lairs!  While  each will have a couple of unique ways to get the adventure going, these will also have a couple of cards dedicated to which creatures provide what magical effects (sorted by power/challenge) when crafting  magic items or powerful spells.  So if the characters plan to create an item that confers increased flight and regeneration, you'll have a couple of quests to find creatures with those abilities. Each sidequest card will also suggest alternate monsters for the adventure.
The Coastal Town Sidequest Deck has 51 mini-adventures designed to play out in a fantasy coastal area, with the adventure outline on one side and a relevant map on the other. The quests center on several VIPs in town who need help with various enterprises as well as threats off the coast & nearby caves. While the sidequests can stand on their own, they are also tailored to match the Coastal Townsfolk NPC Portraits Deck. Each numbered sidequest could involve an NPC of the same number in the NPC deck (though the sidequests do not mention them by name, so you can substitute in your own NPCs). The NPC decks are available as add-ons through this Kickstarter, see below.
We also made a deck of Frontier/Mining Townsfolk NPC deck in a previous project. Like the Coastal Town Quests deck, these mini-adventures use the characters from the frontier townsfolk deck, but they aren't required--fill in your own locations and characters as desired. The quests in this deck focus on the mines & a cult near town as well as several tasks key residents need help performing.
These 50+ sidequests focus on historical mysteries and lost artifacts of the real world. Perfect for a campaign of tomb raiding or following up on lost crusades.  While most are set in the first half of the 1900s, as outlines they are easy to move to other time periods or even different worlds & genres.
Virtual Table Top Maps
You'll also get PNG versions of any maps we create so you can easily share them with your players--or print larger versions.  For example, we make any battlemats at a scale of 75 pixels per square.
Samples
Troll Stew, card 14 from the Monster Hunts Sidequest Deck
Summoning Gone Awry! card 08 from the Monster Hunts Sidequest Deck
By The Rockets Red Glare, card 23 from the Monster Hunts Sidequest Deck
The Mummy Menace, card 36 from the Monster Hunts Sidequest Deck
The Price of Power, card 14 from the Coastal Town Sidequest Deck
Pocket Full of Trouble, card 18 from the Coastal Town Sidequest Deck
Stuffed to the Gills, card 28 from the Frontier Town Sidequest Deck
Loot Tunnels, card 33 from the Frontier Town Sidequest Deck
Reviews
"If you are a game facilitator that enjoys creating within a confined  space, I think these products will appeal to you. The outlines are  enough to keep you moving forward for a night of play but have enough  room to add your own traps, puzzles, monsters, or mechanical widgets  that I feel they can make for a comfortable backboard to bounce ideas  against." --Gnome Stew
"On each of these cards you’ll find what you need to fuel a session,  if not several–it’s not every day you can get a year’s worth of  adventure ideas in a single box" --Bell of Lost Souls 
"Highly recommend checking them out... If your players need a break from the main story line of your campaign, give these Sidequest Decks a show." --A Pawn's Perspective
Prior Sidequest Decks
The prior Sidequest Decks are:
After the TPK (Total Party Kill) - Ideas for the afterlife and how the party may return to the world.
Arcane Academy - Adventures centered on a magic school, for kid characters or adults.
Dungeons, Caverns, & Ruins Fantasy - Fantasy adventures in those settings.
High Seas, Pirates, & Ports - Fantasy & pirate adventures on the seas or port cities.
Horror Fantasy - Fantasy adventures with undead/necromancy themes.
Lovecraftian/Paranormal - Adventure outlines based on story seeds left behind by Lovecraft and other paranormal stories.
Modern (Criminals, Spies, & Supers) - Quests that take place in the modern day with mafia, spy, and super-hero themes.
Political & Urban Fantasy - Fantasy adventures in town and cities as well as political plots.
Science Fantasy - Adventures inspired by Jack Vance's Dying Earth, Thundarr the Barbarian, etc.
Science Fiction - Adventures set in the far future.
Wilderness & Frontier Fantasy - Fantasy adventures set in the wilderness or villages.
And as mentioned above the two Town Sidequest decks are related to our prior NPC Sidequest Decks Kickstarter, but they aren't essential if you plan to fit them into your own towns and NPCs.  If you wish to get the NPC Decks as part of this Kickstarter, they are available as add-ons. For that Kickstarter, we made the following NPC Decks:
Adventurers
Animals (Companions, Familiars, etc.)
Coastal Townsfolk
Frontier Townsfolk
Henchmen & Hirelings
You can pick any of the above NPC decks as add-ons, but only the Coastal & Frontier Townsfolk are related to the new Sidequest Decks. 
And if you don't want to wait to get our prior decks, the Sidequest Decks and the NPC Decks are all available in our store now.
Pledging
While we've set up rewards for one deck (or PDF), four decks, 10 decks, and 15 decks, you can pick any number of decks by adding more via add-ons.  For example, if you want 6 decks, pledge for four, then as you make your pledge you'll be asked if you want any add-ons.  Pick two more.  You'll also be able to add more via the pledge manager later but pledging during the Kickstarter helps us hit our goal & stretch goals. You'll pick which specific decks you want via the pledge manager.
Shipping
We're working with a company that has fulfillment centers located in the US, Canada, the EU, and Australia to minimize shipping fees for most backers.
We'll charge for shipping through the Pledge Manager which allows us to have more detail on the shipping rates.  After some recent kerfuffles with international shipping, we've decided to partner with another company to do fulfillment in order to make sure we have friendly shipping rates for the EU, UK, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, and of course the USA.  While we'll ship elsewhere, postage rates to other locations may be high. Here are our ballpark shipping rates, which do include VAT (money amounts in US dollars) where applicable:
USA: Flat $6 (any number of decks)
UK: 1 deck $13, 4 decks $17, 10 decks: $29, 15 decks: $35
EU: 1 deck $16, 4 decks $22, 10 decks: $34, 15 decks: $40
Canada: 1 deck $16, 4 decks $19, 10 decks: $30, 15 decks: $35
Australia: Flat $20, due to their low VAT and shipping.
New Zealand: 1 deck $25, 4 decks $30, 10 decks: $40, 15 decks: $50
Of course, if rates go up, VAT changes, etc., we'll have to pass that on.
Collaborators
We're blessed to work with a great team of innovative RPG creators:
Aaron Canton: Aaron is a professional writer who specializes in writing fantasy and science-fiction works, and has created content for a variety of literary universes,  role-playing games, and works of interactive fiction. 
Keith Curtis: Keith has done about half of the Cartography on our prior Sidequest Decks.  He has also done work for many other game companies, including work on the Babylon 5 d20 RPG, the Song of Ice & Fire RPG, and the updated 5e Keep on the Borderlands.
Misha Handman: Misha is a professional novelist and gaming writer who lives in the  Pacific Northwest. He has contributed to several earlier Sidequest decks, as well as work for White Wolf Publications and UFO Press. He is  proud to be the only person with his name on the Internet.
Josh Parry: Josh is a freelance TTRPG author who has worked with Nord Games and LoreSmyth as well as his own self-published titles on Itch.io and the DMs Guild. 
Andrew Shields: Andrew has worked on our NPC Decks and our system neutral creature cards.  He has his own publishing imprint called Fictive Fantasies and has worked for a number of other RPG publishers.
Joe Wetzel: Owner of Inkwell Ideas, Joe will manage the project, write some of the adventures, make some of the maps, and pick up anything else that needs doing.
And we're helped by Backer Kit:
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will be our 18th Kickstarter in 10 full years! While we are sometimes a month or two late, we always deliver. Because we've used a group of writers and artists over the years, we can easily bring on someone who has a great track record if someone else is falling behind. We also have worked with multiple printers in case something goes wrong with one of them.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Amazing! RPG Sidequest Decks Funded & Next Steps
updates.update_content:
Thank you all!  This has definitely been our most successful Kickstarter to date & I know you're going to get a lot of use from the resulting Sidequest (& NPC) Decks!  
We didn't officially hit the last stretch goal to make the Pulp Adventures Sidequest Deck 72 cards, but because we know there will be some late pledges, we're going to do it anyway!

updates.update_userinfo: Final 25 Hours! Here's how to help us make all the new decks 72 cards each!
updates.update_content: I hope you're as anxious as I am to see where this project ends up!  We've already expanded the Monster Hunts Sidequest Deck to 72 cards from the original 54 & we've also expanded the 6"x6" cards to 54 from 48. But wouldn't it be great to make all 3 other new Sidequest Decks (Coastal Town Quests, Frontier Town Quests, & Pulp Adventures) 72 cards as well?  They have already been expanded to 63 from the original 54, but 72 is even better!

Yesterday, we blew past our $140K stretch goal for the printed 6"x6" battlemat cards for $25!  (And the $130K stretch goal before that to make the Frontier Town Quests deck 63 cards, at no extra cost!)  We're happy you're able to help us make a better product!  We'll have another goal at $150K to increase the Coastal Town Quests deck to 63 cards, and another $10K after that to make the Pulp Adventures deck 63 cards as well. (We're basing the order of these goals on the poll results from one of our early updates.) And we'll have further stretch goals to make them each 72 cards like the Monster Hunts deck. (That stretch goal was placed first based on poll results.)

updates.update_userinfo: $120K Hit: Monster Hunts Deck Is Now 72 Cards (no extra cost) & Help Us Do More!
updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone,
Thanks to you, we just hit our $120K stretch goal--so as the title says, we're now making the Monster Hunts Sidequest Deck 72 cards at no extra cost to you!  This gives us even more variety for the monsters to include in this deck.
I did juggle around the 6"x6" battlemats deck stretch goal.  After considering it further, the battlemats for these are mostly already going to be created for the two town Sidequest Decks so it didn't make sense to make it a separate stretch goal.  Therefore, we've revised the $140K stretch goal to make the PDF & printed 6"x6" card deck. Previously the $140K goal was the digital version only and the $160K goal was the printed 6"x6" cards.

We've just listed our next couple of stretch goals.  I shouldn't be surprised that larger decks option was the clear favorite of the survey so far.  Right now we're at the cusp of the $100,000 stretch goal to expand each of the decks to 56 cards!  Here are the next couple that we just added to the main Kickstarter page:
$120,000: Our Monster Hunts Sidequest Deck will be expanded to 72 cards at no extra cost!

Welcome to The Fantasy Trip, the classic fantasy RPG of labyrinth adventures that is back and growing larger than ever! Thanks to you and many other fans of The Fantasy Trip, we have successfully run a total of eight different Kickstarter campaigns for The Fantasy Trip.

Fortunately for us, you've had as much fun incorporating the Hexagram content into your games as we have had creating each issue.

Are you new to The Fantasy Trip roleplaying game? The $60 reward is the perfect introduction to this classic fantasy RPG and includes everything you need to start playing the game! Two boxed micro-games, a collection of two solitaire adventures, as well as a dice bag and dice all for only $60! .

In addition to the above boxes, the $60 reward level also includes a custom dice bag as well as one copy of the Skull d6 Dice Set. 
 NOTE: Street addresses only.
After the Kickstarter project closes, and after all pledges are collected, we will open the BackerKit pledge manager. There, you will tell us your Warehouse 23 email address, provide your physical address, and pay for shipping (if you are receiving physical rewards). You will also have the chance to add more items to your rewards package. See the FAQ for estimated shipping costs.
Failure to complete your BackerKit survey by the deadline (which will be announced in a Kickstarter update once the pledge manager opens) will result in a refund and removal from the project. We cannot allow projects to remain open forever; we must set firm deadlines so that we can properly close campaigns.
If you wish, you may choose to use a fulfillment service. This allows you to pledge for the project and then provide us with a U.S. address for the delivery of your rewards. Forwarding from the fulfillment service, as well as any local fees, is your responsibility when using a fulfillment company.
INTERNATIONAL DELIVERY NOTE: There are no physical rewards offered to international backers. If the project closes successfully, we will offer the various titles through our online store, Warehouse 23.
We continue to search for reliable, economical solutions to international Kickstarter delivery.

campaign.story:
One's a real straight shooter. The other's a total wild card. But on the case, chasing down the murderer...they are always Partners.

Partners is a totally unique new storytelling game for exactly two players. A love letter to the police procedural and mystery of the week television genre, players take the roles of detectives hot on a murder case each session of play. Not only are you playing the two irascible, ill-matched detectives, you'll also play their boss, their subordinates and other familiar roles of mystery television. All you need is this PDF and a single pack of regular playing cards.
Interior art example. Final product may change.
Never seen any crime TV shows? No problem: the system does all the work. In a new twist on most detective games, instead of players trying to uncover a plot created by a GM, random card draws slowly reveal which suspects are in play and what kind of clues they provide. Only when the final card is drawn in the final scene will the detectives - and the players - know who did it.  The game is designed to suit experienced roleplayers and crime fiction addicts as well as novices to either.  The literary focus also means it works perfectly as a shared journaling game, or for play across internet video chat.
  Multi-award-winning game designer Steve Dee has been developing the game for over two years. The rules are written, the art is done and the PDF is ready to be sent out as soon as we fund. The last step that brings us to Kickstarter is turning it into a gorgeous fully-illustrated 140 page paperback, designed to look just like an old mystery novel. 
The Book
Partners is like no other RPG, so we want it to look like no other RPG as well. The book is a paperback designed to look like it was lifted straight from the 1980s pulp mysteries it emulates - without the actual low budget. 140 pages of text have been gorgeously laid-out in this evocative style by Matt Roberts, who won critical acclaim for his work on our previous RPG Relics. Complimenting this is the stylish pen and ink art by Kristopher Neal McClanahan throughout. Deep but economically written, it is a hefty tome of crime-busting storytelling tools that also fits in your pocket. The only other thing you need to play is a regular pack of cards. 
Final Artwork May Change
How to Play
Over the history of roleplaying games, designers have taken one of two approaches to mystery solving: either the GM knows the solution and must lead the players to it, or the players collectively come up with something plausible and the GM approves it. Partners instead builds a game where players discover the secrets through random card draws, then determine how and why they matter through their own invention. You won't tell the GM you'll head to the police station to check if any of the suspects have a criminal record in the hope that provides a lead, but rather be informed (for example) that the next clue lies in the criminal record, and which suspect it is about, then work together to describe the scene of how the information is procured, and exactly what it entails. 
The prompts are drawn from random card draws that cross-reference several interwoven tables, combined with random word generation. Players then work together to turn the prompts into scenes and plots, with a few wrinkles thrown in if they are the Wild Card or the Straight Shooter. 
Example: Drawing a three of spades tells the players that the next scene is going to involve a suspect they have determined is a long time friend of the victim, who has a motive of "Escape", and that the evidence coming in will be fingerprints or DNA. A random word prompt gives the word "trip". The detectives decide that some blood is found at the scene that doesn't belong to the victim but the long time friend. They insist it was from an accident where they tripped one day and fell on a knife. It sounds fishy. The friend hides their eyes. Are they ashamed of what really happened? Is the friendship abusive?
This "journaling" structure makes the game half roleplaying game, half script-writing exercise, so it is perfect for writers as well as roleplayers. It also means it can be played easily online, both over Zoom or through email or text chat. All you need is one other player.
You can read a review of the beta rules or listen to one here, on Inside the Caravan.
EDIT: Another review just came in! And another!  And this one. And one more right on the wire!
And a video review from Jenders Gaming. And you can see an amazing playthrough by the Boredom Breakers. That playthrough starts with the show already made but here's a look at how shows are built from Sam and Jamie. 

Wait, Only Two Players?
Partners is designed for just two players, but like all good games it comes with options. It can be played with one, or up to six players. No GM is required.

Stretch Goals
For Stretch Goals, we'd love to bring extra modules to help you explore different subgenres of mystery! These are called Files, and will be short sharp digital documents that give new tables for suspects, motives and clues so the genre is modelled precisely. The assumption of the core game is modern day Law and Order style cops but there is so much more we can do!
Backers at the digital level and above will get all achieved stretch goals!
$8000 - The Teatime File - UNLOCKED!
Like your mysteries solved by ladies of a certain age, be they Miss Marple, Jessica Fletcher, Precious Rambotswe or the ladies of Brindlewood Bay? Or just anyone who enjoys nice cups of tea and a bit fewer less blood-stained bathrooms? This is for you.
$10000 - The Noir File - UNLOCKED!
Listen up, flatfoots. This city is a powder keg and when it blows, you better hope you're not tied to the barrel. These mean streets have a different kind of mystery; black and white on the surface but underneath nothing but shades of grey. 
$12000 - The Junior Detective File - UNLOCKED!
Nancy Drew, The Hardy Boys, Encyclopedia Brown, the Famous Five - the best detectives are always the young. Nobody pays attention to them but they see everything. This expansion lets you play with young players, great for kids to learn to write stories!
$14000 - The Sherlock Holmes File - UNLOCKED!
The once and future king of the mystery genre is also the undisputed master of being the annoying Wild Card. And he remains the most represented character on film or TV by miles. We keep coming back to Sherlock, so let's make sure we do the original with style. 
$16000 - The Conspiracy File - UNLOCKED!
Everything is connected. Nothing is true. Around every corner, someone is watching. This is not just unravelling a murder, but peeling back the layers, all of them, back to the shadowy grey puppet masters who control everything. A different kind of mystery...
$18000 - The Cyber File - UNLOCKED!
The streets shine with neon and chrome. The world has changed, but crime is still the same, even if you can back up your brain online, robots can remember everything you ever said and corporations track your every move. The criminals just got smarter, so the detectives have to be smarter still.
$20000 - The Eldritch File
Something is wrong here. The crime scene is a study in emerald. The witnesses saw something move like no living creature. The shadows hide more than just murderers but horrors few can bear to see. Will you solve the mystery if it costs you your very soul?
And more to come!
Fulfillment and Postage
On this and future products, Tin Star Games is proud to announce our association with  Ink and Gumption. Using their well-established facilities and processes we can assure postage will be friendly to the UK, US, EU and China. We will keep postage costs as low as possible and delivery times as short as possible. Shipping will be charged after the campaign depending on region and should be within US$20-25 to any location outside Australia. Within Australia it should be A$10.
The Team
Tin Star Games is a powerhouse double-act of indie publishing. One's a dedicated artist and a genius at layout. The other's a wild card game designer who plays by his own rules. You know them from 2019's Relics and countless other indie roleplaying games available from www.tinstargames.com
Steve Dee has worked in the gaming industry for over twenty years and has won much critical acclaim and many awards for his work, including four ENNies and three nominations for Best Tabletop Game at the Freeplay Awards. His credits include Buffy the Vampire Slayer, Vampire: The Requiem, Shadows of the Demon Lord and Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay 2nd, 3rd and 4th edition. 
Matt Roberts is a Sydney graphic artist, designer and retoucher with over 30 years experience in advertising, design and print houses. He has done artwork for Rolling Stone, Empire and Ralph magazines and designed album covers for several local acts.

updates.update_content:
Just a quick update today:
You should have your Noir File supplement from DriveThru RPG! If you don't have it, let us know! If you do, let us know about your exciting noir capers! 
We're going to do one final download of all your pledge details and then close off any further ability for you to update your information before any more supplements come out. We'll do that one week from today so this is your last chance to make any adjustments to your records! This helps us begin costing out our postage costs as well, so make sure your postage address is accurate please!

Hey folks. One thing I love about digital products is we can update them. We noticed a few tiny errors in the game sheets: staging scenes were called Interim Scenes on the Rundown sheet, and that was confusing! Now we've fixed this and uploaded correct versions which you can go do DriveThru and grab whenever you like. This lets us get you the most perfect product we can without running out to stop the presses.
This week we also sent out most of the sketches for our backers who backed at the pledge level that let them be immortalized as Partners themselves! We loved seeing how happy folks were with their drawings. You'll also see this art coming up in the supplements we are working on, but here's a quick taste of some adorable kitten detectives!

Hi folks! Here's the weekly update!

Hard Copy: We're currently waiting for the printer to send us copies of the proofs. That usually takes a month or two to finalise, then we'll go into final printing! We've also arranged this week to ensure that all the paper and cardboard we used is sourced from FSC-certified forests, so every tree taken is taken sustainably and with replacement. We'll also be using a soy-based ink so there's no petroleum components therein. This won't slow us down or increase your costs at all.

What's up my friends it's time for a Monday Update on all things Partners. Today I can report that we are now waiting for the proofs from our Hong Kong printer. They should arrive in the next few weeks and we can get a sense of how this baby will come together. In the meantime, I'm going to run down where the supplements are in their process.
Broadly speaking, the RPG production process goes Writing, Editing, Layout and then Final Proofs, before publication. Here's where each of the seven stretch goal books are placed:

To quote the great detective Columbo, we just want to ask one more thing, then we'll get out of your hair:
So far less than half of you who backed at the highest level have got back to us with the information we need to make your portraits come to life! We need this from you by the end of May or we can't get the portraits out to you. Please get in touch immediately if you've backed at that level and not sent us more information.

Hey folks! As promised you're now going to get weekly updates every Monday so you can track exactly where we are with Partners!
I am happy to report that the print layout is now complete and we are sorting out the last few details of the visuals with our wonderful printer. They should be able to get started this week. We've also loved hearing your wonderful feedback on the PDF version and about games already hitting the table! We can't wait to hear more about your sessions! Keep sending them in to us here or to tinstargames@gmail.com

updates.update_userinfo: The One, The Only Matt Roberts
updates.update_content:
I'm Steve Dee - it's my name on the cover. But the other half of Tin Star Games is the incredible Matt Roberts. He's busy making the print version of Partners but he made time this week to get the single sheet versions up and now also do printer-friendly play sheets. The man is a machine. A terrifying, unstoppable machine. I throw a bunch of scribbled game mechanics at him, and he throws me back art. 
We've heard that some of you have had trouble with still not getting your Drive Thru notifications or the notifications coming up empty. This is apparently due to a glitch at Drive Thru where if you do a lot of copies at once it can drop some of them. I think I've resent all of the links again, if they are still coming up empty when you click on them, try .

Hey folks! We’ve heard your request for printer friendly sheets. We are working on it! We also know some of you have had issues with your downloads. We will get to you as soon as we can! Please be a little patient - I had to move house at zero notice today so things have slowed down a little! But tomorrow we’ll get back to it and start trying to solve the issues youre having!

Several of you were quick to point out that you read RPGs on your phones and a double-page version of the game is no good for that. We've now changed the files on Drive Thru so you get both versions. Your library should update automatically, or with a refresh. Let us know if it doesn't!

The word is on the street - and so is Partners. By now all backers should have received a link to download the PDF of Partners through Drive Thru RPG. Please let us know if you have any trouble with that or if you can't find your email! 
If you'd like to direct any friends to pick up a copy, they can find it here. 
Or if they'd like to late-pledge for the print copy, that can be done here.

campaign.story:
Engage in power struggles and build your crew’s reputation. Salvage and steal to survive and endure a ruthless universe. And above all, do anything you can to get that next job.
This sci-fi tabletop roleplaying game takes you to the grimy blue-collar future of a universe filled with risk, but also opportunity. DEATH IN SPACE presents a vision of space where technology is broken and dirty, and society is harsh and desperate. The player characters make up a crew with their own spacecraft or station, and take on the jobs they can find, in order to earn some well-needed bucks and get ahead in the power struggles of the stellar system. 
The people making this game are Christian Plogfors and Carl Niblaeus of Stockholm Kartell. With this Kickstarter, we hope to get the funds to print the core book for the game, which should contain everything you need to start playing. We want to continue making material for the game after the game is out, in the form of adventures and other material to use in your game. 
Follow us on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter or on the website. 

Here's a preview of what we hope the standard edition of the book will look like (the holographic foil is stretchgoal-dependent):
DEATH IN SPACE has its roots in the OSR scene, and follows similar design principles. In terms of setting and tone, inspiration comes primarily from the gritty science fiction of films like Outland and Prospect, classic westerns and the grimy future of early 80’s science fiction movies. 
It is a game about adventure and uncertain journeys out into the darkness of space, it is about you and your crew making a home of your spacecraft or station, in tough competition with everyone else, and most of all, it is about enduring in an abandoned frontier system where your only hope of surviving is to take any contract you can find, sometimes having to put your fate in your enemies' hands.
Inspiration
There are a lot of great and inspiring games out there. In terms of rules and approach, we have found inspiration in some form, large or small, in for example the following games (alphabetically listed): Coriolis, Into the Odd, Knave, Mothership, Mutant Year Zero, MÖRK BORG, Offworlders, Solar Blades & Cosmic Spells, Mutant  (1989 edition), Traveller. Out of these, MÖRK BORG, Knave and Coriolis deserve a special mention.
Most of the inspiration for the tone and feel comes from movies and series. Some of these, that have inspired elements of the setting in one way or another, are (alphabetically listed): 2001: A Space Odyssey, A Fistful of Dollars, Alien, Blade Runner, Escape from New York, The Expanse, Firefly, IO, Moon, Outland, Prospect, Sunshine, Total Recall, The Warriors. 
Visually, much of the inspiration comes from abstract geometric art and design, and old computer interfaces and manuals.

In terms of music, one of our stretchgoals consists of a dedicated soundtrack for the game, by our musician collaborator Helium Kid Kanon. You can already listen to a preview of what that will sound like on Spotify (or scroll down to the stretchgoal list and listen immediately). 


Standard edition with holographic foil (not final)
Kickstarter exclusive edition (not final)
Our main goal is to print a durable book of excellent quality that is easy to use at the table. We aim for an offset printed book with a sewn binding and possibly some fancy extras, depending on which stretchgoals are funded.
The book should land at about 128 pages and measure 6 by 9 inches. You can choose from two cover versions: the standard cover, and a special edition, only available in the Kickstarter.
Regarding the covers, we plan for the special edition to be a cloth bound book, and the regular edition cover to be embellished with holographic foil (the silvery kind with reflecting colors), if we fund the corresponding stretchgoal (otherwise, the holographic parts will be a solid color). Apart from that, there are more possible upgrades to the book in stretchgoals. Basically, we don’t want to pull any punches, and will try to make this as nice a book as possible.
Contentwise, the core rulebook contains everything you need to start playing immediately:
 Light-weight rules, intended to be easy to use and quick to learn
  A system for quickly generating player characters and their spacecraft or space-station
   60+ different modules to make the spacecraft or space-station your own
  An introduction to the default setting, the Tenebris stellar system, its main locations and history (with many pieces of the puzzle left for you to fill in)
  A system for repairs, where you collect spare parts to repair your stuff
   20 cosmic mutations, representing physical manifestations of the void through your body
  A system for spacecraft confrontations and boarding
  An introductory scenario to jumpstart your campaign
   40+ tables and generators packed with setting flavor
Below are some preliminary spreads to give you a flavor of how the interior of the book will look like:
The rules of DEATH IN SPACE are intended to be easy to use and hack but also to support and introduce the setting through the rules. While inspired by OSR games, the primary intent is not to be fully compatible with the rulesets and modules of old, but rather to try to capture the quickness and simplicity of these rulesets, tweak them according to our preferences and add some setting flavor (however, the rules are still close enough to other OSR rulesets that material should be possible to use with some simple conversions).
The basic rule when you try to accomplish something, say force open an airlock, or resist the effects of strange radiation, is to roll a d20 modified by one of four ability values, the ability determined by the nature of the task. If you roll over a fixed difficulty, you succeed. Failing checks gives you void points that you can use to increase your chances the next time you attempt something. Beware of saving up too many though, that might result in some nasty consequences. Void points are also used to activate cosmic mutations, strange powers from the void. 
The player characters are all part of a crew with their own spacecraft or space-station, their sanctuary in a dangerous universe. Characters are generated in a quick randomized fashion, making it quick to make a new one when (not if)  your character suffers an accident. With a list of 60+ modules that provide new possibilities, the players can successively customize their ship or station and really make it their home and base of their adventures. If your ship or gear should break, you can repair it as soon as you collect the necessary spare parts. In case you encounter rivals on your travels, the rules for spacecraft confrontations determine the outcome and whether you can avoid being boarded.
DEATH IN SPACE focuses on the Tenebris system—a system of planets and objects revolving around the star Tenebris. It is a stellar system ravaged by war and strife, where a greed-fueled mining for precious gems ended in a conflict that laid waste to the intricate trade networks that ensured technological production. With no new parts to find, almost every single object built today, from weapon to spacecraft, is put together from discarded, salvaged or stolen parts. Nothing is new.
As if rebuilding the system after the war was not enough, there are reports from stargazing cosmologists that the universe has stopped expanding, and that it has instead begun collapsing at an accelerating rate. The news that civilization is at its end have created a sense of hopelessness and disorder, and in many sectors of the system former vassals have taken this chance to seize control from distant rulers.
Player spacecraft concept by Mattias Astenvald
In the heart of the Tenebris system is the Iron Ring—a huge, ring-like structure surrounding the moon Inauro like a belt of metal. This is the center of activity in the Tenebris system, and here miners and salvagers huddle in cramped living quarters, waiting for their next contract and a chance to earn some much needed money. In other parts of the Ring, far from the bustling market-places and common areas, there are dark, empty sectors, where shady types hide from attention.
Among the people of the Iron Ring, cryptic rumors are spreading about a void accelerating the collapse. A void that whispers strange sentences to the unlucky through the ever present thick static noise that grows stronger and stronger as you travel towards the edge of civilization. A void that infects and corrupts and imbues their bodies with odd powers.
In the middle of all this are the player characters: hard-working explorers and laborers hoping for a big score.
The 99% Void Safe reward level
Void protection. With this reward level you get the core book in print, with the cover of your choice (regular or special edition). The book will be wrapped in foil, to keep it safe from the strange void radiation. Better safe than sorry. 
This is a mockup and not the final product.
T-shirt. Premium cotton t-shirt from Spreadshirt. We're aiming for a design based on the book cover.
Handouts. Two maps for the adventure in the core book—Welcome to the Ring—printed on high quality paper. 
Stickers. One prismatic sticker portraying the spacecraft by Mattias Astenvald, and one holographic sticker using the graphics from the standard cover. These designs are exclusive for the Kickstarter. Below are preliminary designs.
Setting location and printed note. We create a location connected to the Iron Ring—an establishment, a station, spacecraft or similar—and dedicate it to you. The locations are planned to be included in a table in the book. You get an individually crafted and printed thank-you letter that also includes the location name and description. 
50000 SEK – We make this book 
A high-quality offset printed 128-page book including all you need to start playing.
75000 SEK – Holographic foil cover
We add holographic foil to the regular book cover and make this book glimmer.
100000 SEK – Soundtrack
We ask our musician collaborator Helium Kid Kanon to make a full-length soundtrack for DEATH IN SPACE, that you can use as background music for your games. Every backer gets the soundtrack digitally, and it will also be made available on Spotify and Bandcamp. Here is how Helium Kid Kanon describes the soundscape for DEATH IN SPACE:
"Sound waves from dark, vibrating aegrine were found on a 570 million year old, volcanic island. When passed through a cloud chamber, they turn into an oozing, analog warmth, layered with sparkles of cosmic noise. These are some of the parts, arranged into a multi layered space. A composition that can trigger chronesthesia. The soundscape for DEATH IN SPACE."
 150000 SEK – Pamphlet adventure
We make a pamphlet adventure. All backers get it in pdf form and we include it in print with all rewards except Orbit Vagabond and Event Horizon Diver.
200000 SEK – More illustrations
We add more spacecraft illustrations by artist Mattias Astenvald to the book.
250000 SEK – Map poster
We make a map poster of the Tenebris system. For the map, we will receive some help from graphic designer and animator Gabriel Herrin. Gabriel did some work on the movie Prospect – one of the big sources of inspiration for DEATH IN SPACE – so we are very happy to have him onboard! All backers get it in pdf form and we include it in print with all rewards except Orbit Vagabond and Event Horizon Diver. Note that logos are placeholders and will be replaced.
300000 SEK – Bookmark ribbon 
We add a bookmark ribbon to the book, to make it easier to find the page you’re always flipping to.   
350000 SEK – More illustrations
We add even more spacecraft illustrations by our artist Mattias Astenvald to the book.
500000 SEK – New adventure
We ask Rickard Antroia to write an adventure for us. The adventure will be released in pdf and all backers get it digitally. Rickard is a writer and designer who has written adventures for Coriolis and Tales from the Loop and worked with editing on Tales from the Loop, Things from the Flood, Vaesen and Alien RPG. He wants to take you on an epic journey to the edge of the universe.
700000 SEK – Cults and factions
Pelle Nilsson - from Ockult Örtmästare Games, author of games such as MÖRK BORG and Barkhäxan among others, contributes to the game by providing a number of cults or factions of the Tenebris system that you can use in your game.

800000 SEK – Online generator 
We ask Karl Druid to make an online character generator for us. Karl writes material and makes virtual paraphernalia for tabletop RPGs. He is for example behind the MÖRK BORG online generators scvmbirther and dngngen.  

900000 SEK – Printed pamphlet #2 
We print the adventure pamphlet by Rickard Antroia from the 500k stretch goal. All backers with physical reward levels get it (all reward levels except Orbit Vagabond and Event Horizon Diver). This means that if you get the printed book, you get two different printed adventure pamphlets with it.

1,100,000 SEK – Solar Fields song and Tenebris system soundscape
Magnus Birgersson, also known under the name Solar Fields, will write and produce a track inspired by the material included in the book! Solar Fields has released 17 albums and appeared in over 60 compilations, including the in-game scores for the computer games Mirror's Edge and Mirror's Edge Catalyst. You can find his music on Spotify and on other platforms.   
In addition, if we pass this stretchgoal, Helium Kid Kanon will create a number of immersive soundscapes that represent various locations and environments in the Tenebris system. A perfect background to amplify your experience while exploring our world.  
The songs for the soundtrack and the soundscapes will be published on streaming platforms like Spotify, and backers get them digitally.
The majority of the money we collect will fund the printing cost for the book and any other funded print material. The remaining funds will be used to pay our collaborators for their work and costs. 
DEATH IN SPACE will be published by Free League Workshop, Free League Publishing's sublabel for externally designed games. They are responsible for shipping and distribution.
We plan to use a pledge manager, and charge shipping separately after the campaign has ended. See the map for our current best estimates of shipping costs*. The current plan is to ship the game from the UK as the default, but with distribution hubs in the EU and US as well. 
* This is based on shipping one book, the map and a pamphlet, and the Moon Outlaw and 99% Void Safe reward levels may therefore incur some extra shipping charges

Christian Plogfors. When he is not writing for DEATH IN SPACE, Christian spends the rest of his time on the layout and graphics for the game. He has been designing worlds for computer games for 18 years, now as a senior level designer, and has contributed to games such as Battlefield, Mirror’s Edge and Star Wars Battlefront. When relaxing, he likes to write material for his Into the Odd hack Into the Jungle. He has also contributed with material and layout for the Night Yeast zine.
Carl Niblaeus. While almost every sentence of the game has been dissected by both Carl and Christian, Carl has had the last word on much of the language in the book. In the RPG world, Carl has contributed to MÖRK BORG zine Feretory, the Night Yeast zine, and released one or two old school modules before that. He also helps running the so-called Old School Corner (“Old School-hörnan”) at GothCon, Sweden’s largest RPG con. There he referees his own and others’ creations. Outside of RPGs, Carl has a PhD in astroparticle physics, and has spent many years researching the underpinnings of our own universe. In DEATH IN SPACE, this knowledge is used to inspire the creation of another.
Collaborators
Apart from us there are a number of collaborators who provide invaluable assistance in making the game.
Johan Nohr. As one half of the team behind MÖRK BORG, Johan should be well-known to many in our audience. With MÖRK BORG, he works tirelessly to make it look as great as it does, and we are very happy to have him onboard. In DEATH IN SPACE, Johan has worked with the illustrations, adding touches to give them a more personal feel.
Mattias Astenvald. Mattias is an artist located in Uppsala, Sweden, working in the digital gaming industry. For our game, he helps make reality of our spacecraft and we hope to make use of his great skills as much as we can. 
Gabriel Herrin. Seattle-based graphic designer and animator. Gabriel did some work on the movie Prospect, which is one of the big sources of inspiration for DEATH IN SPACE, so we're really happy have him onboard. He will help us make company logos for the map poster. Check out more of his stuff here.
Stockholm Kartell is a creative coven of writers, designers and idiots. A group of friends who play and sometimes make games together.

https://www.deathinspace.com/

The game content is at the launch of the campaign about 90% complete, and we foresee no major changes after the campaign. After the campaign we want to spend about 2 months finalising the last few details before doing a proper round of editing and proofreading with a native English speaker. Our plan is then to deliver the game to the printer in September, which should provide enough time for the game to be in your hands by January 2022. 

Given the experience of Free League Publishing, we feel confident that printing, stocking and shipping will be in safe hands, and we will do our utmost to make sure that you will have your books by January! Hi everyone!
Here’s a small update on what's going on. Since last time, we have mostly kept working on finalizing the contents of the book. We have closed the chapter on rules, and are now working on all the tables and tools at the end of the book. 
We have also received some new art from Mattias Astenvald, that we can't wait to show everyone soon. One full spread showing a massive space station, and a smaller illustration of a spacecraft. And we have also received some great content from Pelle Nilsson, who is writing a couple of cults and factions for the book.

updates.update_userinfo: Pledgemanager is live + update from the studio
updates.update_content:
Wow, just wow! We are truly blown away by the huge level of support this campaign ended up with. THANK YOU! Thank you all so much for believing in this game that means so much for us.
We are now really excited to finish the last parts and get this game into your hands. We have tried hard to make a game that we want to experience and play ourselves, and now all of you have become a part of that. Thanks to your great support, we now have the possibility to make the game we wanted to make, and for this we are enormously grateful. And soon, it is your game too.

Alright, three days left now! Let’s keep our fingers crossed that we can clear that stretchgoal at 1.1M SEK!
We’ve had some questions about mechanics, and in this update we’ll go through the mechanics in a bit more detail, as they look now. Note that the rules are not completely finalized yet, and we’re still doing some playtesting, so some of what we write in this post may change. Most of it should remain about the same though.

Time for a short update. 
First something on stretchgoals: We have unlocked a second printed pamphlet! With that, we will now include a total of three adventures with the game—two pamphlets and one in the book.

We have also added a new stretchgoal. For us, music is a big part of playing and writing Death in Space, and if we pass this stretchgoal, we will get a soundscape by Helium Kid Kanon that represents various environments and locations of the Tenebris system. In addition, this stretchgoal includes a track written especially for the game by the musician Magnus Birgersson, also known as Solar Fields. Solar Fields is an experienced musician who has released 17 albums and appears on 60 compilations, so we couldn't be more excited to hear what he will create.

Alright, time for an update! We’ve been a little quiet for a few days, but in case you haven’t noticed, we have cleared a couple of stretchgoals since our last update, and added a couple of new ones. In Sweden we have had some days off for Easter, and it’s been good to have some time to think about the route ahead and to start working on content for the game again.
Let’s talk about what we have cleared:

We're still not sure whether we've landed on our feet yet after yesterday, but we are incredibly grateful for the support. With 500k SEK in funding, we just cleared a stretchgoal for an adventure (in pdf) by Rickard Antroia. This will be the third adventure included. 

Rickard is the main designer behind the recently released campaign module The Last Cyclade for the Coriolis RPG and has been involved in other games such as Tales from the Loop, Things from the Flood and Vaesen. He likes to write about mysterious phenomena, rickety tech, fights for survival and conflicts where it is hard to choose a side.

Wow, we really smashed through those stretchgoals faster than light speed. As of now, we have already unlocked the bookmark ribbon and secured funding for more illustrations by Mattias Astenvald. And of course, we have unlocked both the pamphlet and map, both included in print for rewards which include physical stretchgoals.
For the map, we'll get some assistance by Gabriel Herrin, a graphic designer and animator who worked on the movie Prospect. We're really happy about this, given that Prospect has been a great source of inspiration when making the game!

campaign.story:
In 2021, after years of unstoppable success in their meteoric rise, the renowned band ASHWELL suddenly vanished. Due to start a year-long world tour, they left their family, fans and sizeable fortunes behind. Clues about their disappearance have started to be identified in their tour brochures and prolific output by their fans, some of whom want the truth revealed and others who are determined to keep it buried.
A secret behind the band's success.
 A secret which would ruin them if it was revealed. 
A secret that the die-hard fans would do anything to protect from being revealed.
The Ashwell project came from a belief that puzzles with a narrative held more depth and interest for players. The Ashwell Tour Brochure is a professionally-designed and beautifully printed realisation of this belief. With a real-world reveal, the puzzles combine maths, logic, wordplay and decoding.
Behind beautiful but innocuous pages lie puzzles and secrets.
Players can also continue the story with their own fanzine, using our keepsake elements booklet and hand bound notebook. We want the answers to the brochure puzzle to be the stepping stones for the next part of the story. We have three possible storylines for creators to adapt, or you can generate your own - we would be delighted with either.
Use Ashwell Keepsake Elements to create a fanzine, a continuation story, a springboard for the puzzle investigation. Let your creativity explore all bounds.
All physical rewards feature the full colour, glossy print tour brochure, professionally litho printed on 130gsm coated paper. An accompanying Hints App will help you along the way should you need a guiding hand.  
There is a puzzle on almost every page, with each directly leading to a clue in the meta puzzle. You will require an internet connection for the final solution, but should be able to solve all the puzzles leading up to the final meta puzzle without one.  We don't want to give anything more away, but they range from the easy to the very hard. We estimate the game play time to be 1.5 - 3 hours, dependent on your puzzle experience and hint use.
Also available is a booklet of additional logos, images and mini puzzles for you to use to create your own keepsake fanzine. 
Use it to create a diary of solving the puzzles, logging the mysteries, or even continuing the story further. We have created  three possible future storylines for those who would like them, but would be enormously excited to see which other directions players may take the story.

We are  offering the option of buying an exclusive handbound A5 Notebook in which you can create your fanzine as part of the package. This uses high quality recycled cartridge paper, and is hand sewn with a fabric binding for a secure fit and beautiful finish.
Should you wish to become part of the tour crew and have your name in the publication, this limited reward is also available. If you really want to indulge yourself, you can even become part of the band! Included with this limited option is to have a significant date added to the tour dates list. An amazing birthday/wedding/anniversary present!
We have been so supported by the puzzle community that we have avoided spending any money at all on advertising. Instead, we are ring-fencing this money, and will  use it to support a fledgling puzzle project. At £5,000, we will put £250 into this pot - enough for a puzzle startup to get some printed samples, carry out some product research, commission a designer. More details after the campaign, but this will be offered to anyone who has pledged for a physical product in this campaign, and will operate by application. If you have any thoughts on this, please do message us, and we will build up a FAQ in response!
We are The Escapages, writers and publishers of Escape Puzzle Games. We successfully funded Flatpak in 2019 (a puzzle book disguised as a furniture catalogue) and Full Deck in 2020 (a three-book serial killer and crime board collection), and this is the first of our Kickstarters for 2021. Both the brochure and hints app have been fully play tested.
This project was created by Stephen, one half of the Escapages, after a conversation with his music-mad son during a woodland walk in lockdown. It mixes high production values, music, puzzles, keepsakes, journaling, scrapbooking and a real-life event which has seemingly been hidden under the fiction radar!
Here are some lovely comments from some of our play testers:
Despite everything being essentially ready for print, the current climate makes us cautious to promise anything too quickly. For full transparency, we were a month late for sending out Flatpak (during the start of COVID), but were a month early for Full Deck. We would rather over-promise and under deliver. To that end, we aim to send out all orders by the end of July 2021.

We are offering a superb product at an excellent price, and would rather offer you the best product we can at an affordable price for this short-run project, rather than galvanise support using the carrot of stretch goals. 

Having said that, if this project does gain a lot of support, we would love to be able to add little extras where possible. We would be keen to explore translated versions, wider (and purposeful) merch and even setting up a Creator Fund for future puzzle makers.
We will be using Gamefound again as our Pledge Manager. This will be open soon after completion of the Kickstarter, and will charge shipping through Gamefound. The buyer will be responsible for any import duties or taxes.

Some brief news for you all:

Dah dah da da. Etc.
We have less than 48 hours to go, and are inching ever closer to the stretch goal of £5,000, which will launch our Puzzle Creator Fund.
In essence, this will be for a person/persons who have an escape puzzle game they would like to launch into the world. While it is entirely possible to do this without a penny, some projects need a little stimulus, some research spend or even some commissioning to bring them to life. If you are a creator or maker, fledging games designer or simply a passionate puzzler, this is for you!

Dear Rockers,
Thank you so so much! The support for this little project from the puzzling community is absolutely incredible! We surpassed our funding target in two-ish hours, and it has been so lovely to see people sharing the project online. Two extra large thanks go to the amazing on Facebook - be warned, joining this active group will cost you a of money (in the best sense), and Angela from , who has been an enormous support since the earliest days of Ashwell. She was the first person I told about Ashwell, and her response spurred me on.

A big thank you to Dean Russell Productions for creating our video. 
 WOW JUST WOW! YOU ARE THE MOST AMAZING BACKERS EVER! WE ARE FUNDED!
Now on to the STRETCH GOALS!
STRETCH GOAL #1 is a gorgeous pin-up by Ashley Woods of Caitlin and Alma which is available to those who have pledged $10 and over to a physical reward.  (Scroll down to see the pin-up.) REACHED!
STRETCH GOAL #2  Six  amazing digital comics that are available to anyone who has pledged $6  and above! (Scroll down for details.) REACHED!
STRETCH GOAL #3 is a fantastical pin-up of Caitlin by Roberta Ingranata. (Scroll down for details.) REACHED!
STRETCH GOAL #4 Six fantasy digital comics that are available to anyone who has pledged $6  and above! (Scroll down for details.) REACHED!
STRETCH GOAL #5 Everyone who has pledged $10 and over to a physical reward will get one of each of our new BMS Owl magnet and the Plague Doctor magnet. (Scroll down for details.) REACHED!
STRETCH GOAL #6 Six fantasy, scifi and/or action adventure digital comics that are available to anyone who has pledged $6  and above! (Scroll down for details.) REACHED!
STRETCH GOAL #7 Wallpaper for your phone and/or laptop of our amazing cover. (Scroll down for details.) REACHED!
STRETCH GOAL #8  Our new Triquetra and Dirigible Magnets. (Scroll down for details.) REACHED!
STRETCH GOAL #9 Six fantasy, scifi and/or horror digital comics that are available to anyone who has pledged $6  and above! (Scroll down for details.) REACHED!
STRETCH GOAL #10 - Our new Bowler Hat and Teapot magnets. (Scroll down for details. ) REACHED!
STRETCH GOAL #11 - By popular demand, this stretch goal will be a print of the cover of The Book of Demons. (Scroll down for details.) REACHED!

BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY needs your help to print our new story, THE BOOK OF DEMONS (41 page story in a 48 page perfect bound book) and produce our NEW PLAGUE DOCTOR LAPEL PIN!
Here's our cover:

Who will love Boston Metaphysical Society?
Fans of Penny Dreadful, Girl Genius, Ruse, steampunk and gaslamp fantasy stories.
People who like to read paranormal, historical fiction, and/or alternate history.
If you like character-driven comics with a mix of paranormal and science fiction, then these are the comics for you!
THE STORY
When Erin, Caitlin’s mother, discovers her daughter can control a demon, she is outraged. In her mind, only a Great House has the right to such power, but who will listen to a poor Irish woman? House Lowell will. For Alice Lowell has inherited an old Puritan journal which describes how to find and enslave a demon, but she needs a psychic to do it. Kidnapping Caitlin is the first step in a plan to rid her husband’s House of debt. But with a demon to do their bidding, her ambitions will be limitless.
The Book of Demons can be read as a standalone, but it is a continuation of Ghosts and Demons.
First Three Pages:
NEW TO BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY?
If you are new to the series, the original six issue mini-series is about an ex-Pinkerton detective, a spirit photographer, and a genius scientist who battle supernatural forces in late 1800’s Boston. They  live in an alternate steampunk history where ghosts and demons are a normal part of life. Families known as the Great Houses control the economy of the Great States of America while the middle class and lower classes sole purpose are to serve the Great Houses.
The original trade paperback is available in several reward tiers.
WHAT'S IN THE TRADE?
I'm glad you asked. Not only does it include all six issues from the  original mini-series as well as the cover art, but it also contains a  ten page  short story called, Hunter-Killer,  and additional bonus pages. With art by Emily Hu and coloring by Gloria Caeli, the story is set at the beginning of the House Wars (my version of the American Civil War) and features the crew of a prototype airship.  I introduce three new characters: Gwen Warrick - Captain;  Emmet Rochester - Navigator; and Joaquin Medina - Engineer.
The complete sequential art version of Hunter-Killer will ONLY be available in the trade.
WHAT ELSE IS THERE?
Our three previous standalone sequels will be available as well. And they are:
THE SCOURGE OF THE MECHANICAL MEN 
STORY: Granville and Tesla are in a race for time to save Boston from a mysterious disease that turns human beings into machines.

THE SPIRIT OF REBELLION 
 STORY: Caitlin flees to Philadelphia only to discover a ghost, a rebellion, and perhaps, her destiny.

GHOSTS AND DEMONS 
 STORY:  A disturbing dream leads Caitlin and the team to face off with a new enemy.
THE BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY COLORING BOOK:
Twenty (20) gorgeous illustrations for you to relax  and color away to your heart's content. Includes illustrations of  Samuel, Granville, Caitlin, Tesla, Houdini, and more! It will be an 8  1/2 x 11 book and is suitable for all ages. Art by Alejandro Lee
OTHER REWARDS
In addition to THE BOOK OF DEMONS, we are offering the trade paperback, the anthology Boston Metaphysical Society: Prelude, the first novel set in this universe, Boston Metaphysical Society: A Storm of Secrets, plus a NEW PLAGUE DOCTOR LAPEL PIN. It is 1 inch in diameter and will be an antique bronze color. (Designed by Alejandro Lee.)
Lapel Pin Set
A set of SEVEN Boston Metaphysical pins (Plague Doctor, Bowler Hat, Teapot, Dirigible, Tesla, 1800's Box Camera, and Triquetra) in a lovely gift box with our logo are available as well. (As long as supplies last.)
BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY: A STORM OF SECRETS
The award winning novel, BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY: A STORM OF SECRETS, is a prequel to the original graphic novel though it can be read as a standalone. It takes place five years prior to the original series.
It was awarded a Silver Medal as well as The Write Companion Award for Best Overall TOP PICK - Adult, Children's and Young Adult categories in the 2019 Feathered Quill Book Awards.
Story: As the Great Houses of Boston jockey for power, an ex-Pinkerton detective, his psychic wife, and his father-in-law must contend with treachery, subterfuge, and a new supernatural threat, in this political and supernatural thriller set in an alternate-history Boston of 1890.
The award winning cover is by Luisa Preissler. Title Graphics by Anke Koopman.

And if you haven't read Boston Metaphysical Society: Prelude yet, then this would be the perfect time to get it. This anthology of short stories and novellas includes stories of how Granville and Samuel met and their first case together; what set Caitlin on her path; and how Samuel met his wife, Elizabeth Weldsmore Hunter. Several reward tiers  include it as either a pdf or print version.
The Underground - A Boston Metaphysical Society Short Story (Available as an Add-on for all tiers and is already included in the Granville Woods and All Things BMS tiers.) 
In The Underground,  Andrew O'Sullivan takes his young daughter, Caitlin, on a case that might reveal a past and a potential future neither of them expected. This is a prose story and is available in Epub or mobi formats. (Previously published in Last Stop on the #13.)
NEW REWARD TIER!
SPECIAL COMMISSION REWARD TIER (KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE)
Ever wanted to time travel? This will be the closest you’ll ever come when our fabulous artist Gwynn Tavares draws you into the illustration with the Granville and Alma (See image) in period costume. This will be an 11 x 17 inch poster on 80 lb. Classic Stripple. She’s only doing five, so jump on this now before they are gone.
 THE MONEY: 
SHIPPING:
Shipping last year was a challenge.  My stalwart shipping envelopes met their match at USPS, so this year I will be using the ULINE S-165 cardboard mailers (or their equivalent) along with boards and extra packing material for anything outside of California (and probably in California as well.) Those who order the Nothing But Books and All Things BMS will get the usual sturdy cardboard box as those have worked well in the past.
INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING: We were able to obtain discounted international postage for over 55 countries this year. I have passed on those savings to you depending on your shipping address. To extend these savings even further, for those who pledge to the Nothing But Books or the All Things BMS, and it is shipped to one of those 55 countries, we will be splitting up the rewards into two boxes in order for you to receive the discount. 
THE TEAM FOR THE SEQUELS:
Madeleine Holly-Rosing - Writer/Creator: A   TV, feature film, comic book writer, and novelist, Madeleine holds an   MFA in Screenwriting from UCLA where she won numerous awards as well as  the Sloan Fellowship. Madeleine has published a number of short stories, novellas, and a novel based on the BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY universe. Other comic projects include the short story, The Scout which is part of The 4th Monkey anthology, The Sanctuary (The Edgar Allan Poe Chronicles anthology), The Marriage Counselor (The Cthulhu is Hard to Spell anthology), The Glob (Night Wolf Vol. 1), Infinity Tree (Menagerie: Declassified) and the upcoming The Airship Pirate (The Rum Row anthology), and The Birth (Stan Yak Vampire Anthology).
Gwynn Tavares – Artist/Colorist: Gwynn started out her art career as a sculptor. After a few years working on   movie special effects, she decided to go into sequential art and was  the  artist for Amelia Sky. Majoring as in illustrator, Gwynn is also an  accomplished comedian and currently lives in France.
Troy Peteri – Letterer: Troy is a Los   Angeles based letterer whose credits include AMAZING SPIDER-MAN, IRON   MAN, and roughly 98% of all the comics from Top Cow Productions for the   last 6+ years. He also co-wrote and lettered ABATTOIR, a mini-series  for  Radical Comics.
THE TEAM FOR BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY TRADE PAPERBACK:
Madeleine Holly-Rosing, Writer/Creator. (See credits above.)
Emily Hu – Artist: Emily is a graduate from   the School of Visual Arts in New York City. She has been drawing ever   since she was little and it's been her lifelong dream to make it as a   comic book artist. Her main influences are Eduardo Risso, Becky  Cloonan,  and Ito Junji. She works freelance and has created covers for  BOOM!  BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY is her first comic book series. Emily  is  currently doing storyboards for Nickelodeon.
Gloria Caeli – Colorist: Based in Jakarta,   she has worked for Avicom Advertising and Stellar Labs. Her most recent   projects are BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY and VOODOO. She like anyone   else enjoys music, photography, travelling, and reads a lot of genre   related books.
Fahriza Kamaputra – Colorist:  Based in  Jakarta, Fahriza is a self-taught comics and concept artist.  He worked  as a colorist on VIENETTA AND THE STUPID ALIENS which led to  his work on  he webcomic ROKKI with Stellar Labs. His current work  includes Bob  Salley's, Salvagers and Shelter Division.
Shawn Aldridge (Letterer – Chapter 4) Shawn   Aldridge is a Portland based writer and letterer. He’s best known for   his awarding winning creator-owned sci-pulp series, VIC BOONE. He also   writes and co-created GoGetters from MonkeyBrain with artist  Christopher  Peterson. His work has also appeared in FUBAR, the NYT  bestselling  anthology series.
Troy Peteri – Letterer (Chapters 1-3, 5 and 6) (See credits above.)

The graphic novel was nominated for Best Comic/Graphic Novel at the 2014 Geekie Awards.
WHAT OTHER PEOPLE SAY
"Women and people of color take center stage in the Boston   Metaphysical Society comic, written by Madeline Holly-Rosing, with art   by Emily Hu. Inspired by fantasy and the art of storytelling,   Holly-Rosing uses her imagination to create a fantastic story that is   both well-written and fearless." - Valerie Complex (Fansided)
"If you have a taste for an intelligent, well written, elegantly   illustrated award winning independent book, you can't go wrong with   Boston Metaphysical Society!" - Alex Yarde (The Good Man Project)
"This very inventive series posits a totally believable Steampunk   world that is populated by appealing characters who act (and react) in   believable manners to the extraordinary events that swirl around them."  -  Robert Sodaro (Comic Reviewer at Examiner.com)
THE STORY BEHIND THE STORY
I love writing BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY.  Not only does it bring my  love of science fiction and history  together, (which by the way, equals  steampunk), the steampunk time  period allows me to address the themes  of classism, sexism, and racism  in America in a thoughtful and engaging  way. For at its very core,  BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY is an American  story. And you can't tell an  American story without including women and  people of color.
It has been and always will be important to me to write characters  who, though they come from diverse backgrounds and have different  points  of view, are able to work together for the common good.
