campaign.story:
Sentinels of the Multiverse: Definitive Edition

A mad scientist holds the whole world hostage with his doomsday device. A self-aware AI in a massive robotic form rampages through major cities, bent on the destruction of all human life. A chaotic earth spirit uses her control over the natural elements of the world to threaten all of humanity! A superpower supremacist leads her army of powerful followers to defeat any who would oppose her goal of global conquest! Only a few stalwart Heroes stand in the way of all these Villains and their dastardly plots!
These stories and more all come from the pages of Sentinel Comics, and in Sentinels of the Multiverse, you play out those stories! You and your friends take control of an array of powerful Heroes, standing resolute in the face of danger to protect the world. Can you defeat the Villains and save the world? Or will the Villains triumph, forcing the Heroes to regroup and fight another day?
Sentinels of the Multiverse is back, and better than ever! With all-new art, notably streamlined mechanics, and new stories to experience, this is the award-winning cooperative comic-book card game you’ve been waiting for!
We want this Kickstarter campaign to be as streamlined and efficient as the gameplay of this Definitive Edition of Sentinels of the Multiverse! There are only two pledge levels: 1) get the game, and 2) get the game and sleeves for every card in it. That’s it. Easy-peasy. With both pledge levels, you get a shiny set of foil cards for each of the character cards in the game! You could look at it as getting the $60 core game for $49, plus a $20 pack of foil hero character cards, villain character cards, and event cards for just $1! Also, you get the game/sleeves cheaper than it’ll be at retail, and it’ll get shipped to you before anyone or anywhere else!
Let’s talk about Stretch Goals: we’re not doing them! This campaign is about making the best version of Sentinels that we can. The Definitive version, if I may. So, this means we’ve known 100% of what’s going into it for months. No matter how massive this campaign gets (fingers crossed!) there are no stretch goals, because every dollar of this campaign goes to creating these games and sleeves, printing them, and shipping them to you!
There are Add-Ons available as part of this campaign. They’re for the same stuff as the two pledge levels: extra copies of the core game, and more sleeves! Every copy of the core game comes with a pack of the foil cards, so that's already built into that add-on. And the set of sleeves is the same as the one that's part of the pledge level!
So, if you want more of any of those things, add them in the Add-Ons section when you back the campaign. Straightforward as can be!
Sentinels of the Multiverse is a cooperative game in which each player controls a Hero, using their powers, abilities, and wits to work together with their fellow Heroes and save the world!
Each game involves three to five Heroes fighting against one Villain in a perilous Environment. The game is fully cooperative, so the Villain and Environment aren’t run by a dedicated player, but rather are controlled by turning over cards from their decks and following the instructions on those cards.
Each Hero, Villain, and Environment are represented by a deck of cards. Heroes and Villains also have character cards, which provide their Hit Points and other information specific to that character.
The game starts with the Villain turn, then each of the Heroes in turn order clockwise around the table. The round ends with the Environment turn. After the Environment turn, repeat the round, starting with the Villain turn! The game continues in this order until the Heroes save the Multiverse, or the Villain defeats the meddling Heroes, one way or another.
In updates to this campaign, we go more in-depth on the contents of the box, but know that this core game comes with a TON of content, including:
12 Heroes (Here's an update all about Heroes!)
6 Villains (This update is all about Villains!)
6 Environments (Look! An update about Environments!)
12 Hero Variant cards & 12 Event cards (An update about Variants and Events!)
Divider cards for each deck
A Rulebook AND a Lore Book! (Here's the entire Rulebook!)
HP spinners & Tracking Tokens (Even an update about components?!)
And a dedicated token box!
Hey, folks! Christopher Badell here. I’m the designer of Sentinels of the Multiverse and the writer of Sentinel Comics. In 2010, Adam Rebottaro (the artist for everything Sentinel Comics — you heard that right: Adam did 100% of the art you see in this campaign and this game!) and I had an idea for how to make the game we always wanted to play. A cooperative card game about comic books; about costumed heroes with powers and abilities working together against far greater threats than any of the heroes could handle on their own, but by working together, they could overcome. A game based in a vibrant world that represented many decades of comic book history, full of rich and dynamic environments that themselves played a part in the gameplay. This game was Sentinels of the Multiverse. We had a very ambitious idea of what this game could be, but part of that ambition did not involve what sort of product the game might be. Even when we teamed up with my friend Paul Bender — who is now the CEO of Greater Than Games — to create a company and publish this game, none of us really knew just how big this game could grow, or what this game could end up meaning to so many people.
Over a decade later, we have a bit better of an idea. The Sentinels of the Multiverse core game and many expansions have sold hundreds of thousands of copies around the world, won numerous awards, and inspired countless fan art, fanfiction, and scores of cosplayers. The world of Sentinel Comics has taken many forms, including a variety of board games, a hit podcast, and a recently released roleplaying game. But, even still, the most popular thing to come out of Sentinel Comics is the first thing: the Sentinels of the Multiverse card game.
We created Sentinels of the Multiverse over ten years ago, and we have learned a LOT since then. I’m a better writer and designer than I was then, Adam is a far better artist, and Greater Than Games is significantly better at making quality products. We have a bigger and better team than ever before. The original version of Sentinels was entirely made by me and Adam just at the start of our careers working in games, and it shows. And yet, it’s still one of our top selling games. It deserves another look — a new, more polished, more definitive edition.
And that brings us here, to the Sentinels of the Multiverse: Definitive Edition Kickstarter campaign! If you’re familiar with Sentinels, this is certainly still the game that you recognize, but cleaned up and improved in just about every way. All of the art is brand new. The writing and game design have both been stripped down to their core elements and rebuilt better and cleaner than before — the game plays more swiftly and smoothly now, and everything happening on the table is communicated in a way that keeps the players engaged, and the action moving forward. All of the graphic design is significantly improved, thanks to the expertise of our graphic designers, Rae Henderson and Darrell Louder. And the polish on the game shines brightly, thanks to the development and playtesting help of our Game Developer Manager Chris Burton and quite a few playtesters. We started working on this game in early 2020, and most of the last half of the year was spent in intensive playtesting to make sure this is the best version of Sentinels of the Multiverse that anyone has ever seen.
Is this game for you? Only you can decide! Hopefully the information in this campaign, the updates we’ll post over the course of it, and the helpful words from our playtesters (in the Testimonials section below) will give you some useful information. Plus, we’re offering a money-back guarantee — if you get it and you don’t like it, send it back and we’ll fully refund you. See more in the Money-Back Guarantee section, below. But first! Here are some video and audio recordings that might further convince you, in our own words!
I was very recently interviewed by Trevor, the A/V mastermind for GTG and producer of The Letters Page Podcast about just what all this is about:
Trevor also interviewed me and Adam on the Greater Than Games podcast, which you can listen to here!
Also, a couple weeks ago, we played a game of Sentinels of the Multiverse: Definitive Edition online using Tabletop Simulator to introduce the game to our friends Patrick Leder and Stras Acimovic. Want to see how it went, and what they thought? Check it out!
We spent the second half of 2020 and the first couple months of 2021 heavily playtesting all of the Definitive Edition material. Going into that process, a lot of our playtesters had a wide variety of opinions... and those opinions evolved significantly over the course of playtesting! Here are some of their thoughts:

"I was skeptical when I first heard about Sentinel of the Multiverse: Definitive Edition. I had already put hundreds of hours into both the physical and digital versions of the current game and didn’t think any small improvements could justify the costs of buying it all over again. But then I played it, and now I’m a believer. Omnitron feels more like Omnitron as he relentlessly builds up and then inevitably eradicates you. Bunker feels more like Bunker as his modes come and go and he maintains his various ordnances while scouring the field in fire. Megalopolis feels more like megalopolis as you scramble to keep a lid on the everyday emergencies popping up while the villain attacks. Playing against villains using their events rules feels like an entirely new game without greatly increasing the complexity, while critical events bring out mind blowing showdowns, sometimes against foes you would not expect. It’s smoother, sleeker, and dare I say just Greater. 
If you thought the first game was too clunky, you’ll love it. And if you loved the first game, you’ll fall in love all over again."
 —Brian Jewett, A.K.A. The Cult of Gloom

"When we playtesters were first told about Definitive Edition, I was excited to playtest it because I love Sentinels, but figured I wasn't going to buy it. Why buy a new game when it's mostly just new art, with just a few notably revised decks? But then we saw more and more, and more of the decks got tweaked, that the final product is amazing. Complex long-haul heroes can set up and be useful much more quickly. Simple heroes that used to do loosely-associated random things have tighter themes and more interesting mechanics. Cheese strategies have been de-cheesed. Villains are less likely to decide a game with a single poorly-timed play. What used to be "challenge mode" and came from a semi-secret downloadable PDF is now in the box, with better playtesting, and is part of a light campaign mode. What used to be "promo" content--variant heroes and villains which could only be found in Kickstarters and from cons--are also now included in the box, are also much more solidly designed, and in this one box there are already as many variant villains as the entire run of Enhanced Edition.
Originally I wasn't planning to get in on the Kickstarter, because, as much as I love Definitive Edition, it does only come with 24 decks instead of the over 100 Enhanced Edition decks I already own. But by the time it's all out again, it's going to be not only much better quality, but have much more content to boot. And Christopher has given us some ideas of what he's thinking about for the future, and it sounds really, really promising. (Plus, if anything isn't good, he's being really good about listening to feedback from us playtesters, and we're giving him plenty.) Anyone who knows me from other communities will know that I tend to be a hyper-critical contrarian. Enhanced Edition was my favorite sub-2-hour tabletop game of all time, and Definitive Edition is shaping up to be much better. If you like co-op tabletop games at all, this is the one you want."
 —Mindwanderer

"I initially had some reservations about Definitive Edition. While I would like to see new art, that alone wouldn't have been enough to sway me. By the end of playtesting, it had blown me away.  Bunker feels fantastic now. Fanatic screams her theme and playstyle like a real fanatical angel would. Absolute Zero doesn't just give up when his equipment is destroyed. Tempest actually feels like someone with control over the weather instead of just someone that shoots lightning bolts willy-nilly. 
While the mechanics have been cleaned up a good bit and there has been an overall balance overhaul, what really stands out to me is how much each hero feels like the heroes I've been hearing about on The Letters Page. The mapping of theme to mechanics is just stellar. I love the original game, and I will no doubt still play it from time to time, but I greatly look forward to DE hitting my table (and also hope that Handelabra makes a digital version, so it can hit my screen as well)."
 —Bryan Graham, A.K.A. Broccoli

"I love Sentinels of the Multiverse. We have a bi-weekly group that has been playing for nearly a decade, now! We have all things Sentinels-related, and thoroughly enjoy it. Now that we've played Definitive Edition, though, it's by far our preferred version. The consistency, the mechanical flavor, the art, everything about it is significantly improved! My spouse loved Fanatic before, but now she prefers the DE version and won't even play the original. I enjoy Absolute Zero and Argent Adept, both of whom recover from loss of cards in play much better than ever before. Things like that just make the game much more fun to play."
 —Russ Luzetski, A.K.A. Rabit

"I was definitely among the people who weren't convinced of the value-to-existing-fans of DE. But the Events, Critical Events, and ability to play through the Canonical Battles in the Canonical order as a campaign has made a convert of me. I was always going to buy DE anyway (even with 40+ years of tabletop gaming behind me, Sentinels is my all-time favorite, plus Adam's art is always worth the price of admission) but now I know that not only will the Definitive Edition be sitting on my shelf, but it will be hitting my table as well.
Ra has been my favorite Sentinels Hero since the original game came out. The cards that I loved in his old deck are still all there in this new version (several with upgrades), and the cards I didn't care for have been replaced with new, and much better, cards. Consuming Flame is my new favorite. And the Staff or Ra has been upgraded and has the potential to do a single massive blast of fire! Villains beware!"
 —Michael J. Ahlers, A.K.A. YakGuardian

"Sentinels of the Multiverse: Definitive Edition retells the stories you know and love from the original and enhanced edition content while doubling down on artwork and mechanics that directly detail those stories, as if the players were reading them in the comics they allegedly come from. The new format not only streamlines game play but clarifies the game phases much more precisely and allows players to get a much better feel for how their characters interact. The new artwork is a perfect facsimile of comics from a multitude of time periods ranging from the Golden Age right up to the present, including many homages to the great artists of those periods."
 —Zach Denoncour (Adjacent Hex Podcast), A.K.A. ALD_Zach

Hi, everybody! This is Paul Bender, CEO of Greater Than Games! I want to tell you a brief story about my personal experience with Sentinels of the Multiverse: Definitive Edition. 
Back in late 2019 and early 2020, Christopher and Adam had a series of discussions about their future vision for Sentinels of the Multiverse. The sweeping set of changes, tweaks, and improvements that you see in Definitive Edition grew out of those discussions, but for those first few months I wasn’t really a part of that dialogue (I was busy with various…. 2020 things. You were there; you know). 
Anyhow! Approximately one year ago, Christopher and Adam presented me with their vision of Sentinels of the Multiverse: Definitive Edition, and at first I was a bit skeptical that remaking the core game in the way they intended was the right way to go. However, they quickly convinced me. Looking at the new art that Adam was working on and playing through the new versions of familiar characters that Christopher was rewriting completely convinced me that Definitive Edition was both worth making and incredibly awesome. I realized at that point that the absolute best argument in favor of Definitive Edition is… Definitive Edition. I knew that some people would be skeptical, as I was, and I wanted them to have the same opportunity that I had to be convinced that Definitive Edition is really something that they want. Unfortunately, we can’t afford to send Christopher to everyone’s city with a pre-production copy of Definitive Edition, so we decided on the next best thing: The Sentinels of the Multiverse: Definitive Edition Kickstarter Money-Back Guarantee!
What is "The Sentinels of the Multiverse: Definitive Edition Kickstarter Money-Back Guarantee"? Simply put, if you back this Kickstarter campaign, you can return your copy of Sentinels of the Multiverse: Definitive Edition within 90 days for a full refund (including shipping), no questions asked. We believe very strongly that playing Definitive Edition will convince you that you want Definitive Edition, and we are willing to put our money where our mouth is on this one. Here are some more details on how this will work:
You have 90 days to request a refund, starting on the date of our Kickstarter update announcing that fulfillment is complete (and reminding you that the refund clock is starting).
Within that window, if you would like a refund for this product, please email contact@greaterthangames.com 
We will generate a shipping return label for you to print out. You will need to re-package your copy of Definitive Edition in its original packaging, affix the label, and drop it off at a FedEx facility. Your refund will be processed within 10-15 days of when the product arrives at our facility.
It is as simple as that! If you have any questions about this policy, definitely reach out to us and we’ll get them answered (and post the answers to any FAQs on this page).
This is Paul Bender again with another Kickstarter Shipping Explanation! Here's the deal with shipping and customs: it is frustratingly expensive — even more so after the events of the last year or so — and there is no legal way around how frustratingly expensive it is. We've tried many different shipping methods in the past, and we've always lost money on international shipping, no matter what we do. Our plan for this Kickstarter campaign is to fulfill pledge levels for North American backers ourselves, and use Spiral Galaxy Games in the UK to fulfill pledges for all of our other backers.
We looked at the rates that we paid last year to fulfill the Spirit Island: Jagged Earth campaign and used them as the basis for shipping rates on this campaign, since Jagged Earth and Sentinels of the Multiverse: Definitive Edition are of a similar size and weight. We then slightly subsidized everyone's rates across the board. That means that we'll be spending some of your pledge dollars on shipping above and beyond what you pay for shipping; the amount that we're charging you for shipping definitely does NOT cover the entire cost of shipping. Just enough of it to make sure that we're not losing a ton of money to shipping, as has happened traditionally. It also means that 100% of the materials, packaging costs, and handling for shipments will have to come out of the actual pledges and not the amount we charge you for shipping.
These shipping charges do not include VAT or customs duties. Talking with our contacts in the shipping industry and looking at our experiences with past Kickstarters, it is still unclear exactly how we (and/or you as the customer) will be charged, especially in light of Brexit. Given that, it is our current plan to charge VAT to backers via BackerKit after the campaign ends (so that we can be sure to charge the correct amount even if the VAT rates change this year). We will also work to minimize customs clearance charges, but depending on how a particular country works (again, especially considering Brexit), customers outside the US or UK might wind up with some delivery charges. Based on our past experiences, this is fairly rare, but does happen. We wish we could offer more clarity on exactly how this will work, but global trade is in massive flux right now so it is impossible to know for certain what will happen. However, we'll post updates with any clarifying information about shipping and VAT charges, both during the campaign and after, if things solidify.
Below are the shipping charges for this campaign. The first number is the base shipping price for a pledge level. The second number is the additional shipping charge for each copy of an add-on.
US: $9 / $5
CAN: $25 / $12
Zone A: $35 / $18
Zone B: $55 / $27
Other: $69 / $39
The "Zones" you see here are based on zones that FedEx and other carriers use to price packages. We've cross-referenced these with our recent Spirit Island: Jagged Earth Kickstarter fulfillment and set the prices for each zone several dollars lower than the average amount we were charged to ship to that zone.
Zone A: Belgium, Denmark, France, Germany, Great Britain, Italy, Liechtenstein, Luxembourg, Netherlands, Spain, Switzerland, Ireland, Sweden
Zone B: Austria, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Finland, Gibraltar, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Israel, Malta, Mexico, Monaco, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Turkey
Finally, there are unfortunately a few countries to which we cannot ship. We've attempted to ship to these countries in the past, only to have the vast majority of parcels lost or returned after very large shipping charges. There is no way to exclude countries from shipping on Kickstarter, so if you back the project from one of these countries, we will unfortunately have to refund you your pledge. We don't like it anymore than you do, but we have even less power than you do to change the laws of the country that you live in! 
Forbidden Zone: Brazil, Cuba, North Korea, Russia, Syria, Venezuela, Yemen
Overall, we are confident that this system of shipping is most fair and equitable to everyone, based on how much we'll be paying to ship out the rewards for this Kickstarter. If you feel the shipping costs associated with backing this Kickstarter are too high, we can only hope that they game does well enough to be available for purchase in a place closer to home for you.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is a bit of an unusual Kickstarter campaign for us, which introduces some new risks and challenges that we haven’t encountered before. The first is that this is the first time we’ve run a Kickstarter campaign for a new edition of a previously published game. Is this the right way to go about it? We think so, but it is impossible to know until we do it!

Separately, we also anticipate concern from some backers about the timeline of this project. In the past, we have run several Kickstarter projects that ran significantly behind schedule before delivering. Fortunately, we believe that we have a foolproof solution this time around! Sentinels of the Multiverse: Definitive Edition is already fully through the development, design, and layout process, and has in fact already begun pre-press work at the printer! While there is still plenty of space for unexpected delays in production or shipping, the single most delay-prone portion of any project, the development phase, is already complete.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
SIN is the second full-length sourcebook for the Spire roleplaying game. You can learn more about Spire on our website.

In Spire - a mile-high city riddled with betrayal and inequality - the Ministry of Our Hidden Mistress fights with dagger and shadow against the cruel High Elf overlords, waging a hidden war of sabotage, insurrection and assassination. 
Sin focuses on three main elements of the city of Spire:
Criminal enterprise is big business everywhere in the city, but particularly in the lawless knot subterranean of violence known as Red Row and among the feuding public house Knights of the North Docks. We go into great detail on the different families and "noble" knightly houses, take a look at the gods and goddesses of illegal endeavours, and shine light on the unfathomably callous high elf murder mystery parties (containing real murder).
The Spiral Council does what they can to uphold a corrupt peace in Spire, but even with a network of guards, militias, undercover operatives and a fully-mobilised army at their command they still struggle. Learn more about the Paladins hunting the Ministry, visit the nightmarish environs of Spire's most dangerous and most secure prison, and infiltrate the ranks of the Allied Defence Force to steal experimental aelfir technology.
With the arrival of the sun-worshipping high elves, much of the religion practiced by the drow inhabitants of Spire was driven underground centuries ago; now, it has twisted itself into something bitter and vengeful as a result. We explore the triparite Damnic faith (the Cathedral of Our Glorious Lady, the Ministry of Our Hidden Mistress, and the vicious Crimson Vigil) as well as looking into the Old Faiths of the Home Nations and the endless parades and rituals of the Solar Pantheon.
All of these sections are backed up with character options, equipment advances and NPCs that allow both players and GMs to use the content provided as easily as possible at the table. 
But that's not all! We've also got:
Two New Classes
Lie to gods for a living as the Gutter Cleric
The Gutter Cleric is an experimental field theologian who hacks together magic from forbidden, dead or merely unpopular gods into unusual effects (in fact, two of their Medium Advances are almost entirely redacted); the Mortician Executioner is the sharp end of a great and powerful administrative organisation devoted to declaring luckless individuals legally dead and then correcting the oversight at swordpoint. 
Read people their rites as the Mortician Executioner.
And: Three New Full-Length Adventures
 The Hand of the Gods sees the Ministers pitched into the middle of a war between three cults all fighting over the same holy relic - the hand of a saint who is connected to one, all, or none of the organisations in the conflict. How can they exploit the situation to their advantage?
In Second-Hand Rain, a demonic eidolon appears in the city of Spire and bring with it the noir  atmosphere of an hard-boiled interbellum crime fiction thriller. The eidolon can bring down empires in the wrong hands; do those hands belong to the player characters?
Although the aelfir have been unable to summon their gods to Spire, The Birth of Brother Harvest unites the Autumn Church and the Midwives as they grow a wretched, deformed murder god in an upspire hatchery. What does it take to kill a god, and do the Ministers even want to? 
A Revolutionary's Guide to Spire
In addition to all that, we're continuing the tradition of our newspaper clippings and The Spiral Muse to bring you The Revolutionary's Guide to Spire, a zine created by the writers of Liberate! (voted Spire's Most Illegal Publication three years running). Discretely released on a quarterly basis, TRGS has the unbiased low-down on all the coolest nightlife spots, where to buy a revolver without getting robbed and/or killed, up-to-date codephrases and ciphers and how best to escape from the City Guard. Rumors that the TRGS is secretly funded by radical aelfir elements looking to promote their own businesses and badmouth their rivals are not to be entertained.
The Revolutionary's Guide To Spire is a companion zine for Spire, filled with in-character adventure hooks, NPCs, setting info and tidbits for you and your players to enjoy. You can add it to your rewards by choosing the Revolutionary Hardback tier.
We're offering flat rate shipping for the Kickstarter only. You'll be able to combine your pledge with our other products in Backerkit later on, and we'll do our best to keep shipping costs as low as possible. Our books will ship either from the UK or the US, and we aim to offer EU-friendly shipping with duties paid.
Endorsements
“Spire’s a mix of narrative freedom and wired and weird narrative detail, its ideas thrusting up from the landscape of fantasy game, visible to miles around. Even my hatred of Elves can’t lower my admiration” - Kieron Gillen (the Wicked + the Divine)

“Howitt and Taylor lovingly built Spire out of compelling plot hooks that will motivate any group of players to chase the satisfaction of smashing it into glistening pieces... a smart balance of well built action and socio-political commentary.” - James D'Amato (The One Shot network)

“Spire has one of the most intriguing settings of any game I’ve come across, backed with elegant and simple mechanics. It’s a fascinating RPG experience.” Adrian Tchaikovsky (Shadows of the Apt, Arthur C. Clarke Award winner)

“This is an edifice of urban fantasy with the electricity of Miéville at his best, and the pressure-cooker claustrophobia of Blades in the Dark. It’s bombastic, sexy, downright political stuff which rises up from foundations in the deepest strata of Gigaxic kitsch into the thin air of pure invention.” Nate Crowley (The Death and Life of Schneider Wrack, The Sea Hates a Coward)

“Grant and the Spire team have answered one of the oldest questions in fantasy: how to do something different with dark elves. Their answer is Spire, a police procedural in Hell, a baroque conspiracy thriller and a heroic tragedy all wrapped up in two mile high feral walls and urban chaos.” Alasdair Stuart (The Doctor Who Roleplaying Game)
Add-Ons
We're going to handle add-ons post Kickstarter via Backerkit; you'll be able to add any of the other books we produce onto your order to save on postage, and they'll all be delivered alongside delivery of Sin. 
The Team
Veteran Spire authors Grant Howitt and Christopher Taylor have returned and put together a team of new and established authors to write Sin. For those of you familiar with Spire, you'll be pleased to welcome back Chris Farnell, Pauline Chan, Basheer Ghouse, JP Bradley and Helen Gould - and we're happy to add Cat Evans, Eleanor Hingley, Cleo Keahna, Thomas Manuel, N MasYk and Viditya Voleti to the growing list of people who've helped us create this  world.

Some of these writers have years of experience in the field; for others, this is their first full-length commission. Over the last few years we've been hand-selecting a suite of writers who, regardless of their prior work, get Spire in a way that we recognise - and can communicate it well with the reader.  We're so excited to work with them and take the world in directions that, alone, we never could have taken it whilst staying true to the high standards of writing that we've set ourselves.

Adrian Stone is returning with full-page, full-colour art (as you can see throughout this Kickstarter) and Rowan Rook & Decard's first actual employee, Mina McJanda, is handling the graphic design and layout.


All stretch goals will be made available to all backers at PDF level or above in digital format. If possible, we'll make any unlocked stretch goals available for purchase as physical add-ons through the post-campaign Backerkit.

£24,000. NORTH DOCKS PUBCRAWL MAP. A map of the city's favourite down-Spire entertainment district - the North Docks - detailing the dozens of Knightly Orders, the pubs they own and operate, and the wide variety of drinks specials and fatal threats on offer there. [Artist: Kyle Latino]
£31,000. SPIRE QUICKSTART. A slimmed-down summary of the rules, five pre-generated characters, an introductory adventure and everything you need to get started with Spire.
£38,000. SOLAR BASILICA MAP. The Solar Basilica is the heart of aelfir faith in Spire, and the official state religion of the area. We'll take a look at the four subsidiary temples that surround the central structure and see how the different cults (of Sister Spring,  Father Summer, Brother Autumn and Mother Winter) are constantly striving for control. [Artist: Carly A-F]
£45,000. MORE ART.  We'll get Adrian Stone to do some more illustrations. He gets more money, you get more pictures of drow, everyone's happy.
£52,000. RED ROW MANSION MAP. An in-detail map of Destera House, a crumbling mansion (complete with palatial, if decrepit grounds) on the outskirts of Red Row - filled with secret passages, NPCs to charm and betray, opulent decor to pawn off once you've pried it out with a crowbar, and presumably some kind of fancy party to sneak into. [Artist: Alex Damaceno]
£59,000. THE MAGISTER'S GUIDE. A set of advice, guidelines, essays and supplementary systems intended to help gamesmasters get the most out of their games of Spire.
£66,000. HIVE MAP. The Hive is Spire's most secure and most dangerous prison, and we'll be taking a look inside it at the wide variety of ne'er-do-wells, brigands, science experiments and luckless individuals who were in the wrong place at the wrong time. Maybe you could even free some of them, if you're feeling generous. [Artist: Marco Bernadini]
£73,000: BONUSES FOR EVERYONE! Everyone who we hired for this project will get some more money because we (and you!) like them. 
£80,000: GM SCREEN AND CONSPIRACY KIT. We’ll make a GM screen pack with the following things in it:
A nice GM screen with art from Adrian Stone on the front
  Several panels of said GM screen with important rules referenced in brief (mainly: the result table, fallouts, and instant NPC generators)
  12 postcard-sized illustrations of NPCs
  6 postcard-sized illustrations of locations
  A guidebook with random tables for each location and NPC that you can roll on to stitch everything together into one big conspiracy with differing motivations, weaknesses and dirty secrets
 
Who are we?
Rowan, Rook and Decard is a roleplaying games design studio and publishing house that operates out of London and Sheffield in the UK.  Founded by Grant Howitt, Chris Taylor and Mary Hamilton in 2017, we've recently brought on Mina McJanda as our first full-time employee.  We've published three full-length roleplaying games as well as a wide variety of sourcebooks, shorter games and play aids since our creation.
We make excellent games for a living. You can learn more about us and our previous work by taking a look at our website here.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The text for Sin is roughly 90% complete and ready for editing; what remains is art, layout, production and delivery. This is our sixth Kickstarter, and we have plenty of experience in the field of making excellent roleplaying games and sending them to people.

Should our illustrator Adrian Stone be unable to fulfill his obligations - and he's delivered on all three major releases we've worked with him on in the past - it'll be a damned shame as he's very much come to represent the look of Spire, but we have connections with other artists and a flexible enough budget to accommodate the loss.

Unlike all of our previous projects, our layout artist is now an in-house full time employee, giving us much more flexibility and control over the final product.

We have an established relationship with our printers - Livonia - who we've worked with on both our recent Heart and Unbound Reprint Kickstarters. Although we had some problems getting books from them to us thanks to Brexit, we've set up a stable import connection so it hopefully won't cause us problems in future.

We will be working with Parcelhub for fulfillment (who we have worked with successfully for the previous 5 Kickstarters); Studio 2 Publishing will handle our US and Canadian orders; we are hoping to work with Kixto to ensure that European orders can be fulfilled with no additional post-Brexit costs. Rules around shipping to the EU will change in July this year; given that we're hoping to deliver late in the year, we'll have plenty of time to create an efficient solution for postage. We're also allocating a larger shipping and delivery contingency budget than ever before on this project after our experiences with Heart taught us that a pandemic can really mess with postage times and costs. 

The previous 12 months have been unlike any other we've experienced in our lives, and they've presented unprecedented challenges with regards to - well - everything. We don't know what will happen over the duration of this project with regards to the wider world, infectious diseases, supply chain disruptions and Britain's increasingly strained relationship with its neighbours, but we promise that we'll remain transparent and tell you what we know, when we know it, so you can stay up to date.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey folks,
Just a quick update: we're a few days off launching the Backerkit which will let all of you input your addresses, add stuff to your pledges, and so on. We had to get some quotes in place for the products so we were sure we weren't going to over- or under-charge you!
CONSPIRACY KIT AND GAMESMASTER'S SCREEN

We've just funded at 93 grand. We continue to be amazed by your faith in us.

Here's the deal: we aren't a big company. (Most of us in the industry aren't!) We're four people who made a risky choice to do what we love instead of throwing ourselves headlong into capitalism. We've worked hard to build something that supports us and allows us to keep a roof over our collective head, to put food on the collective table, and that's all thanks to people like you.

Hello!

We have opened TWO Cult of Personality level slots (you get a bespoke cult, rules and artwork included in the book) and FIVE Non-Player Character Assassination (you are immortalised as a supremely killable NPC in the book) to allow folks who missed out on them the first time the chance to get involved.

NEW STRETCH GOALS
We’ve passed all of our stretch goals, which is great! But it means we’ve had to come up with some more, which is difficult. It’s a good problem to have. We’ve done a bunch of thinking and not a small amount of maths and here are the NEXT TWO stretch goals:
If you'd like to learn more about one of the new classes in Sin, the Mortician Executioner, you can take a look at the class breakdown we just posted on the Rowan, Rook and Decard blog.

Exciting news! We've just rolled over £59,000 in pledges, meaning that all backers of this project will get PDF copies of the Magister's Guide - a sourcebook written for gamesmasters of Spire of all experience levels, helping you to get the most out of the game whether or not it's your first mission for Our Hidden Mistress or if you're a scarred veteran of a dozen shadow wars.

campaign.story:
Black Box
The Black Box is a brand new expansion for Catacombs 3E. It features a new double-sided playmat featuring the Athenoch Mortuary on one side and the Notholag Dungeon on the other. 
It provides a full set of alternate monsters cards for the base Catacombs game plus every expansion published so far including: Cavern of Soloth, Ice Box, Keystones & Keeps, Resurrection Packs 1 & 2, and Wyverns of Wylemuir. 
There is a new set of monsters for the Vermin family and the new Mushroom familiar for the heroes. The expansion provides room cards featuring these new Vermin monsters and the Burial Chamber special room card.
In terms of rules, this expansion introduces the snowball ranged shot, group rush shot,  move to rune "shot" and the transmogrify shot modifier. 
The box artwork  is an homage to the cover of Catacombs First Edition, first released over ten years ago.
Stretch Goals







Upgrade Levels

Reward Levels
Add-ons
Videos
Catacombs Third Edition (Catacombs 3E)
Catacombs is a dexterity based, one vs many dexterity dungeon crawl.  Four heroes are selected to protect the town of Stormtryne by battling  their way through countless enemies before finally facing the dreaded  Catacomb Lord.

Each hero has their own unique set of actions, abilities, items or  spells that aid them through the various rooms and encounters.
The Overseer player controls the monsters and the Catacomb Lord, acting as the adversary the heroes aim to defeat.
There is a near limitless combination of rooms to explore. Some rooms  have a swarm of monsters that the heroes must fight through to succeed.  Others provide unique encounters where the heroes can spend their hard  earned gold on new items, healing services, or even gamble to gain every  edge they can against the Overseer player.
The actions a character may take are determined by the rules provided  on their cards in the form of shot sequences. Each shot does something  different. Some do varying amounts of damage, while others can freeze  opponents, scare them off, or teleport allies out of danger, to name a  few. There are dozens of shots in Catacombs.
Just using a shot doesn't always guarantee its action, however. In  order to be effective, players will have to train their dexterity skills  and accurately flick wooden discs. Ducking in and out of cover,  positioning shots, and banking attacks off obstacles are essential  skills to an experienced player.
If the heroes live long enough to breach the Catacomb Lord's Lair,  they will meet their final test - battling the Catacomb Lord them self!


FAQ
Question: What are the main rule changes to Catacombs & Castles 2E (second edition)?
All heroes in the base Catacombs & Castles 2E game now have a native ability on their hero rules cards. As a result, heroes from the base game only use one ability card.
Catacombs & Castles 2E hero portrait and rules cards are included for the King's Champion, Royal Archer, Wraith Knight, and Shaman increasing the roster of heroes in the base game from 8 to 12.
The base shot sequences for all 8 of the original heroes included in Catacombs & Castles 1E were updated.
The rules for ability cards were harmonized between Team Mode and Boss Mode. In summary, ability cards are always charged up.
The placement of the obstacles during game setup was simplified.
The shield shot rules in Catacombs & Castles 2E were harmonized with those from Catacombs 3E.
The longbow shot rules in Catacombs & Castles 2E were harmonized with those from Catacombs Conquest.
The shuriken shot has an additional effect.
The rules for the net and web shots were changed - they no longer trap players and prevent them from taking an action.
The same hero cannot damage the same opposing character consecutively during a shot sequence.
The horn team action permits only one teammate to perform a shot sequence.
The orange ice shot icon was replaced with the ice boulder shot icon.
The orange target ice shot icon was replaced with a blue target ice shot icon.
The target ice shot and ice boulder shots enable assist transfers.
The fireball and giant fireball shots enable void transfers.
The term grapple shot now refers both to the original grapple shot and the claw shot.
Explanations of the the runic shift, move to rune, hook, and lightning shots were added to the Castles 2E core rules.
The Castle Lord's starting Armour was increased to 3.
The Wraith Knight's starting Health was increased to 12.
Question: Do the playmats have stitched edges?
No, as these interfere with game play.
Question: Will the "Big Box" versions of Catacombs & Castles 2E and Catacombs 3E be available at retail?
No. They will only be available now during this campaign and later from our online shop.
Question: What are the main changes to the second edition of the Wyverns of Wylemuir expansion?
There are additional cards for both Castles 2E and Catacombs 3E compatibility. The game board has replaced by a 3E sized, double-sided playmat.
Question: What if I already own the Wyverns playmat but don't have the Wyverns expansion?
The Wyverns components without the box or playmat will be available directly in the Elzra Pledge Manager after the campaign ends.
Question: What about "group buys"?
Please contact us by submitting a business inquiry ticket.
Question: What time zone are you located in?
Eastern Standard.
Question: What is the best way to contact you?
The best way is by submitting a support ticket via our website. This opens a ticket in our system to ensure we don't miss it. As always, we are a small team and it may take some time to reply.

Sales Tax & VAT
Canada
Prices expressed in pledge / reward levels for backers in Canada are in Canadian dollars and are exclusive of GST / HST.
We must charge applicable GST/HST to all orders from backers within Canada. This is a legal requirement to ensure our company's compliance with both the law and with the Canada Revenue Agency's rules.
UK and European Union
There are significant regulatory changes in the UK and European Union that will affect all Kickstarter campaigns. These are BREXIT, Import Control System (ICS2) and the VAT De Minimis Removal.
 BREXIT (January 2021): Will require Customs Declarations for EU-GB-EU shipments. Affects shipments from the European Union to Great Britain, and from Great Britain to the European Union 
 Import Control System (ICS2) (March 2021): The enhancement of the security screening program will require that certain shipment data elements be sent to the EU Customs authorities for review and approval prior to loading at the country of export. Affects shipments from everywhere in the world to (or transiting) the European Union, Norway or Switzerland 
 VAT De Minimis Removal (July 2021): The abolition of the 22 Euros VAT De Minimis for imports into the EU will result in formal Customs clearance for all inbound EU shipments and the levying of VAT. Affects shipments from everywhere in the world to the European Union 
With these changes, Customs authorities are further enforcing the regulatory requirements related to the provision of complete and accurate customs data in order to optimize security and safety screening, as well as combat counterfeiting and piracy, prevent unfair competition and ensure full collection of duties and taxes.
UK
Prices expressed in pledge / reward levels for backers in the UK should be considered exclusive of VAT.
VAT on your selected reward level will be collected during the Elzra Pledge Manager. VAT will also be collected on the cost of shipping.
One of the main changes that will affect customers from 1st January 2021 is the change to the deemed place of supply of goods. As things stand now, goods are subject to VAT in the country in which they are located at the point of sale.
The government is proposing that from 1st January 2021, a Business to Consumer sale of goods to a UK consumer will be deemed to take place in the UK, even if the goods were located outside the UK at the point of sale. 
Read more here.
European Union
For an overview of the current VAT system in the European Union, please see this article (europa.eu).
There are significant regulatory changes scheduled to come into effect on the 1st of July, 2021. 
The official memo from the European Union regarding these changes can be read online here:
Modernising VAT for e-commerce (europa.eu)
With regards to this campaign, prices expressed in pledge / reward levels for backers in the European Union should be considered exclusive of VAT. 
Read more here.
Shipping
You will be charged shipping after the Kickstarter campaign ends based on the actual costs incurred to ship your package to you. We will collect these charges via the Elzra Pledge Manager after this Kickstarter campaign.
Volumetric Weight
The shipping box for the "Big Box" version of Catacombs & Castles 2E + stretch goals is expected to be 16x16x8" / 40.64 x 40.64 x 20.32 cm (15 lbs / 6.8 kg volumetric weight). 
The dimensions of the shipping box directly affects the price of shipping as carriers now charge the higher cost of either the package's weight or volume (otherwise called volumetric weight). Here is a link to DHL's volumetric weight calculator as an example.
Please watch this video that explains further the concept of volumetric weight:
UK
For confirmed backers in the UK, Games Quest will ship from within the UK. This should prevent any additional customs or handling charges. All shipments within the UK will support tracking data. VAT must be calculated on the cost of shipping the package in addition to the price of the game itself.
Europe
For confirmed backers in the European Union, Games Quest is expected to ship DPP (delivered, duty paid) from their UK hub. This should prevent any additional customs or handling charges. 
Switzerland, Norway, Iceland, Ukraine
For confirmed backers in Switzerland, Norway, Iceland, and Ukraine, Games Quest is expected to ship from their UK hub.
Canada
For confirmed backers in Canada, we will ship from our Elzra warehouse from Ontario, Canada. Please note that it is more expensive to ship packages to some parts of Canada than it is to ship a package to the other side of the planet. Those backers residing in the North outside of Whitehorse and Yellowknife should expect a significant delivery charge. All shipments in Canada will support tracking data. Backers based in Ontario will be able to choose local pick-up in the Elzra Pledge Manager. Our office is in Hamilton (Dundas).
USA
For confirmed backers in the USA including Alaska and Hawaii, we expect to ship from Canada. We may use a third party fulfillment company depending on the final order volume.
For those backers in the USA that must use a PO Box for their shipping address, your order must be processed separately and will be sent via Canada Post / USPS. DHL and UPS cannot ship to US PO Boxes. All shipments to the USA will support tracking data.
Mexico
For confirmed backers in Canada, we will ship from our Elzra warehouse from Ontario, Canada via Canada Post.
Israel
For confirmed backers in Israel, we will either ship from Canada, the UK or Germany. The total number of backers based in Israel will determine how best to proceed. DHL Express service to Israel is reliable but expensive.
China
For confirmed backers based in China and Hong Kong, VFI will ship from within China.
Asia Pacific
For confirmed backers based in Australia, Japan, Malaysia, New Zealand, Singapore, South Korea, Taiwan, Thailand, and Vietnam, VFI will ship from China to their local hubs in those countries.
Important: If there is a significant number of backers from Australia, then fulfillment will occur from within that country using Aetherworks and shipping costs will be re-calculated. Shipping costs to Western Australia, Tasmania, South Australia, and the Northern Territory can be significant.
Rest of World
For confirmed backers in India, the Middle East, South Africa, and South America, we expect to ship from either VFI's hub in China or from Canada using Canada Post's slow, but reliable, international parcel surface service.
Important Shipping Related Information
International PO Boxes
We simply cannot ship to international PO boxes.
Shipping After the Deadline to Confirm Your Pledge
If you do not confirm your pledge after the deadline for confirming your shipping details via the Elzra Pledge Manager, your rewards will  be shipped to you from the Elzra warehouse in Canada. As such, shipping costs may be considerably higher for those outside of Canada and the USA.
Delivery Attempts and Package Delivery Bounces
We will make attempt to deliver your package based on the shipping address and contact information you supply in the Elzra Pledge Manager.
If your package is returned (bounces) during fulfillment, we will conduct an investigation as to what happened. When the fault is ours, we will pay to re-ship the package.
However, if it is determined that the package was returned due to an error in the shipping information provided to us, you will have to pay to have the package shipped out again.
The moral of the story is: help us help you by taking a few extra minutes to double-check your shipping address in the Elzra Pledge Manager and ensure it is correct.
Changing Your Shipping Address
If you need to change your shipping address before we have delivered your package, please open a support ticket. See the Support section of this campaign page.
 Pay Attention to Tracking Emails During Delivery
When the shipping method we use to deliver your package supports tracking, you are responsible for following the tracking data closely and to secure the package immediately upon delivery to minimize the potential of package theft.
Canada Post, DHL, and UPS support redirecting shipments to a safe pick-up location later.
Shipping Addresses for Backers in China, Hong Kong, and Taiwan
To increase the reliability of their delivery, backers in China, Hong Kong, and Taiwan may submit their shipping address (but not their billing address) using Chinese characters in the Elzra Pledge Manager.
Packaging
We spend a lot of effort and extra money to pack your games carefully. We use strong, double-walled shipping boxes, the best protective void fill, and leave extra space between the walls of the shipping box and its contents. If the shipping box suffers from damage which affects its contents, we reserve the right to determine next steps to resolve the issue. Backers frequently request empty replacement game boxes, but the factory doesn't produce these and sending them out to fulfillment centers when they may not be required is a waste of the campaign's resources. Risks and challenges
As this is a new edition of an existing game, much of the initial artwork and development of Catacombs & Castles 2E has already been completed. We have been working on the second edition for over a year.

We are planning to use the same factory that produced Catacombs Cubes. We have met with the owner of this factory and our account manager in person several times. 

We are using the same factory that produces all of our high quality playmats.

We are planning to use the same fulfillment partners we have worked with in the past: Games Quest, VFI, and Aetherworks (assuming a sufficient number of orders from Australia). We have met the owners of all of these companies in person. They have been transparent about delays related to the COVID-19 pandemic when they have been forced to halt or slow operations.

For our domestic and US fulfillment operation, we are using the same suppliers for cardboard cartons and packaging.

We are fully aware of potential delays that may happen with products that are produced overseas: printer production schedules, major holidays (Lunar New Year, National Week), shipping, and customs delays. We will work diligently to minimize these types of disruptions and promise to communicate transparently with our backers if they occur.

We have estimated delivery for January 2022. Due to the global logistics involved in shipping, some regions may receive their rewards sooner than others.

We are factoring in ocean shipping and fulfillment delays as a result of the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic.

ludicreations.com/newsletter
So, you’ve been eaten.
Don’t worry, this is simply an occupational hazard.
In fact, it is fairly common among Deep Space Miners (5th class), and some say that it is almost unavoidable. And, well, it is. Especially since the Crystals that you seek happen to be inside giant space Beasts. To mine them, you need to, well, be eaten.
Should you achieve your objective and mine enough Crystals to meet your quota, it is then cost-effective for the company to activate your jetpack and extricate you from the proverbial belly of the Beast.
In the event that the Bacteria present in the Beast overwhelm you and you are digested, do not despair. Your non-organic parts will certainly be useful in the mining exploits of future Miners. In fact, you may encounter some such pieces of equipment in your expedition, remains of less-than-qualified recruits from past attempts.
Finally, it could transpire that you do not collect the necessary Crystals by the time you reach the end of your adventure, without the Beast having digested you.
In this case, you will then exit the Beast from the other end than the one you entered. Alive... and yet forever changed. In this case we will have to evaluate your performance against that of the Beast’s efforts to consume you.
In So, You've Been Eaten. the Miner and the Beast will face off against one another. 
The Miner earns points by collecting Crystals and the Beast earns points by developing Immune Responses and by its Bacteria attacking the Miner.
The game ends in a win for the Miner if they collect all 8 different Crystals, and the Beast wins by digesting the Miner after four Bacteria of the same type have attacked.
Of course, there’s always the possibility that the Miner will simply pass through the Beast’s system, and then the player with the most points wins!
 So, You’ve Been Eaten. can be played as:
A game for 2 players, with a Miner player against a Beast player.
A game for 1 player, with the Miner player against a Hibernating Beast.
A game for 1 player, with the Beast player against a robot Miner.
A game for 0 players, with a Hibernating Beast against a robot Miner.

Want the all-in-fire-and-forget pledge?
The hyper-high-end one with triple-layered(!) boards?
The lovingly deluxified KS-limited objet d'art for your shelf?
The one with the bursting-with-bits-even-though-it's-even-bigger-box?
Choose the Collector Edition pledge level, and rejoice!
And if you have not yet decided to back now, here's why you should:
- Discounted shipping! Post-campaign shipping costs will be higher.
- Guaranteed availability of the Collector edition! Due to its bigger, special box, we will likely not be producing this as easily as the retail edition, and due to its heavier weight, this is not going to be easy to ship when not doing mass KS fulfillment.
- Loyalty discount! Get $1 per previous LudiCreations campaign backed - see below for more details.
- Don't miss a game full of unconventional asymmetric gameplay by Scott Almes & striking art by Kwanchai Moriya!
Premium Edition - savings
The custom-shaped double-printed acrylic Crystal tokens and the printed wooden Bacteria tokens are going to be available as a $9 add-on, and the Dyspepto-Beastmol mini-expansion will be available as a $5 add-on. By backing the Premium edition, you would get a $4 discount, and also receive the custom-cut Replication token (the "Miner meeple"), which we do not expect to later sell separately.

Collector Edition - LudiCreations Loyalty Discount
Backers of the Collector Edition will receive a discount of $1 per previous LudiCreations campaign they have backed in the past, up to a maximum of $5 off. This will be applied in Backerkit and can be used for reducing the cost of shipping and add-ons. For more information, please see the FAQs.

Tuckboxes - Sleeves?
Yes, they fit. We tested with premium sleeves.
Remember kids, always use protection!
So, You've Been Eaten. is an asymmetric game. Players must balance short-term benefit against trying to gain an advantage for the next turns. Many times they will need to simply survive the turn. To win, they need to make clever plays and try to corner their opponent into having to make increasingly difficult choices.
The Miner is playing a dice manipulation & placement game to try to eliminate Bacteria and capture Crystals (and Tools) that are present on a row of cards between them and the Beast player.
The Beast is playing a hand management and drafting game, to try to position their Bacteria to attack the Miner, and acquire Immune Response cards that can make the Miner player's life difficult.
The 2p game
The Miner begins, and rolls their dice. They then take an action with each one of those dice, removing Stomach cards from the digestive tract between the players, and at the end of their turn, whatever Bacteria is closest to them attacks!
The Beast then strategically refills the tract to cause the Miner the most difficulty, then may develop an Immune Response, refills their hand, and plays a Mutation card against the Miner, trying to match the Bacteria on it with the one that might attack the Miner at the end of their turn!
If the Miner collects 8 Crystals, they win outright. If one of the Beast's Bacteria tracks reaches the 4th level, the Beast wins immediately. If the deck of Stomach card runs out, points are counted, and whoever player has the most is the winner!

The 1p game
So, You've Been eaten. can be played as a solo game, either as the Miner (against a Hibernating Beast), or as the Beast (against a Robot Miner).
All actions remain the same. What changes is how their effects are triggered.

The 0p game
Nope, 0 players does not mean that the game will set up and play itself. And no, it probably does not count as a play if you decide to not play it. Yes, it does seem to fit the times we are now living in.
However you look at it, having the two AIs play each other is possible, and a conversation starter for the non-board-game-geeks wandering near your shelf.

We expect to fulfill the rewards bound for the USA from within the USA, the ones for the EU, from Germany, the ones for the UK from the UK, and the ones for Canada from Canada.
Backers in the EU, UK, USA and Canada do not have to worry about customs or VAT.
Rewards going to Asia/Pacific/South Africa/Middle East will be fulfilled by VFI Asia.
Note that we can not be responsible for any re-shipping fees in case your package is returned as unclaimed, or if the address you provided is not valid. Should a package not arrive within a certain time frame that will be announced when it has been shipped, we will spend a period of time investigating its fate before any action is taken.
Certain countries do not appear on the list of available shipping destinations. This is due to past experiences and potential cost overruns due to weight fluctuations. Click the pledge level and please contact us via KS message if your country does not appear on the list. Regrettably, shipping to CIS and Brazil will not be possible. 
 We will be using Backerkit as our post-campaign fulfillment suite and pre-order management platform, through which shipping costs may be paid and additional copies may be obtained.
Backerkit carts will be locked and credit cards will be charged shortly before fulfillment commences. There will be backer updates that inform about all deadlines.

Costs
The real cost of shipping is subsidized and is offered for backers who pledge during the campaign being live. Post-campaign pre-order will likely be paying higher fees.
Shipping fees include costs like ocean freight, import fees and/or VAT, packing materials, labor, replacements shipping; and the risk of shipping cost increases. Those can add anything from $3 to $10 to the price you would have to pay if we did not subsidize them.
The shipping costs per copy are as follows, and include tracking:
Basic edition: USA - $9 / EU - $9 / Everywhere else - $14
Premium edition: USA - $9 / EU - $9 / Everywhere else - $14
Collector edition: USA - $9 / EU - $14 / Everywhere else - $19
Unfortunately backers in the UK, Switzerland, Norway and Canada do not fall in the EU and USA cost categories.
The USA cost category includes the "lower 48" states, and does not include Alaska, Hawaii, Guam & Puerto Rico. For these and for any other outlying territories, the "everywhere else" category applies. Please ask if in doubt.
Backers (even $1 backers completing their pledge in Backerkit) will get the game with the discounted shipping costs outlined here. The cost will likely increase for post-campaign pre-orders. 
The real costs that we have to pay are at least $12 for the USA, and $15 in the EU and worldwide - and that is not counting ocean freight and customs costs for us.
IMPORTANT: Do not add these costs to your pledge! We will collect the shipping cost after the campaign, via Backerkit.
Regrettably, we can not offer pickup at Spiel in Essen or any other convention.

COVID-19 Impact
Fulfillment providers worldwide are reporting that significant disruptions in deliveries persist in parts of the world. In practical terms this means that shipments to individual countries may be subject to delays.
We have taken what we now (March 2021) know into account when determining our production, logistics and fulfillment plans. However, it may happen that we may deviate from the schedule, and as noted in the Risks section, other backers may receive their rewards a lot earlier than you.
When we have specific new information, we will reach out to backers, either via a backer update or individually, as the situation develops. In any case, please be prepared for delays, both in freight (before your reward is shipped), and after individual fulfillment has commenced. 
 Retailers who wish to back this campaign must back at the $1 pledge level, and then contact us via the KS messaging system: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/ludicreations/so-youve-been-eaten/messages/new?message%5Bto%5D=ludicreations
This offer is available to retailers who have a physical store in the countries allowed by the $1 pledge level. All entities and locations will be verified.
Retailers within North America may also order from our distribution service provider Hit Point Sales, if signed up with an account. This would likely result in lower shipping costs (e.g. if ordering other games at the same time).
Online-only retailers will be considered in territories where no physical retailers have backed the campaign.

Fulfillment will be conducted in the following steps:
1. Individual backers
2. Physical stores
3. Online-only stores (if any) - at least 2 weeks after the previous step

There will be a limit on how many copies of each edition that a retailer can order. A deposit will be taken during the campaign, with the rest of the funds payable via Backerkit.
Only retailers who back this campaign will be able to re-order any editions normally available only on Kickstarter, subject to availability.

Please contact us for more information.
What You See Is What You Get - we like to run simple, straightforward campaigns. We are aware that stretch goals would increase the funding total. However, we have already thrown everything into this game - a lot of time, effort, and money. We are already going to print with the highest quality materials.
We also want to offer the game at the cheapest cost possible - and that is incompatible with stretch goals. We'd have to add "hidden" profit in the pledge levels that we can then "spend" to give you stretch goals - nothing is for free. Raising money beyond our goal does not give us extra money on hand to create stretch goals.
Retail availability: The game will be available through retailers that back the campaign and want the Collector edition. We hope to eventually send a version of the game to distribution.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All previous campaigns have been fulfilled, except "Mr. Cabbagehead's Garden returns!". Its production is initiated, and the project is on track to be completed on time. We are working with a manufacturer we have worked with before, and we are confident in our ability to deliver the game and any additional materials. That said, unforeseen events may affect how quickly fulfillment is conducted, and the final colors, graphics and components that you see presented here are subject to (however improbable) change. We are working with retailers and due to that and the realities of international logistics, it is very likely that some backers or other people may have the game in hand before you do. Note that our goal is to ship the game on time, by the dates listed on the pledge levels. Shipping a package is different than delivering a package. We do not deliver your game, the shipping company does. Therefore, delivery times will vary according to your local postal services – once we ship, the shipment is the responsibility of the shipping company. If tracking is important to you, please let us know. Informal currency conversions made on this campaign may not be accurate by the time you read this, and therefore result in seemingly cheaper prices further in the future. Warning: Please do not, under any circumstances, volunteer to mine crystals from space beasts. But if you do, remember to purchase our supplemental loss-of-limb insurance (payable only upon return of at least one(1) torso). By backing this project, you indicate that you have read, understood and agreed with the above. If you have any questions, please contact us directly via the KS messaging system.
