campaign.story:
Lore of Aetherra: The Lost Druid is the first installment in an expansive new anthology of science-fantasy adventures designed for 5e.
Created by a screenwriter, a seasoned Dungeon Master, and a User Experience Designer, this adventure presents a uniquely designed RPG experience with immersive storytelling and balanced game mechanics bound together in an easy-to-use and beautiful book layout. 
We've leaned heavily into a cinematic storytelling structure, breaking chapters into scenes supplemented with expansive soundscapes, dynamic musical scores, and environmental visuals for an unparalleled gameplay experience.
This project is already 75% completed. All music, sound, and art assets have been created, leaving just the final few chapters to be written and edited by our in-house team. We need your support to finance the production of a physical book printing.

We've made our 40-page Adventure Preview available to everyone to get an early look into the world of Aetherra and its characters. Download it now.
Fano. Once a magnificent city upon the lake. Now a run-down sanctum for the destitute and the depraved. A quest to seek out a lost druid brings promise to restore the city to its former glory and awaken the ancient technology built within. Could Fano's awakening bring peace and prosperity once more, or will it unearth a conspiracy lurking in the shadows?
The Island City of Fano
 Aetherra is a fantastical world bound together by a raw elemental energy known as aether. A substance so profound that, when controlled, can power great cities with otherworldly technology, endow beings with the ability to manipulate the elements, and enrapture one with a lust so intense it consumes their very being.
Crysal Lake, an impossibly deep caldera, keeps Aetherra's best-kept secret hidden: an aether deposit at the bottom of the Lake that joins directly to the aether core. Floating proudly above that secret is the island city of Fano. Once the prototype of symbiosis between mankind and aether, now the destitute remains of forgotten greatness.
Crysal Lake Region Map
It's been generations since the inventors, a society of brilliant elves known only to historians as the Crysaleans, disappeared from Fano, taking the city's beating heart with them. Their disappearance is now a mystery as great as the outlandish architecture that supports this depraved city's crumbling walls.
The resolve of a young Indosian may present the spark of hope the citizens of Fano so desperately need: the hidden location of a fabled druid known as Gilgazo who belongs to an ancient order of sages devoted to mastering the instrumentation of aether. 
Will our heroes heed the call to recover the lost druid and save a city? And if they do, will they survive the journey?  
The Lost Druid is designed to deliver a deeply immersive gameplay experience utilizing a cinematic scene-based structure over traditional chapters. Every scene is meant to provide a unique mood as diverse environments are explored throughout the world of Aetherra. This feeling is primarily achieved through an audio accompaniment for each scene that provides both an ambient sound bed and an original composition, scored explicitly to construct the intended atmosphere for each scene.
Scene Guide
At the beginning of each scene is a QR code that can be scanned to navigate quickly to the corresponding audio. Links, like this one, can also be found in the scene's footer for easy access to the audio component from anywhere within the scene.
Environmental Visual
In addition to audio, each scene includes a unique visual that captures the essence of the environment and is meant to be presented to players while they experience the scene. This environment is presented in the book at the beginning of each scene and is also available in high resolution static or motion cinemagraph for casting to a shared display at your physical table or virtual tabletop.
Appendix
Scenes are deliberately constructed to be concise, enabling the GM to run them at a glance with minimal preparation. Mechanics, tangential story details, and elements of lore are off-loaded to a comprehensive appendix to maintain an easily scannable scene structure.
Audiovisual Experience
Each scene is designed individually with a distinct feel based on its intended story content. Some settings have a higher propensity for combat and therefore come with additional themes to support an action sequence. Others are more dramatic and come with themes to amplify a suspenseful moment or create a sense of space by shifting ambiance from an exterior to an interior perspective.
The Lost Druid comes with over 2 hours of original music to support your adventure in Aetherra, composed by acclaimed recording artist Jessy Ribordy. Each composition is handcrafted utilizing film-quality audio production tools, sounds effects, instrumentation, and recorded performances.
Jessy Ribordy (Composer)
Scene compositions are explicitly written to support long-form RPG gameplay with indistinguishable repeat and sonic variance, allowing tracks to loop for extended periods without feeling monotonous or repetitive.
Listen to the complete Main Title Theme above.
The Lost Druid is the first release in a series of multiple planned adventure modules that will take place within the original campaign setting, Lore of Aetherra. Instead of publishing a Campaign Setting supplement, our approach to building the world of Aetherra is through exploring its stories, locations, and characters. Each subsequent adventure will occur in a new area and traverse new concepts that build toward an expansive story world that will continue to grow over time.
We aim to make this approach possible by emphasizing the development of extensive lore throughout the adventure. The Lost Druid contains three in-world lore books written by non-player characters within Aetherra that your players can discover throughout the campaign. Lore books, once found, can be distributed to your players through individual PDFs and are also appended to the back of the physical book. We believe this world-building method enables players to take in as much or as little of the lore as they wish and still enjoy the setting.
Includes five pre-made playable character builds
Included with The Lost Druid, are five pre-made Player Character builds with original artwork, custom backgrounds that fit within the world of Aetherra, and balanced starter stats. Enabling quick-start, out-of-the-box gameplay.
*Based on currently completed content and assets. These numbers will likely increase.
Mr. Tarrasque Kickstarter Preview
Join RPG content reviewer, Mr Tarrasque as he walks through the Adventure Preview, samples the digital asset pack, and shares his thoughts.
Helpful Goat Gaming Live-play One-shot
Watch as the kind and talented humans at Helpful Goat play through a one-shot of the Adventure Preview on the Alchemy RPG platform.
Bob World Builder Quick Look
Bob World Builder shares a few thoughts on the features of the adventure in his video about the Pros & Cons of big campaign books.
Kickstarter Preview
Join Jeff McAleer over at The Gaming Gang as he walks through the Adventure Preview, samples the digital asset pack, and shares his thoughts.
Alchemy RPG Platform
Alchemy RPG, created by Chris Eddie and Isaac Overacker, is a revolutionary new way to play tabletop role-playing games online by providing a deeply immersive, cinematic experience to support a more "theater of the mind" style of gameplay. Designed to be both beautiful and intuitive, the Alchemy platform provides a truly unique alternative to today's virtual tabletop.
A new gameplay experience requires a new approach to content creation. Early on in our development process, we made the critical decision to fork our efforts and develop both platform and content in parallel. As Super Mario was for the Nintendo, we aim to make Lore of Aetherra: The Lost Druid the catalyst to set the Alchemy platform's standard.
Alchemy may provide the richest way to experience this adventure. Still, we also know that it won't be for everyone, which is why we're developing a physical version, PDF, and a digital asset pack to enjoy on your favorite virtual tabletop.
Jessy Ribordy is the Creative Director at Alchemy RPG. With almost two decades of experience in music and writing, he began his professional career as frontman and songwriter of the indie rock band Falling Up and has since expanded into composing for film and television. Inspired by both songwriting and storytelling, coupled with a passion for developing lore, Jessy is now using his creative talents to bring Aetherra to life in a truly unique way.
 Cole Nordin is an RPG book hoarder, professional Kickstarter, and the resident Game Designer at Alchemy RPG. A renewable energy engineer by day and Dungeon Master by night, Cole brings a lifetime of knowledge, passion, and experience crafting balanced game mechanics and narrative design to create the interactive backbone for the story world of Aetherra.
 Chris Eddie is the co-founder and designer of the Alchemy RPG platform. For over 13 years, he has worked as a Lead Product Designer for some of the world's most loved user experiences, including Amazon Music, Google Search, and currently, Netflix. Now Chris is bringing everything he's learned about designing world-class products to build a beautiful and intuitive role-playing experience within the world of Aetherra.
 Stu Harrington, a rogue paint slinger, is the Lead Artist and Art Director for Alchemy RPG. With over ten years of experience working in game art and fantasy illustration, he is currently one of the Senior Illustrators at Hi-Rez Studios doing splash art and concept design for games like Smite. A passionate artist, long-time gamer, and avid Dungeons & Dragons fan, Stu brings his expertise to make the world of Aetherra visually come to life.

Additional Artists
Helen Ilnytska, Leon Tukker, Daniel Hasenbos, Jeff Langevin, Hanzel Haro, Max Schiller, Nargas Jafari, and Jordan Kerbow.
Every backer of Lore of Aetherra: The Lost Druid will receive exclusive access to playtest materials throughout the adventure book's final development phase. As a backer, you will be invited to join the private playtester channel on the Alchemy RPG Discord, where we will share in-progress PDFs of various game mechanics, story details, artwork, and music, allowing you to weigh in on the final adventure.
As a special thanks, all backers who join the playtest group will also receive credit with their names printed in the Lore of Aetherra: The Lost Druid book and PDF.
We'll be shipping worldwide! 
Charges will be collected once the campaign has ended through our pledge manager, BackerKit. Please note, pledge prices do not include shipping. Consult the chart below for estimated shipping prices but be aware that these costs may vary based on address and the state of shipping prices at the time of fulfillment.
Thank you...
Regardless of the outcome of this campaign, we want to give a heartfelt thank you to a few folks who helped make it possible. Thank you to my sweet friends Lindsay Giebel and Hanzel Haro for making us a beautiful video. And thank you to Tyler Crumrine for being the epitome of what makes the TRPG community so wonderful by sharing his wisdom and advice with us. Make sure to check out his upcoming Kickstarter too!
And thank you to those who choose to believe in this project with their support. It means the world to us.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Creative Production
As of March 2021, our creative team is roughly 3/4 of the way finished with the end-to-end adventure. All primary art and audio for the core 12-scene experience is complete and ready to ship, mitigating the potential for long lead times or extraordinary costs due to outsourced creative services. The work that remains is the final draft, editing, and layout of the book's last three scenes, which our in-house team has projected to complete in the next four months. (July 2021)

Manufacturing & Fulfillment
The manufacturing of physical goods can come with a wide variety of risks and challenges. That's why we're working with one of the best (not the cheapest) book manufacturers available: The Friesens Corporation. Friesens specializes in high-volume, art-book quality printing and customer service. We're working directly with an assigned representative (Hi Elise!) on every detail of our order, from paper weight to freight.

We also understand the various challenges that come with international shipping and order fulfillment. That's why we won't be stuffing envelopes in our living rooms and making trips to the post office. Instead, we're working with the professionals at Funagain Logistics to ensure that parcels are properly packed, shipped, and routed through the best possible shipping routes throughout the world. Funagain's operation is also local to us, which will enable strong in-person communication and collaboration (if necessary) throughout the fulfillment process.

First-Time Publishing
Lore of Aetherra: The Lost Druid is our first publication, and of course, this has come with several learning opportunities and challenges that we've had and will likely continue to have until its completion. But it also means that we have everything to prove in doing whatever we can to create the highest quality product and deliver it on-time. We have put forth a significant amount of up-front investment and effort to arrive at this position, and we will do whatever it takes to earn your trust, fandom, and repeat support for many more projects to come.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello everyone,
Thanks for being patient while we navigate through the waters of international shipping logistics! We're coming to you with good news in today's quick update.
Backerkit Surveys Are Ready to Send!

Hello everyone! 
We've been making great progress over the past week on the adventure and wanted to pop up to give you an update on add-ons, late pledges, and playtesting. Let's dive right in!

And just like that, we're in the final week of the campaign at 400% funded and just two more days to go. We can't begin to express how grateful we are to all of you who have chosen to support this project, and we can't wait to get this book in your hands.
The team is hard at work writing, editing, refreshing artwork, and diving into entirely new art pieces. Here's an early draft of an ominous new illustration by Jordan Kerbow of Broken Top Bay's hidden grotto.

One of the things we've been focused on while creating The Lost Druid is an uncommonly high bar for quality in the storytelling experience, the writing, the music, and of course, the art. Seeing the overwhelmingly positive response to this effort has been so heartening and inspiring to us; to dig deeper and push even harder to make this adventure the best it can be.
As we're neck-deep in writing and editing the final scenes of the adventure, our art director () is poring over the existing illustrations and bringing them up to a consistent level of quality, detail, and stylistic cohesion. Here's a look at a recent tweak to the environment.

When we first started writing The Lost Druid, we eagerly looked forward to the day that we would one day see it in print and be able to hold the manifestation of all of our hard work in our hands. When we launched this Kickstarter, that was our only aim. Now, standing at the precipice of doubling our funding goal in our first week, our hearts are full of gratitude, making us more excited than ever to bring you into the world we've been dreaming up for over two years.

Hey everybody, thanks so much for your support!
A quick note to anyone who backed in the first 30 minutes: we accidentally included a $20 shipping charge in the Eschan and Alliander pledge tiers. We have corrected the mistake by creating new Eschan and Alliander pledge tiers with a $0 shipping charge, and the original tiers have been closed. Please feel free to update your pledge to the new tier so we can provide an accurate shipping charge after the campaign ends.

Clica aquí para ver la campaña en español
Key Enigma is an Escape box that mixes puzzles, narrative, and technology to immerse you in a challenging experience so carefully designed that it may be impossible for you to distinguish reality from fiction.
A box full of mysteries and enigmas will reach your hands. With the materials, codes, and clues hidden inside, you must use your ingenuity and match the objects to solve the case.
With this model, we want to expand the possibilities of traditional Escape Rooms. By not being dependent on a physical space we have greater freedom to:
 Create complex, different, and surprising puzzles that will blow your mind.
Imagine a more sophisticated story capable of immersing you in a complete narrative experience.
Focus on investing in the quality and design of the materials to bring you a more dynamic and wider gameplay time experience.
Make the game arrive all over the world.

After the success of our first project Hack Forward, we want to give you a gaming experience as immersive as the first but, this time, focusing on another famous genre. Face the challenge by yourself or with a trustworthy group.
The box is the heart of the project where you will find the materials that serve as a bridge to connect the physical and digital world to live an immersive experience.
Here you will find some examples of the puzzles and objects hidden in the box to solve the challenges that the adventure requires:
Traditional puzzles
Similar to those found in the traditional Escape Rooms: Logic puzzles, reveal messages, interact with objects, use pencil and paper…

Immersive / Digital puzzles
Puzzles that will make you doubt the boundaries between reality and fiction; exploring websites, news, videos, or spying on security cameras. Even in some cases, you will have to use everyday tools such as your email, social networks, chats, or mobile phone…
 Investigation puzzles 
Puzzles in which you will have to consult and review the different clues and inconsistencies between the suspects, investigate old cases, compare different publications or objects and find the necessary evidence to solve the crimes committed ... or prevent them from being committed.
Advanced Puzzles
If we manage to reach certain stretch goals, we can add more complex, sophisticated puzzles, which could include magnets, embarking on missions in the real world, receiving phone calls, and higher quality components to get a more realistic and stunning experience, among other amazing surprises.

*In order to avoid spoiling your experience, some of the puzzles shown above are examples. 


If you want to get a taste of the inmersion of the game here you have the chance for free. The DEMO can be completed totally online without the box but it’s nothing compared to the whole experience with the box.

In this new adventure, you will have to put all your deductive and investigative skills to the test because what seemed like an average case has become a twisted game.
Your role will be to stop and unmask the terrible plans of a distinguished psychopath master of manipulation and specialist in the deepest and darkest instincts that guide the actions of the human being.
Your passion for solving puzzles has made you fall into their disturbed game and all attention is focused on you. Who is behind all this? Why? If you like detective plots and crime movies and series, get ready because you are about to experience one for yourself.
The case will be divided into 8 chapters. Each one has its own objective and different challenges that can be completed in 1 hour, like a traditional Escape Room. You can play them all in a row or you can take a break and play another day.

At Key Enigma, we have decided to surprise you and test your and our community skills through an international treasure hunt.
WHAT DO YOU NEED TO KNOW ?:
We have hidden 4 boxes in different parts of the world.
Each one hides enigmas and puzzles that complement each other, this means that a box cannot be completely solved until the others are found.
You need to solve ALL OF THEM for the community to have access to the final prize.
Anyone can take part in this treasure hunt, the reward will unlock a Stretch Goal on the Kickstarter.
You will find the keys to their locations at the end of the DEMO.
You have until May 6 to find and solve all the treasures to unlock the prize.
Shipping is charged after Kickstarter ends with a pledge manager.
Your exact shipping address will be collected after the Kickstarter ends and we get close to the delivery date.
The European Union, USA will be “Shipping Friendly”. Backers from these countries will not pay import taxes. We will be using fulfillment center partners to ship locally for each country.
Outside of the EU, USA we cannot guarantee customs friendly shipping in these areas. There may be additional duties and/or fees charged by your country's governmental agencies and/or shipping partners that will be your responsibility.
Shipping approximate prices:
Spain: 4€
Europe: 9€ (for most countries)
UK: 12€ (11£)
USA: 18€ ($20)
Canada: 15€ ($22 CAD)
Rest of the world: 35€  ($38)

Note that this shipping prices are for the Calling Card base game, if you purchased any add-on, the shipping price could increase. 
We will send our games inside a cardboard shipping box in order to protect the game box as much as possible.


We are a startup that aims to launch different Immersive Escape Games themes (Terror, Adventure, Detective,...) that resemble the Escape Room experience but right in your home.
Or even explore the possibilities of launching a subscription box with bi-monthly shippings.
But this project can only be carried if we get enough support through Kickstarter.
Why do we do it?
As big fans of Escape Rooms and Escape Games sometimes we encountered limitations for playing as often as we wished. And in times of Coronavirus, these limitations have undoubtedly increased.
Mobility restrictions
Escape Room activity at 30% or 50%
Lockdowns
That is why we want to propose an alternative so that you can enjoy a good escape experience:
 Location: Most of the time we are limited to playing in our city or surroundings, and assembling a group of friends to go to a faraway Escape Room seems impossible.  Key Enigma box is at the best location: your home.
   Variety & Innovation: Once you have played many traditional Escape Rooms they all start feeling the same. Our game is a breath of fresh air that will surprise you.
   Cost: Escape Rooms are expensive! Our game is a fraction of the price.
   Main Inspirations
The night of October 30th 1938 gave us the most famous radio broadcast in history: "War of the Worlds" by Orson Welles.
Orson Welles certainly understood all the possibilities radio could offer and knew how to use it to carry out a very different entertainment experience from what people were used to. What we want to do now is to present a similar experience using the multiple communication options we have available nowadays.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
If you're new to Kickstarter: you can support our game by selecting one of the rewards we have prepared for you. If we reach our funding goal of €38.000, you will enable us to develop the game from start to finish in every detail according to our vision.
The amount of money you spend will only be collected if we reach our goal you will receive your rewards once the game is released. However, if we fail to reach our goal, your contribution won't be charged.
This is not our first rodeo, Albert Benitez former co-founder and CEO of Stream Hatchet, knows how to handle deadlines, and has a very specific plan of attack for this new project. And the amazing team that surrounds him has experience writing novels and scripts from start to finish and they also build Escape Rooms in their city. The team has the skills necessary to complete the vision of the company.

Our biggest challenges to complete the game are:
Manufacturing and design: we want to make this game available at an affordable price. We have to talk with lots of providers and get a fair price because we want to include quality components, physical objects and elaborate puzzles.
 
Technology: we must form a credible digital universe in addition to testing and programming web pages, chats, email responses,… These components are being developed in house to bring the prices down due to the experience we have elaborating similar technological projects.
 
Narrative: We want to naturally blend narrative, puzzles and technology to form a credible and immersive story given the tight budget

campaign.story:
Grab that Victorian outfit from your closest and join the Ghosts of Christmas Past, Present, and Future on a time traveling adventure. You'll play tricks to each time period as you try to outwit your fellow travelers and collect enough wreaths to decorate all the holiday doors.

Ghosts of Christmas is a new version of the acclaimed hard-to-find Japanese game "Time Palatrix" by Taiki Shinzawa. Have you ever played "spades" or "hearts" and thought "I wish this game had time travel?"
All in a small 5 x 5 x 2 inch box

Ghosts of Christmas is a trick taking game where you play cards into three separate tricks: past, present, and future. You visit all three locations in a single round, and winning tricks in one time period could help you win more in the future!

The gameplay remains the same, but with a new optional variant for a more relaxed game.
Twelve colorful characters inspired by A Christmas Carol by Charles Dickens.

Click to view pdf. (This is a draft, not a final version.)
Taylor is an avid player of trick taking games and has a YouTube channel dedicated to them. Ghosts of Christmas can sound confusing at first, but Taylor does a great job explaining how it all works.
Please Note: Prototype components are shown in the video. The final version will have some minor changes.

Also please note: This is one of the most creative Kickstarter preview videos we've ever seen. Give it a chance. You won't be disappointed.
#1 Meeeaty - Some trick taking games are relaxing affairs. Play your highest card and hope for the best. In Ghosts of Christmas, there are multiple ways to approach each round and use brain cells.
#2 Ripple Effects - When you don't have the cards to win in a straightforward way, sometimes you can engineer a change in who wins the "Past" trick in order to make the "Present" and "Future" trick work out better for you.
#3 Dials - They're both fun and informative. A great visual way for everyone to keep track of which suit they can play to each ghost.
#4 Different Variants/Difficulty Levels - If you want a more low stress evening (or you are just learning), play the variant without bidding. If you think you've mastered the game, try playing one of the TWO variants with the "Beyond" ghost that add even more options.
#5 Bidding Options - Speaking of bidding, the ability to place an "exact bid" or a "wiggle room bid" gives you the option to play it safe or really go for that high score each round. 
#6 Small Box - It's a fact. Games in smaller boxes take up less room on your shelf, get taken to more game nights, and get played more. This is a small box game. (We work to keep even our "big boxes" pretty small.)

Put on your hard hat and install factory tiles in this fast, furious and fun game of factory planning. Connect your tiles to build the best possible production chains. Whoever makes the most profitable factory wins!
Efficiently packed into our 10.8 x 6.8 x 2.75 inch box
Like Ghosts of Christmas, we're republishing this cult-classic by Corné van Moorsel because it deserves a wider audience. The gameplay will stay the same (if it ain't broke...), but it has brand new art.

Our Touch:
1. Added a sixth player
2. Official variant to play without the quick grab element. Details TBD but will definitely be a part of the game.
3. Added unique names and logos to each of the six company boards and score tokens to make the game more thematic and improve accessibility for color blind players.

Play solo, with a full table of six players, or anywhere in between.
What's your favorite machine name?

It's a puzzle, but not a jigsaw puzzle. Like a "How am I going to connect all of these? Did you just take the machine I wanted? I have no use for blue! Let's play again. I think I get it now." kind of puzzle.
Unique names improve theming and accessibility
Click to view pdf. (This is a draft, not a final version.)
Please Note: The game shown in this review is the original Factory Funner. Our version has the same gameplay, but all new artwork, and support for a 6th player.
#1 Quick grabbing is rewarded - This game doesn't have analysis paralysis. When the machines are flipped over at the start of the turn, you have to decide which one you want. Too slow and someone will take your machine. Too fast and you will grab one that you thought would work ... but didn't.
#2 Non-real-time variant - What about groups who don't like that real-time part of the game? We really think that is the best way to play, but we realize it isn't a fun or even possible option for everyone. We're including an alternative rule that removes all the speed elements and is still fun (in a different way).
#3 Making it work - At some point during your game, someone at the table will be quiet for 30 seconds. Then they will announce, "I think I can make it work." Pipes start getting laid. Reservoirs are moved around. The table will laugh at how ridiculous their factory looks. And in a few turns you will know if what they did was smart or short sighted.
#4 You Will Improve - You might not be good at this game the first time you play it. You will get better. You will learn. You will overcome. And it will be rewarding.
#5 Bad Grammar - Factory FunNER is the sequel and a very solid improvement to Factory Fun. It uses hexes instead of squares to allow more creative building, and some subtle improvements to scoring, length, and machine placement rules really improve things.
#6 Solo Mode - You can play this game by yourself. Never know when that might come in handy.
#7 On Tour - Factory Funner has a lot of similarities to our other game "On Tour".  It shares the roller coaster emotions and intuitive gameplay.  Whether you're building an optimized route, or installing the most efficient machines, you'll feel the same tension and joy of making it all work out.

Note: Our game will NOT be an exact duplicate from these reviews, but the core gameplay will stay the same.
Zee Garcia's Kickstarter Pick of the Week | Dice Tower
Turn into a high-flying stock trader as you work against the other players to control the market, buy and short stock, and make the most money.
Have you been pumping cash into GameStop? Want to have the fun of making big bets without risking real cash?
You're going to thoroughly enjoy this brand new game that will bring you into the exciting and crazy world of buying and shorting stocks.
*No financial knowledge required
** Really does play within 60 minutes 
Our standard box size: 10.8 x 6.8 x 2 inch
Bear Raid is designed by Ryan Courtney, the same mind behind two other mind-bending games, Pipeline and Curious Cargo.
These are four of the character you can play as. What should the other two be? Leave your ideas in the comments.
For those who are wondering about the name, Bear Raid is a real phrase used to describe when a stock price is intentionally lowered through short selling and rumors.
Click to view pdf. (This is a draft, not a final version.)
Please Note: The game in this video is a prototype and the final version will have some adjustments.

Also Please Note: We're super excited that Jac, who does not normally make board game videos, agreed to do one for Bear Raid since she's the most passionate person in the world about this game. She is responsible for getting Chad (Owner of BoardGameTables.com) to play Bear Raid and ultimately publish it. Part of Kickstarter is authenticity, so we wanted you to hear from a real fan.
Later during the campaign, Chad will be interviewing Ryan Courtney about some of the different strategies in Bear Raid. We will post that here after the interview.
Submit a fake news headline and win a copy of the game!
We're hosting a contest over on Reddit.com/r/BoardGames where you can submit some ideas for a fake headline that will be used for one of the forecast cards in the game!
Enter today! →
#1 Shorting Stock - Not many games let you do this. It is so much fun to short stock and then drive the stock down.
#2 42 Dice & Event Interaction - Not a lot of luck (but some luck). 48 dice. It is a lot. It's not just a matter of chucking dice and moving the prices. Each company has dice, and they interact with different "event cards" every turn. It's a cool mechanic that lets you get a glimpse of what might happen next turn, but not a perfect picture.
#3 Controlling What's Rolled - Not all the dice are rolled. You can influence what gets rolled. Leave dice on a company or take them back. Leave dice behind your screen or add them to the bag. These decisions are just as important as buying or shorting the stock.
#4 Unspoken Alliances - There's not negotiation. But sometimes you will find you can go further if you and a "partner" work together. Maybe one person can't bankrupt a company by themselves, but two people working together can. Just watch out. Most partners want to do about 40% of the work and leave the other 60% for you.
#5 Quick - Many financial/economic games are long, but Bear Raid packs all that action into 60 minutes.
#6 Q.E. - Although our other financial game QE is certainly a different game, we really enjoy the genre. We think great financial board games are really under-the-radar. Wouldn't you agree?
#7 Surprisingly Funny - You expect silly games to be funny. You don't expect a stock market game to have humor in both the gameplay and player's reactions to it. You could almost call it a party game.
#7 Bears - Bears. Beets. Battlestar Galactica.

For the gamers who want the absolute best from every game, you're in luck!
Wood components for the most handled pieces of Ghosts of Christmas and Bear Raid feel better in your hand. The Factory Funner box inserts makes setup way faster. Each upgrade adds both form AND function.
If you want something to carry all three games, and many more, this is for you.

Taiki Shinzawa has been living and working in Tokyo designing original and unique board games since 2011. He enjoys origami and puzzles which has lead to a fascination with trick-taking games.

Maria Surducan creates illustrations with one hand, graphic designs with the other, comics with the third, and holds a coffee cup with the fourth. Only this way does she think she can draw herself the perfect life. She lives at mariasurducan.com
Ryan Courtney is a New York City based designer best known for Pipeline and Curious Cargo. He enjoys providing an opportunity for players to challenge themselves by adding a thinky twist to established genres.

Nick Nazarro is a multi-faceted artist working out of Los Angeles. Co-owner of Lay Waste Games, he has illustrated games such as Dragoon, Human Era, and Life Siphon. Also working at DreamWorks animation, Nick contributes visuals to many animated shows, such as HarmonQuest and The Midnight Gospel. When Nick isn't drawing, he can be found on Twitter, tweeting about drawing.
Corne Van Morsel is a game designer in Maastricht, Netherlands.  Board games, card games, dice games, thematical and abstract games, varying from 2 player games to 10 player games. Mainly deep games packed in a short amount of time with short rules, attractive for both heavy gamers and casual players.

Nigel Sussman creates complex isometric murals and illustrations by hand and with a lighthearted sense of humor that keeps you looking, and smiling.  He enjoys creating seek-and-find type illustrations that feature complex fantasy architecture and imaginary machines. His influences include Martin Handford (creator of Where’s Waldo?), MC Escher and the original SimCity computer games.
Anca Gavril is the art director and graphic designer for BoardGameTables.com. When she's not reading, playing and cooking with her daughter, she can be found working. She misses hosting game nights with her friends now that she owns a real gaming table (the Jasper!!). She always involves her husband, Filip Gavril, in playtesting the prototypes and he is the 3D artist who designed the Factory Funner insert and created all the gorgeous renders you can see on this page. 

Sam Hillier has always enjoyed teaching and explaining things, whether that's teaching philosophy (in a previous life) or new games to his family. Now as a professional writer of rulebooks, he can put that passion to work, helping players discover the joys of new and exciting games.
BoardGameTables.com was founded in 2014 by Chad DeShon, a gamer who wanted a nice table for  playing board games and figured other people might as well.
Now, in addition to selling high quality custom board game tables, BoardGameTables.com also sells a less expensive, some-assembly-required, solid wood table called The Jasper Board Game Table.
Our board game bags were created for a similar reason. We needed something to carry our games in. No off-the-shelf options worked for us. They were too big, too small, or  not protected enough.
And if that was not enough, we have published 5 quick but deceptively strategic board games and 3 small "super easy to play" games.
You can find us on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter and YouTube.

campaign.story:
This is what people say about our games so far:
 Download our first two Interactive Book Games - The Prehistory:
 Google Play  and  App Store
 EXITUS is a one-of-a-kind puzzle game experience that combines several unique things: 
The Co-Creator option is exclusive and available only during the present Kickstarter campaign, with each and every Pledge Level including 8 Works of Art that form the foundation on which EXITUS is constructed.
Eighth and last among these perks is the one where you become a Co-Creator and by doing so you not only get the game but you also remain forever as part of it because your name will be immortalized in the project. In this way, every Co-Creator will reach the inverted eight, which happens to be the magical symbol of Infinity.




Besides the above-listed eight monumental foundations on which EXITUS is built, it also has the following 10 important characteristics:
Covid-19 has made the last year terribly hard for everybody, so we’ve decided that our base package should cost just 17 EUR (and 12 EUR for any additional game) and within this price, we offer not the usual 1 hour “Escape the Room” game, but 10+ hours of puzzles, challenges, storytelling, and fun.
And to all our future Co-Creators who are willing to choose a higher pledge level – THANK YOU!
Each of you will not only get additional special extras but will also support us and our immense effort.
Our goal is to make participation in the project as easy as possible, so the payment will be one-time and will take place on Kickstarter. This includes also the shipping costs when ordering the Co-Creator „ARTE FACTA” reward level. 
IMPORTANT: When you pledge for the "Arte Facta"  Reward Level, the delivery price will be automatically added at the time of the pre-order. If you get a message that your country is not eligible for delivery, write us a personal message and we will check if we will be able to add your country of residence to the list.

* (Lat.) an object that is made by a person, such as a tool or a decoration, especially one that is of historical interest.
A set of FOUR mysterious, beautiful, and purely hand-made artefacts, included in the ARTE FACTA Reward Level.
This is the accessory that served as an inspiration for the magic bracelets worn by the main characters in the saga.
It’s a bracelet with a unique design, hand-woven using a specific technique, and 414 precise needlepoint stitches. It features the Elbetitsa figure in which are coded several ancient symbols of health, wealth, and harmony.
Elbetitsa is one of the oldest images found in the solar calendars of many peoples and exists as a symbol in almost all of the main ancient religions in the world.
Apart from being an elegant accessory, the bracelet is A CLUE and unlocks an additional and self-contained chapter in the game where you can find yet one more unique puzzle.
The bracelet is unisex and comfortable to wear on the left or the right hand.
Both medallions bear the original design that inspired the images on the amulets that protect Marc and Zoé during their adventure. They feature two ancient runic symbols dated back to the 1st century CE and found in many different written records across the world.
The material they are made of is pieces of wild cherry wood remaining after the making of furniture and usually thrown away as waste.
Our master craftsman buys these beautiful pieces of waste wood directly from the furniture factory and turns them into hand-made works of art.
Both accessories are unisex, extremely comfortable to wear, with soft fabric necklaces.
Each of the medallions is A CLUE to an additional and self-contained chapter in the game where you can find yet one more riddle.
A top-secret object that will remain hidden until you receive it. What we can say now, however, is that it's created by us personally and for you to be able to solve its secret, it will require some extra courage because it could be even a little dangerous.
This item is accompanied by an additional and hidden story chapter, plus the clever hints if you need some help while solving the puzzle.
The challenges in EXITUS have been designed in such a way that they can be solved by one person or group of people.
*If you prefer to read the story at your leisure and solve the puzzles by yourself – you do that.
*If you want to share your enjoyment of the game with those close to you – your friends or family, you can do that as well.
EXITUS is a game that illustrates the way an epic novel transforms into an unforgettable interactive experience when it is integrated with unique riddles, mysterious physical artefacts, music, sounds, portraits, graphics, and more.
EXITUS is a lengthy pleasure which, depending on the speed of reading and of solving riddles, can even last for few days. That’s why every time you close the EXITUS App, your last position will be saved automatically and when you next open the game, you’ll continue from the point where you last left off.
Once you’ve downloaded EXITUS App on your phone or tablet, you can go on to read the story and enjoy the music, sound effects, portraits, graphics, hints, the answers to the riddles – and in general, play the whole game from the beginning to the end.
Without internet. Everywhere. No limitations.
You’ve been solving the riddles quite well; you are ahead with the story and are becoming more and more involved in its complications when suddenly … your progress is blocked by a puzzle for which you need a hint.
And while you’re frantically searching the internet for a helpful clue or waiting for another player to advise you on your next action, your initial excitement melts away and never comes back the way it was.
With EXITUS the above scenario is impossible.
If you need a hint, it’s at your disposal at any moment because all hints, together with all the answers, can be found in EXITUS App and are always just one click away.
This allows you to choose your own tempo at which to move ahead in the game, as well as to make your own decision when or whether to use a hint.

EXITUS doesn’t come out of nothing.
EXITUS is part of the world’s first multilingual Challenge Book Game Series and although it has been created as a fully self-contained and independent game to be played with no prior preparation, the first two parts of the series come as a free bonus accompanying it. They contain the exciting prehistory of the events making up the story of EXITUS.
In addition, concealed in each one of these two mobile gamebooks are 12 challenging riddles.
If you want to trace the whole epic story from its very beginning, then Vol. 1 – PRAELUDIUM and Vol. 2 – CODEX are available to you completely free and they challenge you.
Download our first two Interactive Book Games - The Prehistory:
Google Play  and  App Store


ЕXITUS will be available worldwide! If you have an email address and access to Google Play or App Store, you will surely receive and be able to play EXITUS, no matter where in the world you are.




We have some creative ideas for additional extras because our Co-Creators deserve the right to get truly and fully involved in the creation process of EXITUS.
And to make this theme-related and exciting, every single new Stretch Goal will be accompanied and enhanced by a dedicated CHALLENGE in form of a riddle, puzzle, brainteaser, important Co-Creator's voting (watch out for these!), and other fun activities. So, for any new Stretch Goal, which will appear here, there will be a new Campaign Update where you can find out more about the challenge and how to get involved.
UNLOCKED STRETCH GOALS:
If you like our approach, appreciate our effort, and want to support the campaign, the only thing we ask of you in return is to be active and share those challenges wherever and with whomever, you think appropriate and, in this way, to help us spread the word about our campaign.
The more backers we have, the more awesome extras we can put into EXITUS.
Help us reach more people!
IN THIS VIDEO YOU CAN MEET US AND FOLLOW OUR STORY:
For many months now we’ve been working hard, applying all the experience we have gained as creators and managers of two successful Escape the Room games, followed by those two unique virtual gamebooks:
This Kickstarter campaign is our PERSONAL INVITATION to all the fans of unusual, innovative, and exciting challenges.
If you’re one of those people, now is the time to join us!
Become a Co-Creator of EXITUS and help us create a game that is an exciting challenge to the mind and a unique treat to the senses.

We rely on a solid and experienced team of professionals with proven expertise in their fields and with whom we’ve already worked on our previous games. They are wonderful people, and we trust them unconditionally because with time, we’ve become more than collaborators – we’ve become friends.
The names of all those who have helped EXITUS to become a reality will be ceremoniously announced in the completed project and will remain part of it forever.
Editors, translators, programmers, graphic designers, artists, puzzle testers, sound-recording experts, and … YOU. Because only with the support you give now will EXITUS become a reality, while we promise that the final result will very likely exceed all your expectations.

To make it as simple and easy as possible, for the Add-ons we will use the built-in option in Kickstarter.
Each of our Co-Creators will have the chance to add to their pledge more additional EXITUS base packages at the exclusive price of only 12 EUR per game. 
So, if you want to make a gift to a friend or family member, for the price of 12 EUR you will offer her or him something truly special - one unforgettable experience.



The packaging and sending of the rewards which include the ARTE FACTA Set will be done by a team of our own and directly monitored by us.
In principle, we can send those rewards to almost any country in the world. However, in view of the current situation dictated by a global pandemic, there may be some problems in receiving the package. If you believe that the country in which you live does not have a trusted postal system, you can choose a pledge level that does not require shipping.
IMPORTANT: When you pledge for the "Arte Facta"  Reward Level, the delivery price will be automatically added at the time of your pre-order. If you get a message that your country is not eligible for delivery, write us a personal message and we will check if we will be able to add your country of residence to the list.

 Help us reach more people!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are game makers, developers, team leaders, and publishers since 2014, so we are quite familiar with the full pipeline of product creation and its delivery. We do not expect any problems in completing the final version of the game because over 90% of it has already been created. 
However, when it comes to a multi-layered project like ours, there are certain parts of the process we cannot control. For example, unexpected illness of a team member, delay in the manufacturing process, global pandemic situation, or some force majeure circumstance. 
That said, we promise that we will do absolutely everything we can to overcome any problem that arises, so we can fulfill our commitment to all our Co-Creators by delivering them the best possible version of EXITUS. We promise, also, to regularly update our Co-Creators on Kickstarter during the campaign and often enough after, so you know exactly what the game status is. 

Terms and conditions: 

REFUND POLICY: Following the terms of Kickstarter, we will provide a full refund provided the request is received within 14 days of the close of the campaign. If a request is made after this period, any refund would be at our discretion and would be a maximum of 85% based on incurred fees. This project is in EUR, therefore, all refunds will be processed in EUR. 

CHANGES TO PRODUCT: By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the design, final look, and materials of the project are subject to change and may differ from what is presented on this page and while the Kickstarter campaign was active. 

DAMAGED PRODUCTS: Our game does not include easily breakable parts, and therefore we believe that all Co-Creators will receive their games intact. We promise that we will do our best to ensure that your package arrives in the best condition but if you still find a broken part in your package, we will replace it for you. However, all decisions on part replacements due to damage occurred during delivery will be made at our discretion and on a case-by-case basis. 

RETURNED PRODUCTS: If you refuse to accept and/or collect your package on arrival, we cannot issue you a refund for the cost of the pledge. 

FAILURE TO RESPOND TO SURVEY: Surveys will be completed through Kickstarter. If you fill out the survey after the designated time frame, your package may be delayed in sending to you. If you do not fill out the survey until after the declared end of the project, we may not be able to send it to you. 
By pledging on this Kickstarter, you agree that our responsibility to you is for sending your order. You are responsible for import duties or other fees that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities in your country. 
You also accept that you are fully liable for incorrect shipping details and will risk your pledge being unable to be delivered.

By pledging to this project you are indicating that you understand and give consent to the risks, challenges, and the project's terms and conditions laid out above.

campaign.story:
Get these products on store shelves
This project will fund a print run of 4 tabletop RPG products. Everything's written and ready to go, but we're asking for your pledge to fund the printing costs.
 Barrow Keep: Den of Spies (Zine) - A low-prep, old-school setting, driven by playbooks and adaptable, easy-to-run scenarios. You play the young residents of the Keep who deal with mysteries, treacheries, and intrigues. Includes play kits for 5e, Troika, OSE, and Sharp Swords & Sinister Spells. 
 Shortsword (Zine) - Welcome to a miserable world of precarious adventure! Grab a couple of six sided die and embark on this journey with a rules light system inspired by grim TTRPGs of old. First time in print! 
 Bone Marshes (Book) - An OSR adventure module about getting lost in a burning marsh. Includes a ruleset based on Knave and a detailed hex-crawl with dozens of locations and new monsters. This third edition adds a dozen pages of content! 
 Patron's Cookbook (Book) - A collection of 49 adventures for Dungeon World released over several years during Joe's Patreon. First time in print! 
More books and zines may be funded through Stretch Goals, so spread the word!
All PDFs are also being updated to conform to Section 508 Accessibility Guidelines.
Books vs Zines
The difference between a "book" and a "zine" is a deep philosophical question that we have no answer for. For our purposes, a book retails for $20+ while a zine retails for less than $20.
The backer rewards group books and zines together; buy a book and get a zine for free! It may seem weird but it keeps orders and payments simple on our end while giving y'all a great deal. 
We'll send out a survey in early April so you can choose which books and zines you want.
If you want to buy zines separately, or order multiple copies, or other changes, then help us fund so you can place custom orders later (looking at you, retailers). But for this Kickstarter we're keeping things simple; order a book and get a zine for free.
Chart of books vs zines
Books
"Patron's Cookbook" by Joe Banner
"Bone Marshes" by David Schirduan
"Clink" (unlocked at $4500) by David Schirduan
"Adventure Trilogy" (unlocked at $6000) by Joe Banner
Zines
"Shortsword" by Giuliano Roverato
"Barrow Keep: Den of Spies" by Richard Ruane
"Tempered Legacy" (unlocked at $4500) by David Schirduan
"Lowcountry Crawl #1" (unlocked at $7000) by John Gregory and Steven Bramlett
Timeline
1. Early April - We send out a survey so you can choose your Books and Zines.
2. Mid April - We deliver PDF rewards to all backers.
3. Late April - We place the print order with Mixam.
4. May - The products arrive at Spear Witch.
5. Early June - You will receive a special code to place your order. This is when you pay for shipping!
6. Late June - Spear Witch ships out the books and zines. Easy peasy.
We've partnered with the SoulMuppet Webstore to reduce shipping costs for EU backers! Updated shipping costs:
US: $5
UK: £5
EU: £15
These prices may fluctuate of course, but that's the best estimate we can give right now. I hope these reduced costs allow more European backers to participate in this exciting project!
$3500 Budget 
Piechart showing budget breakdowns
 $1,000 - Bone Marshes
 $1,000 - Patron's Cookbook
 $230 - Shortsword
 $630 - Barrow Keep
 $350 - Kickstarter Fees
 $290 - MISC (Joe Banner will be reviewing the print files and Richard will update PDFs for accessibility). 
This is a decentralized printing run. David is managing the project, but all the money raised goes towards the print run and creators keep the books for themselves. Any extra money raised past Stretch Goals go towards printing more books.
Stretch Goals
If we raise enough money we can add more books to this project. After these are unlocked you may choose them in your reward survey!
Chart of books vs zines
 $4500 Clink (Book) - A tabletop RPG about drifters, the creeds that bring them together, and the history that drives them apart. This game uses coins to tell a story inspired by spaghetti westerns, Ronin tales, and shows like Firefly or Supernatural.
 $4500 Tempered Legacy (Zine) - A magic item supplement for fantasy RPGs. The powers of these items are locked behind the regrets of previous owners.
 $6000 Adventure Trilogy (Book) - Three classic adventures for Dungeon World, or any tabletop fantasy Roleplaying Games: "Shadows of Umberto", "The Green Scar", and "The Mirkasa Chronicles".
 $7000 Lowcountry Crawl #1 (Zine) - Lowcountry Crawl is a roleplaying game supplement for DnD-ish games. Most of the content is system-agnostic, but the creature stats are OSR. It's chock full of tables, house rules, monsters, and other resources acting together as a toolbox for generating a deep coastal South-inspired atmosphere. This 2nd edition includes additional content and more art! 
 $8000 Stickers! - We'll include a handful of fun stickers in every print order. These stickers will be custom-made from art and jokes related to the products in this project.
The Team
pictures of the team
Richard Ruane is the creator of Chronicles of the Spacejammer, Barrow Keep: Den of Spies, and Moonlight on Roseville Beach. He was nominated for an IGDN Groundbreaker Award for Best Setting for his game Dark Designs in Verdigris. He created R. Rook Studio in 2019. By day, he is an instructional designer and content developer living in Brooklyn, NY.
Giuliano Roverato is a full time nerd and part time advertiser from Brazil. Best known for the culinary adventure, Bakto’s Terrifying Cuisine, he is trying to spend less time complaining on Twitter.
David Schirduan is a programmer during the week and a game designer on the weekends. He publishes weird games for Technical Grimoire. He is always seeking out new opportunities and connections.
Joe Banner is a writer and games designer living in South England. He's probably best known for writing approximately a bazillion short-form adventures for Dungeon World (and other systems) on his Patreon. He's contributed to several Kickstarters in the past, including The Perilous Wilds by Lampblack and Brimstone.
Jared Sinclair is an editor and sometimes writer of games and games-related material. His work as a writer includes Anti-Sisyphus, What's So Cool About Outer Space?, Prismot!, and The Vanilla Game. He also runs Spear Witch, an independent online bookstore specializing in small-creator gamebooks and zines.

campaign.story:
Relive the legendary Battle of Waterloo!
Experience the third game in Hall or Nothing's award-winning Historic Epic Battle System (HEBS) card game series.
18th June 1815, Napoleon Bonaparte is determined to rise back to power and claim all of Europe as his prize. But the forces led by an unassuming yet undefeated Arthur Wellesley and his charismatic Prussian ally Blücher are amassing to stop Napoleon in his tracks.
Players: 1-2 (up to 4 with additional sets)
Time: 30-40 minutes
Ages: 10+ 
 “The French system of conscription brings together a fair sample of all classes; ours is composed of the scum of the earth—the mere scum of the earth. It is only wonderful that we should be able to make so much out of them afterwards” – 
Notes of conversations with the Duke of Wellington, Philip Henry, 5th Earl Stanhope 
1815, Scum of the Earth is an asymmetric, competitive, tactical card game. It is the third game in the critically acclaimed Historic Epic Battle System, and successor to the award-winning games 1066, Tears to Many Mothers and 1565, St. Elmo's Pay.
Deeply thematic, but richly and lovingly researched, 1815, Scum of the Earth presents the Battle of Waterloo as you've never seen it before.
Since we hit £90,261, peeps we'll have some special guests from Kilforth join us in the game too...
For the first time, you will now be able to play the Historic Epic Battle System (HEBS) with up to 4 players providing you have more than one base set!
There are normally only two leaders in each HEBS game, but the additional two bonus leaders included with every copy of 1815, Scum of the Earth – Prussian Field Marshal Blücher and French Marshal Ney – allow you to play with 3-4 players when using two core games.
With two core games you will battle over 6 Frontiers, side by side with an ally – you can pass troops to each other via your Reserves, as well as being able to target either of your foes with events and abilities.
You can also play multiplayer by using and/or mixing 1815, Scum of the Earth with other previous HEBS games too. So if you want to, for example, pit Napoleon's armies of 1815, Scum of the Earth against the Ottomans of 1565, St. Elmo's Pay, now's your chance!
In 1815, Scum of the Earth, each player, as either the Duke of Wellington or Napoleon (and/or Blücher and Michel Ney), musters troops and resources to overcome the various obstacles in their path before their armies clash in an epic battle over three farms forward of the ridge at Waterloo: Hougoumont, La Haye Sainte, and Papelotte.
Every arresting card in the game is inspired by a real person or event from the time. With a focus on quick, tactical play, and a thematic re-imagining of the events of the time, the game is non-collectable, and there is no deck building required. Each player simply grabs their deck and shuffles, then play begins. 
Relive the bloody Battle of Waterloo and the tumultuous events leading up to it, and stamp your mark on the history of the world... 
From the team behind the lauded Kilforth series of Fantasy Quest Games, Shadows of Kilforth and Gloom of Kilforth (Tabletop Gaming Magazine's Game of the Year Award winner) and 1066, Tears to Many Mothers (the beautiful game that launched the Historic Epic Battle System), 1815, Scum of the Earth is the ultimate card game of war and history. 
Hall or Nothing awards
In 1815, Scum of the Earth both players race against each other to overcome a series of asymmetrical historical objectives that the British Duke of Wellington, Arthur Wellesley and the Emperor of the French, Napoleon Bonaparte had to overcome in order to battle each other at Waterloo. Returning from exile after his defeat at Leipzig, Napoleon is set to take on Europe yet again, and the fate of the world is in your hands!
1815, Scum of the Earth is an asymmetric, competitive tactical card game in the style of Magic the Gathering but non-collectable. The complete game is in the box. Striking artwork complements sumptuous production values. All character names are taken directly from history. 
As with all of our games 1815, Scum of the Earth is Solo Friendly. The game and all the cards contained in it are fully playable solo, and an 'AI' Foe with varying levels of difficulty for the enemy player has been developed in partnership with an expert team of solo players from the One Player Guild on boardgamegeek led by the great Paul Ibbs. Some cards even have solo specific effects too!
The Solo rules can be found here. 
Solo Against Multiple Foes?!
Feeling particularly tough? Want to take on two Foes at once? With two core sets you can now play solo against two Foes simultaneously, each of varying difficulty if you so choose! Find out what it was like for Napoleon to take on the cunning of Wellington and Blücher at the same time. Or reverse the situation and play as Marshal Ney and Napoleon against only Wellington, for example.
UPDATE: We've also cleaned up the setup for solo play so you can now speed through the early game by getting to the cards your Foe can play much more quickly.
The first game in the series, 1066, Tears to Many Mothers won Game of the Year and Best Art awards and was a runner up in the Golden Geek and Origins Awards for 'Best Historical Board Game'. 1565, St. Elmo's Pay won the Dice Tower Seal of Approval as well as Tabletop Gaming Magazine's Must Play award.
1815, Scum of the Earth honours this heady legacy whilst breathing new life into the system with all new and original art, all new characters, all new units, all new historical stories, and featuring brand new card abilities too...
 3-4 Players (with 2 sets): Channel soldiers into your ally's battlefield 
 Revamped Solo Play: Cleaner setup + battle multiple Foes! 
 HEBS Weather Deck Expansion: Battlefield conditions that affect both sides!

 Ridge Defenders: Educe Wellington's tactics to save your soldiers! 
 Mired: Soak your enemies in mud and rain! 
 Duelling: Target specific units to grind your foes to dust! 
 Fated Characters: Powerful heroes whose deaths bring consequences!  
 Brothers-In-Arms: Killer units who bring their friends with them!

 and many more!

In 1815, Scum of the Earth, each round players take turns to play cards and build their armies. Play units, characters, tactics, attachments, and events, all based on the real figures, weapons, and occurrences that resulted in Napoleon's downfall. 
Whilst racing each other to deploy the best army, players must also defeat a variety of historical obstacles that their respective leaders had to conquer on their way to Ligny, Quatre Bras, and Waterloo. Master Napoleon's bloodless revolution in Paris; experience Old Nosey's (Wellington's) marshaling of the Allied forces; not to mention Wellington's partaking in the Duchess of Richmond's glamorous ball in Brussels on the night before the bloodbath of Waterloo commenced. Many of the beautifully dressed officers lay dead in their dancing shoes within 24 hours...
The Battle of Waterloo is initially fought over three Frontiers of troops (just as the real battle was), represented by three Frontier cards: Hougoumont, La Haye Sainte, and Papelotte. Players compete for these cards by inflicting damage on them. Careful hand, resource, and tableau management is required for victory, and the first player to claim two Frontiers wins the game!
