campaign.story:
The newest edition of the Deadlands: The Weird West roleplaying game (at the printer and shipping early 2021!) focuses on Wild Western tales of local horror, and what could be better than a good old-fashioned cattle drive from Hell!
This twisted tale takes a posse of hard-riding drovers and their Texas Longhorns from the rolling hills of Texas through swollen streams in Colorado, the mountain passes of New Mexico, the haunted prairies of Wyoming, and more! The weirdness escalates along the way, slowly exposing our heroes to the true horrors of the Weird West. So saddle up, partners, and join us on a Blood Drive!
Includes PDFs and VTT assets for the Blood Drive Campaign, Figure Flats, Archetype Set 3, Infernal Device cards, AND Map Pack 3 (End of the Line) and 4 (Ambush Pass!). See below for more details!
Includes the PRINT version of the Blood Drive campaign book and TWELVE new PRINTED Archetype Cards! You also get the PDF and VTT versions of the book, Figure Flats, Archetype and Infernal Device Cards, and Map Pack 3 (End of the Line) and 4 (Ambush Pass)! (Go All In for the PRINTED maps at a special, one-time only rate!)
Includes PRINT version of the Blood Drive campaign book, THREE sheets of individually DIE-CUT cardboard pawns, TWELVE new Archetype Cards, and SIX Infernal Device Cards! You also get the PDF and VTT versions of everything, including Map Pack 3 (End of the Line) and 4 (Ambush Pass)! (Go All In for the PRINTED maps at a special, one-time only rate!)
Includes PRINT version of the Blood Drive campaign book, THREE sheets of individually DIE-CUT cardboard Pawns, TWELVE new Archetype Cards, SIX Infernal Device Cards, and Map Pack 3 (End of the Line) and 4 (Ambush Pass)! You also get the PDF and VTT versions of everything.
Here's a closer look at the rewards, amigos!
Blood Drive is a 96-page hardcover book printed in full color.
The Blood Drive Campaign Book
This gorgeous, graphic-novel size hardback contains all you need to run this epic tale of intrigue, adventure, and exploration. The story takes our heroes from greenhorn cowpunchers to hardened trail hands, letting players take on the roles of regular cowboys and cowgirls or any mix of Deadlands' unique character types.
Interior spreads from the book, already laid out and ready for printing! Your support helps us create the additional materials we think will add to the entire Deadlands experience!
Archetype Cards
Our Archetype Cards allow players to jump into Blood Drive or any other Deadlands game quickly. We gave you a passel of pregenerated characters in the original Deadlands Kickstarter, and Set 3 adds even more ready-to-play heroes and heroines to choose from!
Print Version: 127x89mm on sturdy and durable 350gsm cardstock.
12 new Archetype Cards suitable for Blood Drive or your own Deadlands games. Stay tuned for updates and previews as the Kickstarter drives on!
Pawns
This project features three sheets of Deadlands Pawns containing a selection of characters and critters and brand new terrain pieces as well! (We'll have art to show you soon, partners!)
We'll supplement your maps with campfires, a chuck wagon, hangin' trees, and other bits you'll find useful for Blood Drive or your own outdoor adventures, all printed on thick, die-cut punchboard. 
Beautifully illustrated front and back and easy to transport, Deadlands Pawns make your games come to life on the tabletop, especially when used with our gorgeous new map packs (see below)!
Sample pawns from our first pawn set. We'll have new art to show soon for these Blood Drive-specific pawns.
Infernal Device Cards
Mad Scientists in the Weird West harness the Hellish energy of the superfuel known as ghost rock to power their incredible gizmos. These quick reference cards grant convenient access to the most important information about six common infernal gadgets, adding to those already printed in the original boxed set.
Print Version: 2.5" x 3.5" on 300gsm cardstock.
Map Packs
Deadlands Map Packs are large, 30" x 24" double-sided laminated maps for use with miniatures or our Deadlands pawns. They're marked with a  light one inch grid, perfect for Savage Worlds. Map Pack 3: End of the Line features a train station, corner saloon, and other classic western buildings. Map Pack 4: Ambush Pass features wilderness terrain ideal for use in Blood Drive. We'll have detailed images for you soon!
Print Version: 30" x 24", double-sided, laminated cardstock for use with dry and wet-erase pens.
Artist's render of a Deadlands pawn on Map Pack 1 (Grand Saloon).
Our Kickstarter Boosters are smaller support projects for our existing lines. They come with Booster Rewards built-in rather than Stretch Goals. We're definitely going to print them on our own no matter what and want you to know that up front, but are asking for your backing so we can order the right amount and most importantly, create the extras that add to the entire experience for all of us—like maps, pawns, and additional Archetype Cards. We play too, and we want all these goodies as much as we hope you do!
Why Kickstarter?
Pinnacle is very fortunate and grateful to have a loyal and established group of friends and fans who enjoy playing our games, but it's sometimes very hard to get our products to you. We love game stores and sell to them through our fulfillment partners at Studio2 and through traditional distribution, but we also know many of you don't have a store in your neighborhood, or your local store just doesn't carry our games.
For those that do, great! Retailers who want in on our Kickstarters get discounted versions of the rewards including Stretch Goals for them and their customers. If you're a retailer, just sign up to our newsletter for all the details. (And gamers, please feel free to let your local store know!) Retailers also get their rewards when backer orders go out, usually several weeks before they show up in the traditional distribution chain.
In sum...
If you want Blood Drive and the extras we're offering with it, back this Kickstarter Booster.
If you want Blood Drive but prefer to support your local store, GREAT! You can pledge for the Digital reward level here if you like, get the Booster Rewards, then order the print version of the book from your store later next year. (But be sure to tell them or they might not order it on their own!)
Deadlands is the premier Weird Western setting. You can download the free Test Drive, here to see what it's all about.
If you missed the Deadlands: the Weird West Kickstarter, you can still get in on the action through the pledge manager, which is still open. Anything you add through that pledge manager will be delivered as soon as it arrives in our warehouse in early 2021.
You'll be able to add these items to your Blood Drive order in the Pledge Manager.
You can also add on our other Deadlands products once we launch the Blood Drive pledge manager (available sometime after this Kickstarter Booster closes and funds). There you'll be able to add on extras like the Deadlands core boxed set, pawns, the Horror at Headstone Hill campaign, town maps, Action Cards, Bennies, and more!
Spread the word!
It's hard for a small company like ours to get the word out about our game and our worlds. If you care to help boost the signal, you can do so using the following channels. Much obliged, amigo!
Blood Drive is written and in layout. Your support allows us to create the extras and get the word out to other fans (by far the hardest challenge for a small company like ours).
We plan to deliver the PDF of the book and cards a few weeks after the project funds and we get the final backer list from Kickstarter.  This means delivery of the main PDFs about a month after funding and the physical products about 5 months later depending on the printer and shipping, and barring unforeseen mishaps...y'know, like world-wide pandemics and all!
Digital Rewards
We deliver PDF materials through the Pinnacle website  first, then through DriveThruRPG.com.
Physical Rewards
After the Kickstarter ends we'll use a pledge manager to collate the physical pledges and allow you the opportunity to include additional Pinnacle products with your pledge. 
We'll charge for shipping after the Kickstarter through the pledge manager, but below is a table estimating how much the shipping will be. It's possible these prices may go down as we continue to seek out different options, but we won't charge you any more than what's listed below.
*Prices exclusive of VAT/GST, shown in USD. We will collect and pay customs in the pledge manager. USA backers pay no additional shipping on Add Ons!
Customs and Taxes for EU, UK, Canada, Australia, and New Zealand
We know international shipping is an expensive part of buying games and we're constantly looking for ways to reduce those costs.
The above rates are postage only. Depending on your location, additional VAT/GST will be added to your order in the pledge manager. For example, current VAT for books in the UK is 0%, while Denmark is 25%. After collecting these fees in the pledge manager, our regional partners pay the taxes and file paperwork for you during shipping!
To save on international shipping, consider having one of your friends pledge for your whole posse, then "Add-On" additional books to a single package. You should also encourage your local retailer to sign up as a Savage Retailer so they can order directly from us (before it hits regular distribution). Then you can buy the physical product from your favorite local game store, while you pledge at a digital reward level so you don't miss out on the digital Stretch Goals.
We Ship Anywhere in the World
Email Info@peginc.com for an estimate to ship to your location if you don't see it above.  You can also use the handy calculator at USPS.com (most rewards ship in a 12x12x12 inch box, but the Book Only tier will likely ship in a padded envelope).
Delivery for Merchants
Read our "Welcome, Retailer!" Newsletter here for the basics we recommend for your store!
All retailers located in the contiguous United States receive free shipping. Retailers in Hawaii, Alaska, and outside the United States receive discounted shipping. The store also receives Kickstarter products before retail release and may restock other Pinnacle products with their order. We recommend retailers sign up for our Savage Retailer newsletter here (no pledge required at this time). Customers of Savage Retailers may request complimentary PDFs of books purchased by emailing Info@peginc.com.
Any Questions? Email Pinnacle customer service at Info@peginc.com

Tabletop Tycoon will donate a game to Toys for Tots for each game sold through this campaign. To date, we’ve raised enough as a company to donate over 60,000 games to kids. This campaign will help give even more! 
The Newest Expansion to Nemo's War is Here! Featuring...
 A COMPREHENSIVE OPERATIONS MANUAL & BETWEEN VOYAGES GUIDE: The new Operations Manual shows how to run the ship turn-by-turn and includes many useful appendices at the end, while the new Between Voyages Guide features instruction for setup, ending the game, scoring, epilogues, variants, and more!

 A NEW 2-PLAYER VERSUS VARIANT: Joining the riveting solo and cooperative modes where players command the Nautilus, in this game variant one player will play as the Imperialists, bent on its defeat. Includes special cards and 2 Imperial Squadron Miniatures!  

 A NEW CHARACTER TILE: Entering our story is Nemo’s son, Nadeen Dakkar, who crosses paths with his father after hearing news of mysterious events at sea!

 NEW FINALE CARDS: Spice up your endings with The Trap, Imperialists’ Catspaw, Scientific Espionage, and The Kraken! 

 NEW STERN MOTIVES, ADDITIONAL NAUTILUS UPGRADES, AND EVEN MORE TOKENS & MARKERS! 
Brave the hazards of the seas, combat vessels around the globe, incite uprisings, chronicle amazing wonders, find mysterious treasures -- your quest knows no bounds in this Ultimate Edition. Combining all expansion content, including the Journey’s End Expansion, both new and returning players will be able to experience everything Nemo’s War has to offer. Play solitaire, cooperatively, or competitively; the choice is yours!

Each turn, you must address the seas’ challenges in a grand adventure, confront the growing pressure of the Imperialist powers’ navies, undertake Actions with the Nautilus and her crew – all while maintaining Captain Nemo’s spirit to continue.  The Turn Sequence is as follows:

Begin each turn in the Event Phase by flipping an event, Test, or other card from the Adventure Deck. Favorably resolving Tests, and using resources to manipulate your die rolls in this pursuit, will be critical to securing a victory no matter what your motive is.
Roll high, captains, but be careful: your mission ends in Defeat if you deplete a Ship Resource. Developing an understanding of the probabilities, risks, and rewards for each Test and to what degree will ultimately be the reason for your mission’s success or failure.
Next is the Placement Phase, where you roll the dice for this round’s Oceans for Ship token placement based on the game’s current Act and your Notoriety. Strategic choices about where to place your ships, what we call “painting the board,” will be crucial to your plans! Which Oceans to populate (and, through combat, denude) is the vital strategic chess game you are playing with the Imperialist powers who oppose you.
 You also receive the Differential Roll result of the two (selected) white dice rolled in Action Points for that turn. If the two (selected) white dice are doubles, a Lull Turn takes place..
  Now it’s time to act! During the Action Phase, you spend your Action Points to Move, Attack, Search for Treasure, Incite Uprisings, and more, all to advance Nemo’s goals.
Always remember: you are questing for the greatest number of Victory Points (VPs) that you can acquire, as modified by Captain Nemo’s Motive, while avoiding the many ways to suffer defeat. BVPs are earned in several ways (e.g., sinking enemy ships, passing TEST Events, collecting Treasures, inciting oppressed peoples, making scientific discoveries, etc), so choose your actions wisely each turn, and beware: 
 Your mission ends in Defeat if your adventures gain too much notoriety, as you become an international Pariah to be hunted down mercilessly.

Repeat these Phases until the game ends with your early defeat or you reveal the Finalé card that ultimately instructs you: “The game ends!”

When all is said and done, read the epilogue to your voyage in the Between Voyages Guide. Your level of victory and motive will change the story of your Journey’s End.

Here's a Preview and How to Play video for The Ultimate Edition from the Game Boy Geek:
You can also check out this How to Play from Meeple University with designer & developer Alan Emrich! This video uses an older edition of the game, but it does an excellent job of showing the gameplay.

campaign.story:
Welcome to the Royal Grand Opera House, the largest and most prestigious theatre in the city of Pavilion. All of your characters have just joined the company of the Royal Grand in one of several potential roles. You might be an actor, dancer or musician, but you might also work backstage on the crew, in wardrobe, lighting or sound or even as a stage manager.
Your contract had an extra section asking if you would be happy to do 'additional duties' for a very small bump in salary. You thought that might be just putting out chairs before a rehearsal, or having to help tidy the auditorium or suchlike. Unfortunately, it turns out to be much more.
Other theatres send spies and saboteurs in to try and ruin the show, and you have to stop them. But that's not all, ghosts haunt the theatre looking to suck the life out of the audience. Horrors are often drawn up from the impossibly deep basement levels by the sounds of the show. Then there are the cursed props that need to be handled exceptionally carefully. The rats in the building are also intelligent, so watch out for that.
You and the other poor souls who agreed to additional duties have to solve all these problems. No one cares how, as long as the audience never knows. However, you also have a job in the show to do, and if you miss a cue because you were fighting a ghost, chasing a saboteur or trying to intimidate a morlock that's no excuse.
Opera House is a tabletop roleplaying game designed with three things in mind.
First, its everything you'd expect of a tabletop RPG, with the option to tell stories in the strange world of the Royal Grand Opera House.
Second, the game can be played in a single session, 'one night only' mode where events occur in real time during the performance of a show.
Finally, Opera house is a theatre sourcebook. It explains what each department does in a theatre, and how a show is put together from auditions to the final night.
The book also offers a full description of the Royal Grand Opera House itself. It is a vast building with more than enough stories packed inside its walls to run whole campaigns without ever setting foot outside. As the building is self contained it might be transplanted into almost any setting to suit your group's current campaign.
Opera House is a complete stand alone RPG. The book will be available in pdf and as a letter size black and white interior hardback book.
My name is Andrew Peregrine and I’ve been writing and creating games for over ten years. I’ve worked as a freelancer for Cubicle 7 (Doctor Who/Victoriana), Onyx Path (Vampire 20), Margaret Weis Production (Leverage/Firefly), Eden Studios (Buffy/Angel), Modiphius (Vampire 5/Star Trek) EN Publishing (Judge Dredd) and AEG (7th Sea) among many others. I'm also currently the project manager for the Dune: Adventures in the Imperium RPG on the way from Modiphius.
However, as well as being a games writer I've also been working in the professional theatre for around thirty years. I have acted in amateur theatre, but went to drama college to study stage management and technical theatre. Since graduating I've worked all manner of jobs, mainly in theatre lighting, across the industry. I'm currently the Deputy Chief electrician at the Theatre Royal Haymarket in the West End of London.
As Corone Design I’ve released my own independent products including the anarchic Hellcats and Hockeysticks, the dark Dance of the Damned and horrific Pie Shop. I've also successfully funded and completed a kickstarter project before with Cabal.
As well as my playtesting team, I’ve had some great help from many awesome people. Not least of which are Andrew O’Hara who has been my layout lifesaver, Mark Stewart-Birch who crafted the graphic design and the incredible Jon Hodgson who put together the excellent introduction video and my editor Keith Garrett.
Now we come to the tricky bit, getting the product to you after the Kickstarter!
To make this as simple as possible, I'm going to be using Drivethrurpg's fulfilment process. The advantage of doing this is that it puts all the shipping and packaging into the hands of professionals with a worldwide network. This means the game can ship to anywhere in the world, although you will need to add the costs for shipping the product yourself. Additionally, there is a small unit charge for any print copies of the game, but the print pledge levels take this into account.
So, the things you need to know are:
Opera House will be an letter size hardcover book with a colour cover and black and white interior. The current page count is around 200 pages.
Shipping costs will be extra, you can see more about Drivethrurpg's charges in this regard here.
There will be an extra charge (the printing cost) for each print reward. This should be around $10.31 or £7.62 but this may change a little as their prices may vary and my page count isn't quite fixed yet. Its a little higher than I'd like so I'll see if I can reduce that.
But you will still not be paying any more than the retail value. When it hits retail the price will by £28 ($36) in print and £14 ($22) PDF, so backing now, even with the extra unit cost still offers a discount.
By the way, everyone who backs Opera House gets their name in the book. Everyone. Without you there is no game, so credit where its due!
The book will not be available for sale until all the backer rewards have been completed, and will only be available in the final version including the stretch goals.
£1 Theatre Tour
You just popped in to have a look round the building, and that's fine. Hopefully you'll book a ticket if something catches your fancy. This is a great way to bookmark the campaign and keep an eye on things as you can always upgrade later.
£10 Online Audience
With social distancing its tricky to get a seat. But you can still support the performance digitally. You get a PDF of the final version of Opera House. The PDF will be £15 when it goes on general sale so you get a solid discount.
£20 Royal Circle Seats Discounted
You want to see the show and get the souvenir brochure. You get a copy of Opera House in both print and PDF. This option gives you everything with a significant discount as both print and PDF will add up to £42 on general release.
£30 Block Booking Discounted
As a retailer you will be after a few seats for the show, maybe even a coach party. You get five copies of the final version of Opera House in print. The book will also be available on the bits and mortar scheme so you can provide PDFs to your customers. However, like any print version you will need to pay for the books unit cost and shipping. I will need to see some evidence you are a retailer but I'll not be needing a full background check! Drop me a line for more details via the kickstarter message board.
Adding Cabal
In amending some of the pledge levels I'm able to offer a deal on my other kickstarter game 'Cabal'  Take a look at the kickstarter here 
So, if you want to get hold of both games you can select one of the 'season Ticket' pledge levels.
Each copy of Cabal in print will cost an additional $3.51 for the print cost. The pdf costs you nothing extra.
£25 Royal Circle Season Ticket
This gets you a print-at-cost and pdf copy of Opera House, and the same for Cabal. 
£40 Block Booking Season Ticket
As well as 5 print-at-cost copies of Opera house, you get 5 print-at-cost copies of Cabal as well.

Sadly I was forced to make some amendments, so don't back the old Royal Circle or Block Booking pledge levels or you will just pay more money than you should. 
 I'm not planning a lot of stretch goals for this project as I just want to get it out there. Stretch goals can start to complicate the project and create delays. But if we do well I'll be looking at adding some more goodies. However, I should have something on the horizon at least to start the ball rolling, so...
£4000 Map of the Royal Grand
The Royal Grand Opera House is a vast building, so navigating around it is usually done in quite broad terms. But its always nice to have a map and if we get the funds I'll be commissioning the renowned RPG graphic artist Mikael Brodu to craft something cartographical.
£5000 Rewards for Backstage
If we hit this level I'll be able to add a bonus to the amazing people who have done such excellent for criminally low wages.
While it is not alone, the theatre and events industry across the world has suffered a crippling blow with the advent of Covid-19 and social distancing. While the industry recognises the importance of public health and keeping our audiences safe, government assistance has been painfully minimal, leaving the industry on a precipice. In the UK we were among the first industries to close and will be the last to open. Many amazing shows are simply unable to break even without a decent size audience.
With most of the industry freelance, there has been little to no support for actors and backstage staff.  These people are not just wealthy celebrities, but jobbing actors, technicians, stage managers, wardrobe and crew etc. who don't earn a particularly impressive wage at the best of times. With no option to work from home, and companies unable to keep them on, they have been left with nothing.
With no events, we have already seen several production companies and theatres announce bankruptcy and most of the few full time staff remaining are facing redundancy. On a personal note, it has been heartbreaking to see so many talented people looking at the end of their entire careers. Theatre is a tough industry at the best of times, but we are looking at a collapse that may take decades to repair. The industry hasn't asked for a full bailout as it recognises how many others are also in need. But its calls for a minimal package to keep its head above water (such as a furlough extension) feel like they have been ignored.
If you care about the theatre, which I hope is what has led you to this game, please also consider supporting the following charities that are trying to keep the actors and backstage staff afloat through these difficult times. Just buying a T-shirt helps to raise money and awareness. While I'm not allowed to add charitable donations as part of the kickstarter, or use its funds for charity, I'm looking at making donations from the post kickstarter earnings of the project. Thankyou for anything you can do to help.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Opera House is fully written and edited, with art and a cover. So this kickstarter is designed to recoup my losses rather than get the funds to start it. Even if it fails horribly I'll be offering the game for sale via retail.

I've already run a successful and complete kickstarter campaign before with my game Cabal. So I'm familiar with most of the problems and issues that come up.

I hope to amend any mistakes I’ve made with the Kickstarter as we go, but I’m keeping things simple to avoid as many problems as possible. Retailer levels are new to me, so that may take a little adjustment, but I have talked to FLGSs about what they need and expect. 

As such I honestly welcome any advice and suggestions you may have to improve this project for you, the backer. Having said that, any marketing company who mails me to say how they can help my project reach thousands after its already funded will be ignored. Actually, I'm pretty likely to ignore any emails about marketing, the spam you get for running these things gets ridiculous!

Apologies this has taken a while, but I should emphasise its all me.
Mikael has been very patient with my lack of email as the sands of Arrakis have piled up around me.
But Dune is out in pdf now and its something else I and my team are very proud of, check it out here:

So, the final proof came back and it all looks fine.
So those of you who ordered a print at cost copy should now have a token to redeem at drivethrurpg for that. I've made the hardcopy option public so they should all work.
The print at cost should be about $11.30/£8.05 plus shipping.

So, I've uploaded the final files for print and the previous proof copy was perfect, so I was ready to send out print tokens.
But drivethrurpg insist (not entirely unfairly) I order another proof copy to check as its a new file.
So, once I have that in about 2 weeks (as long as its fine) I'll finally be issuing print tokens.

Quick update to say we've made all the final corrections to Opera House and there is now a new version 1.1 in the drivethrurpg library. If you have already reclaimed your token just check your library and the updated version will be there. If you've not sent me your survey or used your token, you'll have to do that but you'll be getting the 1.1 there too.
The only thing we've not been able to duplicate is the weird black blobs instead of art some people have had. We've tried the pdf on old and new systems on mac, PC and tablet and can't see the problem. With luck the is new file might fix that. But if it doesn't, do mail me with details of the system you are using and we can see if there is a common factor.

Just a quick message to remind you I need your survey back by the end of the month if you'd like your name in the book. 
If you've had a pdf token you're either already there or on my list for the final round of corrections. But if not, you'll miss your chance.
Obviously if you've sent a survey and not got the pdf yet, check your spam traps for the token otherwise drop me a line.

So, like any show, we stagger on for the first night and find a few bits of the set don't work the way they did in the dress rehearsal!
While most people seem to be getting their pdfs ok, I wanted to share a couple of issues that have been reported and what we can do about them if you've had this problem.
The first one was the initial release that should be fixed. I thought I could issue tokens for a project that was not on open sale, but it turns out I can't. So Opera House as a pdf is now available to the public and thats unlocked your tokens. This means if you were lightning fast to redeem your token and it just refused you, try again now it should be fine.

It looks like Drivethru can't cope with having the title private and processing tokens.
So I've made it live for pdf, which will solve the problem.
The tokens you already have should still all be valid.
I'd ideally wanted you all to have your copies first, but you will still be the first ones to see it.

If you've sent in your survey you should now have a token for a pdf copy of Opera House (and Cabal if you backed that level).
(if you don't  - check your spam filters, down the back of the sofa, etc.)
The code will take you to drivethrurpg where you should be able to redeem it for free.

updates.update_userinfo: Random Disasters - but the good kind
updates.update_content:
Fear not! Despite the title this is not an update about a last minute print disaster. Everything is on track and we're just putting the finishing touches to the pdf. 

But I do have a new bonus item for you, a Random Disaster Table. Its a table in the book, but I've put it up on the website as a useful accessory.

I've got almost all the names now we've hit the Jan 18th initial deadline so I've passed those on to Andy to make the final amendments to the book. Hopefully not long now until I at least put a pdf in your hands.
If you still haven't sent in a survey and want your name in the book there aren't many of you left. So I'm making Feb 1st the deadline for getting in a survey if you want to see your name in the list. Andy will then have a final update early in February and that will be the last one and the book will be locked.

campaign.story:
Find A-Puzzle-A-Day and many other fun and original puzzles at DragonFjord puzzles and games.
An incredibly fun and addictive puzzle with a new challenge every day!
We have a new puzzle that people are going crazy about. It’s called A-Puzzle-A-Day. 
It gives you a new challenge every single day of the year.
Incredibly fun and addictive!
All you need to do is fit these eight pieces into the calendar frame to leave one month and one day showing. Can you find your birthday? Your favorite holidays? Your anniversary? Today’s date? Every day you have a new puzzle!
There are almost 120 thousand ways the pieces fit in the frame, but finding the date you want can sometimes drive you crazy! (Some people decided it would be easier to change their birthdays instead!)

Everyone loves this puzzle!
“I can’t put this down! I think I’m addicted.” – John N.
“Genius! Most puzzles you only solve once and you’re done. This puzzle is a new puzzle every day.” – Terry E.
“My husband usually doesn’t like puzzles, but he plays with this one every day.” – Grete V.
“So much fun! Unbelievable that you can make every single day!” – Solveig D.
“I can’t solve August 26th, so I’m changing my birthday to August 24th.” – Kristin B.
A-Puzzle-A-Day is a great way to start your day! You'll keep your brain sharp, develop visualization skills and have a lot of fun trying to find the solution... every day of the year! This is a puzzle for all ages – young, old and everyone in-between!

Each puzzle comes with a fold-out calendar so you cross off each day as you find it. Can you find all 365+ solutions? Compete with your friends and family!
You're really going to love this puzzle. You can get several puzzles so you can compete with your friends and family. If you have a business, you can place them in your waiting rooms. Invited to dinner? Bring one as a gift!

Patented design - a whole new kind of puzzle
Most puzzles you can solve only once and you're done. A-Puzzle-A-Day is an exciting new challenge day after day! 

A-Puzzle-A-Day is a patented design (EUIPO 007690433) and is hand-assembled and packed in Norway at our headquarters in Vanvikan on the shores of Dragon Beach.

Size: 14 cm x 14 cm (5.5" x 5.5"), 8 pieces in a calendar frame. Our puzzles have distinctive burn marks ... maybe they were cut by dragons ... ?


Delivery
We're producing like crazy now and can send out our Early-bird orders the first week in December so you can have them in time for the holidays. We'll do our best to send out all orders as soon as we can, but delivery for non-Early-birds may take longer depending on demand.
Get in on our Early-bird special to catch a really low price and be one of the first to get your A-Puzzle-A-Day!  
A-Puzzle-A-Day makes a great holiday gift!
About us
We are a small puzzle-making business located on Dragon Beach (Drakestrand) on the shores of Trondheimsfjord in Norway. We design and produce many different puzzles. A-Puzzle-A-Day is our most popular and we're excited to offer this on Kickstarter.
Right now we’re operating with just one laser cutter in a small studio. With your help we can build up our production and expand our business around the world. Your support will help make this happen! Check out our other puzzles, too, at  www.dragonfjord.com! 
Gerd Åsta and Mike in our studio
Our gallery
We design and produce lots of different puzzles
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We believe there is very low risk that we cannot deliver as promised. We have many puzzles ready to go and we're working every day to make more. We are a small company with only one dragon cutting puzzles (well... one laser-cutter), so if we experience equipment failure we could be delayed. Barring a catastrophic event, we have high confidence we can have all Early-bird orders in the mail before December 7th so that our supporters can have their puzzles in time for Christmas. Mail service delays are a possibility beyond our control.

updates.update_userinfo: Our profile name is changing to DragonFjord
updates.update_content:
Hello! We've had a lot happening lately... new machines, workshop, designs, improvements to A-Puzzle-A-Day, new puzzles and new campaigns coming! We're excited to share the news with you shortly.

First, we want to be sure you know that we're changing our profile name to DragonFjord puzzles and games so that it will be easier to keep connected to our upcoming Kickstarter projects. We hope you'll keep an eye out for us!

We have had many people sending us a message that they have solved today's date. That has been incredibly fun! 
We invite you to post your solutions on our Facebook page:
DragonFjord Facebook page
There are so many different solutions and it will be exciting to see how many we can find as a group. Join us!

updates.update_userinfo: ALL ORDERS SENT FROM DRAGONFJORD - MORE IDEAS ARE SPINNING IN OUR HEADS...
updates.update_content:
Mike and I are very satisfied that we now have all the orders sent out... Early Birds and Regular Birds! (except for those we haven't gotten a survey from). We are overwhelmed with the positive energy from your good feedback and it is very motivating to us. Thank you all! 

Dragonfjord puzzles and games will be back with more fun and challenging ideas 2021. We are working on ideas and design for a couple of new products.

updates.update_userinfo: A-Puzzle-A-Day in other languages, and more of your ideas
updates.update_content:
We've enjoyed reading your comments on the surveys! Thank you for your suggestions, some of which we'll be implementing as we move forward.

Many backers were interested in a version in English, or German, or Hungarian or other languages, which we will DEFINITELY be making in the first part of next year. It will take some time after the New Year until we have our machines back in service, but we'll keep you updated. Exciting times ahead! Thank you!

Packages sent to all over the world - 36 different countries - we are so excited to see if they all arrive safe and in order! A few people have not filled in the surveys and we can't send them if we don't have their adress. Hopefully we get them soon!

updates.update_userinfo: Over an hour at the post-office licking stamps today!
updates.update_content: Yes, it took that long... we are struggeling with the post office system to print out 355 customs forms. We are learning a lot, not things that we necessarily are so eager to learn... anyways more packages on their way to their new homes!
We'll be sending out surveys tomorrow (Monday) so we can get your address and other info and begin addressing packages. After an exciting campaign we need to relax for the weekend with grandchildren.

updates.update_userinfo: Peaceful morning - unusual - nothing went wrong...
updates.update_content: Big surprise this morning - nothing bad happened!! Only a few minutes left until the campaign is over. Thank you so much for being a part of our adventure. The feedback you have given us, has been so encouraging. And since we have had such good respons, this will help us to buy extra replacement parts for the days coming... we also want to buy a new, faster and better laser cutter. Maybe there will be less feeling of dragons making them, since there will be less burn marks. We hope that you will follow us and our new projects. We want to start a blog on dragonfjord.com, so that you can learn more about what we are doing (and learn a little about life in Norway).

Thanks to all of you who have supported the project. It is only a few hours left untill the campaign is over.  Not only have we reached more than 900% of our goal and gotten more than 800 orders, but we've also had some orders from our webpage Dragonfjord Puzzles and Games. We have even gotten orders for some of the 3d puzzles that we make. (They are actually not a product that we want to sell because it takes forever to make them, but we have had so much fun making them!).  We are not expecting to get rich from our business, but we hope to be able to make a living from it!

campaign.story:
Trip 1907 Interactive Escape the Book Game was released in 2018. It has been translated by Kosmos Verlang in German, Polish, Frech, Italian, Czech and Hungarian under the title of EXIT das buch series of Kosmos EXIT GAMES. 
This second version will include a new gameplay system, new faster website,  and 5+ new puzzles and riddles.  

Trip 1907 (2nd Edition): Dark Sails, will be officially launched on March 2021 on Amazon.
Scattered around the globe, parts of a legendary naval diary.
Writings of an insane mind, while stories speak of a greater mystery filled with sea monsters, nightmares and messages from other dimensions.
Years since its disappearance, the sea legends speak of a dark journey, on a ship long forgotten. 
All that until now.
The missing pages of this journal have been mysteriously put together.
The naval diary appears every now and then on the doorsteps of people who challenge its existence.  It's now the time to see what lies hidden and reveal the ship's final days."
 The basic idea behind Trip 1907 (second edition), is to provide an enhanced game play by limiting the webpage usage, and focus on the hardcopy. In this version the webpage is only for submitting the chapters answers and receiving puzzle hints.
The main differences between Trip 1907 Interactive Escape the Book Game and Trip 1907 (2nd Edition): Dark Sails are on the game experience. The new version does not need logging into the website. The passcodes are there to save your progress as well as the sanity system is now embedded inside the book. The passcodes are transformed into game clues and 5 riddles have also been replaced with new ones, along with two Easter Eggs. In this version the book's story will be in the hard copy.
In this version of Trip 1907 (2nd Edition): Dark Sails you will find:
A new, faster, website has been added with no registration required.
The "sanity" token hint exchange system is now on the hard copy. It is up to the players to keep track of their sanity tokens spent, leaving more space to continue the book even if all sanity points are spent.
 Pass codes have been added in order to save the game progress and give a linearity on the game puzzles.
The game story will be on the hard copy instead of the website.
 5 riddles have been replaced with two easter eggs on the hard copy.  
In order to play Trip 1907 (2nd Edition):Dark Sails you will need:
A copy of Trip 1907 (2nd Edition): Dark Sails.
A pencil.
An internet connected device.
A pair of scissors.
In this version you will need to go through 45 chapters of the book, solve the puzzles, submit your answers online and get the passcodes of each chapter.
Trip 1907 (2nd Edition): Dark Sails  is finished. Given previous experience on Kickstarter the game is finished as well as the play-test getting an excellent response from our game testers.  In this way delivery is a primary issue to us and will be done through Amazon & KDP separately for every backer of this project. Main goal is to complete all the shipping process by the first days of January. 
EU countries together with USA and Canada have at the moment an estimation time for dispatching of 5-7 days.
Is Trip 1907 (2nd Edition): Dark Sails an eBook?
Nope, Trip 1907 is  a hard copy book.

Do I need an app to play it?
Nope, all you need is the copy of the book a pen and an internet connection.

Is there a hint system for the riddles?
A hint system is provided on trip1907.com, where players can exchange their sanity tokens for hints.

Are there any additional charges for playing the book?
Nope, once you have purchased your copy there are no additional perks to buy.

What is the language of the game?
English.

Is there a forum to keep up with the riddles?
A forum will be provided for players exchanging ideas over the riddles.

I have the original copy of Trip 1907 Interactive Escape the Book Game, should I back this one?
There are changes in 5 [puzzles and gameplay. So if you have played the first version you will only find 5 different riddles. The story and the rest of the riddles remain the same.

When this version will come out so I can buy it?
This version will be launched on February 2021.

                 Pages: 170+
                 Puzzles: 45+
                 Artwork pages: 20+

campaign.story:
Welcome to The Fantasy Trip, the classic fantasy RPG of labyrinth adventures that is back and growing larger than ever! Thanks to you and many other fans of The Fantasy Trip, we have successfully run and delivered a total of eight different Kickstarter campaigns for The Fantasy Trip. 

Hexagram #6 digital mock-up. The zine will be printed at Mixam, the same printer we have used for the other releases in the series.
Hexagram #6 is the latest in a series that started out as a part of Kickstarter's 2019 Zine Quest event. We had so much fun working on the zine that we just kept making new issues. Fortunately for us, you've had as much fun incorporating the Hexagram content into your games as we have had writing every issue. 
This latest issue includes:
Rapier to Rapier: Fencing inThe Fantasy Trip by Lester W. Smith
Forge Sprites by Stefan Jones
Maximum Range of Thrown Spells by Henry J. Cobb
Random Mission Generator by Jean McGuire
Questions Three: David Pulver by Steve Jackson
The Ultrahex Map by Howard Kistler
A Tool of Flesh by James Eisert
The Household Grimoire by John Paul Bakshoian
Gralls: Moss, Bracken, Briar, and Bramble by Gregory Miller
Medium: A Proposed New Talent by Benjamin Pew
The Stench Snake by Kelly Nall
Creating an Infinite Arena by Philip J. Reed
Naturalist’s Notebook by Anthony Shostak
Laggy’s Last Game by P. D. Haynie

Hexagram #6 digital mock-up. The zine will be printed at Mixam, the same printer we have used for the other releases in the series.
Ultrahex Playmat
As with Hexagram #5, one of the articles in this latest issue was designed to work with a new 36" x 36" playmat. The Ultrahex Playmat is included in the $55 and $125 reward levels (see right). If this campaign succeeds, the playmat will be listed for pre-order on Warehouse 23 in the future.
Digital mockup of the 36" x 36" Ultrahex Playmat for use with one of the Hexagram #6 articles.

The Fantasy Trip Adventures 2
Now at print and set for release in 2021, we are making this new 64-page hardcover collection of adventures available as a part of this campaign so that you may combine shipping costs. 
As with the original Adventures hardcover, this new book features five adventures and includes five different sheets of new megahex tiles and counters. Please see the $40 and $125 pledge levels to include this new book in your rewards.
The Fantasy Trip Adventures 2 digital mock-up. Image is representative of the book and not 100% final. Details may change.
Old School Monsters
Steve and the team have been busy! This new 64-page hardcover book -- now at print and scheduled for release in 2021 -- is packed with monsters that have been adapted from the world's oldest roleplaying game, all thanks to the Open Game License! In addition to the hardcover, this set also includes two new sheets of counters and 55 new creature cards – one for each monster in the book!
To include this book in your rewards, please see the $45 and $125 pledge levels (at right).
The Fantasy Trip Old School Monsters digital mock-up. Image is representative of the book and not 100% final. Details may change.

NOTE: Unlocked stretch goals only apply to the $125 and $165 pledge levels. None of the pledge levels below the $125 reward benefit from unlocked stretch goals.

All stretch goals unlocked!

Please note that some of the add-ons that are listed below may be limited in BackerKit. It is best to always complete your BackerKit survey early so that you can lockdown your preferred extras. Contact help@sjgames.com if you have any questions about using BackerKit. 

 NOTE: Street addresses only.
After the Kickstarter project closes, and after all pledges are collected, we will open the BackerKit pledge manager. There, you will tell us your Warehouse 23 email address, provide your physical address, and pay for shipping (if you are receiving physical rewards). You will also have the chance to add more items to your rewards package. See the FAQ for estimated shipping costs.
Failure to complete your BackerKit survey by the deadline (which will be announced in a Kickstarter update once the pledge manager opens) will result in a refund and removal from the project. We cannot allow projects to remain open forever; we must set firm deadlines so that we can properly close campaigns.
If you wish, you may choose to use a fulfillment service. This allows you to pledge for the project and then provide us with a U.S. address for the delivery of your rewards. Forwarding from the fulfillment service, as well as any local fees, is your responsibility when using a fulfillment company.
INTERNATIONAL DELIVERY NOTE: There are no physical rewards offered to international backers. If the project closes successfully, we will offer the various titles through our online store, Warehouse 23.
We continue to search for reliable, economical solutions to international Kickstarter delivery.

campaign.story:
TL;DR: Thornwillow is publishing the first ever fine press edition of Octavia E. Butler’s visionary masterpiece, Parable of the Sower. Letterpress printed and hand-bound, the Thornwillow edition is available in a range of versions, from classic paper, cloth, and leather bindings, to an array of unique artists’ books incorporating unconventional materials such as limp vellum, burl wood, wool, Baltic amber, lapis lazuli and gold. Featuring historic U.S. Geological Survey maps, which trace the heroes’ journey across the ravaged California landscape, as well as indices of record-breaking wildfires and events from our own times, the Thornwillow edition ties past, present, and future together to create a book which will honor Butler’s extraordinary legacy and preserve this important story for the (dystopian) future.

Check out our new Stretch Goal Reward - a free INVICTUS letterpress broadside for all backers of a physical tier if we break $100,000 and our new add on The Map of DYSTOPIA. See below for details.
The Ultimate Edition of Octavia E. Butler's Masterpiece - Parable of the Sower
A Book for Our Time
In 1949, George Orwell imagined 1984. In 1953, Ray Bradbury imagined 1999. In 1993, Octavia Butler imagined the 2020s. Her future is now.
For the first time in a fine press edition, Thornwillow proudly presents: PARABLE OF THE SOWER,  Octavia E. Butler's iconic view of a future that is all too familiar today, printed letterpress and hand-bound. 
Wildfires. Global Warming. Racial Violence. Drug Addiction. Desperation. The dystopian future Butler imagined is sadly ringing ever truer to life as we know it—and is an ever more visceral warning for what our future will hold if we are not mindful.
Parable of the Sower begins in the year 2023. Climate change and growing inequality have decimated the country, and the American middle class has been all but erased, with the last holdouts residing in fragile gated communities. The story centers on Lauren Oya Olamina, a young woman forced to flee her home on the outskirts of Los Angeles. Traveling north, she dreams of a redemption for humankind: Earthseed—a new religion, a new community, and a destiny to take root among the stars. With a small band of companions, she makes her way along the coast of California, fleeing wildfires and roving gangs of marauders and pyromaniacs in an apocalyptic wasteland.
It is a dark story, and a grim warning of what may come—but one equally steeped in hope, as well as fear.
 The Mother of Afrofuturism 
The Mother of Afrofuturism, Octavia E. Butler
Octavia Butler changed the landscape of science fiction. At a time when there were few Black sci fi writers—and virtually no Black women—she dared to imagine diverse and nuanced worlds and present a tangible vision of a future world that increasingly feels like the one in which we live. She wrote about Black heroes and Black futures integrated in universal hopes and dreams for a better tomorrow and created stories that capture all of our imaginations. 
Not only was Octavia Butler a two-time winner of both the Hugo and Nebula Awards (science fiction’s highest honors), she was also the first science fiction author to be awarded a MacArthur “Genius” Grant. Her dream was to become a New York Times bestselling author.
Octavia Butler dreamed of becoming a New York Times bestselling author. In 2020, that dream became reality.
This year, that dream finally came true. More than 25 years after publication, in September of 2020, PARABLE OF THE SOWER appeared on the New York Times Bestseller List for the first time. It is high time we celebrate this extraordinary author with an edition that will honor and preserve her legacy for generations to come.

Taking Her Place in the Thornwillow Canon
Thornwillow Press has published the works of some of the world’s greatest thinkers and writers, from Jane Austen and Frederick Douglass to John Updike and Barack Obama. Our books reside in the permanent collections of the Metropolitan Museum, the Smithsonian Institution, the White House, the Vatican, and many more—as well as the homes of readers like you all across the globe.
With your support, Octavia Butler will take her place in the Thornwillow canon with the ultimate edition of PARABLE OF THE SOWER—exquisitely letterpress printed and hand bound.
 Tracing our journey through past, present and future...
2020 has seen some of the worst wildfires in history, including the disastrous fires of the Australian “Black Summer” and record-setting blazes across California. As of the time of this writing, over 4 million acres have burned in California, displacing tens of thousands of families. Octavia Butler’s PARABLE OF THE SOWER is prescient in more ways than one, but perhaps her most prophetic observation was of the effects of unchecked climate change.
In Parable, as the heroes journey northward through her native California, they are pursued not only by bandits and thieves, but by flames. On several occasions, they are forced by wildfires and pyromaniacs to change course—all of which Butler describes with incredible specificity. Throughout the Thornwillow edition, historic U.S. Geological Survey maps trace their journey north along real California roadways. An index of real 2020 fires, with pictorial indicators on the maps, tie Butler’s fiction to a terrifying reality.
How Thornwillow Books Are Made
For 35 years, Thornwillow has been committed to making books that enhance the relationship between the reader and the written word.
All of the design, printing, and binding are done at Thornwillow in our workshops in Newburgh, New York. We are perhaps the only fine press publisher in the world to unite these related arts and crafts of the written word under one roof, and we are committed to teaching and perpetuating them for readers today and for years to come.
We start with a beautiful layout.  The text is set using classical ratios of type to page, giving each book luxurious margins and elegant proportions.
Once the book is laid out, the text is printed letterpress on our Heidelberg Cylinder Press. The type is literally pressed into the paper, so that you can feel the letters as you run your fingers across the page. This is an ancient art—the same process by which Johannes Gutenberg printed his books 500 years ago.
The books are then bound by hand by our master craftsmen, who create the highest quality bindings in the world.
 The Edition 
This is the first ever fine press edition of Octavia E. Butler’s visionary masterpiece, Parable of the Sower. Letterpress printed on archival papers and hand-bound, we are presenting our edition in several versions from classic paper, cloth, and leather bindings, to an array of unique artists’ books which explore ancient and unconventional binding techniques that push the boundaries of fine bookmaking. These hyper-limited editions feature rare and unusual materials, including limp vellum, burl wood, wool, and gold, as well as genuine Baltic amber, opals, carnelians, onyx, and lapis lazuli.  Three are presented in wooden boxes, handcrafted in cedar and black walnut by exceptional craftsmen from our own Makers Village.
Paper Wrapper  |  Edition limited to 100 more than backed  |  $95
Letterpress Paper Wrapper Edition
Our paper wrapper bindings are made with incredible care. Like the cloth and leather bindings, they have sewn signatures, enabling them to open easily for a beautiful reading experience. The letterpress printed wrapper is folded over a letterpress cover that secures the signatures. The text is printed letterpress on vellum finish archival stock. Each copy is numbered and signed.

Half-Cloth  |  Edition limited to 100 more than backed  |  $195
Bound in Half Cloth and Letterpress Printed Boards
The Half-Cloth Edition features a cloth spine and corners, letterpress printed boards and endpapers, and a letterpress spine label. The text is printed letterpress on vellum finish archival stock. Each copy is signed and numbered.

All Leather Bound Editions are presented in an elegant Clamshell or Wooden box. 
As established collectors of our leather bound editions know, Thornwillow's signature black clamshell boxes are an elegant way to preserve and protect your books and to unite the collection on a shelf. For this campaign, we have added two new variations, just as elegant and meticulously crafted, but made to complement this unique project.
All of the Half Leather and Full Leather editions include clamshell or wooden boxes for safekeeping. Clamshell boxes will be hand wrapped in either black or buckram binder's cloth (depending on the binding style), lined in suede, and have leather title labels tooled in genuine gold on the spine. Each of the EL DORADO, WORLD ON FIRE, and EARTHSEED volumes will be presented in wooden boxes, handcrafted in either cedar or black walnut by exceptional craftsmen from our own Makers Village.


Half-Leather | Edition limited to 25 more than backed  |  $595
Bound in Half Leather and "Scorched Wood" Paste Paper Boards, Presented in a Clamshell Box
The HALF-LEATHER edition is bound in black Moroccan leather and scorched wood grain patterned paste paper boards, with letterpress printed endpapers. The top edge of the book is gilt and each copy has hand-sewn headbands. It is presented in a suede lined clamshell box with a gold tooled leather spine label. The text is printed letterpress on felt finish archival stock. Each copy is signed and numbered.

Deluxe Half-Leather GOD IS CHANGE Edition  | Limited to 36 Copies | $795
'God is Change' Half Leather Deluxe, Presented in a Clamshell Box
The GOD IS CHANGE DELUXE HALF-LEATHER edition is bound in yellow Moroccan goatskin leather and psychedelic letterpress boards—inspired by the ‘Pyro’-addicted “painted faces” who terrorize the California landscape in Parable of the Sower. The top edge of the book is gilt and each copy has hand-sewn headbands. It is presented in a suede lined clamshell box with a gold tooled leather spine label. The text is printed letterpress on felt finish archival stock. Each copy is signed and numbered.
 Full-Leather DESTINY Edition | Limited to 24 Copies | $895 
'Destiny' Edition bound in Full Purple Moroccan Leather, Presented in a Clamshell Box
“The Destiny of Earthseed is to take root among the stars.” The full-leather DESTINY edition is bound in full purple Moroccan leather and features hand-marbled end papers. The top edge is gilt and the book has hand-sewn headbands. It is presented in a suede lined clamshell box with a gold tooled leather spine label. The text is letterpress printed on felt finish archival stock. Each copy is numbered and signed. The edition is limited to 24 copies.

 Full-Leather Antique Calf SCORCHED EARTH Edition | Limited to 18 Copies | $995 
'Scorched Earth' Edition bound in Full Black Calf, Presented in a Clamshell Box
The SCORCHED EARTH edition is bound in black mottled calfskin with 'burnt wood grain' paste paper endsheets.  The top edge is gilt and the book has hand-sewn headbands. It is presented in a suede lined clamshell box with a gold tooled leather spine label. The text is letterpress printed on felt finish archival stock. Each copy is numbered and signed. The edition is limited to 18 copies.
 Vellum BOOK OF THE LIVING Edition | Limited to 18 Copies | $1350 
'Book of the Living' Edition bound in Limp Vellum, Presented in a Clamshell Box
The BOOK OF THE LIVING edition is bound in full limp vellum, a historic binding style popular in the 16th Century and revived by many of the great bookmakers of the early 1900's. It is a flexible binding made of genuine vellum and it is tied at the fore edge by grosgrain ribbons that lace through the cover. The top edge is gilt and the book has hand-sewn headbands. The text is letterpress printed on gypsum felt finish archival papers. Each copy is numbered and signed. The edition is limited to 18 copies.
 THE GROVE Edition in Half Leather and Ash Wood Boards | Limited to 12 Copies | $2000 
'The Grove' Edition bound in Leather and Burl Ash Boards, Presented in a Clamshell Box
The GROVE edition is bound in half leather and ash burl wood boards. The top edge is gilt and the book has hand-sewn headbands. It is presented in a suede lined clamshell box with a gold tooled leather spine label. The text is letterpress printed on gypsum felt finish archival papers. Each copy is numbered and signed. The edition is limited to 12 copies.

Full-Leather HEARTHSTONE Edition | Limited to 7 Copies | $3000
'Hearthstone' Edition bound in Full Calf set with Baltic Amber, Presented in a Clamshell Box
The Full-Leather HEARTHSTONE edition is bound in full mottled calfskin with genuine Baltic amber inlaid on the cover, and features handmade paste paper endsheets. The top edge is gilt and the book has hand-sewn headbands. It is presented in a suede lined clamshell box with a gold tooled leather spine label. The text is letterpress printed on gypsum felt finish archival papers. Each copy is numbered and signed. The edition is limited to 7 copies.
PLAY

Baltic Amber is 35-40  million years old and each piece is unique and distinct. It is said  to help balance the emotions, clear the mind and release negative energy.

 Full-Leather fully gilt EL DORADO Edition | Limited to 3 Copies | $4000 
The 'El Dorado' Edition is bound in Full Moroccan Leather. The whole cover is gilt in genuine gold. Presented in a Suede Lined Black Walnut Box
The EL DORADO edition is bound in full scarlet Moroccan leather with hand marbled endpapers. The entire cover is gilt in genuine gold leaf. The top edge is also gilt and the book has hand-sewn headbands. It is presented in an elegant suede lined black walnut presentation box, handcrafted right here in the Thornwillow Makers Village. The text is printed letterpress on all-cotton fiber stock. Each copy is numbered and signed. Limited to 3 copies.
The entire cover of the 'El Dorado' Edition is fully gilt in genuine 23 carat gold

 Full-Leather WORLD ON FIRE Edition | Limited to 3 Copies | $4500 
'World on Fire' Edition bound in Full Orange Moroccan Leather set with genuine Opals, Citrines, Onyx, Carnelians, and Lapis Lazuli. Presented in a Suede Lined Black Walnut Box
The Full-Leather WORLD ON FIRE edition is bound in full orange Moroccan goatskin with hand-marbled endpapers. The cover is hand tooled and set with an array of gemstones, including opals, citrines, onyx, carnelians, and lapis lazuli for a psychedelic look inspired by the novel’s dread designer drug “pyro”. The top edge is gilt and the book has hand-sewn headbands. It is presented in a suede lined black walnut presentation box, handcrafted right here in the Thornwillow Makers Village. The text is letterpress printed on all-cotton fiber stock. Each copy is numbered and signed. Limited to 3 copies.

Wool and Leather EARTHSEED | One of a Kind Artist's Binding | $5000 
Each 'Earthseed' volume is bound in a soft leather and one of a kind crocheted wool cover. Presented in a suede lined Cedar Box
Each EARTHSEED volume features a one-of-a-kind crocheted wool and leather cover by artist Irena Martens. The top edge is gilt and the book has hand-sewn headbands and bark patterned end sheets. It is presented in an expertly crafted cedar presentation box, handmade right here in the Thornwillow Makers Village. The text is letterpress printed on all-cotton fiber stock. As each copy is completely unique, each will be numbered 1/1 and signed by the publisher and artist.
Each hand crocheted cover is a one of a kind work of art.
Irena Martens is a celebrated sculptor who has always had a passion for fiber arts. Her work has been exhibited across three continents, by the Smithsonian and the Museum of Contemporary Crafts among many others. Friends of Thornwillow may also know her as Luke's mom. Her eighteenth century New England farmhouse (called "Thornwillow") was the birthplace of our press. Born during WWII in Hamburg, Germany, some of her earliest memories are of a world ravaged by hate and war—and conversely, of what it took to stitch that world back together. 
Luke (several years ago) with his mother, artist Irena Martens.


SPECIAL OFFERS and ADD-ONS
As in past projects, we are offering some very special ADD-ONS and EXCLUSIVE OFFERS for subscribers of the Thornwillow Dispatch. 

STRETCH GOAL | INVICTUS for All

If the campaign breaks the $100,000 barrier before the end, we will send free copy of William Ernest Henley's iconic poem INVICTUS for FREE to all backers of a physical tier.
Stretch Goal - a free copy of William Ernest Henley's iconic poem INVICTUS will be sent to all backers of a physical tier if we break the $100k barrier on this campaign.

CHECK OUT OUR NEW ADD-ON | The Map of DYSTOPIA | $50
DYSTOPIA represents the entire journey undertaken by Lauren Olamina and the Earthseed community as they travel northward through the California wasteland. This letterpress printed, limited edition map is the perfect complement to Thornwillow’s Parable of the Sower—and a powerful reminder of what it will take to plan our journey forward.
DYSTOPIA is a letterpress printed limited edition map that represents the journey of the Earthseed community.

DANGEROUS SPEECH | Exclusive for Patreon and Thornwillow Dispatch Subscribers.
For our Thornwillow Dispatch subscribers, we are pleased to offer a complementary Broadside Portfolio — DANGEROUS SPEECH — with any book tier backed on this campaign.

Freedom of speech is a cornerstone of Western society, yet in these past few tumultuous years, even this fundamental principle has been shaken. This portfolio features 10 letterpress printed broadsides and is complimentary for all backers of the campaign who are also subscribers of the Thornwillow Dispatch. The broadsides included are: 'Banned Books', 'The Apology of Socrates', 'Areopagitica', 'Brandenburg V. Ohio', 'An Ideal For Which I Am Prepared to Die', 'The First Amendment', 'The Sermon on the Mount', 'If We Are Wrong', 'I Know It When I See It', and 'A Sincere And Honest Book'.
Patreon subscribers are always the first to know about new campaigns (and always get some free goodies when they back our projects on Kickstarter), so if you would like to be the first to know about our next upcoming project, be sure to sign up!

Plus, next month, we are bringing a very special related publication to the Thornwillow Dispatch that supporters of this campaign will not want to miss...
 Octavia Butler's award winning short story SPEECH SOUNDS 
We are pleased to announce that Octavia Butler’s Hugo Award-winning short story SPEECH SOUNDS will be coming to the Thornwillow Dispatch in December! Like Parable of the Sower it is letterpress printed and hand bound. 
PLAY

This publication is available in two limited editions: CLASSIC EDITION copies will be bound in letterpress printed paper wrappers. PATRONS EDITION copies feature handmade paste paper bindings with engraved labels, and will be individually numbered and signed by the publisher. The paste paper on the covers of the Patrons Edition is the same "Scorched Wood" pattern used on the Half Leather and Full Leather "Scorched Earth" edition of Parable of the Sower.
"Speech Sounds" is available in the Classic Edition or the Patrons' Edition as an add-on or by subscribing to the Thornwillow Dispatch before November 30th..
SPEECH SOUNDS is available two ways: You may reserve the Classic Edition for $38 or the Patrons Edition for $138 as an add-on to your pledge. Alternatively, both Classic and Patrons Edition copies are available as part of an ongoing subscription to the Thornwillow Dispatch until the deadline of November 30. As a 'thank you' for their steadfast support, subscribers to the Thornwillow Dispatch receive not only the anchor publication and other delightful contents of the monthly Dispatch, but are also given access to the most advantageous pricing, at $30 for the Classic Dispatch, and $100 for the Patrons Edition (which includes an additional, complimentary copy of the Classic Edition). 

To receive SPEECH SOUNDS as part of an ongoing subscription (and to secure the best price), be sure that you are subscribed for the Thornwillow Dispatch on Patreon before the November 30 deadline! Subscribers at the 30pt. Baskerville tier will receive Classic Edition copies in the December Thornwillow Dispatch; Subscribers at the 100pt. Electra tier or higher will receive BOTH Patrons’ Edition and Classic Edition copies, and will support the continuation of the Thornwillow Patrons’ Prize for Emerging Artists. 

What is the Thornwillow Dispatch?
The Thornwillow Dispatch is our monthly subscription of finely printed ideas and inspirations. Each month ongoing subscribers receive a new letterpress printed, hand-bound publication from the Press, as well as a curated collection of engraved and letterpress printed keepsakes. Past Dispatches have included an assortment of limited edition chapbooks, broadsides, and prints that feature editorial and artistic content, as well as finely crafted goods for your study like engraved note cards, journals, and calendar cards.
To reserve your copy of "SPEECH SOUNDS" and claim your FREE "DANGEROUS SPEECH" Broadside Portfolio, subscribe to the Thornwillow Dispatch here: www.patreon.com/thornwillow

"Tomorrow is the Child of Today" | Letterpress Broadside | Add-on $5
"Tomorrow is the Child of Today" Letterpress Broadside featuring quotes of Octavia E. Butler
This broadside is part of the Thornwillow Broadside Library, and features notable quotes from the author, Octavia E. Butler. It is letterpress printed on heavy archival stock and pocket-sized. This handsome keepsake is a fun read and a thoughtful enclosure with a letter to a friend. It is included with all the tiers on this campaign and additional copies can be added on for $5 each.

 The PYRO Notebook | Add-on $20
The PYRO NOTEBOOK features sewn signatures and heavy archival stock to preserve your ideas and inspirations.
Like our fine press editions, the PYRO NOTEBOOK features sewn signatures and heavy archival stock with letterpress printed cover—perfect for keeping your ideas and inspirations. It is included for free with the PARABLE BOOK CLUB and PARABLE FAN tiers. It is also available as an add-on to your pledge for $20.

BUNDLED TIERS
We are pleased to offer the following bundled tiers that give backers of the campaign more ways to engage with Parable of the Sower and the work of Thornwillow Press.

 The Parable of the Sower Book Club | $190 
The Book Club Tier features TWO copies of Parable bound in paper wrappers and TWO Pyro Notebooks and TWO "Tomorrow is the Child of Today"broadsides.
If you’re planning to read PARABLE OF THE SOWER with a group of friends (or would simply like an additional copy to give as a gift), subscribe to the BOOK CLUB tier and receive two copies of PARABLE OF THE SOWER in letterpress paper wrappers, along with two PYRO NOTEBOOKS and two "Tomorrow is the Child of Today" BROADSIDES. Like the edition itself, the pages of the PYRO NOTEBOOK are sewn into signatures, and they have a letterpress printed paper wrappers. The pages themselves are heavy archival stock suitable for notes, diaries, sketches, ideas, and inspirations. Reading with three friends? Four? A dozen? Additional paper wrapper and half-cloth copies, as well as additional journals, are available as add-ons to your pledge.

 Parable Fan | $325 
Receive two copies of PARABLE OF THE SOWER: One book is bound in paper wrappers and the other in half cloth. Each copy is individually numbered and signed, and your name will be included on the subscribers list. Plus, receive the PYRO Notebook and the "TOMORROW IS THE CHILD OF TODAY" Broadside.
The Parable Fan tier includes both the Paper and Cloth editions plus the Pyro Notebook and letterpress Broadside.

 Paper Collector: The Gods Must Be Crazy $375 
Backers who select the Paper Collector: 'The Gods Must Be Crazy' tier will receive PARABLE OF THE SOWER by Octavia Butler, GENESIS, and Dante's INFERNO
Receive three divine Thornwillow books, all bound in letterpress paper-wrappers:
GENESIS, Dante's INFERNO hand-lettered and illustrated by George Cochrane, and PARABLE OF THE SOWER by Octavia E. Butler.
Each copy is individually numbered and signed, and your name will be included on the PARABLE OF THE SOWER subscribers list.
 Half-Leather Collector: Wastelands | $1500 
Backers of the Half-Leather Collector: Wastelands tier will receive THREE WAR STORIES by David Mamet, PARABLE OF THE SOWER by Octavia E. Butler, and THE WASTELAND by T.S. Eliot
Get three Thornwillow books, all bound in half leather and paste paper boards:
THREE WAR STORIES by David Mamet, THE WASTELAND by T.S. Eliot, and PARABLE OF THE SOWER by Octavia E. Butler.

Each book is signed, numbered, and presented in a suede lined clamshell box with a gold tooled leather spine label. Your name will be included on the PARABLE OF THE SOWER subscribers list.

A Note on our Pricing:
We are extremely grateful to pre-publication subscribers like you. Without your support, it would not be possible for us to do what we do. By way of thanks, we offer our work at reduced pricing to those who come in early to support a project and help it get off the ground. Our prices increase as availability decreases. After the prepublication subscription period ends for a particular project, we will post available copies on our website. (NOTE: Often certain versions of the edition are fully subscribed during the Kickstarter launch.) When an edition is down to just a few remaining copies left, the prices tend to be much higher then they were at the beginning. This rewards collectors who came in early.
In subscribing to a Thornwillow publication, you are not just adding a beautiful book to your shelf that is likely to appreciate in value, you are making an investment in people. You are making it possible for us to teach and perpetuate the related arts and crafts of the written word. By joining our community, you join us in celebrating the written word.
About Thornwillow Press:
Thornwillow Press was founded in 1985 by Luke Ives Pontifell when he was 16. During college he ran the press from his Harvard dorm room and the barn at his parents’ 18th century farm in Western Massachusetts. Over the years, Thornwillow has grown to become one of the preeminent fine presses in the world. Thornwillow has published the original works of John Updike, President Barack Obama, James Merrill, and more. Thornwillow publications can be found in the permanent collections of the Metropolitan Museum, the Smithsonian Institution, the Morgan Library, the Vatican, and the Bodleian Library at Oxford, among many others.
To learn more about Thornwillow Press please visit thornwillow.com. To learn more about the work of the Thornwillow Institute and Makers Village — a 501(c)3 public charity committed to supporting craft, culture and community — and how you can help support our mission, please visit thornwillowinstitute.org.
