campaign.story:
SHOTGLASS ADVENTURES – Kal-Zar’s Bane 2: MINED GAMES is the sequel to the successful Shotglass Adventures: GRAVIS TOWN BLUES Kickstarter and the 7th book from Laidback DM!
Published under the OGL and compatible with 5e and OSR fantasy role playing games, SHOTGLASS ADVENTURES – Kal-Zar’s Bane 2: MINED GAMES is 78 pages of adventures that can be played as One-Shots or as the second module in a four-part campaign, taking your players from 1st– 14th level.

Gravis Town is locked down as the Kal-Zar’s Bane virus runs rampant. A journal found in a lost shipyard provides the location of the long-hidden library of Kal-Zar Ro. The party must travel to the Orinspeak, a mountain trapped in perpetual winter in the heart of the forest.
There are questions to be answered, secrets to be uncovered. The truth about Kal-Zar’s Bane may be revealed. And the quest to find a cure can begin…
So, what’s in SHOTGLASS ADVENTURES – Kal-Zar’s Bane 2: MINED GAMES?
· 7 adventures – puzzles, investigations, dungeon crawls, quests, social encounters - complete with full color maps! Varied adventures from 5th – 7th level, designed for minimal preparation and flexible delivery. Each adventure can be run as part of the ongoing Kal-Zar’s Bane campaign, or as a One-Shot. Every adventure has both Campaign-specific and One-Shot-specific hooks. The One-Shot hooks ignore all the sub-plots and provide you with exactly what you need to run each adventure as a one-off for your players - you can either slot them into your existing campaign or run them as separate, individual side quests.
· Loads of hand-drawn, full-color maps!
· 20 new monsters & NPCs and 9 new magic items!
· Fully detailed village and region setting– The Elven tree village of Ai’Pa’El is home to the An’st’rm elves and a potential regional base for the PCs in the vast Orinwood Forest. The elves harbor a secret that may start to unravel the truth about Kal-Zar’s Bane…
· Expanded map of Verona Province - including the Jarldoms of Skandara – a new, expanded map and brief gazetteer of the Invician Empire and Verona Province! More new and expanded lore for the Shotglass Adventures campaign setting!
· Full guide for OSR conversions!
Here are some example pages:
Note: adventures are currently being play tested – some content and page lay outs may change slightly as a result.
As an added bonus, Shotglass Adventures Rounds #1 - The One That Got Away is FREE with all pledges of Party Died For and above! A 12-page PDF-only module with gridded and gridless maps included, this is a re-working of an adventure I submitted to the One Page Dungeon Competition in 2018, which gained an 'honorable mention'. Lost in the Abyss, the party needs to get home - and to do that, they need to solve the dilemma of a demon's long-lost love...

Concise, easily accessible and quick to prep for, every adventure comes complete with adventure hooks for Campaign play and for One-Shot play, maps, NPCs and monsters, with enough space for you to incorporate improvisation based on your players' decisions. Loads of variety and something for all your players - run them as One-Shots or easily slot them into your existing campaign!
Check out these teasers for each of the adventures included in SHOTGLASS ADVENTURES – Kal-Zar’s Bane 2: MINED GAMES:

Several of the pledge levels include the MINED GAMES Digital Maps Package. This package contains two versions of every hand-drawn, full color map in the book – full size color (A3 & A4-size) + optimized full color suitable for virtual tabletops like Roll20or Fantasy Grounds  – giving you options for how you use them. 36 images – all are 600 DPI (300 DPI is print quality) high quality digital JPEGs.
Purchasing the Digital Maps Package also gets you a limited Royalty Free License enabling you to use each map in your own commercial and non-commercial projects (but not to sell them separately or as part of another digital maps package).
Here are some examples of maps in the package:
Note: Only some of the maps are shown. Additional maps will be added as stretch goals are unlocked.
$2000 - 1st Stretch Goal Unlocked!
A bonus full size, hand drawn, unkeyed full color map added to the book PLUS 2 x Digital JPEGs added to the Digital Maps Package – Full size and a smaller version sized for virtual tabletops - you can use for your own adventures.
Forest Tower Ruin!
The tower is a shadow of its former self. The upper levels have collapsed, bowing to the weight of years and other conflicts. Crumbling, rib-like walls extend out from its emaciated torso. Your party can smell the stench of death within. Foul, rotting zombies cluster in the tower courtyard, ambling senselessly about. But why aren't the creatures coming out? And why does the water in this central well smell so wonderfully pure and clear? It's overwhelming your senses. It's so good you just want to taste it...
How would YOU use this map in your own adventure?

 $2500 - 2nd Stretch Goal Unlocked!
A bonus full size, hand drawn, unkeyed full color map added to the book PLUS 2 x Digital JPEGs added to the Digital Maps Package – Full size and a smaller version sized for virtual tabletops - you can use for your own adventures.
Forest Cave!
The treeline thins. A cold and dank cave entrance lies before you, its darkness swallowing the forest canopy's light shafts like a great, toothless maw. Bloody footprints lead away into the black - man or beast? They're too smeared to tell. You can hear sounds echoing from the depths. Is that the tearing of flesh? You draw your sword...   
 $3000 - 3rd Stretch Goal Unlocked!
2 bonus full size, hand drawn, unkeyed full color maps added to the book PLUS 4 x Digital JPEGs added to the Digital Maps Package – Full size and a smaller version sized for virtual tabletops - you can use for your own adventures.
Both of these battlemaps have 1-inch squares ideal for 25mm miniatures!
Ravine Bridge Map
The Troll licks its lips as it gestures for you to cross the rope bridge. "It's just a small toll," you remember it saying. As you place your foot upon the unsteady slats, you glance below. Was that a spider you saw down there in the ravine? Pretty big. And now it seems to be crawling up the wall... 
Druidic Island
Ancient standing stones rise from the island like giant teeth. The hairs on your neck rise as you step out of the boat onto the shore. This is a sacred place - perhaps you shouldn't be here. As you move closer to the circle of menhirs, you notice a red stain upon the ground at its center. Then a great howl breaks the silence as something rises from the murky waters behind you...  
 $3500 - 4th Stretch Goal Unlocked!
1 bonus full size, hand drawn, unkeyed full color maps added to the book PLUS 2 x Digital JPEGs added to the Digital Maps Package – Full size and a smaller version sized for virtual tabletops - you can use for your own adventures.
Cavern Platforms
This cavern is huge, with a ceiling at least a hundred feet high; hanging stalactites outlined in phosphorescence and resembling ghoulish teeth provide a modicum of illumination. Sprinkled around massive natural columns are rock platforms, rising to various heights like tin cans in a pantry. Suddenly, an arrow scrapes your cheek - glancing up you see humanoid creatures on top of each platform. It seems they have the drop on you... 
$4000 - BONUS: Map Upgrade and Addition to DIGITAL MAPS PACKAGE! 
Map upgraded in book PLUS 2 x full size old and new map and 2 x virtual tabletop versions added to Digital Maps Package, bringing total maps to 36!

SHOTGLASS ADVENTURES – Kal-Zar’s Bane 2: MINED GAMES will be delivered as a PDF via DrivethruRPG, the biggest marketplace for RPG PDFs in the world, so you can always access a copy through your DrivethruRPG account.
Additionally, if you are an Illustrious Backer, Excelsior Backer, Avenger Backer, Scion Backer, or Ultimate Backer, you'll also receive a POD code to purchase a print copy if you want one - you won't have to pay the cost of the PDF again, only the base printing and postage costs (approximately $6-7 printing + approximately $5-6 postage, depending on where in the world you are) via DrivethruRPG. The book will look great on your bookshelf and in play!
I’m the author of 7 books of adventures for 5e and OSR RPGs, 2 books of poetry and 21 other RPG products. 
I first started playing and DM’ing D&D in 1981. Nowadays, I game roughly 2-3 times a week. I have lots of RPGs - Fate Core, Symbaroum, Numenera, Pathfinder 2e, Mutant Year Zero, Stars Without Number, Mouse Guard, Coriolis, Forbidden Lands - basically too many to list, but I'm a fan of them all. D&D remains my greatest love and when I write a new product, I pour my years of experience and passion into the project. Your support helps me continue to produce quality fantasy role playing adventures and supplements.
This is my seventh Kickstarter – the last six were delivered ahead of schedule, and anyone who’s been part of them can tell you I always come through.
What's the money used for?
Kickstarter  enables me to write and design role playing game content. Every Kickstarter I do is not only a labor of love, it pays for all the time I've invested creating, laying out and play testing the product - and more importantly, making a living! Read any blog by any product designer and you'll know margins are always tight, so your support for my projects is amazing and always appreciated.
Visit Laidback DM at stevestillstanding.com for DM/GM hints, product reviews, and free maps. And poetry!
Social Media:
TWITTER: twitter.com/SteveStillStand
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/steve.stillstanding
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/stevestillstanding/
Wordpress: https://stevestillstanding.com/
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Your funds help cover my costs as a full time Product Designer. Much of the work is done, with some play testing, writing and editing to be completed. 

Once the Kickstarter is complete, I add the backer names and draw, digitally color and write any stretch goals and add them to the book, and compile the digital maps package. I complete the work myself, which means there are no staffing/scheduling issues. And I’m locked up in isolation like you guys, so Covid-19 won’t impact on my production of this book.

I worked for 22 years in customer service and project management, so I'm used to managing time-scheduled projects and delivering products within timeframe. My previous projects have all been delivered within a month of Kickstarter completion, all ahead of schedule. 

The only potential delay is any shutdown of DrivethruRPG’s printing house, which is always possible in light of the current pandemic. This hasn’t delayed the production of my print proofs previously, and I’ll keep you all informed if it does happen. If it does, I can release the digital content early and release the print version when their printing house comes online again.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
When things are at their worst, the best among us rises to the fore. When disaster strikes or menace looms, they don’t run from the danger, they run toward it. Whether they claim supernatural abilities or just plain courage, there's a single word that describes such people:
In a world that could use a few heroes now more than ever, you can now join their ranks—using the flexible TTRPG mechanics of the Cypher System.
Imagine, for a moment, that you find yourself imbued with powers well beyond those of mere mortals. With great might, you leap into dark and daunting dangers. You stand before the forces of injustice with confidence. You slip the grasp of gravity and soar. You Claim the Sky itself.
But what about on the other end of the scale, where we’re all a bit more earth-bound? We can still be heroes. Saving lives amid natural disasters, man-made cataclysms, pandemics, or crises of any sort, we can take on the role of First Responders.
These two new Cypher System sourcebooks focus on heroes of all kinds!
Claim the Sky continues the series of genre-focused books that includes The Stars Are Fire (science-fiction), Stay Alive! (horror), We Are All Mad Here (fairy tales), and Godforsaken (fantasy). Each of those titles dives deep, exploring different aspects and variations of its genre and offering new rules, character creation ideas, equipment, creatures, cyphers, and other elements for making the most of the topic.
In this case, of course, the topic is superheroes. Whether your love is comic book superheroes or the blockbuster films of recent years, Claim the Sky will give you step-by-step guidelines for recreating all your favorite characters, building your own heroes from scratch, and sending them out into fun, fast-paced RPG adventures and campaigns.
But there’s more. Like the books that came before it, Claim the Sky presents a fully realized, ready-to-use superhero setting: Boundless. In the world of Boundless, your player characters can join the ranks of well-established heroes and face titanic foes: invading alien creatures, horrors from other dimensions, supervillains using their powers for selfish or destructive ends. This setting is like our own world, but superpowers have existed for generations, and the world has adapted accordingly (in sometimes surprising ways!). If you’re looking for a setting with the feel of movies or comics, Boundless will take you there!
First Responders looks at heroism from a different angle. This is a world where the heroes' powers aren't supernatural: our world, where courage, wits, experience, and grit are the tools by which our heroes overcome crises and disaster. Around the globe, the PCs respond to earthquakes and hurricanes, floods and fires, war zones and industrial disasters, plane crashes and pandemics. They're part of an international organization with a mission to save lives and to not just respond to crises, but to end them.
In First Responders, you create a campaign with a broad roster of heroes. In one session you might need a paramedic, a trained rescue worker, and a firefighting specialist, while the next mission requires the paramedic, a field researcher, and a pilot, and the one after that you need a rescue worker, a field researcher, and a technician. The players maintain multiple characters, but the unique system advances them all, regardless of which are involved in a given adventure, so that any can be called upon as the campaign progresses and the threats become ever more dangerous.
First Responders also provides exciting rules for mega-challenges, making events like a forest fire or an earthquake into a fully-realized narrative filled with challenges as dynamic and exciting as any battle against monsters or crawl through a dungeon. These large-scale challenge rules will be easily useable in any Cypher System game, so you can incorporate them into your Numenera campaign, or adventures based on Claim the Sky, The Stars Are Fire, or any other Cypher System setting.
Our world needs heroes. Cypher System fans love new books. We've already unlocked The Origin, a new hardcover setting book. And we're looking forward to reaching the Cypher System Bestiary later in this campaign! What else might we unlock before that title—or beyond it? We have lots of great ideas, and look forward to lots of cool stretch goals!
The critically acclaimed, award-winning Cypher System is fast-paced, narrative-focused, flexible, and uniquely easy on the GM. Baked-in mechanics like Effort and player intrusions easily support heroic styles of play—PCs can really push themselves to do amazing things. The Cypher System’s Power Shift mechanic and Power Boost cyphers perfectly portray the way superpowers work. They make it easy to show how a super-strong hero can break down a door without thinking twice or how another hero might briefly try something unique with their powers to get a very specific effect. Both of these mechanics—and more—will be even further developed in Claim the Sky.
Creating a great Cypher System character is as easy as coming up with a great concept. You build the character you imagine through a quick, fun process that results in a character with depth, nuance, and flexibility.
Cypher System characters are built with a three-part sentence. You might be a Rugged Warrior who Stands Like a Bastion. A Guarded Adept who Keeps a Magic Ally. Perhaps a Graceful Explorer who Moves Like the Wind. Or a Charming Speaker who Bears a Halo of Fire. Each part of your sentence says something about your character—but also provides some of your abilities, skills, and stats. They even offer guidance on your connections to other characters in your party, creating bonds that can be a foundation for an ongoing campaign, or facilitate great roleplaying in one-shot adventures.
Cyphers give characters single-use abilities frequently gained and spent, adding variety to the character’s capabilities and providing exciting new approaches and options. Depending on what’s appropriate for the campaign, cyphers can be subtle, representing blessings, unusual turns of luck or capricious powers, or manifest, in the form of bits of unusual technology, charms, or minor magic items.
Character arcs encourage and reward players for pursuing their characters’ own motivations, in addition to the overall story of the campaign. Just as the heroes of movies, comics, and TV shows grow through their own subplots, Cypher System players may choose arcs to pursue, tying their characters’ personalities more closely to the overall story and engaging the players even deeper into their characters and the campaign.
No problem! Every backer level includes a copy of the complete Cypher System Rulebook in PDF. This 448-page book is a $22 value in PDF, but it's free with every reward and delivered early, mere weeks after the campaign closes. (Already have the CSR? You can gift your free PDF to a friend!)
Want to Check It Out Now?
Download the free Cypher System Rules Primer, and have a look at the system's amazing mechanics right now!
Claim the Sky is a 224-page hardcover (upgraded to include a poster map!) that delves deeply into all aspects of the superhero genre. With a similar look and form, it's a beautiful companion to the recent Cypher System supplements The Stars Are Fire, Godforsaken, Stay Alive!, and We Are All Mad Here. Beautifully illustrated, it explores the many facets and subgenres of superhero comics, movies, and fiction, with rules and options for all of them. It includes the Boundless campaign setting, along with creatures, cyphers, artifacts, equipment, and more.
First Responders is a 128-page hardcover (strike that: we've upgraded the page count through stretch goals!) that presents rules, options, gear, and more for heroes inspired by the real world to take on massive challenges and dangers.
The Origin is a 128-page hardcover (strike that: we've upgraded the page count through stretch goals!) setting book. This is a world where superheroes are not a fact of life. Player characters must come to grips with the fact that they can do things normal humans cannot, and then decide what to do with these abilities while facing clandestine government branches, terrorist organizations, and even more mysterious groups that want to study, recruit, or destroy them.
Every backer level includes a copy of the complete Cypher System Rulebook in PDF. This 448-page book is a $22 value in PDF, but it's free with every reward and delivered early, mere weeks after the campaign closes. If you already have the CSR, we'll make it easy to gift your free PDF to a friend.
Are You a First Responder? If you're a firefighter, EMT or paramedic, emergency worker, or other front-line hero, the Real-World Heroes backer level gives you First Responders and the Cypher System Rulebook at a deep discount just for you.
Looking to Get into the Cypher System? You'll get the Cypher System Rulebook in PDF at any reward level. Prefer it in glorious hardcover? The Brand New Hero level gives you every title funded by this campaign, plus the CSR in print (a $70 value). Or check out Any Character, Any Campaign, which includes four additional genre books at an astounding discount! If you're looking to spend a little less, you can instead choose the CSR as an add-on.
Want to Playtest—or Just See It Early? Materials for the titles funded by this campaign generally go to playtesters about four months before those titles become products and go out as backer rewards (that's a generalization, though—not a specific commitment). If you'd like to be part of the action, or just have early access to the materials to check them out, or to roll the mechanics into your existing Cypher System campaign, back at any level from The Danger Room up. Backers at these levels may choose to be part of the playtest, or simply to receive the playtest material without providing feedback. It's up to you!
Love an Incredible Deal? To get your hands on a whole stack of awesome Cypher System products, you can't do better than the Any Character, Any Campaign or THOOOM! reward levels. The savings are so spectacular they're a bargain even if you already own some of the titles. All the levels from The Danger Room and up also get you the Cypher System playmat for free, and early access and playtesting!
Are You a Retailer? The Secret Base level is a flexible way for you to decide how many of each title is right for your store, and to avoid tying up lots of cash between now and release. Your pledge gets you three copies each of Claim the Sky and First Responders. You may, at a later time, increase the quantity of these titles, and add additional titles funded by stretch goals. You’ll pay for those additional titles, at a retail-friendly discount, at that time. It is likely (but not guaranteed) that you will get them ahead of street date, and you are welcome to begin selling them immediately. For this retail backer level only, MCG covers domestic US shipping—but you must still complete BackerKit and follow our fulfillment process (see Shipping, below).

REWARD REDEMPTION AND FULFILLMENT Because we will ship rewards at several times over the course of many months, our fulfillment process may be different than other campaigns you’ve backed.
A few weeks after this campaign ends, we will invite you to BackerKit, our pledge management platform. This allows you to confirm your pledge and add on anything you might have missed. Later, when a reward is ready to fulfill, you'll use the MCG Shop to manage the process. This puts you, the backer, in charge of redeeming rewards at your convenience, and ensures we always have your up-to-date address at the time we ship a reward. YOU MUST COMPLETE THIS STEP TO RECEIVE YOUR REWARD.
Here’s a brief look at how it works:
1.  When a reward is ready, we’ll notify you by email.
2.  You log on to the MCG Shop.
3.  You go to your Coupons page and click on the coupon for the reward, and it is automatically added to your cart. If you have multiple rewards, or want to make purchases, you can add them all to your cart before checking out.
4. Check out! You give us your address and pay for shipping (for physical rewards) at that time.
UPDATING YOUR ADDRESS OR GIFTING YOUR REWARD If you move, you won’t need to tell us, since you’ll simply enter your new address the next time you redeem a reward. If this is a gift and you want to ship it directly to the recipient, just enter their shipping address when you check out. If it's not convenient to receive a reward at the time of fulfillment, or to ship multiple rewards together to save on shipping costs, you may delay redemption of a reward for up to one year after the product’s release date. 
SHIPPING All backers pay for shipping when they redeem their rewards. We offer a variety of domestic and international shipping methods from which you can choose. As of this writing, basic domestic shipping is $7 per shipment, but we do not control future postal rates, so that cost is subject to change. International shipping is based on postal and shipping rates at the time of the order, and varies by destination and shipment weight.
INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING International shipping is expensive. We don’t have any control over that, and we can’t accurately predict what shipping rates will be at the time of fulfillment. We must comply with international law and cannot mark your reward as a gift or as a zero-value item. Here are details that apply to your region:
 The Americas: Your rewards will be filled by our shipping center in the United States. You will be responsible for import duties, taxes, and brokerage fees (if applicable). Canadian backers please note that our books are printed in Canada, and thus are not subject to import duties; however, items not printed in Canada, such as decks of cards, are subject to import duties.
 The EU and UK: Your rewards will be filled by our shipping center in the UK. UK and EU backers will not pay import duties and taxes.
 Australia, New Zealand, the South Pacific, and Asia: Your rewards will be filled by our shipping center in Australia. Backers in Australia will not pay import duties and taxes; other backers will be responsible for import duties, taxes, and brokerage fees (if applicable).
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Monte Cook Games has run sixteen previous Kickstarter campaigns. All of our previous campaigns have been successful and jam-packed with rewards. Most of those campaigns are completely fulfilled, and we have a strong record for fulfilling rewards on time—we’ve delivered well over a million rewards to date. These include such varied items as corebooks for Numenera, The Strange, and the Cypher System, leather-bound deluxe books, boxed sets, scores of hardcover supplements, signed bookplates, playtest access, special-access seminars, meetings and dinners with the creative team, online and in-person games, and so much more. Thus, while there are always challenges that can arise, we've probably already faced them.

We are extremely proud of our track record. There have been bumps on the road, but what are roads without bumps? We're confident that the project will meet all its promises.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

We are keeping late pledges open for a little longer, so please continue to share BackerKit's preorder store with your friends who love RPGs!

The BackerKit smoke test went smoothly and all surveys were sent out. If you missed the BackerKit link, you can join through the survey recovery page. Greetings backers!
We hope you are healthy and well.
This is a mini-update to let you know that we've started opening BackerKit for Heroes of the Cypher System . . . huzzah!
The first step in opening BackerKit is to send surveys to 5% of backers from each pledge level (the 5% of backers to receive surveys is selected at random). BackerKit calls this step the Smoke Test. Once the surveys are sent, BackerKit collates data on the response rate, the proportion of support inquiries received, and the add-on purchase rate to let us know if the survey and pledge questions are working appropriately. Once we're sure all is well, surveys will be sent to all remaining backers. We expect this to happen no later than Tuesday, January 12th.

Welcome ADVENTURER, to Eldritch: the Book of Madness!
Follow the campaign's progress by signing up to our mailing list - CLICK HERE!
 Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/entertheblackvault 
 Twitter: https://twitter.com/BlackVaultUK 
 Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/entertheblackvault/ 
Designed by creators with thirty years’ experience in professional publishing, and created by the writers of the bestselling Lords of the Night: Vampires, Eldritch: The Book of Madness is a beautifully written 144 page hardcover tome featuring an all new mini setting for your 5e campaign. It’s filled with new monsters, spells, items, cults, dark magic, locations, and a horde of otherworldly adventure ideas for your players, all designed to be instantly added to any campaign. It features a shadow war between the worlds of light and the monstrous creatures of the Dark Place - the realm beyond the mirror -while still being decidedly D&D. With expanded rules for madness and corruption - it's designed to put the dread into your heroes - literally!
Eldritch: The Book of Madness
ELDRITCH CONTENTS
Here’s a summary of exactly what you are getting with Eldritch, and why it’s such great value for money. Not sure, check out the many previews in every update!
So far, Eldritch: The Book of Madness is a 144+ page hardcover featuring:
50 pages of monsters and their powers (all completely new - these creatures will shock and terrify your heroes - guaranteed - I've schemed for months to bring you the most terrifying abilities designed to give pause to the most seasoned adventurer). Also includes DMs tips on handling your otherworldly creatures and a host of other details on their existence (including the cults that worship them).
6 pages of fearsome Dread mechanics (designed to strike fear into your heroes - literally!)
20 pages of locations in the Grey Wastes – the demi-plane that sits beyond the Dark Mirror.
10 pages of new magic items including the Dread Staff and the fearsome Shadow Blades.
12 pages of new profane spells that use the heroes' fear against them!
6 pages of corrupt spells and cursed magical items, including cursed scrolls and trapped spells.
6 pages featuring four of the Dread Lords – creatures of incredible power that are able to manifest a tiny fraction of their power in the mortal realms.
18 pages featuring the many faces of evil (including some terrible cults hiding in plain sight). 
Just one of many creatures (this page is cut down to show an all round selection of its abilities)
What is Eldritch: The Book of Madness?
The Book of Madness is a high quality hardcover with 144 pages featuring a unique setting where the magic of the mortal realms is coveted by the minions of chaos from the realm beyond the Dark Place. They cannot enter this world - yet - but they can reach out tendrils of magic to ensnare the minds of the weak-willed and the corrupt! 
The first of five books, Eldritch has its fingers in the feel of HP Lovecraft's works, but it most certainly is NOT a clone of his works - oh no - this is 100% D&D. In Eldritch you will encounter a paranoid world where anyone could be in league with evil. The sinewy tendrils of wicked magic seep into the mortal realms from the Dark Place; its inhabitants seek to corrupt the minds of the living, with the goal of one day passing from one reality and into the worlds of light. Should the heroes discover what is going on under their noses, they have a choice: face the evil head on and risk being destroyed by its power, or walk away and do nothing knowing that a terrible shadow is gathering... 
Eldritch is a book about ancient evil powers, unfathomable magic, and entities with goals and desires beyond those even of the gods. Check out the  many updates for more information on what you can expect from this tome of shadows!
You can see from the previews (below) that there's nothing standard about this book!
An Assortment of Amazing Art from Eldritch: The Book of Madness
Key Selling Points
Gorgeous art - evocative of the madness-inducing mythology of an alien universe.
Beautifully written - the Book of Madness is filled with plot hooks and adventure ideas to stir the imagination.
New Dread rules - wrapped up in an ultra high fantasy D&D setting. These monsters will fit right in with any setting, from fantasy to sci-fi.
Monster tactics - gain an insight into how to use these monsters to take your players by surprise. They will never see it coming!  
Unique game mechanics - so secret we can't reveal them here, but they will fit seamlessly in with any game version allowing you to strike fear in to the hearts of your players!
PREVIEW: THE GREY WASTES
The Demi-Plane of Madness and Evil
PREVIEW: DREAD BLADES
Corrupt Magical Weapons (Work in Progress). Use with Supervision!
Preview: The Hounds of Veth  
The Hounds of the Ancient Ones (work in progress)
Some encounters may have serious repercussions! (work in progress)
These enemies aren't playing around!
Want the Book but Too Close to Christmas?
Pledge just £1 and then we'll open up the pledge manager in January through February 2021 to make it really easy for everyone to pick up a copy of the book.
Contents
Here is a work in progress of the book's contents. Check out some of those exciting chapters. There's a whole section dedicated to proper madness. Now it's not just a bunch of random rolls on a single table - I guarantee the possibilities will shatter your sanity!  
A Work in Progress Copy of the Book of Madness Index (may cause sanity loss)
 Preview of Eldritch: The Book of Madness 
On the fence?  You've already seen for yourself how beautifully written this book is. But there's more to come. There will be a preview every night of the week until Halloween itself! That's four more delicious pages filled with murderous monsters to tempt you! 
The Agolytes: Putting the Fear Back into Divination!
Part of a Series!
This is the first book in a quartet which aims to challenge your players in new and surprising (and often terrifying) ways. Nothing in this book is like anything you've seen before (we genuinely mean that - Stewie is a writer unlike any other when it comes to new and exciting ways to present gaming material). The next release, Aether: The Book of the Summoner has already been written and you'll see it in 2021.
Playtest!
One month after the campaign ends, we will release a playtest (text-only) version of the book. This is your chance to give feedback on the contents and to shape the direction of the book. We'll take all your feedback and we'll even reward those testers who submit proper testing reports (but more on that after the campaign).
STRETCH GOALS
I'll reveal the stretch goals as we get closer to them. They will increase the value of the book and make it even better value for money. You've already got the best possible paper with a lovely silk finish and cover, so all that's left is more quality writing and gorgeous art. 
£6000 - The Black Grimoire - six pages of gruesome dark magic
£7,500 - 16 NEW PAGES! Taking the book total to 112 pages (find out exactly what when we reach the Stretch Goal). 
£9,000- The City 6 - additional pages featuring the city of evil.
£11,000- Corruption - 6 additional pages featuring cursed items and deadly trapped spells.
£12,500- Everything expanded to *144* pages of dread and evil. 
Work in Progress. Do Not Look Directly At These Spells
 SOCIAL MEDIA
Like BlackVault on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/entertheblackvault 
Like BlackVault on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/entertheblackvault/ 
PLEDGE MANAGER
This campaign promoted by GameFound and there will be a pledge manager launching in January 2021.
SHIPPING
Physical rewards will be sent from the UK. Please check our restricted shipping locations (below). Shipping fees will be added after the campaign, during the pledge manager phase (January 2021). Below are a few shipping fee estimates - overseas prices may go down based on the number of copies we sell (more copies = lower shipping for everyone). Please note right now these shipping charges include the Covid-19 Temporary Carrier Air Charge, which may be removed in 2021. 
Your estimated shipping costs are:  
Estimated Shipping Charges Per Region
We are using GameFound for our post-Kickstarter management website. Through GameFound, you will be able to let us know of your delivery address, and also to add extra books and options to your pledge, depending on the remaining stock.
PDF: Your PDFs will be available on DriveThruRPG and on your GameFound account.
Restricted Shipping Locations
We will ship worldwide, but if you are shipping to one of the following locations you will be required to pay additional charges for signed and insured delivery. We anticipate these costs are approximately £10 over the standard fees listed in the Shipping information (above).
Who is BlackVault
Based in Yorkshire, UK, BlackVault Limited specialises in the creation of magical worlds. This is the first of many game books: Aether: The Book of the Summoner, The Book of Blood, and Chaos: the Broken Mirror- have already been written and will launch in 2021. 
Stewie Black
Starting out with a full-time career in journalism, Stewie's credits include: The Doctor Who RPG, the Scarred Lands setting, as well as working with Wizards of the Coast on 3rd Edition D&D, White Wolf Publishing, Cubicle 7, two novels, a self-help book. He lives in Scarborough with Zachary, his elderly Cavalier King Charles Spaniel.
Zachary fully approves this campaign!
Risks and Challenges
This may be our first Kickstarter as BlackVault, but it's perhaps our tenth physical book we've printed in the last 20 years and everyone involved in this project has delivered at least one previous Kickstarter. Eldritch: The Book of Madness has been written, it just needs peer-review and final editing.
By participating in this campaign, you will follow the uncertain process of designing, manufacturing and delivering a project. There are always risks that the schedule will change. For five years we have dedicated endless hours to creating these universes. But the risk remains. If you don't want to take this risk, don't participate in this Kickstarter campaign and wait for the public release in 2021.
We want to thank all the people and the community who have supported our project from the start.
Without you, we would be nothing. Thank you!

Dear Adventurers
It's almost here. We're at the point where I can almost turn on the pledge manager.

Dear Adventurers
We're getting closer. We've done more art in the past two weeks than we did in the last four months! It means the launch date is creeping ever nearer and that my "Art to Complete" list is almost empty. Hurrah! 
To say I'm super excited is an understatement. I can't wait for you to get your hands / tentacles / pseudopods on Eldritch and to try out all the grotesque content on your players! The USP of the book is that most of the bad guys synergise with each other, which makes fights so much more challenging (but more about that soon)...

Hi adventurers
As we are getting close to the finished product, I need to start looking at Book 2.

2020 has seen shipping prices fluctuate greatly and we are expecting that trend to continue into next year. Additionally, some changes are being put in place for EU/UK customs in 2021 that may affect shipping prices going forward in those countries. Note that this will NOT affect us providing customs-friendly shipping to our backers.
Please note that shipping is also notoriously unreliable in some regions such as Russia and Brazil. Because of high loss and damage rates, Arcane Wonders will not be able to reship lost packages to these countries without additional cost. We certainly welcome citizens of Megalopolis from all these regions, but please be aware of this before backing.

updates.update_content:
Hello friends
Today’s update is very brief, and a bit different from our typical posts. Right now we’re in the middle of a major sprint to wrap up the expansions’ comic books, which were added to this campaign via stretch goals. We’ve been having so much that we felt we needed to share a quick behind-the-scenes preview of how they’re made!

After the initial design, playtesting, and iteration process for the gameplay, art for the graphic portion of the scenario comic book is drafted using a combination of reference images and a written breakdown of the action.

Greetings Citizens of Megalopolis!
It’s been a bit since our last update, and we can’t thank everyone enough for all your patience while we’re busy bringing everything together behind the scenes. While we have manufacturing and production updates on the horizon, we couldn’t wait another minute to share some previews of what our artists and developers have been working on over the past few weeks. There is a lot to share, so let's jump right in!

Hey folks!
We hope this update finds you happy and healthy in these first few weeks of spring. Today’s update is brief; we just wanted to touch base and share some of the art coming in as we polish off the expansion content!

Hello friends!
We hope the first few months of 2021 have been treating you well, including plenty of time for games amongst the crazy winter weather! We have two important things to share today, so let’s jump right in.

updates.update_content:
Greetings heroes!
Today is the day! After extensive logistical coordination, the Freedom Five Pledge Manager is finally live!

Invites

Hello friends!
We hope this update finds you all happy, healthy, and riding out the final hours of 2020 with some games! As this year comes to a close, we’re reflecting on how fortunate we are to have a community as passionate and supportive as you folks by our side. 2020 has been a long and winding road for all of us, but as the newest pieces of Freedom Five come together, we’re feeling incredibly optimistic about what the future has in store!

Hey folks!
Hope everyone is staying safe and sane as we charge headfirst into the holiday season. Today's update is on the shorter side, but we wanted to touch base to let you know how immensely thankful we are for you all! 2020 has been a crazy year all around, and we are beyond grateful to be a part of this incredible community of gamers.

Incoming art

Hello Heroes! 
Not going to lie, we’re feeling pretty emotional right now.

In the past hour or so (and truthfully the entire length of this campaign) you folks have shared some incredible, heartwarming words about this project and our team. Kickstarter campaigns are long and winding roads, that rarely go exactly as planned. Freedom Five is no exception; this campaign has been an absolute roller coaster of ups and downs, no doubt about it.

campaign.story:
Before the Stroke of Midnight is a Gothic mystery adventure inspired by
Edgar Allan Poe for the world’s largest roleplaying game 5e.

You’ll get the following products:
➛ The adventure Before the Stroke of Midnight
➛ The Black Raven’s Compendium
➛ Specially designed character sheets with a Gothic theme
➛ Digital maps, tokens, and handouts for virtual tabletop gaming
➛ Bonus: You’ll get a special mention in the book!   
Before the Stroke of Midnight is a level 9 adventure, and includes scalable encounters so that the adventure can be played by all characters of level 1-20.
We’ve also included free VTT tokens, gridless maps, and digital handouts so that the adventure can be played online.

The Black Raven’s Compendium contains new monsters, magical items, spells, and more. It also includes unlocked stretch goals and will be available to all backers.
The book will be approximately 80 pages (if all stretch goals are unlocked) and available in hardcover, softcover, and digital format.

This adventure is created by Midnight Tower, the two nerds who brought you
What happened to Evy Ashwood? and Rise of the Ice Dragons Trilogy.

Join us on our epic journey!    
The Duchess Rose Blackraven of Shieldsborg Castle is dead.
However, her last will is missing, and it is unclear who will inherit from her.

You must find the will before midnight and identify the true heir to Shieldsborg Castle.
Search the old castle for clues, interview the secretive residents, and investigate the mysterious surrounding areas.

But be careful – more blood will be spilled, and a new murder will occur before midnight.  
➛Download the first part of the adventure Before the Stroke of Midnight.
(Spoiler alert! The PDF preview contains vital information about the adventure plot and is meant to be read by the DM only.)   
Viola Grey, one of the many ghosts that haunt Shieldsborg Castle.
➛ A classic mystery adventure inspired by Edgar Allan Poe!
➛ New monster: Dusk wolf
➛ Unique magical item: The Ring of Serpent’s Tongue
➛ Nine illustrated and detailed NPCs (including a ghost) with personal background descriptions, agendas, and secrets
➛ Legend & Lore: Shieldsborg Castle
➛ More than 40 original high-quality colour illustrations and artworks, including professional commissions from Alaina Milare (Empyrean Investigations and Rise of the Ice Dragons Trilogy)
➛ Approximately 80 pages of content in total (if all stretch goals are unlocked)
➛ High-quality maps created by cartographers like Dark Realm Maps and Lizard Ink Maps
➛ The Black Raven’s Compendium with all the unlocked stretch goals
➛ Bonus: You’ll get a special mention in the adventure!       
Dusk wolf, one of the new monsters in the book.
➛ You’ll get the adventure before it’s released anywhere else
➛ You save money, as all prices are heavily discounted

campaign.story:
Pincha en la imagen para la pagina web en castellano
Aboard a cruise ship, the lifeless body of a passenger has been found in their luxury suite…
The prime suspects are the occupants of the VIP cabins on the upper deck. They are the only ones who could have had access. You and your fellow private detectives are participating in a conference aboard the ship, and you all decide to make a bet to solve the murder. Who among you will prove to be the finest sleuth?
The story-based competitive crime investigation game Midnight Murder Mysteries takes you on an unpredictable voyage, in which you must try to reconstruct the circumstances of the alleged crime…
Who is the murderer? What was their motive? How did the victim die? These are the questions you will need to answer once the ship has docked… Or after another detective discloses what they have found! 
Common assumptions for all cases: the suspicious death occurred the day before, between 11:45 pm and midnight; the murderer acted alone and is always one of the occupants of the VIP cabins unless it was an accident or suicide.
In each case, you will be able to talk to 12 suspects who could be interrogated about three topics and 24 locations that are spread over several floors that could be explored. The cases are completely independent of one another. Even though they have identical first names in all of the cases, the suspects are never the same people. 
OUR FUNDING GOAL!
Please see cases details in the CASES section below.
NEXT STRETCH GOAL
Unlocking this stretch goal will add 1 case in the Green/Red booklets & 1 case in the Purple one.
CORE BOX
The board, with floor plans of the decks of the ship and the Ship Progression track
 ALL-IN BOX = Core box, plus:
Cases are the heart of Midnight Murder Mysteries! Each booklet contains several cases, which you don’t have to play in any particular order. Amateur cases contain fewer wrong paths than Expert cases and offer more ways to find important clues.
At the beginning of a booklet, you find the Case Presentation (which may include special rules), with a correlation table: each of the 60 possible paths you can follow has a number, which points to a specific Paragraph. 
In the middle of the booklet, the Paragraphs for all the cases, referenced by a number, are mixed, which means that the surrounding Paragraphs won’t be relevant to the case you are playing.
Plenty of cases!
You will get tons of cases from the start! But the 100% goal is only a first step: the more backers we get, the more cases will be added to the boxes! 
The Green & Red booklets: the 12 starting cases
Please note all cases are written and tested but most cases are not translated yet. 
The Purple booklet: the 8 starting cases
Please note all cases are written and tested but most cases are not translated yet.
The White booklet contains 5 cases and is an exclusive KS bonus for ALL backers! 
Fancy yourself a detective? Try out the game by playing 3 cases: K01 - The Billionaire Cruise; K02 - Pirates!; K03 - The Epidemic. 
Download the print and play version (zipped file)
These 3 cases need less material than the Standard ones: only 6 Suspects; no Purser; no Event deck for K01 & K02. Nevertheless, the plot is just as exciting as in other cases! You'll also need the rules. You'll find 4 files:
MMM-2DED_EN_PnP_Booklet-White-K1to3 (landscape format with 2 pages per sheet)
MMM-2DED_EN_PnP_NotebookSheets (you'll need one double-sided page per player)
MMM-2DED_EN_PnP_Board&Tokens
MMM-2DED_EN_PnP_BlueSetEventDeck (only required for playing K03)
DOWNLOAD THE RULES (pre-published PDF version)
Choose a case (Amateur level or Expert level) from one of the case booklets. Read its presentation out loud, and embark on a new mystery adventure…
At the beginning of each round, reveal a new Event card (some will cause the ship to advance on its track, others will add a bit of spice to the game) and place the purser in the zone designated by the number on the card.
Then, players will take turns investigating in clockwise order. On your turn, you have 3 action points to spend (Buoy tokens also give additional action points). You can use them to take the actions described below.
Investigation actions
Whether public or private, all investigations are automatically successful. To search/inspect a location and to interrogate a suspect, the detective must be in the same zone as the target. To interrogate a suspect, you must also choose one of the three possible conversational subjects and announce it to the other players:
 ALIBI (Where were you at the time of the murder?),
 WITNESS (Do you know something about the death, the victim, or the other suspects?),
 MOTIVE (What was your relationship with the victim?).
Then refer to the case booklet to read the paragraph (each of the possible paths you can follow has a number, which points to a specific Paragraph).
After spending your action points, you may move one suspect of your choice one or two zones for free. Put the Last Moved Suspect disc underneath the moved suspect, which indicates the next suspect to be moved this way has to be a different one.
End of the case and player conclusions
A case ends when the ship arrives at the port OR when a detective makes disclosures. In both cases, all players will share what they have deduced. After that, read the entire solution of the case out loud and then calculate the scores. The player with the highest total score wins the game! 
The most exciting parts of this game lie in discovering the story piece by piece and in trying to understand what happened. Ultimately, you’re aiming to avoid the wrong paths and be the best at gathering and interpreting the puzzle pieces presented by the story…

Watch Ryan, Jonah, Will & Sara from Tantrum House playing through Midnight Murder Mysteries (4 players, 80min). They started the game in a very (too?) cooperative mood, but the atmosphere changed completely at some point!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
You are a crucial part of making Midnight Murder Mysteries a reality. It is your support that will ensure we can translate the remaining cases and launch production! It is quite a challenge, as neither the game nor the author and publisher are yet well-known in the English-speaking game community.

Except for France and Spain, we do not have yet a distribution network established. So the only guaranteed option to get your hands on Midnight Murder Mysteries is by backing this campaign.

In terms of development, rules and cases are 100% written and tested on a large panel of gamers. Rules have been improved since the First Edition (in French and Italian only). Illustrations and graphic design are completed. Except for the case booklets, whose translations in English and Spanish remain to be financed, the files are ready for manufacturing. Once the project is 100% funded, we will be able to complete the translations.

Since the very beginning (prototype in 2010!), Midnight Murder Mysteries was also intended to be published in English. It just required some time to sail in this direction. We're happy to work with GDM Games for the Spanish version as they have shown interest in this game since 2016.

Thank you very much for your interest and your help!

campaign.story:
The Hidden Listener
THE TRUTH:
This cosykiller series is based during World War 2 in England at a top secret war time POW interrogation centre known as Latimer House.  
At Churchill's orders, the estate underwent 2 million pounds worth of renovation at the start of the war to fit out the manor house out with secret listening devices which would enable the MI5 and 6 operatives to listen in on conversations between high ranking POWs .    
Many secrets discovered by the teams of secret listeners at Latimer house were integral to the war effort - and although many files have now been declassified, lurking in the basement of the property (which incidentally is now a stylish hotel) is a tunnel which is still sealed under the official secrets act and will not be opened for many more years.
THE FICTION:
This cosykiller series explores the fictional secrets contained within this tunnel at the very real wartime interrogation centre.  Discoveries are made as the National Archives slowly release information to the Inheritance hunting firm "Fairhall and Brett" who contact you as the last living descendant of a woman your family always thought had been killed during a V2 rocket attack in 1944...

Never played before?
This is our  fourth "season" of cosykiller - but the stories grow in complexity  annually as we learn what we can and can't do with paper and extras - we're moving offices this year because the cosykiller series have become so popular we need more space.  We're using this increase in space to buy a few more large machine gadgets that will enable us to really increase the hands-on nature of cosykiller this year...

For those who've played before you know each story contains a heady mix of puzzles and plot allowing players  to get really immersed in the story as each unfolds.  It's a unique mix  of choose your own adventure and cryptography and it's not for the  faint-heated.
Each series has included mementos and memorabilia from the time thanks to our various contacts in reproduction services and our  excellent design team.
If you've never played before, then you won't be disappointed with this year :-)

The Rewards?
We've tried to create tier points that enable you to back us even if you don't want to commit to a full story!  If you have never played cosykiller before and want to dip your toe into the water to see what a box might be like - then why not just pledge for our Christmas Murder Mystery Weekend Gift Box.  This will be a stand alone story with evidence and live action drama via zoom on a weekend in January.  Our last murder mystery virtual weekend contained puzzles similar to our cosykiller series... so if you can achieve those - then you'll know you can tackle the full year...

Our Early Bird Pledges have some unique offers, only available in limited quantities.  So grab those while you can!

Why are we seeking funding through Kickstarter?
Since we started Cosykiller in 2016 it's literally taken over our  office!  We are currently working within a cocoon of cardboard boxes,  sitting behind stacks of printing for the boxes, and with finished  subscriptions stacked up to the ceiling around us!

At the moment we can't actually FIT another story into our office, which means we are moving offices!  

As we hand pack each box it means we need space to lay out all the  pieces that fit inside each one.  Players this year have noticed the odd  mistake as we miss items, or add in duplicates, and this is purely  caused by space problems within the office as we're working without  space to swing a cat (probably just as well as I think the two dogs in  the office would eat any we did bring in to test swing-ability).

A fully funded Kickstarter will help towards the office expansion  plans, as we need more shelving, fit for purpose storage and just  generally MORE ROOM to grow!

This office move will also mean we'll have space for a laser cutter of our own, which we will be using to increase the complexity of our puzzles!  An overfunded kickstarter will make this vision a reality much sooner too!


Reviews for previous series:
Amazing and friendly company with a very immersive story line. Half  way  through the first season and have to say I’m addicted! I’m solving  this  with my mum and it’s a great way for us to spend quality time  together.  Can’t wait to see what the other seasons have in store! Thank  you cosykiller xx
-----
This is the ultimate mystery. There is so much information that you   receive over a year’s time. It’s fun to get completely immersed in the   story. There are lots of clues, but many of them are difficult to  figure  out and are a great challenge for your brain. The different  ciphers  used take just enough work that you get a real sense of  satisfaction  when you complete them. Overall, this has been a great  experience!
-----
I feel like I've been transported to 1930s India, and I'm only  working  through the journal in the first box! I cannot wait to see  what's next!  In addition to the game itself, the women who are Cosy  Killer have been  very welcoming and accommodating with all of my  questions! Way to go,  ladies! You all are fantastic!
----
I just got my first box and it is really cool. The journal came  burned,  it is so interesting. I wonder why, that is something I need to  figure  out. This is the best box ever!!!! If you like mystery, i  highly  recommend.
----
Cosy Killer is by far the best murder mystery subscription box. If  you  are looking for an engaging experience filled with authentic  characters,  a story with multiple interwoven plot lines, puzzles that  are  organically entwined within the narrative which serve to enhance  the  whole experience then this is it. The excellent skills of the  CosyKiller  team encourage an inevitable emotional investment in the  characters.  While you know that you are investigating the death and  whereabouts of  Marie, there is a point in Box 9 where you decode a  tricky artifact,  with every letter decoded my heart ached a little as I  could predict  what the next letter would be.
If you want an experience like  no other I have encountered, one that  will keep you puzzling and that  keeps you coming back for more - then  Cosy Killer is the only  subscription box out there.
Treat yourself - you won't regret it
----
Let's get the downside out of the way first -  CosyKiller is a  year-long subscription.  Telling one story over twelve  monthly boxes,  it's some commitment of money and time.
BUT!
What  it gives you back for that subscription is unsurpassed in terms  of  mystery subscription boxes.  There are no phone numbers to call  that  might end up disconnected after a few months, there are no  websites to  visit that might be taken offline at no notice, everything  you need is  there in the boxes.
And what boxes they  are - one month you might get a 128 page  diary/journal containing two  obvious ciphers and one very well hidden  one.  You might get twelve to  sixteen letters from one character to  another, including drawings and  birthday or christmas cards.  You might  get clay artifacts, or death  certificates, or shipping manifests, or  telegrams, or....
You  can read something in box 8 that reminds you of something in box  1 to  find an inconsistency in testimony that feeds into the final  solution -  you can find ciphers in early boxes that are made more  explicit later  on, but still solvable at that early stage.
The commitment is huge, but the project is major league, satisfying, intelligent, interesting and thoroughly recommended.
----
I am only three episodes in but the storyline is awesome and very   gripping. I didn’t want to stop reading! You get very authentic items   and they pay close attention to detail. Very impressed!

campaign.story:
Our Kickstarter has now ended but if you missed out - or want more episodes - visit our website:  https://thedetectivesociety.com/
 Receive a package to your door! Our packages are delivered direct to you, filled with incredible puzzles and a deep, immersive world.
 Team up or play alone! You can play by yourself, with your partner, or with a group of friends or colleagues. Each of the packages should last around 90 minutes.
 Interact with the world! Contact the characters by email or message, stalk their social media accounts and scour the internet to help solve the puzzles.
 Become immersed in the story! Put yourself into the shoes of the detective to solve The Sudden Silence of Timothy Lee.
 Continue your journey! Each package follows on from the previous one, presenting you with new challenges and exciting plot twists.

Physical Items
At the heart of each episode is the package that will be delivered through your door. Inside you will find a range of different items, which you will need to solve the case.
Interactive Technology
To create a truly modern detective experience, all members of the Society will need to examine digital sources as well as the physical ones in the package.
Our bespoke communication systems allow players to converse with characters via email and SMS/Whatsapp.
Our detailed and immersive websites create complex online worlds for detectives to explore as they search for answers.
Exhaustive Clue System
Even the best detectives can require a little help. That's why we created an innovative and exhaustive clue system for Season One, to enable detectives to get a little assistance should they require it.
Our master detective Lucid Montgomery takes a look over every case that comes through our door and is kind enough to write down a few prompts for each part of each episode in case a detective is in need of assistance.

Welcoming Community
We have already collected together an incredible bunch of detectives from Season One on our dedicated Facebook and Reddit groups.
These amazing detectives discuss and share their findings, assisting each other when they get stuck and pointing out hidden tidbits that some might have missed (while flagging spoilers, of course).
We know some detectives like to work alone, but for those that don't, you will find the community a welcoming place for you to discuss the cases.
Christmas is coming and you might want to give a loved one the gift of detecting this holiday season.
To make this easier, we will be giving backers the option to be emailed a gift voucher code, that they can pass on to the recipient at Christmas (or for their birthday or for any other event worthy of a present). The recipient can then redeem this code via our website to receive the packages at the same time as everyone else.
This option will be provided when we send out our backer survey once the campaign ends, meaning you will receive these vouchers in time for Christmas.
Add-ons are a new feature being trialled by Kickstarter and mean that we don’t need to utilize a pledge management system.
Backers can also select to receive Season One (either the first episode or all six episodes) as an add-on when they pledge to receive any of our rewards. The Season One add-ons are available at discounted rates as a thank you to all our Season Two backers.
Season One add-ons will be shipped in January 2021, alongside Episode One of Season Two.
You can also use the add-on feature to purchase additional copies of Season Two (Episode One or all six episodes).
As a Company, we're committed to producing Season Two - no matter what! And we'd like to thank everyone who has supported us so far for allowing that to happen. 
So what made us decide to launch Season Two on Kickstarter?
By pre-selling on Kickstarter, we then know how ambitious we can be with our plans for Season Two. The huge support we received for Season One, meant we could do so much more than we originally planned.
Every copy of Season Two that's purchased on Kickstarter contributes to extra design features, video work, voiceovers, interactive elements, digital content and physical box contents. Simply put, the more you support us the more we'll be able to do.
We're a super small company, but we have big ideas and your support makes them a reality.
We are pleased to say that we ship worldwide! You can view the shipping costs in the table below:
All shipping to the United Kingdom is included in the price, as that's where we manufacture and ship our packages from - we have also reduced the normal international shipping costs to take into account that shipping is included for UK customers.
We take all precautions to ensure that customers outside of the UK pay no customs or import fees - including attaching CN22 forms - although we cannot guarantee your parcel will not be held at customs or have additional fees applied. However, to date, we are unaware of any of packages we have shipped internationally having additional fees applied to them.
If you have had board games sent to you in the past from the UK without issues, then there is a good chance the same will happen with The Detective Society's games.
The season is made up of six episodes and if you buy the whole season you will receive one a month. We'll ship each of the episodes to all players simultaneously. This will help avoid any spoilers, whilst also giving all players the chance, if they wish, to experience each episode at the same time as every other player, making it an exciting 'live' event.
How will this work with your Kickstarter pledge?
If you pledge for “First Package” then you will receive your first box at the same time as everybody else, when Season Two goes live (January 2021). You can then choose to buy the rest of the season, either via a subscription or by buying the packages individually when they are released.
If you pledge for “All Six Packages” then you are purchasing the whole of the season - you will receive one episode every month. The story will run alongside your life for the entire six months!
Who can play the game?
The game can be played solo, with a partner, or with a group of friends or colleagues and is recommended for players aged over 14 years, due to the peril the characters find themselves faced with.
When will we deliver?
Episode One will be produced and shipped in late January 2021, with the subsequent five episodes being shipped monthly from then on.
It's always been important to us that we deliver what we promise on schedule, and we have achieved that with Season One. 
All our processes and supply chains have been established from the production of Season One and that will continue seamlessly as we move into the production of Season Two. 
Season Two is being designed by the same people that brought you Season One - Joe Mills and Tristan Rogers - while Dan Wiseman is in charge of the business operations.
Before creating The Detective Society, Joe was instrumental in the success of some of the best escape games that London has to offer. His journey began with Time Run, ('fifth best escape room company in the world' in 2018); before moving onto Sherlock: The Game Is Now - the official BBC TV series tie-in. He also created and launched one of Design My Night's top picks for a night out in London: the immersive puzzle-based cocktail experience, The Case of the Poisoned Chalice. Joe takes the lead when it comes to creating all the puzzles. 
Tristan is a game designer, actor and award-winning writer. He's worked in some of London's top theatres and has written on numerous programmes for BBC Radio. He’s worked with Joe designing puzzles at various escape games, most recently penning the plot for The Case of The Poisoned Chalice. Tristan is in charge of overseeing the narrative of the cases.
Dan is our managing director and brings his vast business and marketing experience to the team. For over 10 years he has been building and operating successful businesses, including a digital marketing agency. He is connected to the Detective Society through a mutual love of all things gaming-related, evidenced by his constant stream of RPG game ideas. Dan made his first RPG when he was just 13 years old. Dan ensures that we deliver on our promises.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with any project, there are of course various risks and challenges involved - problems with design, procurement and shipping can all occur. However, our extensive work creating Season One means we have lots of experience to draw on. We have already built relationships with our key suppliers, and we are now very well versed in the processes required to release one episode a month. Our budgets are thorough, and we have built in significant contingency to deal with those issues we cannot foresee.

Of course there are two factors that are outside of our control. Firstly, Covid-19 continues to spread across the world, and its existence has underpinned the lifespan of our young company. As we have existed with it for so long, we are confident we can deal with what the current situation throws at us. We are in regular contact with our suppliers, all of whom continue to operate as normal. Initially it impacted on the delivery timescales of our suppliers, but - at present - those have returned to their normal estimated delivery times. However, should this crisis deepen further, and cause major disruption to these supply and distribution networks (both here in the UK and worldwide), then this may impact our ability to deliver according to our planned schedule. Secondly, it remains unclear what trading agreement, if any, will be reached between Britain and the EU. While we believe that regardless of the outcome we should be able to continue to ship our packages to the EU and beyond without any customs issues, the nature of these negotiations means that things could change suddenly and unexpectedly.

campaign.story:
Face the threat of the supernatural as a traitor with a chance of redemption in the service of Queen Elizabeth I, in an alternately historical tabletop RPG from the creator of The Cthulhu Hack.
When Elizabeth Tudor succeeded to the throne in 1558, she found herself under assault from all sides, paying for her father's arrogant machinations, and the weakened barrier between worlds his split with Rome had caused.
As magic and creatures of the supernatural proliferate throughout the land, the Queen passed an Act Against Conjurations, Enchantments and Witchcrafts, making the punishment for acts of magic more severe than others, but in many cases drawing the line before a death sentence. In 1564, John Dee and Francis Walsingham convinced the Queen to pass an amendment to the Act — The Dee Sanction — permitting the practice of magic in defence of the realm.
You are an Agent of Dee; not out of choice, but out of some twisted sense of self-preservation. Somewhere between conscription and penance, you work for Walsingham and Dee to make amends, with a faint hope that you can use your talents to earn your pardon and absolution.
You can see the light at the end of the tunnel. If only you can outrun the shadows of your past and the horrors of the present…
This is The Dee Sanction.
The Dee Sanction is a tabletop roleplaying game about serving Queen and country in the late Tudor period, in a time where kingdoms vie for power, the Church splinters under the pressure of reform, and creatures of folklore emerge from enforced hiding seeking revenge against those who imprisoned them.
You're a bad person — sentenced to hang for dabbling in magic — given a chance to redeem yourself and earn freedom in service to Queen Elizabeth's newest line of defence. 
Like The Cthulhu Hack, the system focuses on simple mechanics. A player rolls against one of three Resources — measured by a dice value for Physical, Intellectual and Supernatural — and hope to avoid a result of 1 or 2. The agent always succeeds in broad terms, but with a result of 1 or 2, they fail forward.
That means even a bad roll won't stop progress; it just means things might get a bit harder. That's the core of it, the philosophy that even in failure, the story should always be moving forward, even if it might tilt toward potential disaster in the process!
The campaign will fund a 60-page black-and-white illustrated compact book (A5, 148 x 210mm/5.8 x 8.3 inches), 95% written at the time the Kickstarter starts and tested over several years. You can find out more about the background and development of the game at The Dee Sanction blog — which will continue to expand and support the game.

Recorded as part of Virtually Expo in August 2020, three fearless agents head into the unknown — south of Krakow, April 1585 — on the trail of a missing relic at the strange mercy of a blessed eyelash...
Both an interview and an actual play (starting at 32m 46s) as part of podcast Orlanth Rex's Gaming Vexes. We chat around the genesis and development of the game, before setting out to Deptford, 1593, in pursuit of a volume from Dee's lost library, The Book of Dead Names.
Orlanth Rex's Gaming Vexes — Episode 8 
And finally, an interview with Paul Mclean, of Yog-sothoth.com, was kind enough to interview me in January 2020 about the development, back story and future release of The Dee Sanction. Paul has kindly allowed me to host the interview, previously only available to Patrons via Patreon.
The core of the Kickstarter is the book, available in PDF (the Page), softcover (the Gentlefolk) and a cloth-bound hardcover version with a foil-blocked sigil of the Black Seal on the front (the Courtier).
All pledge levels with a physical book will also include a PDF, fulfilled through our web store at All Rolled Up.
In addition to the basic levels of book, both the Agent of Dee and the Favoured of the Queen pledge levels offer Kickstarter Exclusive rewards in the form of an All Rolled Up game roll. 
The All Rolled Up game roll is a versatile, compact hobby wrap, that's way more than a dice bag; it can hold more than 100 polyhedral dice, plus up to 10 pens and pencils, as well as index cards or a small notepad.
These hand-crafted Kickstarter Exclusives feature special design features:
the Agent with closure strap complete with a metal buckle;
the Favoured with a crimson cord tie tipped with charms, representing elements of Elizabeth's elaborate outfit. The accessories and material of the game roll accentuate and mimic the Queen's dress design (see Update #22 for more pictures).
Softcover and Hardback covers (to be finalised)
Work-in-progress printed fabric badge motif for All Rolled Up
Charms adorning the ends of the cord tie on the I, Elizabeth ARU
After the Kickstarter concludes, and the book is finalised, all physical rewards will ship. PDF copies will be available as soon as the book is completed. The PDF and softcover will be available on an ongoing basis through All Rolled Up. 
The hardcover book is a Kickstarter exclusive, printed in limited numbers on a short run. Any not sold through the Kickstarter will be available through the All Rolled Up web store.
The campaign's core goal aims to bring The Dee Sanction to print with the artwork it deserves. Mindful that the book is almost complete, we're keeping any stretch goals simple — focusing mostly on enhancements and digital extras.
The book stands at 60-pages, illustrated with black-and-white full and half plate illustrations by Evlyn Moreau. The £3,000 base Goal will fulfil the print run and pay for existing artwork.
If we achieve stretch goals, we'll add more art, more content and enhance the range of initial digital material available to support the game.
Additional PDF adventures and accessories will not delay the release of the physical content.
Beyond the base Goal of £3,000, stretch goals will add:
 More Art (£4,000 — UNLOCKED) - We will add two additional full-page commission pieces by the talented Evlyn Moreau to the Core Book. This brings us to 62-pages.
 PDF Adventures #1 through 4 (ALL — UNLOCKED) - Over the course of playtesting the game, many adventures have been run, taking the Dee Sanction from the heart of the Ossulstone Hundred in the shadow of the Tower to the foothills of the Carpathian Mountains in the wilds of eastern Europe.
 Longer Bestiary (£6,000 — UNLOCKED) - The Core Book contains a two-page bestiary. At this stage, we will expand that count to four-pages in total. This brings us to 64-pages.
 Tudor Mini Guild (£8,000 — UNLOCKED) - We will commission Evlyn to create twenty mini character portraits in the style of her Fabulous Mini Guild. All backers of virtual or physical product will receive a copy of the PDF version to print out or use online as tokens.
 Ossulstone Map (£10,000 — UNLOCKED) - First glimpsed at Dragonmeet in 2019, the part of London at the heart of many Dee Sanction investigations is that which lies in the shadow of the Tower of London. A work-in-progress, at this level, all backers of virtual or physical product will receive a copy of the PDF version to print out or use online.
 Sanction Journal (£11,000 — UNLOCKED) - The Dee Sanction encourages a play style that weaves tales across different dates, places and characters. Rather than restrict character information to just a sheet, a Sanction Journal - also known as a Book of Days - provides copies of the character sheet interspersed with a mix of gridded, lined, and dotted paper. All backers of virtual or physical product will receive a copy of the PDF version to print and use.
 More Art (£14,000 — UNLOCKED) - As we've extended the bestiary, it's appropriate to add some creature images to the section. We will add two additional full pages to the book to include additional commissioned pieces by the talented Evlyn Moreau. This brings us to 66-pages.
 More Tables (£16,000 — UNLOCKED) - The character generation system includes tables for generating occupation, association, focus and favours. We will add two tables, providing additional occupations and humours, which defines a possible quirk for your character (like the pre-generated characters used in the Actual Plays). This brings us to 68-pages.
 Wipe Character Cards (£18,000 — UNLOCKED) - When we worked on The Cthulhu Hack we found that the option to have a dry wipe character card made sense for one-shots; an easy way to create and erase characters. We propose to create A5 dry wipe character cards (148 × 210 mm or 5.8 × 8.3 inches) for The Dee Sanction and include two cards with each physical reward level. Also, we will add the option to buy a pack of 10 as an Add On.
 PDF Adventure #5 (£20,000 — UNLOCKED) - What's a wooden rammar and how did John Dee hurt his left shin on the sharp small end of it at four o'clock in the afternoon today (or possibly tomorrow – he isn't certain) in 1592? If we hit £20,000, I'll write an adventure that explains (or at least considers) Dee's shin injury.
 Mystery Final Stretch Goal (£30,000) - Dee's interminable quest, persevering in contempt of all reason, always pushed him onward. Who knows what esoteric wonders might await should such lofty heights be attained?
