campaign.story:
Unbound is a rules-light, settingless roleplaying game about over-the-top cinematic action, interesting tactical choices, and empowering players to create an engaging, evocative world with as little fuss as possible.
THIS IS A REDESIGN AND A REPRINT
We've already Kickstarted Unbound once - in 2017. But we didn't make any extra copies, so it's been out of print since then, despite lots of people wanting a physical edition. This project is a way to gather the funds we need to do a second print run.
We've worked with Mina McJanda to redesign the book down to a more portable A5 format (she did the layout on Heart, Lancer and Voidheart Symphony, so you know she's good). We're having the book litho-printed, rather than digitally printed on demand like the previous run, which allows us far more control over the quality of the paper and binding and lets us make a book that will last for years to come.
We've been through the text, removed errors, corrected spelling mistakes, tightened up some wording and generally made the entire thing easier to read and play. We're using the same brilliant art by Adrian Stone as the original print, because look at it.
We’ve also included the two themed supplements written as part of the original Kickstarter - Cyberpunk and Urban Horror - into the core book as appendices. These each come with a new core, two new traits, and a new hierarchy of adversaries.
Everything's ready to go. You'll get your PDF as soon as the money comes through to us, and we'll go to print as soon after that as possible. We're aiming to get the books to you before Christmas.
If you already own a copy of Unbound (digital or physical), you can have a free copy of the redesigned PDF as soon as it's released. We'll update the PDF to the new version everywhere we sell it, and if you got it via our previous Kickstarter, we'll be distributing the new version via the original Backerkit to the email address you used then. If you don't have access to that any more, drop us a line at admin@rowanrookanddecard.com and we'll sort you out.  
IS IT ANY GOOD?
Yes! But don't just take our word for it:
"There are so many things that grab you about Unbound: fantastic world-building tools, super clever way the cards are used.  But honestly the stand out is how you make a party that is bound together but allows the characters to spin off into their own special thing.  Just magical!" - Becky Annison, author of Lovecraftesque and Bite Marks 
"Unbound is everything we’ve come to expect from the team at Rowan, Rook and Decard - a blend of outrageous creativity and innovative but intuitive mechanics presented with style and polish. Bursting with ideas and advice for worlds, stories and gameplay, Unbound really is the RPG that can claim the only limit is your imagination." - Gav Thorpe, Games Workshop luminary
"Unbound has a great combination of action and drama - it's tactical enough to get your teeth into, but cinematic enough that you don't get bogged down in the mechanics and always have a chance to do something cool." - Joanna Piancastelli,  Golden Cobra live games award winner

HOW DOES IT WORK?
Unbound is designed to give you and your group the agency, inspiration and encouragement to build your own world and fill it with exciting stories. As the players make characters, they and the GM will answer questions relating to their chosen abilities that sketch out the rest of the world, the heroes' goals, the opposition in their path, and what stands to happen if they fail.
First, the group picks a CORE - an overall identity for the party - such as Warrior, Devout, Outlaw, or Wild. The core dictates the overall campaign arc (i.e. who the player characters are and what they're doing) as well as giving players a shared ability - the way in which they recover health in combat.
The Pactbound core lets the players tell stories about characters who draw power from otherworldly sources
Each player then picks a ROLE. Anyone familiar with roleplaying games, either traditional or digital, will be familiar with these - the long-ranged Deadeye, the tough and dependable Warden, the supportive Protector, and so on. The role comes with a set of capabilities and a choice of abilities that give the character a niche within the party when it comes to combat.
The Striker is dangerous, but fragile
Finally, each player chooses a  TRAIT. This is a specialty that sets them apart from others of their role, and they're things like Shadows, Spirit, Transform, Dirty Fighting, and so on. As well as giving them a useful ability in a fight, they'll help populate the world around the player characters with friends, enemies, locations and events that lend weight to the campaign by answering questions attached to the choices they’ve made.
The Companion trait lets you bring a loyal ally into battle
The questions in the CORE, ROLE and TRAIT tie together with touchstones - key concepts that the players select and then collaboratively build into the bare bones of a setting - to ensure that every game of Unbound has, by default, a set of unique characters in a fascinating world full of adventure hooks.
All told, this makes for the best session zero you'll ever have. Each campaign of Unbound begins with the players ready and raring to go, eager to explore (and possibly destroy) the world they've just imagined - and with our unique advancement system that rewards players for completing scenes and objectives of their own creation, the GM doesn't have to do any prep to make it happen.
WHAT ARE THE RULES?
Unbound uses one set of standard playing cards per player - at the core of it, each party involved in a challenge draws a card and whoever draws highest wins, but there's a bit more to it in practice.
As you play, you'll personalise your character deck so it reflects where your character's been and what they've done by writing down important events and damaging scars on the cards themselves. Your deck is as important as your character sheet when it comes to describing your character.
Mina has created useful diagrams that explain the game's mechanics
The combat system is designed to provide a mix of abstraction - letting players get creative and exciting with their descriptions - with tactical action. Player characters and adversaries occupy AREAS that are, in essence, individual locations that it's interesting to have a fight in. Moving between these areas, pushing and pulling enemies, and setting up interesting combinations of abilities forms the crux of combat in Unbound.
Maps are made up of areas and connections to keep combat flowing smoothly
We've also created more than fifty adversaries for your players to take down, and every single one of them has an interesting ability or quirk that marks them out from others of their kind. There are big bruisers who storm around the battlefield smashing apart obstacles in their path; there are grim killers who disguise themselves as their minions; there are critters that grab on to your leg teeth-first and refuse to let go until you shake them off. What's more, almost all adversary abilities are triggered by a series of memorable player actions, so the GM doesn't have to memorise each one to run them in a fight.
 CAN I LISTEN TO AN ACTUAL PLAY OF IT? 
You can! We got together with our friends Becky Annison, Kieron Gillen and Sharang Biswas to play through the character creation and world building for a brand new campaign. You can listen to STONEGRAVE here.
 WHAT SORT OF CHARACTERS CAN WE BE?
Unbound not only allows, but encourages, wild creativity on the part of players. Sure, you can play a dude with a sword if you'd like - and you'll probably have fun doing so.  But working from the basic ideas laid out in character creation and using the abstraction that Unbound affords, we've had some truly unusual characters.
Want to play five wolves? You can do that. Want your special weapon to be a truck that screeches in and runs over your enemies? Sure! Want to never lift a finger but be defended by a cadre of armoured battle nuns? Go for it! These are all player characters we've had in sessions of Unbound, and that's just the games that we've run ourselves. If your players are chafing against restrictions in other roleplaying games, Unbound might just be the RPG for them.
HOW LONG DOES IT TAKE?
Unbound is a game about big, bold short-burn stories that don't outstay their welcome - the standard campaign length is around five to six games of a few hours each, and groups are encouraged to explore the same world from different angles with multiple arcs that use entirely new characters. (For example: we ran a Cyberpunk game where the players failed to overthrow the evil corporation in the final scene, so the following campaign took place 10 years afterwards as the characters' children dealt with the war that the corporation brought to their homeland.) Ultimately, it's up to you and your group, but we've found that shorter story arcs are much easier to plan around and execute - so we've written a system that supports them.
WHAT CAN I GET?
This is a no-frills Kickstarter designed to gather funds to allow us to print a product that's all ready to go. You can get a PDF of the updated design of Unbound, or you can get a softcover edition with a PDF included for free. 
This campaign is an experiment to see if we can justify the cost of doing a print run and redesign on the games that we developed before Spire - the title we're best known for. We've set the funding goal for two weeks because we don't intend to have this become a huge project, but instead to get physical books into the hands of people that want them.
WHO ARE YOU?
From left to right: Decard, Rowan, Rook
We're Rowan, Rook and Decard. (Or: Mary Hamilton, Grant Howitt, and Chris Taylor.) We're a UK roleplaying design studio based in London and Sheffield, and we make some of the best games on the market because we care about good writing, strong mechanics, excellent art, books built to last and paying everyone involved a fair wage. (We are a Living Wage Employer and we say so with pride.)
We've published more than a dozen roleplaying corebooks and supplements in the past, including short ones like Honey Heist, Crash Pandas and the Witch Is Dead and long ones like Spire, Heart and Royal Blood. We really care about what we do, and we're really good at it too. You can take a look at our other games on our website.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We’ve already printed Unbound successfully once, and we have three extra years of experience under our belts now. The text is written, the book is laid out, and we have everything set up with the printer to push go as soon as the money comes through from this project.

We face challenges due to the ongoing threat of the COVID-19 pandemic and, on a more national level, whatever unpleasantness Brexit brings with it. The world is hard to predict at present, and we may face delays in shipping or printing. We will be open and honest with you with regards to expected delivery dates as we have been in the past.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: EU delivery update, digital fulfillment and discount codes
updates.update_content:
Some news on deliveries, etc:

All the EU-bound books are now with Kixto and began shipping yesterday. If you don't get your book in, say, a fortnight, then drop an email to admin@rowanrookanddecard.com and we'll take a look into it.
DTRPG fulfilment has happened - check your emails for a link to add the PDF to your library. Itch.io distribution is currently a work-in-progress while we wait for confirmation from them, but you should receive an email about that soon too.

Just a quick note to say that we've set up a deal with Kixto to distribute all the European orders that have yet to ship - and at no extra cost to you, as we've taken care of the customs charges. Please make sure that your addresses are correct, as we'll be locking them down on Friday and sending off the orders next week.
Thanks so much for your patience on this!

Hello! 
If you opted to wait for the edition of Unbound with the correct cover, and you live anywhere other than the EU, then it's on its way to you right now (and may in some cases have already arrived). We're still working on the EU shipping - our main concern as ever is making sure you don't end up paying for the book twice, and as soon as we have a good answer for that we will get your parcels on their way to you. Digital fulfilment will also be coming in the next few days, so look out for emails from DriveThru and itch.io if you signed up for your free copies there.

Hello!
Okay, so:

We're going to lock orders for all non-EU shipments today, as we've finally managed to get the reprinted books out of Latvia and into the UK (with only one unexpected customs charge, in addition to the expected customs charges!). Once we've done this we'll ship out your books from our distribution centre in Nottingham as soon as we can.

Hello!
The new printing of the core book is done, and advance copies have made it over to us. (It looks good!)
The next step is getting the rest of the books into the country; that's proving more challenging than we'd like due to Brexit, but we've arranged pickup and we're hoping that the delays at customs won't be too bad. For now, everything is on its way, and we will update you again when the books clear customs.

UNBOUND INBOUND
If you're part of the first wave of "limited edition" (ahem) backers, your book is on its way to you now. If you're in the UK, that's fairly straightforward. If you're not - well, look, we're sorry about our country. We believe that a substantial number of books have made it out of the UK and are headed in the general direction of backers, but between Brexit, the virus, the unexpected closure of the Dover-Calais freight crossing, the bricking up of the Channel Tunnel and the converting of a motorway into a very orderly - but still quite apocalyptic - truck queue, we think it's possible there may be some delays at the border. You should have tracking codes, and if your books are lost we will replace them when this has all died down a bit.

For those of you who are getting the 5mm off-centre Cover books (which we're tempted to refer to as the Limited Edition) - we're posting the books this week. Depending on a) how far you are from Nottingham and b) how congested the ports and infrastructures in this country are due to Covid and Brexit and Christmas all at once, you should get them before Christmas. But our apologies if they're late - we did the best we could.
For those of you waiting on a reprinted edition with the cover on properly, they're due to be printed in January and then shipped to us in February - we're currently finalising the files. We'll have more information on the delivery of the books post-Brexit.

Unbound copies have arrived, and we have good news and bad news. 
The good news: we're hugely happy with how the binding and the print internals look - the colours are vibrant, the book is weighty and sturdy, and you can hold it open with one hand and open it flat without cracking the spine. It's a lovely piece of work. The bad news: unfortunately due to a proofing error, the front cover has printed off-centre, cutting off about 5mm of the artwork. It's not a massive problem and it doesn't change how the book reads, plays or feels in your hands, but it does affect the look of the book, and even more unfortunately it's present on all the copies we've printed so far. If you've been with us for a while you'll know we have very high standards for our products - and also very high standards for getting books to customers on time. At the moment it looks like there's a conflict between those things.

Hello!
We're going to lock down addresses tomorrow. If you haven't confirmed your address yet or need to change it because you moved since you filled out the form, get over to Backerkit immediately and sort it out, okay? Okay.
Good stuff.

Hello! Some news:
1. Unbound has gone to print! We've spent the last three days frantically getting the PDF ready to go, but it's all submitted and we're looking forward to hearing more news from our printers in Latvia.

campaign.story:
"There's always more than meets the eye, you just need to know where to look".
Our first product is a fantastic, escape room home experience: a large-scale escape room set which will dominate your dining table, replete with lights, and interactive audio. 
This is the first at-home game for the Spectre & Vox team made up of escape room veterans Nick Moran, former Creative Director of live escape rooms including Time Run and the award-winning Sherlock: The Official Live Game, and Glen Hughes, Founder of Tandem Set and Scenery. 
When Covid-19 closed many doors to the exciting world of escape rooms, we were determined to find a way to recreate that same thrill (the sounds, the lights, the touch, the story-telling and the total escape from reality) within people's own homes. 
We've now built the first fully-realised prototype for a 3D immersive escape room for the home and we need your help to bring it to market!

The Spectre & Vox 3D Haunted House will be available exclusively on Kickstarter so don't miss this exciting opportunity to experience a brand new way to escape!  
Here is a short trailer for this mystery. We advise you wear headphones for the full experience (or listen on good speakers!). 
PLAY

PLAY

Below: steel cutting in action in the workshop! 
Founders - Nick Moran and Glen Hughes
Spectre & Vox are brought to you by the minds behind some of London's greatest immersive experiences. At the helm is Creative Director Nick Moran, also of Time Run and the award-winning Sherlock: The Official Live Game - designer of some of the most lauded escape rooms, worldwide.

Partnering with him is Glen Hughes, Director of Tandem Set and Scenery, the market-leading escape room and immersive theatre construction company.
Read more about Nick and Glen here.
Above: The Tandem workshop in action
Dean Rodgers - Consultant, and Matt Farthing - Composer
Dean Rodgers brings his experience of creating Heist, The Crystal Maze Live Experience amongst others to his role as Game and Experience Designer. 
Matt Farthing is a multi-disciplined composer, sound designer and silly facial-hair enthusiast. He produces all original music and soundscapes for the experience. 
If you'd like a taster of some of Matt's work and the sound design of Spectre & Vox, listen to the audio trailer and/or the music from our Kickstarter video.

If you'd like to find out more about Locktopus Studio, visit their website. 
The Cast
The title roles of Rylan Spectre and Tabitha Vox are voiced by the incredibly talented James Killeen and Dani Mosely and will be accompanied by a range of supporting actors to voice the many characters you will meet on your investigation.
Dani Mosely as Tabitha Vox
James Killeen as Rylan Spectre
As we already have the necessary equipment including our own laser cutter for manufacturing production in our warehouse, we have minimum initial set-up costs. 
Our initial target goal is £34,800 which will be used to pay for the following: Raw materials including (wood, paint, wiring), Equipment, Technology (Game software Locktopus and other software costs), Team costs (Actors, composers and consultants) and Packaging. 
Budget Breakdown
We ship to the UK, Europe, the US, Canada, Australia and New Zealand*. Shipping will be charged AFTER THE END OF THE CAMPAIGN, during the “Pledge Manager” phase.
Below, you will find an estimation of shipping costs per shipping area. 
UK (including Northern Ireland): £6-£12
Europe: £15-£25
Switzerland: £45-£50
USA: £35
Canada: £35
Singapore: £75
Korea: £76
Australia + New Zealand: £75
*If you have any questions or would like to request delivery to a country not listed below, please message us on Kickstarter or email us at hello@spectreandvox.com.

Our warehouse already has the equipment we need to hit the ground running once we hit our target goal. 
As soon as we hit our target, we'll produce the remaining audio recordings and soundscapes. December will be used to refine gameplay and design ahead of manufacture of the game in January.
We'll be fulfilling orders in February for delivery in March 2021. 
We're excited about the prospect of being able to capture the magic of real world escape rooms and transport that experience right into your home with a tactile product and interactive audio and gameplay. Be the very first to experience this totally new format of escape game.
The Spectre & Vox 3D Haunted House will only be available on Kickstarter and will only come to life with your help!
Visit our website at www.spectreandvox.com
Follow us on Twitter, Instagram or Facebook.
For Press Enquiries, please contact marketing@spectreandvox.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Together, Nick and Glen have nearly two decades experience in developing and producing escape games. Although this is our first tabletop game, we are designing and manufacturing the sets in-house which gives us total control over our production line - including access to raw materials and laser cutter. 
 
Our game technology is provided by Locktopus, but we have alternative suppliers lined up if for any reason they can not fulfil their requirements.

Changes in product costs, shipping fluctuations, global pandemics have the potential to affect our final product and schedule.
 
However, any issues that arise during our development process, from schedule delays to component changes, will be quickly and clearly shared with our backers via frequent updates. The only unusual activity you'll find, is in the world of Spectre and Vox.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: What links our laser cutters, tea and 130,000 heads of livestock?
updates.update_content:
They are all currently hanging out on the Suez Canal. 
Not ideal...  but not the end of the world. We wanted to ensure the Covid delays earlier in the year didn't slow down our fulfilment too much and so we invested in a number of additional laser cutter machines to help speed up manufacture. Unfortunately, they're not super speedy right now.
We have our original machines in place so even if these guys take a few extra weeks to get here, they shouldn't slow us down too much but wanted to let you know that even the best-laid plans can sometimes get stuck in the Suez Canal.

Greetings from the S&V team,
We're continuing to experiment and optimise, in fact, we're playing with our character designs and paint finishes as well as exploring using the flatbed printer to create different wallpaper patterns for the different rooms. Haven't finalised the prints yet but you can check out our experiments below!

Greetings from the S&V team,
Sadly the ongoing covid restrictions here in the UK have taken their toll on our timelines, but we're continuing to work in our bubbles and have finalised a new schedule. Based on our current working times and an impressive GANT chart, we can now estimate that we will be able to deliver globally at the beginning of June. We're very sorry for having to delay but we want the final product to be its very best for you.

updates.update_userinfo: Death and Taxes: The only certainties in life

We're still not totally sure what the additional taxes will be in each individual country because they all seem to be quite a bit different. So to support any EU backers impacted, please let us know if you are hit with additional charges (and keep a copy of the receipt for payment!) and we will give you a gift voucher for the same amount to be used on our next game.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks and Challenges
 
Although this is the first campaign for Glass Cannon Unplugged, we have been working in teams that fulfilled 7 campaigns (games done by Phalanx and This War Of Mine: The Board Game) and manufactured and distributed more than 20 titles. We do not expect delays in production, but unforeseen issues may arise during manufacturing and shipping. We estimate that in the worst-case scenario, the production might suffer delays of at most 30-60 days, and shipping & customs may add an extra 15-45 days. We are experienced with large production runs, and we are preparing back-up plans for each step of the project, from production to shipping and final delivery. We will be working with trusted partners for manufacturing and logistics, their names will be revealed upon campaign launch.
 
By backing this project you agree that our primary responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into the pledge management system. You are responsible for import or other duties that may be payable to relevant tax authorities. You also accept that you are fully liable for incorrect shipping details and will risk your pledge being undeliverable or lost in transit. We are unable to ship to PO Boxes. We allow a maximum of one delivery location per backer, regardless of the number of pledges/copies ordered.
 
Please note that geopolitical events not under our control, such as Brexit and the imposition of new tariffs on the access of goods to a country, may change the terms we offer to residents of such countries, even if we guarantee we will do our best to avoid such issues.
 
COVID-19 has been a challenge for us all, we observe the global situation and think ahead, to minimize risk we have decided to work with companies that have a stable position on the market and to the best of our knowledge will not endanger the production and fulfillment of this project.
 
Since the start of the pandemic, we have been working remotely and plan to do so until it is once again safe to meet in the workplace. Using project management tools and Tabletop Simulator we are able to not only run the tests locally how we would in a normal situation but engage internationally with interested testers, this has been very beneficial to the project.

If you apply for a refund after the end of the Kickstarter then we will be able to refund 85% of your pledge. The difference is the amount of the unrecoverable fees paid to process your order.
Once we have started to pack your order, refunds won't be possible.
Refunds are reversed via Stripe to the credit card you used to pledge originally. This project is being funded in EUR and any refunds processed will also be in EUR.
 
If you do not accept the proposed terms, then please do not back this project; kindly wait for the retail release.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Frostpunk: The Board Game is being designed with a long life cycle in mind. The game itself is an environment for various scenarios and modes of playing it that we intend to create both during this campaign and long after it has ended. The core game will be a necessary component to enjoy each of those scenarios and variant gameplay modes. Creating the game with highest possible quality components ensures it will last for many years to come!

updates.update_content:
Hello Frostlanders,
We hope that the spring has melted the snow and ice where you live (hopefully not on the South Pole…) and that you take your time to appreciate the sunshine and the blossoming nature. May is particularly beautiful here in Poland with lush, green trees and people smiling more often as the country is slowly coming back to life after the worst waves of the pandemic. Kids are back at school (thus our efficiency is a bit higher 😉) and things are looking good, and we look to the future with a shy smile of optimism.

Hello Frostlanders!
Today’s update will feature the updated Tabletop Simulator module as well as revised rules – just as mentioned in our last communication. We do hope that the changes we introduced will be to your liking – we are extremely excited about it! Please give a big shout out to Adam and to our dev team (Rafał, Grzesiek, Bartek and Paweł) thanks to whom Frostpunk: The Board Game is an even better game than before! The most essential changes were described in so if you missed it we highly recommend acquainting yourself with it (it’s not short but it is packed to the brim with important information!), oh and don’t forget to come back to this update once you’re done reading 😉.

updates.update_userinfo: Pledge Manager - new products & last call to fill out the survey! / Delay / Changes in the game
updates.update_content:
Hello Frostlanders!
We are grateful for your participation in filling the survey posted in our previous update. More than 3000 backers filled the survey. A bit over 2000 of you declared the demand for the hold-it-all box and a bit over a 1000 said they will be getting the wooden meeples depicting buildings. Due to the number of answers and your feedback we’ve just added both add-ons to the pledge manager and you can now add them to your baskets if you will. Both add-ons are also available for the late pledgers.

Hello Frostlanders!
DISCLAIMER: If you are not interested in the alternative wooden game components nor the big-hold-it all-box please ignore this update. Our regular update is coming and will be posted in the first half of April. The April update will feature a detailed development & production schedules and a lot “what’s new” information. If you are curious about the potential new addons please keep on reading :-) !

updates.update_userinfo: Snow is thawing, the Spring is coming!
updates.update_content:
Greetings and salutations dear Frostlanders!
We hope that wherever it is that you call home you too can feel the coming of the Spring. In Poland we had a rather oldschool Polish winter with snow and temperatures of – 10 Celsius at night so it caused some everyday life issues and a ton of fun for the kids 😊. Surrounded by frosty weather, covered in snow and unable to leave (pandemic restrictions) we kind of felt trapped, as if in some crater with walls frozen solid…

updates.update_userinfo: Hear me, hear me! Pledge Manager is Live! Pre-Order is Live!
updates.update_content:
Hello Frostlanders!
We’ve said our goodbyes to 2020, although for us it had one major positive memory - it saw the birth of Frostpunk: The Board Game and this year will be all about seeing it land safely on your tables and stay there for many months, if not years to come! We are doing everything we can to deliver a game you’ve dreamt of. Happy New Year!

Hello Frostlanders!
We decided to publish this, second after the campaign update, a bit sooner mainly because we wanted to pass our wishes to all of you beautiful souls! To those of you who partake in the Christmas tradition we wish the merriest possible time with your loved ones and to those of you who have other beliefs or simply don’t have any we hope that the upcoming year brings only the most welcome changes and improves every aspect of your lives. We hope that no matter where you are in World these last days of 2020 will allow you to catch a breath and gain the strength needed to face what 2021 has in store for us ;-). With a new hope we all look to 2021 to bring us challenges that we can easily overcome together without any bad outcomes, so let’s hope that the Event card to be drawn on the 1st of January will be a good and easy one ;-). To wrap it up we wish you all the strength and determination to turn the upcoming year into a series of success and joyful memories!

Hello Frostlanders!
We hope you missed us a bit, cause sure as heck we missed y’all!
Preparing and managing a Kickstarter campaign, let me tell you, It’s like being on a roller coaster. First the slow build-up, then it goes live, excitement and adrenaline courses through your veins, and before you know it, it’s over. All those pent up emotions have to find an outlet and be refocused elsewhere: towards fulfillment. And let me tell you, we haven’t wasted any of those short autumn days.

updates.update_userinfo: Live session - exclusive look at the Leaders & Citizens rules
updates.update_content:
Greetings citizens of New London!
Today (in three hours, at 21.00 CET, 16.00 ET) - we will have a small surprise for you: a live Tabletop Simulator session hosted by Paul Grogan from GAMING RULES! Paul is going to introduce you to the multiplayer rules, showing how the game works when using Leaders and Citizens cards. Hope that you will find it interesting!

Dear citizens, fellow survivors!
We’ve survived the storm and for the first time in weeks our eyes could see the sun! We thank you for your indomitable support in this time of trials, we thank you for your spirit and sacrifice! Your actions took into the annals of global crowdfunding and hopefully will inspire others for as long as we all live!

campaign.story:
IT’S TIME TO PRINCESS UP!
You’ve earned a sword! You’ve won a crown! Now you have a responsibility to help keep Awesome World awesome and safe. Are you PRINCESS enough?!
The Excellents is a game about being Excellent Princesses in an AWESOME cartoon world. Each cartoon adventure is created by the players and Game Mistress working together. The Excellents is great for a one session pickup game or for an entire campaign.
Powered by Polymorph The Excellents, features a unique ONE DIE PER PLAYER role playing system that is perfect for new players and veterans alike.
Haven't had a chance to pick up The Excellents yet? 
Don't worry! You can ADD-ON The Excellents RPG to any level!
Did we mention yet that The Excellents was nominated as PRODUCT OF THE YEAR and BEST FAMILY PRODUCT by the 2020 GenCon ENnie Awards...what an honor!
In this KICKSTARTER we are offering awesome PRINCESS accessories as well as our 3rd reprint of The Excellents! Check out all our offerings below: 
The Excellents Princess Diary 
Not only can you keep the princesses YOU CREATED in this diary, it also includes another Awesome World adventure and 6 more instantly playable princesses!! You'll get both the physical and digital versions of the diary!
A book of Princess Characters and Character Sheets for you to make and share your Princesses!
Princess Dice & Lesson Token Counter
We partnered with LEVEL UP DICE to make some amazingly cool PRINCESS DICE and the absolute cutest token counter we've ever seen! 
Each dice set includes one d4, d6, d8 and d10! These are the dice required by the Polymorph System which The Excellents uses. Both sets have unique Excellents iconography - a paw on the one (for your beast friend) and a crown on top number of your die.
We are offering:
 Oversized Translucent Resin Dice Set (25mm)  
Upgraded Aluminum Dice Set (16mm) 
Flower Shaped Lesson Token Counter (metal) 
Keep track of all the lessons you've learned during your game of The Excellents! Store this cute flower shaped counter with your dice for use in any game that requires you to keep track of things. The innovative Level Up counter has a magnetic closure which allows the pieces to move freely, without falling apart.  NOT FINAL COLORS.
The Excellents Roll20 Pack
The Excellents is coming to Roll20 and you can get the really awesome pack along with the compendium and character sheet to play with your friends online!   
Roll20 Pack includes PDF, play space, interactive character sheet, & all of the power of ROLL 20.
PLAY


 The Excellents Princess Pencil Case 
Shine brighter with this pink iridescent pouch that is 6x9 inches of pure princess! It's large enough to hold The Excellents RPG, The Excellents Diary, your dice, and some pencils!
The Excellents Hosted Online Game 
Did you know that 9th Level Games is hosting online RPG play weekly? We want you to experience the fun by joining in a game run by our professional GM's who are ready to show you an AWESOME TIME in AWESOME WORLD! 

 NOTE: The digital versions of the RPG & Diary come with the physical books. 
ADD-ON'S
We are utilizing Kickstarter's new Add-on feature! 
Haven't had a chance to pick up The Excellents yet? Add it on to ANY LEVEL!
Only want the physical diary and the Roll20 pack? No problem!
DID YOU BACK ONE OF OUR PREVIOUS KICKSTARTERS??  YOU CAN GET $5 BACKERKIT CREDIT IF YOU PLEDGE DURING OUR FIRST 24HRS!  Find out more here!
Check back here LATER for stretch goal announcements! 
ACTUAL PLAYS 
GENCON 2020 Actual Play game hosted by Sarah Moore 
“When  Sarah Moore told me about this game I realized it might be a lot of fun if she ran it for me and some other old dudes.  She agreed so I invited  Mike Pondsmith, Tim Kask,  Stefan Pokorny to join us and we had a great time letting our inner  princesses run loose.” Peter Adkison, Owner of GENCON

"Who wouldn't want to be a pre-teen princess with a flying monkey and unicorn for friends? Play it with your kids or grandkids, I predict you will all have a great time."  from Tim Kask, Creator of Mutant Crawl Classics

VICTORY CONDITION GAMING Actual Play hosted by designer, Adriel Wilson  
GIRLS' GAME SHELF REVIEW
Vote of Approval from AnnaMaria Jackson-Phelps of Girls Game Shelf

SPRITES + DICE REVIEW  
We will be able to ship rewards around the world! 
 USA BACKERS: Shipping costs will be collected via KICKSTARTER.
 NON-USA BACKERS: Shipping costs will be collected AFTER the campaign via our pledge manager BACKERKIT. (NOTE: The below prices are estimates)
***IMPORTANT: You must fill out the BackerKit  survey with your shipping address and pay the corresponding shipping  fee in order to receive your reward***
This will help us ensure non-US backers are charged the actual shipping cost for their pledge. We are partnered with a customs-friendly fulfillment service which means you should not be charged any customs, import, VAT or other fees after paying your shipping costs for this Kickstarter. If you are charged any other fees, please contact us and we will provide you a refund less then 10% Kickstarter fees.  See the RISKS & CHALLENGES section for more details and excluded countries.
The Excellents was designed by Adriel Wilson and Chris O'Neill of 9th Level Games! They did the writing, game design, layout, and everything! All of the art is by the A-M-A-Z-I-N-G Tina Bongorno. We are a group of she, he, and they focused on bringing diverse ideas to your game table. EVERYONE CAN BE A PRINCESS!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
PROVEN TRACK RECORD 

This is 9th Level Games’ 11th Kickstarter campaign, so we’ve been down this road before! 

We have funded and delivered the following projects: 
Mazes - seasonal zines (2020)
Pavlov's Dogs (2020)
Kobolds 20th Anniversary Zine (2019)
Mazes fantasy RPG zine (2019)
Meeple Party (2018)
Tragedies of Middle School (2017)
Bearicades (2017)
HOT16 (2017)
Knuckle Sammich (2016)
Schrodinger's Cats (2015)
Kobolds Ate My Baby! (2013)


MINIMAL PRODUCTION RISKS 
As with any Kickstarter, and especially one that’s the work of many hands, there’s always a chance that our dates could slip. If this happens we will be up front and communicative. 

For the diary and The Excellents RPG we are working with a printer we have worked with many times before. We have a high confidence level that they will be able to meet their quoted delivery time.

The accessories are coming from a variety of vendors. Dice is coming from Level Up Dice who is our partner on this Kickstarter. They are committed to providing high quality products and great customer service. The pencil case and nail decals are coming from local vendors with proven track records of delivering in a timely fashion.


SHIPPING 

Shipping cost is a concern for most backers, especially those outside of the US. Our fulfillment partner is helping us to be able to offer a CUSTOMS FRIENDLY SHIPPING which means your shipping cost is inclusive of duties and taxes (including VAT) for Canada, UK/EU, Australia, and most of Asia. If for some reason you are charged any additional duties or taxes by your country please contact us and we will REFUND you. If you have any specific shipping questions please email us at contact@9thlevel.com 

We will be shipping throughout the US, Canada, UK, EU, and most of the world. Shipping rates are based on 2021 rates as we won't be shipping until next year. 

NOTE: We are not able to ship to the following countries due to high postage prices and lost parcels; Brazil and South America, South Africa, Somalia, North Korea, Russia, the Middle East. If you live in one of these areas, we recommend that you use a USA address and have the game forwarded to you via a relative/friend or postage forwarding company. If you need help please contact us for assistance. 

If you have any specific shipping questions please send us a message here. You can also reach us directly at contact@9thlevel.com 


OUR COMMITMENT TO THIS PROJECT, OUR CREATIVES, AND OUR BACKERS 

9th Level Games is committed to doing this right! Our goal is not just to make games, it is to make the best games we can make! We want to make sustainable business decisions, pay our creatives for their work, support diverse communities, and make rad fun things together! 

As a backer, you are part of this journey. You will be kept up to date on our progress with regular updates (but not spammed with pointless updates), and you should feel free to drop us a line with questions or concerns at any time.

Thank you for your support!

campaign.story:
Cracking the Cryptic is partnering with Blue Beard Entertainment to bring you a collection of puzzles by the world’s best sudoku creators!
Cracking the Cryptic’s Greatest Hits is a collection of hand-crafted sudoku puzzles from some of the world’s most talented setters, as featured on the Cracking the Cryptic YouTube channel:
The book will also contain three of our famous themed puzzle hunts! Every page of Cracking the Cryptic's Greatest Hits will include fun facts and full-colour graphic design. We have unlocked ALL our stretch goals, adding new content and never-before-seen puzzles!
UNLOCKED! At $30,000 we included a second puzzle hunt in the book! Puzzle hunts are connected series of puzzles, which stretch your logical ability and force you to think outside the box.
UNLOCKED! At $40,000 we added brand-new puzzles, made by some of the world's greatest setters. These puzzles will not be available online, and will be uniquely available within the book!
UNLOCKED! When we reached $50,000 in funding, we resolved to create a whole new puzzle hunt, exclusive to the book!
UNLOCKED! At $60,000 we added a preface to the book, with more information about Mark, Simon, how they met, and the origins of the Cracking the Cryptic YouTube channel!
UNLOCKED! At $70,000, we posted a poll allowing our Kickstarter backers to vote for which puzzles covered by the channel should be included in the final book!
UNLOCKED! At $80,000, we created a website allowing owners of the book to solve the new puzzles using the Cracking the Cryptic web app.
UNLOCKED! At $90,000, we decided list every backer (who wants to be included) in the back of the book! That's right - if you back the Kickstarter (at any level), you'll be personally thanked in the book.
UNLOCKED! At $100,000, Mark and Simon agreed to record a solve video for every new puzzle in the book. There'll be no chance of getting stuck on the 25 brand-new puzzles, with a CTC video for each and every one of them.
UNLOCKED! At $110,000, we added illustrations to the book! Each sudoku will be given a matching illustration by the supremely talented Tina Bongorno.
UNLOCKED! At $120,000, we added a small section at the end of the book showing all the number combinations for killer cages and sandwich totals, to assist you with those tricky solves!
UNLOCKED! When we reached $130,000, we DOUBLED the number of community-selected puzzles that go in the book, adding all the top twenty puzzles voted for.
UNLOCKED! At $140,000, we included a Cracking the Cryptic sticker with each book ordered, as well as an exclusive bookmark which will only be available during the campaign!
UNLOCKED! At $150,000, every CTC solve video for the new puzzles in the book became a blind solve, just like the videos that go up on the youtube channel! Discover the beautiful logic in the 27 new puzzles at the same time as Mark and Simon do!
UNLOCKED! Now that we've hit $160,000, everyone who pledges for a copy of the book will also receive a PDF copy!
The book will contain puzzles from these amazing setters:
Aad van de Wetering
Ahaupt
Alexander Rappa
Alice
Arvid Baars
Bastien Vial-Jaime
Ben Needham
Christoph Seeliger
Kurt Hugo Schneider
Laura Soler
Matus Demiger
Matyas Martinkas
Mitchell Lee
Peter C. Hayward

Phistomefel
Prasanna Seshadri
ProwlingTiger
Ri Sa
Richard Stolk
Ricky Cruz
Rishi Puri
RockyRoer
Sam Cappleman-Lynes
Shye
Undar Beyond
Willy Wonka
and more! 
With over 42 million views on YouTube, Cracking the Cryptic is the world’s largest sudoku community. Hosted by Mark Goodliffe (12 times winner of The Times Crossword Championship) and Simon Anthony (former record holder for consecutive Listener Crossword solves), daily videos show the tips and tricks needed for solving sudokus and other kinds of puzzles for all experience levels.
We've brought the joy of hand-crafted sudoku to millions of people around the globe, and now we want to take some of the best puzzles we've featured on the channel and turn them into a gorgeous book.
In order to make this book a reality, we need your help! Support the project to help us bring this book to life, and be one of the first to get a copy of the best sudoku book ever made.

campaign.story:
Lost Ones is a stunningly illustrated, fully cooperative game where 1-4 players take on the role of a young person who finds themselves in a nightmare, inexplicably taken to the Fae world, and are trying to find a way home. 
Click on the image to learn more about Lost Ones!
Playing a character, you must use your mental and emotional resolve (in the form of action cards) to solve riddles, defeat foes, acquire boons, and explore the map. As you travel, place new map tiles that unravel the mystery of this land, by reading the matching page in the Story Book. This narrative will give you choices of how you may interact with the magical creatures you encounter. Every choice may be a piece of the puzzle to find a way out, or it may be a trap to keep you in the Otherworld forever. You must consider your choices carefully, and spend your resolve wisely, or forever be a Lost One.
This hauntingly beautiful game, designed by Gordon Alford, also has character miniatures, and a Kickstarter Exclusive Metal Compass Rose token available.
The Core game, which will retail for $39.95, comes with 128 map tiles, 40 Ability cards, 20 Bane cards, 32 Boon cards, 12 Foe cards, 4 Hero cards and standees, 1 Moon Card, Moon token, Lock/Unlock tokens, Story tokens, Story Ending tokens, The Adventure Guide, the Story Book, and more!
New Character Kaya will come as a standee and with her character card in the base game, and a miniature in the minis box.
Character Minis do not come painted.


 Dominika
Fenrir
 Maeve
 Will

The Lost Ones Expansion will come with at least 9 tiles, one new Boon card, additional story content, and more!
This gorgeously illustrated book, showing the world of Lost Ones and Of Dreams and Shadows, will have over 80 pages of illustrations, and is a WIP
We couldn't leave it this close... the final stretch goal is unlocked!
We have so many exciting previews, reviews, and interviews scheduled for you! Here's a look at who will be looking at Lost Ones throughout this campaign!
"I really enjoyed my time with this one, and off camera I'm going to continue to try to figure out what is going on in this Otherworld." 
- Adam Smith, Rolling Solo
"I found it really cool there were a multitude of paths out."
- Robert Geistlinger, FOMO, Dice Tower

"I am going to say that you are going to want to discover what this game has to offer."
-Jeremy Howard, MvM
PLAY

"If you enjoy a really good adventure game with stunning artwork then Lost Ones is the game for you and you should definitely check it out!" 
- Sarah Shah, Board Games In A Minute

"The sense of wonder around every corner and questioning your trust in everyone you encounter is the best part. You’ll find yourselves exploring your own creativity as much as you explore the lands of Lost Ones."
- Kitty, Long Distance Gamers
"Lost Ones will light your imagination on fire. Find your way out. Trust no one… or everyone. Take chances... or play it safe. Embrace the magic. Get Lost!"
- Brooks, Long Distance Gamers
"Lost Ones provides a beautifully written tale to weave together with your friends. Embody your characters and make thoughtful decisions, working together to create a fully engrossing experience."
- Lizzy, Long Distance Gamers
"Sometimes you will make a wrong decision that will lead you down a path that will cause you to loose. That is part of the fun in exploring this game, and replaying it and finding new paths to discover more and more about the story."
-Monique Macasaet, Before You Play


Click on the rule book image to read the rules of the game.
Click on the image to subscribe to our Tabletop Simulator version of Lost Ones.

If you are a retailer or distributor and are interested in securing copies of The Lost Ones, please read the information here about how to place an order.   


  If you'd like to add more content to your pledge level, you may add funds by clicking "manage my pledge" (available after you've selected a level). A post campaign pledge manager will be open for a brief window after the Kickstarter ends, where you will be able your add-ons pledges. You will also have an opportunity to add more funds during the pledge manager, if you decide you want to upgrade last minute. You are free to mix and match any combination of add-ons you'd like, adding the sum total to your pledge. These changes will alter shipping estimates.
NOTE: The Kickstarter exclusive content will be available only at higher price point levels in the pledge manager as add-ons. After the Kickstarter, the remaining content will be sold through our webstore, and at conventions only. Retail items will differ from these Kickstarter Bonus items. The only way for retailers to acquire any of these items will be through this Kickstarter.


Some of our license partners will eventually publish our games in their own language. We will try to keep you informed through Kickstarter updates and on our website when this occurs.
If you are a publisher interested in licensing any games in this campaign or in the Greenbrier Games catalog for a non-English language, please contact julie@greenbriergames.com.

With 17 successful Kickstarters under our belt, we have learned a lot about what it takes to get our games into your hands. One of the biggest things is how variable the cost of shipping can be. As such, we will be charging shipping after this Kickstarter concludes, according to the actual costs incurred to ship to your area. We will do this through the pledge manager system once this Kickstarter has concluded.
There are two reasons we do this. First, it allows us to provide a lower rate on the actual pledge levels and structure a much tighter budget for the campaign and stretch goals since we do not have to estimate shipping costs. Second, the funds raised for the project are 100% for the actual project itself rather than being partially inflated by shipping costs that may not be accurate. Though the pricing will vary due to any add-ons you pledge for by the end of the campaign, these are our closest estimates for shipping, based on region  region this year.
If you live in the regions where we offer “friendly shipping”, you will not have to worry about paying additional taxes or duties. These numbers are based on regional averages, and are subject to change. Unfortunately, import laws and customs have made it impossible for us to ship to Russia, Ukraine, Kazakhstan and Afghanistan.
Timeline for Fulfillment - What to expect
Once mass production is complete, shipping from the manufacturer to the fulfillment centers in the US and Europe takes about 8 weeks, followed by 3 weeks of set up time before shipping to all backers in the US and Europe begins. From manufacturer to our Chinese based fulfillment center, it takes about 4 week followed by 4 weeks of setup time before shipping to all backers begins. Note, these times are only estimates based on information from the fulfillment centers.
We are pleased to work with these companies to bring this project to life.

updates.update_userinfo: Update - Mostly about the card and standee tray and mini bases
updates.update_content:
Hi Friends!
We're just giving you all the updates!
Insert design
We sent our design in and the engineers sent back some tweaks, likely concerned with the structural integrity knowing the plastic they will be using. We’ve looked it over, and are asking for a sample because we have a few questions we need answered before giving a green light. First we’re looking to see if the cards will fit sleeved. This is not something everyone will want to do, but it is better to plan in case you do. Then, we thought the dimensions for the area holding tokens was too big, and we don’t want the tokens to slide around. Finally, the depth for holding the story book was less, and we need to ensure the story book will fit. This brought up an additional question because the binding was not spiral bound as we had asked for. We are looking to see which binding will be better since this book will get used frequently (we hope).

updates.update_userinfo: Where we are in the process
updates.update_content:
Hello Everyone!
Finalizing Manufacturing
The past few weeks have been a lot of going back and forth on miniature scaling. We want the bases to be 25 mm so that the four characters are able to fit on the map tiles (2.5 in. squared), while keeping  the scale of the characters smaller than the Nightmare. This was an ongoing conversation that is sometimes a challenge. We are relaying the details to our contact person at Long Pack, who relays the information to the miniatures factory. Sometimes this game of “telephone” along with translation challenges can mean incorrect information. We want to be sure everything is correct, and to that end, both teams have worked carefully to make sure the end result is correct. The prototypes are being shipped next week so that we can verify all the adjustments.

Art Book

Arkham Archives: the Limestone Abyss is an immersive story, the first of a series, taking place in the world of the Lovecraftian horror. Its interactive storyline is based on an innovative playing system, in which you, the player, will take all the decisions, but the Fate will help or hinder you in an unpredictable way. 
Each Arkham Archives chapter is unique, since it comes with finely designed, Made in Italy collector's items. "The Limestone Abyss", for example, features a custom poker card deck, illustrated with amazing Lovecraftian artworks by the Italian artist Francesco Crisci. The traces left by Cthulhu, Dagon, Azathoth and the other cosmic horrors wait for you in the clues you will find in the Archives.  
It was 1932 when the first file marked with a "top secret" label was deposited in the Arkham Archives. During the years, the police had to face so many unspeakable events that even the harshest of the officers had to pay a visit to the Arkham Sanitarium. Now, the Archives are abandoned, just like the city itself, and the memory of these events is now sleeping under a blanket of dust and mold stench.
It seems, however, that one single person is able to link all these nightmares with a subtle red thread. While her or his name is still unknown, we soon find out she or he can possess the people who were touched by the cosmic horror. 
In the first chapter, "The Limestone Abyss", you will be thrown into the mind of Jack, an experienced archaeologist, who finds himself involved in a horror as old as the Earth itself. As soon as you start to understand that you have a full control on Jack's thoughts and actions, you also realize that you will have to face the monsters lurking in the depths of the Abyss... alone.  
The stars of the first chapter of "Arkham Archives" are our gamebook and the poker cards deck.
The gamebook "The Limestone Abyss" is nearly 200 pages long and it offers a wide, immersive storyline in an environment you will be able to explore completely. Your actions will determine the course of the adventure; if you are smart and wise enough, you'll make it until the final showdown; otherwise, the horrors along the way will kill you... or worse.
The storyline is written by Samuele Zanotti and the artwork in it has been realized by Davide Molino, two of the project founders.  
The gamebook and the cards are meant to be together. The game system featured in "Arkham Archives", in fact, uses a poker cards deck to determine elements like events, fatigue, outcomes and, of course, your madness level. The cards feature original artworks representing the entities that obliterated Arkham and its people at the end of XIX century: you will find Azathoth, Nyarlathotep, Dagon and, of course, Cthulhu. 
The two objects are accompanied by side elements in some bids: for example, the Ouija cardboard is used to place the cards, and the hard paper tokens can remind you the items you have got with you. 
We though of some prizes that we really want to share with you, in addition to what we already put inside the different bid tiers. Fingers crossed and let's hope to match them all:  
And we also added a bunch of fantastic rewards if you help us grow our community on the most popular social networks. The two social goals are alternatives: we will consider the goal unlocked if we get at least one of the two numbers described.


 Each of the 4 chapters in the Arkham Archives storyline will be narrated in a gamebook, both a paper tome and a digital ebook. Most importantly, each chapter features a different Made in Italy, exclusive object.
All of them will be launched here on Kickstarter, so be sure not to miss them! 
"The Limestone Abyss" is the first adventure of a long series, so expect hours and hours of fun and thrill while you explore the world of H. P. Lovecraft from a completely new perspective. The story is structured as a one-shot though, so you'll experience a complete and satisfying adventure even if you won't there to order the next chapters.
There is much more to be seen in the next releases, and brand new Made in Italy, finely designed objects wait for you with the following chapters.
We also have a special gift for you. You will soon be able to play a gamebook demo that will let you explore the world of the Arkham Archives whenever you want!
In the meantime, you can play an interactive prequel at the link below: it will drag you into the terrifying atmosphere of the '50 Arkham, right when the Cosmic Entities started appearing again in the life of human beings.
You will find the interactive story here.
If you speak Italian, there is a translated demo already here.
Stay tuned, follow us on our social networks and be among the first backers! And remember: a fantastic early bid awaits you if you'll be here on day 1!

campaign.story:
Missed the Kickstarter?
Explore the magic at fairytalefiles.com
The Fairy Tale Files are lighthearted murder mystery detective games inspired by iconic fairy tales. We bring  you the delight of your favorite childhood stories with an adult twist! Join the Magical Mishaps Agency to solve the clues and find the killer!
The Fairy Tale Files are immersive escape room style experiences in which you interact with physical game components and also chat with characters, suspects, and witnesses in real-time to solve the case!
As an investigator at the Magical Mishap Agency, you are called upon to shine light on crimes and other strange events troubling this faraway land.
The Experience:  you receive a case packet in the mail - review the crime files, dispatch your team to the crime scene to uncover evidence, break locks, solve puzzles, and send the culprits to rot in the Fairy Land dungeons!
As the case takes shape, you'll get immersed in the rich and surprising stories that unfold!
In each game, you receive a file that covers the known facts of the case.  Included are:
- At least ten physical paper documents to inspect along the course of the case. 
- Puzzles to unlock and mysteries to solve
- A web-based messaging portal to talk to your Magical Mishaps Agency team in real-time
- Re-packing instructions so you can give the game to a friend or re-sell it
- Magic Mirror hint system
An sample from The Cinderella Murders game.
The Messaging Portal: An integral part of the game is interacting with your Magical Mishap team on the ground in Fairy Land.   These interactions with the characters are powered by the industry-leading AI messaging system developed for the Society of Curiosities games.
PLAY

It's easy: there are no rules! Just open up the game and play!
In each game, you will have a file from the Magical Mishaps Agency with the evidence that has been gathered so far. 
Review the evidence to find the culprit or eliminate suspects. 
Use the agency messaging portal to send your team to the crime scene, converse with your team and suspects, and learn more about the case.
You will need an internet-connected mobile phone or computer to direct your crime scene team and interrogate the suspects and witness.
Consult our Magic Mirror for hints as often as you want. We leave you little breadcrumbs of hints.  There are a lot!  This way, if you've lost your path, you can get back on track to solving the mystery.  
We expect to sell the game for $25 each after the Kickstarter launch, so you get up to a 25% discount by backing the project with Kickstarter!
Stretch Goals
We are happy to announce 3 stretch goals for the Fairy Tale Files:
REACHED! - $15,000 - Printable certificate for gift-giving
We know some of you want to give this as a gift and the first game will be released after the holidays, so we want to give you something great to present.
REACHED! $20,000 - Audio introduction to each case

SO CLOSE THAT WE THREW IT IN!!! - $35,000 - Fairy Tale Files Soundtrack
We will create a soundtrack for the Fairy Tales files that will fill you with whimsical delight and set the stage for a magical evening of exploration.

The award-winning team
We're Michelle and Yacine and we are the creative minds behind Society Of Curiosities and Kauai Escape Room. We've been creating escape games and mystery games since 2015.
Kauai Escape Room was ranked a Top 100 escape room in the world in 2019!
Society Of Curiosities launched in 2020 and has already published 5 adventures to great acclaim in the mystery game industry!
How we got started
We got into the game and puzzle industry the old-fashioned way: by accident!
We played an escape room in 2015 in Montreal and loved it. So we played a few more. Soon, we were designing puzzles and building full-scale escape rooms for our friends in our home and 30-foot airstream trailer.
Eventually, Michelle made the suggestion to go commercial and open a physical escape room business. Yacine didn't think it was such a great idea but agreed to set up a fake website with fake escape games "to prove her wrong".
Of course, she was right.
Within a few days, people were finding the fake website and trying to book our fake escape games! Fast-forward a few months and Kauai Escape Room opened its doors.
Over the last 5 years we have designed and built 10 escape games and also created and launched 5 play-at-home mystery games.
Yacine Merzouk
Yacine has been a tabletop and strategy game enthusiast and designer since high school.
This hobby culminated into a few years running an award-winning D&D blog, the publication of 2 RPG books, and a stint freelancing for Wizards of the Coast.
From there, it was a natural jump to take these storytelling skills to the escape room and mystery game worlds.
He enjoys long walks on the beach with his dog and generally has a tendency to adopt too many pets from the Humane Society.
Michelle Rundbaken
Michelle is a master storyteller and the driver of the artistic vision for our games — always polishing minute details of the stories and adventures she designs for her audience.
She channels her background in psychology, education, and film to craft delightful experiences and puzzles that are challenging but never overstay their welcome.
Five years of escape room design taught her there's always room for a sprinkling of magic and delight.
Her ideal day consists of reading in bed with a steaming cup of tea. Cuddling a cat is a bonus.

campaign.story:
A New Chapter in Cthulhu Mythos Horror
GOD CANCER starts with At the Mountains of Madness, meshes it with The Narrative of Arthur Gordon Pym (the origin of the dread phrase "Tekeli li!"), and brings it into the twenty-first century with a heavy dose of harrowing medical drama.
The twin narratives of GOD CANCER concern two doctors, Miles Trewick and Gail Pym. Miles is a renowned oncologist, hired to heal a sick billionaire in secret. (Why in secret? Because they don't want to panic the investors.) Gail is an archaeologist, leading an expedition to the deadliest depths of Antarctica in search of evidence that everything commonly accepted about prehistory is a lie.
Gail and Miles never meet, but both push science far beyond its limits, into deadly realms of cosmic horror. Both uncover truths new to science, but ancient when humanity was in its infancy.
A New Novel from Greg Stolze
If you've read Mask of the Other, or You: A Fiction, or Switchflipped or The Forgotten Monk, you should have some idea what kind of stories I'm capable of telling. You can expect this to have relatable but desperate characters making understandable but bad decisions. You can expect people to suffer, and to overcome it. You can expect the strange, the ugly, the bizarre, and perhaps the small moments of grace that can arise when misery is transcended.
Or you can just go read from my free online fiction library, that should let you know if it's to your taste or not. The stories most similar to GOD CANCER are probably  How to Make A Book Safe, Specimens, and The Grey People.
The tangible version of GOD CANCER is a softback print-on-demand book, produced via DriveThruFiction. It's about 260 pages, not counting the afterword. 
The Tangible Rewards
As you can see from the examples in the photo, the linocut prints are done, there are three different designs, and I've done a lot of experimentation with color, paper and other aspects of production. They're all 6x9 inches or a little smaller, handmade, and I've done 107 of them. If you pledge at the linocut level, you get one picked pretty much at random. (The ones that, for whatever reason, I deem "not so great" will get sent out last.) I believe there are slightly more of the skulls. 
There aren't many patches left, so if you want one, don't delay. They're four inches in diameter.
UPDATE: A Preview Reader Weighs In!
Spoilers: He says nice stuff about the book.
-G.

updates.update_userinfo: Some Good News? In THIS Economy?
updates.update_content:
I don't know about you, but 2021 has not been the best of all years for me. I like it more than 2020, but... that's a bar so low it's actually digging into the ground, right? In the spirit of "be the good news you want to see in the world," though, I'm trying to make something positive happen. You can read all about it here, on the website where I keep all the free fiction people have funded. 
It's nothing revolutionary, but it is an opportunity for me to get fiction out there, which means it's an opportunity for you all to read it. I hope to see you involved. Thanks!

updates.update_userinfo: Hey! Here's something cheaper, simpler, and less deliberately unpleasant!
updates.update_content: As backers of GOD CANCER you've all shown your tolerance for my bleak and nihilistic cosmic horror, but just in case some of you really dug the linocut print aspect of the project, I have a KS going now that's all that.

updates.update_userinfo: And Now, For Something The Same, But Different
updates.update_content:
GOD CANCER was a novel, about how humankind might fit into a bleak and uncaring universe, with a lot of thought given to what "the truly alien" might feel like.
DIFFERENT TROUBLE is a game supplement, about how humankind might fit into a weird and confusing universe, with a lot of thought given to what "the truly alien" might act like.

updates.update_userinfo: Hey Greg, Did That Printer Issue Ever Get Fixed?
updates.update_content: PLAY

Print Copy Issue
The last update was about print copies being delayed and rejected. The good news is, it looks like all the hard copies I requested before the formatting issue arose did get processed and are being sent, so the only a small number of backers are affected by the delay. The problem has been isolated at the printer and is being corrected over the next few days. After that, we'll need another proof copy, which inevitably has some turnaround time, but you have to do it -- or else risk sending out a differently damaged book, which just means more delays multiplying. It's still well on track to March delivery.

updates.update_userinfo: Problems With The Printer, Still Hoping To Fulfill By March
updates.update_content:
Some of you have attempted to use your fulfillment codes, only to be told that Lightning Source doesn't like my file and won't print the book. I just got an email this morning to that effect. As you can imagine, I wasn't happy.
However, DriveThru did get back to me quickly, despite the Thanksgiving holiday (and the global pandemic), so they're apprised of the situation and trying to figure out why it won't print now when, before, it printed out just fine.

updates.update_userinfo: My Freelance Income Grew Three Sizes Today
updates.update_content:
By which I mean, the funds have cleared and fulfillment begins tomorrow. If you haven't filled out your rewards survey, there will never be a better time to do it than right now! The plan is, scrape out all the email addresses for PDF fulfillment and send them ASAP, then dive in on the physical stuff. So, watch for that soon!

-G.

updates.update_userinfo: We made it? WE MADE IT!
updates.update_content:
The day before Election Day 2020 seems like a weird time to be happy and excited about a horror novel succeeding against the odds, but here I am. Hopefully, you're all as stoked and pleased as I am. It's humbling to see the support and excitement y'all have thrown at my project, and I can only hope to live up to your expectations as much as I aspire to exceed them.
So! The next step is surveys. The sooner you get your survey in, the sooner I can start fulfillment. I have to put that off until the money clears, but once that's secured, I'll be sending out the ebooks as quickly as I can.

My hope is that this spooky season whets an appetite for the weird, the fearsome, and the uncanny. Unfortunately, as with every fourth Halloween, a season of beloved terror is overshadowed by the election, and the pleasurable chills of ghosts and monsters is displaced by the very real fear of "What if my candidate fails?"
I can't help you with that.

Random Fun Generator, written by Sam Mitschke and Randy Scheunemann and illustrated by Len Peralta, includes over 20 new dice games, all of which can be played with standard six-sided dice.

If you're on the hunt for more dice to add to your collection, we are making many of our custom dice sets available as add-ons (including some sets that have not yet been released) – see below.

Some of the games included in Random Fun Generator include:
 Great Rolled Ones – You and the other players are all cultists, attempting to summon Cthulhu and bring about the end of the world. 
 Leftovers – You and the other player are competing for points each round, but the player with the lowest total for the round gets to keep the leftovers as a bonus. Outwit your opponent and finish with the highest score!
 Participation Award – You and the other players must work together to defeat monsters, but you’re all a bit lazy and really don’t feel like working too hard.
 Liquid Courage - You and the other players are Dwarves. After centuries of peace, Dragons now threaten your way of life. Tunnel into long-forgotten mines to find the tools to help you survive the onslaught. With Dwarven beer to bolster your courage, only the bravest Dwarves will be celebrated as legendary heroes!
 Unreliable Flying Object - You and the other players are members of a spaceship crew, trying to return home. Your ship is pretty battered from the last mission, and things are constantly breaking, risking the lives of everyone aboard. Can you work together to keep the ship flying, or will you die in space?
 Six-Sided Slayers - In this cooperative game, you and the other players take on classic adventurer roles and charge deep into the monster’s lair. Kill enough monsters, and become legendary heroes! Fail too often, however, and you become a cautionary tale . . .
These plus another 20 games fill the pages of Random Fun Generator. Whether you play one as a filler between larger games or plan an entire evening of dice madness, Random Fun Generator has something for players of all ages!

Our large drawstring dice bags are satin-lined and each is ready to carry more than 100 dice of varying shapes and sizes. 

Dice Games

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Steve Jackson Games is an established game publisher with a successful track record and we have enough Kickstarter experience to deal with issues should they arise. We have the book almost ready for print – we're working on the last round of proofing – and we will work with a printer who has done well for us in the past. To reduce the chance of delays, we are limiting physical rewards to U.S. only.

Now it's time for you to tell us whether or not to complete the project. As we've done in the past, we will stay in touch with our backers during and after the Kickstarter, all the way through fulfillment of the rewards.

updates.update_content: As of yesterday, Sam and Randy have twenty different dice games for Random Fun Generator 2, the sequel to this project! We do not yet have a date for when Random Fun Generator 2 will launch on Kickstarter, but everything is moving in the right direction. In addition to the games, we also took a look at early concepts for the new artwork for the book; Sam roughs out ideas which we will send to Len Peralta when we're ready to move to the art and layout stage of the project.

updates.update_userinfo: You Like Dice? We Have Dice!
updates.update_content:
A couple of news items for today:
Work on Random Fun Generator 2 has officially started! Earlier this week, I sat in on a video meeting with Sam and Randy to discuss some of the new possible games and to play one of them. No solid schedule at the moment, but we're seeing some progress on the design and testing side.
We have launched a new pre-order store at BackerKit for dice, dice bags, and game accessories. This is also the place to order another print copy of the first book if you need extras to give out as gifts. There are several items listed: Check out the pre-order store today!

Thanks to the Warehouse 23 team (as well as our friends at PSI), we can report that the last of the print and dice rewards have shipped. Please watch for your print rewards to arrive just as soon as possible. If you spot an issue in your package, please contact help@sjgames.com for support.
For those of you who have asked where to find more dice, please see this page at Warehouse 23 for a list of our available dice, dice games, and accessories. The page changes as items sell-through and new releases are added, so the page may not look the same a month from now as it does today.

Two important bits of news today:
Physical rewards are still shipping! The Warehouse 23 team is packing and shipping rewards as fast as they can manage. We're a small team, and that combined with the social distancing rules we follow in the warehouse means that we can only ship so many packages each day. We will post an update when the last of the physical rewards have been shipped. (To accelerate the process, some of the rewards will be shipped from our primary fulfillment warehouse in Georgia.)

Earlier today, we started charging credit cards and locking BackerKit surveys. The books are in the final stages of printing and everything is on track for the Warehouse 23 team to start shipping the physical rewards later this month. 
As for the PDF reward, that is still on schedule to go out in December. 
A Sequel?

The time has come!
Random Fun Generator is off to print, and now we need to collect the necessary information to ship rewards for the future fulfillment process. Please check your email for a direct link to your Random Fun Generator survey (retrieval link)
BackerKit will guide you through the survey process. You may provide your Warehouse23 email address to save your PDF copy of  Than take a peek into the add-on store, and finally, provide any necessary shipping information for your order.
