campaign.story:
Planet Apocalypse was designed by Sandy Petersen, one of the best-known designers in horror gaming. In the early eighties he wrote the Call of Cthulhu role-playing game for Chaosium. In the nineties, he was a key designer for the ground-breaking video games Doom, Doom 2, and Quake. And in 2015, he released Cthulhu Wars. Now he returns to the topic of apocalyptic horror with a game Shut Up and Sit Down described as "[having] cemented Sandy Petersen as the king of games where you roll dice and things die."
This Kickstarter offers two separate tabletop experiences:
The board game (core game reprint) with new expansions. 
A 325+ role-playing book for 5th edition D&D with TONS of content to bring the apocalypse to your fantasy world, plus new adventures, monsters and more.
NOTE about Pledge Levels:
If you are NEW to the board game, choose a RECRUIT pledge level, if you already own the core game, choose a VETERAN pledge level!
If you want both board game rewards AND the role-playing book, then get a board game pledge level, and simply "add-on" the book.

The main risk is the timeline. We have successfully kickstarted many previous projects. These Kickstarters collectively entailed sending more than 250,000 products to tens of thousands of backers.

All the art, sculpting, and design is done, and all that remains for us to do is some minor editing and proofreading, and to begin manufacturing in China.

PETERSEN GAMES KICKSTARTER TERMS & CONDITIONS

By confirming your order, you agree that this sale is final, and no refunds will be issued except at our absolute discretion. You further acknowledge that the final look, materials, and content of the order (and the project) are subject to change and may differ from what is presented on Kickstarter.

You agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our pledge manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities.

Typically, import fees are paid up front as part of your shipping costs (which is what “friendly shipping” means). These include the following countries and regions, The United States, Members of the European Union, China, Australia, and New Zealand. However, there are countries where regulations prevent advance payment by a third party, and you may be responsible to pay customs taxes directly.**

**These countries include but are not limited to the following: Albania, Belarus, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Burkina Faso, Canada, Faroe Islands, Iceland Indonesia, Israel, Japan, Korea, Kosovo, Kuwait, Macedonia, Malaysia, Malta, Mexico, Niger, Norway, Pakistan, Portugal, Qatar, Russia, Saudi Arabia, Serbia, Singapore, South Africa, Switzerland, Taiwan, Thailand, Turkey, Ukraine, the United Arab Emirates and the United Kingdom. Due to the variety of different ways that countries handle import fees, all customers are responsible for knowing what import fees they may be required to pay, and you order at your own risk, not ours.

We no longer ship directly to Central, and South American countries (including Brazil), If you live in one of those areas, we require that you have your product shipped to an address of someone you know outside of Central and South America who plans on traveling there to deliver it to you, or that can arrange to have it delivered to you themselves.

You are also responsible for providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods.

These policies may be modified or changed at any time. For the most up to date Terms & Conditions please refer to this page: https://petersengames.freshdesk.com/support/solutions/articles/48000952326-petersen-games-kickstarter-terms-conditions

PETERSEN GAMES KICKSTARTER AND LATE BACKER REFUND POLICY

As per the terms stated on Kickstarter, a full refund will be provided if the request is received within 14 days of the close of the campaign.

Otherwise such a refund will be at our exclusive discretion and will be net of handling costs, Kickstarter commissions, credit card processing fees and other expenses we incur while processing the refund (15%). This fee applies to both Kickstarters backers and Late backers. In the event that a refund is given through Paypal, any fees that Paypal charges for the transaction will also be deducted from the refund.

Refunds and/or cancellation requests will only be considered before we set the print run size for mass manufacturing with our factory in China, which takes place upon the posted payment deadline for the Pledge Manager. If the print run size has not been set and the pledge manager is still open, refunds can only be offered up to a year after a payment has been made. After a year, our credit card processor will no longer allow us to issue refunds. in most cases we cannot issue a refund if we are unable to process the refund back to your credit card. In such a case we will give you credit towards our web store or to the open campaign of your choice.

If you fail to check out and pay for your order, including shipping costs, before the posted payment deadline, you may be forfeiting your products. Unclaimed games will be released after the closing date to online and retail sales since we lose money on unclaimed games due to storage fees.

From the author of The Necronomicon Gamebook comes a new interactive storygame which enables you to experience—firsthand— the horrors as described by the master of the American short story, Edgar Allan Poe. Through a faithful adaptation of some of his most famous tales (The Black Cat, The Masque of The Red Death, King Pest, The Fall of The House of Usher, The Tell-Tale Heart, The Pit and The Pendulum…), you will be granted a carefully narrated, interactive, full-immersion experience, complete with winding paths and complex puzzles, that will bring you face to face with human fears and desires, down dark streets, along mysterious tunnels, and through haunted mansions, allowing you to explore the nightmarish border that divides the dream world from madness.
[ITA] Dall'autore di The Necronomicon Gamebook, una nuova avventura letteraria a bivi dove affronterai in prima persona gli orrori narrati dal maestro della letteratura americana Edgar Allan Poe. Alcuni dei suoi più celebri racconti (Il gatto nero, La maschera della morte rossa, Re Peste, La caduta della Casa Usher, Il cuore rivelatore, Il pozzo e il pendolo...) sono stati adattati con la massima fedeltà al testo originale in modo da permettere un'immersione interattiva in una narrazione fitta di percorsi ed enigmi da risolvere dove affronterai le profondità delle paure e dei desideri umani attraverso strade oscure, tunnel misteriosi e ville infestate, esplorando lo spaventoso limite che divide i sogni dalla follia. 
Available in two languages (English or Italian), The Horror Gamebook was adapted by professional writer and boardgame designer Valentino Sergi and by professional translator Oonagh Louise Stransky >>> At the end of the campaign you will be sent a survey to provide your address and select your preferred language.

FINAL STRETCHGOAL: HECKNA! COMIC
There are so many stories to tell about Heckna and the Revelia. This final stretch goal will allow us to team up with Gail Simone (Clean Room, Birds of Prey, Deadpool, Wonder Woman) to bring those stories to life!
Available as PDF only, included in all tiers. Slated release, 2021.
Welcome to The Revelia!
Heckna! is 5e adventure story designed to take characters through levels 1 to 10. This book is both a setting and a campaign guide with plenty of replayability. Game Masters and players alike will delight in this whimsical, dark carnival setting.
Heckna! Cover WIP (Art by Justin Chan @justinchans)
This is a book that combines dark fantasy and fun, campy escapades. It’s designed for players ages 14 and up. However, it’s very easy to adjust the tone and the atmosphere for your party. There’s plenty here that will satisfy horror fans, and just as much that will entice fans of humor and whimsy.
Welcome to the carnival, where we are always smiling…
*...actually I'm sure we're responsible! (Art by Julia Metzger @JuliaMetzgerArt)
The sounds of revelry drift through the dark, cold forest, drawing wayward travelers to a place where the senses are delightfully and bewilderingly overwhelmed. Peering out from the top of the conifers is the blood-red spire of The Revelia, where wonder and fun awaits!
But underneath the sparkling lights and gleaming facade is a sinister underbelly of chaos and terror. The magical Revelia is the work of Heckna, a creative mastermind masquerading as a jovial ringleader. Some, however, are aware of Heckna’s ruse, including a hunter who will stop at nothing to dispatch Heckna — and destroy The Revelia — once and for all.
Travelers may believe that they find The Revelia by chance, but in fact, Heckna goes to great lengths to lure only the best and brightest to his carnival in his search for greater, more spectacular challenges. Many have tried — and failed — to escape from this carnival, but with the right brains, brawn, and alliances, even Heckna can be outmaneuvered.
Run away with us! (Art by Corey Brickley @CoreyBrickley)
Will characters see through the glitzy and glamorous charade, or fall prey to Heckna’s relentless torment and become a permanent member of The Revelia?
The Revelia
Out of the frying pan and into The Revelia! (Art by Julia Metzger @JuliaMetzgerArt)
A Heckna! campaign takes inspiration from classic court jesters, Victorian-era circuses and sideshows, and campy flicks from the 1980s. Heckna’s realm, called The Revelia, drifts in and out of different planes, and Heckna likes to collect “souvenirs” from every place he visits. While the campaign fits into any fantasy setting, you're sure to find other unique aspects of The Revelia that have been drawn from other planes, such as weird science, classic arcade games, and robotic automatons.
Rubes and Revellers
I don't think we're in Ravenloft anymore... (Art by Justin Chan @justinchans)
Humanoids trapped at The Revelia are known as rubes, and are the most common creatures there. However, but that identifier is generous, as many rubes eventually become clowns or monstrous hybrids in Heckna’s hands. Rubes are doomed to live out their days at The Revelia, unless they find a way to escape.
Revelers, on the other hand, are a part of The Revelia by choice. Whether they ran away and joined the carnival, or adopted Heckna as their patron, they revel in the outrageous, unlimited lifestyle that the ringleader and his Revelia offer, and help lull unsuspecting rubes into a false sense of security.
The Monsters
Many a fiend and sinister foe lurk within The Revelia; it's up to you to discover what is a joke and what is out to eat you. Here are some of the monsters you can expect to find!
Shnozlings & Clown Thralls
Got your nose! (Art by Jason Engle @J_A_E1)
Shnozlings are tiny blood-red aberrations that are a rube’s worst nightmare. Released by Snout, these round red parasites latch onto unsuspecting humanoids and infect them with a nasty corruption that eventually turns them into clown thralls. A shnozling is soft and sponge-like to the touch, although its grip on a nose is quite painful. To an average carnival attendee, the shnozlings may look rather silly, but those at The Revelia know the a round red nose smells like certain doom.
 Children of the Candy Corn
CAAAANNNNDDDYYYY!!! (Art by Camille Alquier @camillealquierillustration)

Children of the Candy Corn are childlike aberrations that often roam in packs of two or three. They favor the Food Court, lurking near supplies of sugar or sweets, and are obsessed with candy. Always on a sugar high, these hyper tykes zoom around The Revelia being loud and mischievous. However, if confronted, these creatures become less childlike and much more frightening, removing their masks to reveal their monstrous form underneath. When angered, there is very little about their appearance that resembles a child.

Bosses
Mwahaha! You thought that Heckna was the only baddie?! Heck na! (had to). At The Revelia there are multiple big bad encounters that you'll come across. Take Sophie here...
Will you be her next pet... project? (Art by Daarken @DaarkenArt)
Sophie, Chandler of Flesh
Sophie’s love for science and experimentation began at an early age. She quickly became obsessed with dissection and reassembling corpses to form new creatures that she could control and make her own. Initially, Sophie started with wax, which had similar properties to flesh but was easier to source without arousing suspicion. She used the wax to prototype her ideas, and then hunted down the best creatures to dissect and bring her ideas to life—or at least undeath. Years later, she still follows this process, combining wax with flesh to animate gruesome “creations” that she can control.
Wax is eternal. (Art by Jason Engle @J_A_E1)
For this reason, Heckna recruited Sophie to serve at The Revelia. With free rein to experiment to her heart’s desire, she's become the creator of many creatures that your party can encounter, and is well-regarded and respected by the revelers. Though, this respect stems mostly from fear. Those who undergo her experiments often don’t live through them, or their memories are wiped and they no longer remember their former selves.


A Heckna Lives! campaign can be assembled manually or randomly using the Shuffled Stories Engine. Following the book in the order written forms a full campaign, or you can use the included deck of cards and the Shuffled Stories Engine to form a storyline.
 Introducing the Shuffled Stories Engine! 
Want help setting up a story for your party? Introducing the Shuffled Stories Engine.
The Shuffled Stories Engine helps GM's of all experience levels build out a full-blown Heckna! campaign using a standard deck of playing cards. The cards are split up into smaller 'area' decks based on their values, representing the three main areas of Heckna's world. Each card is tied to an encounter, and cards are drawn from each area deck and arranged into the campaign frame of your terrifying tale! Low on time? The SSE can help you build a one-shot just as easily. Want to bring the feeling of a rollercoaster to your game? In the McNally's Mischief variant, the players and GM play a variation of poker at the start of each session to determine what encounter comes next—pure chaos! 
So many stories to discover at The Revelia!

campaign.story:
THE CONCEPT
The Cluebox is an interactive, manually assembled wooden box with various puzzles, which have to be solved one after the other to open the box. Very much like an Escape Room in a handy format! The solution to each and every puzzle is based not on randomness, but only on logical decisions.
The Cluebox is an intriguing challenge. It's difficult to solve, satisfying to hold, and beautiful to display.
The facts about the game:
Special edition in multi-color available only for Kickstarter campaign
Size: 11*11*12 cm
Age: 14+
Players: 1-2
Play time: 60-90 minutes
Can be reset and solved again by other players
Can also be used as a sophisticated gift wrap (size of the gift space is 45mm*60mm*10mm)
Language independent
THE STORY
Davy Jones' Locker.
London, 1720. Ian Kensington, captain of the British Engineering Forces, is responsible for the first successful recovery of a sunken ship. In the report to His Majesty King George I of England, Kensington mentions Davy Jones' locker for the first time.
Despite it being a real artifact, he describes the locker in the context of a legend about the sea devil Davy Jones, who supposedly locks away the wandering souls of all sailors who lose their lives at the sea. It is told that on each sunken ship, he hides a replicate of the locker, promising to release all souls if someone manages to open the box.
 Since the first find, similar lockers were found in shipwrecks scattered around the world. Some of them are still kept in private collections, others in museums. However, nobody has been able to reveal their secret so far.
We are sure that you are the one, who will finally be able to open the locker and force Davy Jones to admit his defeat.
THE DESIGN AND PRODUCTION
According to Davy Jones he decided to create a special version of the box and release it to the community of Kickstarter. His crafty and intrepid team of developers has spent the last eight months designing and testing this special version of the locker. The team explored a wide variety of interlocks and functionalities, and ultimately settled on a final version which was confirmed by Davy Jones as the most sophisticated version of his locker. 
We will not hide that our team participated in the creation of the box, but even we don't have the details how to open it as the final mechanisms were personally crafted by the Sea Devil. In any case the Cluebox „Davy Jones Locker“ is our most complex project to date— both from a design and manufacturing perspective. The puzzle is made with loving care out of birch wood and wood oil, consists of 72 individual parts assembled with care by hand.
TEAM
Our international team of game and puzzle enthusiasts, mainly based in Germany, established in 2015 company  and developed several innovative board game and puzzles focusing in escape games niche. Today we're very excited to present our first Kickstarter and will appreciate your support to bring our product to life. 
Pirate music theme credit to Ross Bugden
Package design Federico Meloni/Chris Lattner
Meet our team member locked in Davy Jones' cabinet and requested to announce start of the campaign.
MEGABOX (Kickstarter special)
For Kickstarter we will produce a special edition of Megabox in multi-color.  Box size is 21,5*21,5*22,5cm. This box is ideal for escape rooms and events with larger amount of people. 
In your pledge for Megabox 2 boxes are included: 1x Megabox + 1x Standards size
 Complimentary artifact - Davy Jones' Sundial
Dear friends of Cluebox,
we have important news to share with you. We're really excited with number of people who decided to support us and we made a serious effort to match the level of expectations and get more mysterious artifacts from hands of Davy Jones.
And today we succeed!  We achieved to get plans of his sundial, which is an important element in the process of solving Davy Jones' Locker: when solving the Locker, keep an eye on the time shown on the clock and don't ever cross the number 12. Otherwise the Locker will turn into ... actually you better don't know what is it, just trust us ;)
Each one of our bekers will receive a wooden kit of sundial as a big thanks for your support.
The size of sundial is 6x6 cm.

Other iDventure Puzzles
 Cluebox - Schrödinger’s cat 
Schrödinger’s cat is a thought experiment by the Austrian physicist Erwin Schrödinger that illustrates the problem of quantum mechanics in every day objects. In this experiment, a cat and some poison are locked in a closed box.
According to Quantum Mechanics after a while the cat will be both dead and alive. Only by looking at the object, in this case the cat, the status will be determined. 
Unfortunately, Schrödinger completely forgot the cat because of his busy daily routine.
We are sure that the cat is still alive, and you must save it!
Box size: 
Secret space size: 1,5*4,5*8cm
Play time: 45-60 min
 Cluebox - Schrödinger’s cat - MEGABOX 
For Kickstarter we will produce a special edition of Megabox.  Box size is 21,5*21,5*22,5cm. This box is ideal for escape rooms and events with larger amount of people.
In your pledge for Megabox 2 boxes are included: 1x Megabox + 1x Standards size
Cryptex (wooden kit)
Cryptex is a portable vault used to hide secret messages. We have produced it as wooden kit, giving you the opportunity to build it on your own, get insights on it's mechanics and of course hide secret message as a present or as part of the a game. 
Size: 10,5*6 cm
Our Cryptex can be easily reset and the secret word can be set to any word up to 6 letters. 
Secret space size: 2*2*8 cm
REWARDS
TIMELINE
Shipping and Taxes 
Every backer is important to us, regardless of location. The reality is that shipping and sales taxes are expensive. To offset this we worked with our shipping partners to get the best conditions for our bakers on Kickstarter.  
For the EU, UK, US and Canada, your rewards will be sent duty-free from within your region - there will be no additional customs charge. We cannot guarantee customs-friendly shipping in areas outside of the US, Canada, UK and EU. There maybe additional duties and/or fees charged by your country’s governmental agencies and/or shipping partners. Those fees are solely your responsibility, and we can neither cancel a shipped pledge, nor will we pay those fees. In the event that a package is returned or destroyed due to the non-payment of such fees, your pledge will be considered fulfilled.
Shipping charges will be added after the Kickstarter ends - every backer will be responsible for paying these in the pledge manager after the campaign ends.
Approximate shipping prices listed in the table below, but subject to change based on the pledge size.

campaign.story:
Once a functional fortress and the cradle of wizards, little now remains of the Scarlet Citadel... on the surface. However, the place is known among adventurers and lorekeepers, and well-trod stairs lead down into the depths.
Deep below, dwarven mercenaries once bred their owlbears for war, the sorcerers of the White Forest practiced their forbidden arts, and strange cults from other realms settled into a place where nodes of power draw together. Their treasures and their remains are scattered across the halls and caverns. Those malevolent creatures that remain still spin their shadowy webs, enchant foul magics, and summon forth the dark gods.
This all-dungeon adventure for levels 1 to 10 presents adventuring in the most classic style of all, facing the foul monsters below the earth and seizing lost treasure. Sharpen your ax and ready your wand, and step forward for adventure in the Scarlet Citadel!
The 5th Edition of the world's first tabletop RPG is all about dungeons (and also dragons, though not in this project!). This is the first dungeon-centric adventure design that Kobold Press has tackled for 5th Edition, and the design effort is led by TSR and Wizards of the Coast veteran Steve Winter, working with notes and characters from Kobold Press publisher Wolfgang Baur's home game.
The result is a classic, old-school dungeon crawl that goes from a surface setting to a deep set of caverns far from the light of the sun, where alien things skitter and guttural chants murmur down chill and damp passageways lit only by magical spheres and phosphorescent fungi.
The Scarlet Citadel includes at least 6 levels of dungeon exploration with lavish maps, plus a town base, appendixes of additional monsters and characters, and a full suite of PDF and virtual tabletop options from Roll20 and Fantasy Grounds.
The project will create 6 main items: 
A hardcover book in both regular and limited editions,
A hand-tooled, rich leather edition,
A map folio of poster-sized, table-ready battle maps to play on, 
A fully-optimized PDF,
A digital edition for the Roll20 virtual tabletop (VTT), and
A Fantasy Grounds edition for that VTT platform.
The limited edition will be printed once with a leatherette, foil-stamped cover, ribbon bookmark, special endpapers, and similar touches. The content is identical to the regular edition, but this deluxe, limited edition often becomes extremely sought after.
This project does also offer a handbound leather edition for collectors and bibliophiles. This is done entirely in the traditional style of bookbinding, with excellent leather (likely scarlet-colored) stamped with gold foil and embellished with corded spine, ribbon bookmarks, and other flourishes. This is limited to about a dozen copies and is not available after the Kickstarter. Because of the extra time needed to create it, this reward ships about a month after the other reward packages do.
You can get these items separately or in bundles, and the bundles offer a discount. In addition, the limited edition is available though the Kickstarter, not through later elements such as the survey or pledge manager. (Sometimes we have a few extra limited editions for sale in the Kobold Store—that's never guaranteed!).
The rewards available during the Kickstarter are shown here. 

Because of postal variations and yearly increases in shipping costs, the shipping for print rewards is calculated and charged in the pledge manager after the Kickstarter closes.
This project continues the Kobold Press goal of reducing shipping costs to international backers and shipping in a sustainable way by using friendly, bulk shipments to three main regions: Canada, Australia, and the EU. From there, shipments go out via Canada Post, Australia Post, and either Royal Mail or Deutsche Post. 
As always with our projects, if we exceed our funding goal we will expand the adventure, the maps, and other elements of the project. The more people who support Scarlet Citadel, the better the rewards for everyone.
Our first goal and the next few stretch goals are posted here. More goals will be unlocked once we reach these, and quite a few secrets remain in the depths...
At Kobold Press, a fantastic team of accomplished tabletop gaming professionals is working hard to pull this project together.
Steve Winter, Lead Designer: Steve Winter got his start in the RPG industry by answering a help wanted ad in 1981. He’s managed to make a living from RPGs ever since as editor, developer, managing editor, creative director, web producer, designer, and author on countless roleplaying games, adventures, boardgames, wargames, novels, magazines, and web articles. His most recent work includes Tomb of Annihilation, Tome of Beasts, Deep Magic, and Midgard Heroes Handbook.
Misty Bourne, Lead Editor: Apex editor Misty Bourne is a professional word nerd with a ruthless red pen. An avid 5E player with more than twelve years of publishing experience, some of her more notable projects include: Mythic Odysseys of Theros (Wizards of the Coast), Underworld Lairs and Tome of Beasts 2 (Kobold Press), and the Epic Legacy series, Total Party Kill series, and Tyrants & Hellions (2CGaming). She edits Hit Point Press’s “Big Bads” (2020 silver ENNIE winner) and is currently authoring the guidebook for HPP’s Animated Tarot, slated for release in 2021.
Jon Pintar, Lead Cartographer: Jon Pintar is an illustrator and concept artist working mostly in tabletop games. Designing worlds is his passion, and his maps are published in dozens of products from publishers such as Kobold Press, Worldspinner, and Absolute Tabletop. He lives in Slovenia, on the sunny side of the Alps, and is never far from a medieval castle. You can find him on Twitter at @JonPintar.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Kobold Press has shipped over 37 crowdfunded titles since 2006, both small and large, with 15 of them on Kickstarter (this is #16). The Kobolds have won Gold and Silver ENnie Awards for this work, most recently an ENnie for the Creature Codex for 5th Edition in 2019 as Best Monster/Adversary book. The creative team is experienced, and we keep leveling up!

For Scarlet Citadel, much of the adventure design and cartography is already done. Likewise, we already have the cover and a portion of the interior art commissioned because of our confidence in this book. 

The main challenges are in editing the material, creating additional maps generated by stretch goals, layout of the books, and managing the uncertain landscape for printing and shipping.

Other risks include entirely new ones: the health of the core team of kobolds (editor, art director, and publisher), as well as business-related risks from COVID-related printer delays plus the recent tampering with the US Post Office. We'll keep you informed on any delays if they arise. 

And if we spring a trap or two on the way back to the surface? Well, surely one or two kobolds will survive to tell the tale!

campaign.story:
The Story
I've written a short story, about 8,000 words long, in which a psychic assassin working for the government explains (and complains about) his job, its history, its secrets and techniques and risks. It's inspired in equal parts by Tim Powers, Scanners, The Men Who Stare at Goats and Delta Green. If you like creepy technothrillers with surreal edges, I think you might enjoy this one.
It most closely resembles my stories NECROCHROME, Specimens and Forgeries and Simulacra. (If you prefer, you can listen to Specimens as an MP3 podcast, instead.) Like them, my hope is to host the story at my fiction library under a Creative Commons license so it's available to everyone with internet access. 
As with much of my recent work, I Am A Psychic Assassin for the US Army is concerned with government, its impact on individuals, its over-reach, and the effects this has on the people whom the government uses to pursue its agendas. It is also, of course, about weird psychic phenomena and the dangers of trying to make practical use of something you don't understand. 
STRETCH GOALS!
Hoo boy, we're funding right along! In one of the updates, I promised that if we hit $1500, I'd record a podcast of the story for all backers, like this one for After the Cops. And we hit it!
So now, with five days left, I'm putting up the last stretch goal: Giving the podcast to everyone. (Like I did with After the Cops.) To change things up, instead of a financial goal, I'm doing one based on people power. 
If this hits 200 backers, the podcast goes out to everyone.
If you haven't backed, even a dollar pledge gets you the podcast regardless--and it might, also, gift it to the whole population of the internet. 
If you have backed--wow, thank you. I appreciate it. You're definitely going to get the story and the podcast. If you want to make it broader and make the podcast available to all and sundry, spread the word.
Thanks!
-G.

updates.update_content:
Something about "guy kills people for shadow government with his mind" just really sticks in my craw, it seems, as I've written another story in a similar vein. This one, however, is within the setting of my game UNKNOWN ARMIES, so the whole thing is weirder, clumsier, hornier, and unreliably told. If you'd like to read this story, click this link here for details on the project. It's called Mick and the Spoon Bender. Thanks!
-G.

If you're a fan of my fiction, let me suggest that you branch out to my games--specifically, my science fiction game TERMINATION SHOCK, which answers the question "What happens when the middle-class of human space explorers suddenly get shoved into the middle of a thickly-populated cosmos with weird aliens and very little guidance?" The answer, of course, is "hijinks," ranging from the hilarious to the tragic. 
You could just go out, buy the game, play it with your friends and admire its clear prose and elegant mechanics, but I'd like to offer you something better: Bundling with its first supplement .

...Fulfillment
As of right now, 136 of you have replied to your surveys and 136 of you have had your stuff processed. Only ten more replies required until everyone has everything they're owed, so if you haven't replied to the survey, hey, you've no one to blame but yourself.
Also, Greg's Cancer Project Is Ongoing

Awesome, we crossed the $1500 barrier, so I'm comitted to massaging my throat with some honey tea and recording a podcast of the story! If you're a backer, you're going to get that. If you aren't yet a backer, well, there has never been a better time. Not just because we're in the final week, but because of the final stretch goal.
All backers get the podcast. If I get a total of 200 backers for this, I'll release the podcast to everyone, like I did for After the Cops.

Thanks, backers, for this amazing start. We really clobbered the goal and I couldn't be happier about that. So let's sweeten the pot, shall we?
At $1500, All Backers Get a Podcast
Yep. Even if you only pledge the single dollar needed to push this to a thousand bucks, you get the story for everyone... and should we hit $1500, you get a podcast, recorded and read by the author himself* for backers only. If you want to hear what I sound like reading my own work, here's the podcast I did for .

support.title: Become the Story
support.descp:
Four spots only to become part of our series. First, you'll get a primetime pre-recorded speaking slot at the VNC (family friendly content standards do apply) Then, starting in Chapter 3, you or your company will be immersed into Belle's world. It all starts with Vampire Services' soon-to-be-released Vampire DNA test. You'll be the first to take it and sit for our immersive interview process. From those results, your Vampire profile will become an ongoing character and distributed in our continuing adventure. Everybody in our network will know you or you co's name. Also includes everything above.

Become the Story
VNC Speaking Slot
Belle Herself Drops in & Joins Your Coven

campaign.story:
Summary
Mantis Falls is a strategic and highly interactive 2-3 player hidden traitor game. As cautious companions, players must use cooperation, hand management, social deduction and deception to protect themselves, and each other, on a dark and perilous journey.
On the shadowy film-noir roads of a mob-ruled mountain town named Mantis Falls, you have witnessed something not meant for your eyes and must now move quickly to escape town alive. You are informed that another witness will join you, and you consider your greatest hope for survival will come if you can contend with the hazards of this night together. But with each damaging event and every fresh wound, your suspicions grow. Looking into your companion's eyes you wonder, perhaps too late, if this person is here to kill you.
By use of hidden role cards, Mantis Falls is a “sometimes cooperative" strategy game. A game may have only witnesses, in which case players can win only if they all escape together. Or there could secretly be an assassin, carefully protecting the illusion of collaboration until the right moment to strike.
Unlike semi-cooperative games with multi-tiered win objectives or accumulations of points, Mantis Falls presents a simplicity of purpose: survival. And this task presents challenge in equal and high measure for all players. When there are only witnesses, players will need to continually perform acts of sacrifice and generosity even as double-edged action cards and "unseen" events test the limits of their fragile alliance. Players charged with the role of assassin can survive only with deceit and cunning, always cautious of the powerful but fleeting ability of witnesses to call in a hit on those they no longer trust.
Mantis Falls combines combo-driven card-play and hand-building with player communication. On every turn, players discuss tactics, defend choices and bluff through carefully guarded secrets. Witnesses and assassins alike must walk the line between a willingness to help their companion and a readiness to kill, always reading each other as much as surveying the hazards of the road.
With a variable modular board and uncertain objectives, each walk through the roads of Mantis Falls is unique. Moreover, the level of interaction means the relationships and personalities of the players themselves have the power to meaningfully transform every game.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will be our first scale-up to mass production and that inherently entails the risk of the unknown. Fortunately, we have the guidance of valuable mentors experienced in this industry, so we are optimistic in our ability to address the challenges that come our way.

Our greatest concern right now is that the game may not reach everyone on our planned schedule. Although this is always a concern, it is particularly so now due to the challenging circumstances of COVID-19. If production or distribution is unavoidably delayed, we will still do all we can to get you your reward as soon as possible.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
We chose a card-based design in part to ensure a game that can withstand the rigors of time. The heavy reliance on cards allows for relative ease of replacement of lost/damaged components.
Reusability and recyclability
Mantis Falls is made almost exclusively from recyclable and/or easily biodegradable materials (card stock. cardboard and wood). The only use of plastic is the shrink wrap and thin bags to hold game components within the box.
Sustainable materials
For our design, we have deliberately foregone more substantial uses of plastic such as heavy inserts.
Sustainable Distribution
We are very excited that our collaboration with MyClimate.org has ensured our carbon offsets will account for all fulfillment, from manufacturing all the way to the backer's door. This strategy was made possible in part by our compact game design and small box, which has been a key consideration for us since the start of this game's conception.
Something else
We have proudly partnered with MyClimate.org to make our game 100% carbon neutral.

updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone,
This update is, unfortunately, mostly about a further delay (a setback of several weeks). This is disappointing, as we'd been very much under the impression that it would be 100% done (and loading into freight) by now. The more positive news, though, is that the game is very close to completion and we think it's all looking great.

updates.update_content:
Hey everyone! It's been a very busy and positive month on our end and we're excited to share lots of news with you! Since it's a long update, here's a quick synopsis:
Manufacturing update (with pictures!)
A look at a complete preview copy (with a video!)
Links to the completed compendium
Links to the completed official soundtrack for digital download

Hi, we hope everyone is doing well! We've got a quick manufacturing update and some new content to announce. 

Our manufacturing team has said they won't be finished with manufacturing until early May. This pushes our timeline for fulfillment tentatively to June/July.  We are very disappointed to be telling you this, and thus we have worked on two main fronts in the last couple of days; figuring out what went wrong and finding ways to make it up to you all.

Hey everyone! We hope you're all well.
Things are continuing to proceed nicely with Mantis Falls. As you're probably aware, Chinese New Year is just concluding, and that has put some of the production aspects of our project on a brief hiatus. We'd anticipated this in our timeline, but it just means there are fewer manufacturing updates for us to share than usual. It also means we've been able to use the time for other less exciting-to-share (and mostly less exciting-to-do) parts of the project, like learning how to file taxes to several different countries. So, with that said, here are our latest updates:

campaign.story:
After the success of both A Dozen Sinister Rumors (Kickstarter page) and A Dozen Troubling Rumors (Kickstarter page), I'm back with a new wave of PDFs in the A Dozen . . . series! Between them, those two earlier Kickstarter campaigns led to the creation of 30 different 14-page PDFs, all of which were delivered to the backers of those projects on schedule! That's 360 total pages of actual content packed with systemless fantasy RPG inspiration that gamemasters can turn to when looking for ideas to make their own!

Now, with your support, we'll bring the third wave of the A Dozen . . . series to life. Starting with A Dozen Frightening Rumors, this latest Kickstarter campaign was designed around a single goal: To create more of the same! The series has proven popular with Kickstarter backers -- between the original campaign and later projects, over 3,000 gamers have downloaded the 17 first wave titles as a part of their rewards -- so I see no reason to change my approach to this series.
No new physical rewards. This project is all about the new PDFs. There are no new print books offered through this campaign. For those of you in the U.S. who have missed some of my earlier projects, the Fantasy City Sites and Scenes books and Dungeon Crafter's Sketch Book (square edition) are being offered. Please see below (and the rewards, at right) for more information.
Print Schedule: If the project closes successfully, then I will send out the surveys for those backers in the U.S. who have selected print rewards. The goal is to send the print rewards no later than September of 2020 (which will be before the new PDFs are ready).
Each rumor is designed to fit on a single page (with artwork), so that you may print only the page that you need for your next game session. A Dozen Frightening Rumors comes in at 14 pages and includes -- as you may have guessed from the title -- twelve different rumors + a cover page and a page outlining the anatomy of a rumor (as well as tips on using the rumors in your game).
The content is systemless and designed for use with any fantasy roleplaying game. The gamemaster will need to create any statistics necessary to use the material during a game session. These PDFs exist as inspirational works that are intended to help fire the GM's imagination.
Sample pages from wave one titles.
ALL STRETCH GOALS NOW UNLOCKED! 
As project stretch goals are unlocked, all reward levels -- including the $1 level -- will receive the unlocked PDFs at no extra charge. Tell your friends; more backers could mean more PDFs for all project supporters!
NOTE: At project launch, none of the PDFs have been written. If the campaign closes successfully, then I'll start the serious task of writing A Dozen Frightening Rumors (as well as any unlocked stretch goal PDFs). I'll keep everyone informed through project updates as I work on writing the PDFs that are required to complete the campaign.
The first wave of modern A Dozen . . . series PDFs was created thanks to the success of the A Dozen Sinister Rumors Kickstarter campaign in October of 2019 (project page here). To get these PDFs as a bundle, please see the $16, $26, $44, and $66 rewards at right or, if you wish, visit DrivethruRPG to buy single PDFs.
The Kickstarter campaign for the second wave of A Dozen . . . series PDFs came to a close in December of 2019 and, by the time it closed, project support led to the creation of thirteen new PDFs. You can get a bundle of the thirteen PDFs in this campaign -- please see the $11, $26, $29, $44, and $66 rewards, at right -- or you may find individual titles at DrivethruRPG.
Did you miss the Fantasy City Sites and Scenes and Fantasy City Sites and Scenes II Kickstarter campaigns? Now is your chance to get these two books in print (and in PDF)! Please see the $13, $29, $41, $44, and $66 reward levels (at right).
To learn more about each project, please visit the Kickstarter pages.
Fantasy City Sites and Scenes
Fantasy City Sites and Scenes II

Featuring 100 different encounter ideas -- ten of which feature maps created using SkeletonKey Games' tiles (website) -- this 8.5" x 11" 52-page PDF is ready to aid you in your next adventure. Please see the $7,  $29, and $44 rewards level if you would like to add The Book of Dungeon Encounters in PDF to your collection.
To learn more about the book, please visit the Kickstarter campaign. 
The Dungeon Crafter's Sketch Book is for the gamemaster who enjoys creating dungeons. (Kickstarter page here.) This 56-page book (60 including the cover, inside covers, and back cover) is filled with page after page of square grids: space for you to draw your dungeon ideas. Scattered throughout the book are several random tables to inspire you as you create your newest dungeon. Please see the $3 and $15 reward levels.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have worked in a real-life room escape game industry for over five years. During this period, we have made 20 different game designs throughout the country as a team. These games have been played by more than 20,000 people and have won many awards here in Turkey. We wanted to put into use our experience globally and we want to share the stories we have created with the world. The idea of Arca Ludum was born at this point. We wanted our work to be extraordinary. We have been researching and updating our games since the middle of 2018. Our biggest risk is to transfer all our energy and capital to Arca Ludum by canceling our activities on real-life room escape game companies.

We have worked hard to improve our team and add interactive elements to our games. We have repeatedly produced new prototypes to find the best materials to use in the games. We have worked in an organized way to avoid any disruption in various subjects such as scenario writing, puzzle design, visual design, progressive prototype production, blind-tests, planning of production, storage, logistics, customer services, and control of technical failure processes. We take care to choose the right partners.

The room escape enthusiasts know it well. The most important element for a perfect escape game is the puzzles. These puzzles should be both enjoyable and extraordinary. We have carefully selected our puzzles in all of our games from a large pool. Puzzles and gameplay are a whole. To ensure this integrity, we have updated each of our stories several times.

Considering all these factors, we believe that we will be successful in our games. We've spent quite a lot of effort to add re-playable mini-games in each game. Apart from all these, we have understood clearly that preparing the game completely is not enough for the global market. We talked to a lot of alternative logistic service providers about how to get our games to game enthusiasts. In order to keep both the cost of the game and the cost of shipment at the optimum level, we talked to many services in different regions of the world.

We agreed with an investor who would provide the necessary budget for materials, graphic designs, advertising expenses, and game development expenses. Thus, we have taken huge steps to create Arca Ludum, which will produce new and unique projects in the future, as a successful brand in this field.

We have no doubt that you will love the games immensely because we love creating these games. We're sure you'll notice this as you are experiencing our stories in the comfort of your homes.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
While the games are played, no component gets harmed. With the help of the setup guide, it will take at most ten minutes to repack the game to its replayable form. This way, you can replay the game, let your friends play, or even gift it to your loved ones.
Reusability and recyclability
Our purpose in creating this project was to make our board games similar to real-life room escape games. It's not just a tabletop game. What we aim is you trying to escape from one or two rooms you locked yourself by solving the puzzles we designed. Therefore, we have developed a mechanism called an easy-to-lock system.
 
The easy-to-lock system inside the boxes can also be used with our different game scenarios in the future. You won't have to get these mechanisms for our new games again. You will also be able to use these mechanisms to play PnP games that we plan to publish more often.

campaign.story:
Sherlock's Mysteries seamlessly blends a narrative murder mystery experience with the puzzle and enigma solving that you would find in an escape room game. With more than 150 puzzles ranging from ciphers and codes to association and logic, there is something for everyone regardless of skill or experience level.  

Lucid Dreaming is perfect to play at home, at work, at school or on the go. The graphic heavy and visually stimulating puzzles are great for sharing the experience with a friend or loved one and, the handheld size makes it easy to bring anywhere you go.

The Sherlock's Mysteries Mobile App is available on all Apple & Android devices. Once you have downloaded the application you WILL NOT REQUIRE AN INTERNET CONNECTION which means you can play anytime without worrying about data or WiFi coverage. The app is riddled with Easter eggs, optical illusions, clues, videos, evidence files and mini brain teasers for true puzzle addicts. The app also handles all the multi-stage hints and solutions for each chapter so that you never get stuck. 

 Lucid Dreaming is broken down into 10 individual chapters that are connected by an arching narrative that unravels as you progress through the game. This culminates in an incredible meta puzzle that will test your wits and push the limits of your abilities as a detective. Each chapter takes 1-2+ hours to complete but there is no time limit and you can jump in wherever you left off last time. The Deluxe & Collector's Edition Journals also contain a Prequel & Bonus Chapter for even more puzzling.
The Attache contains all 10 Chapters of Lucid Dreaming in a high quality and incredibly detailed suitcase that is filled to the brim with clues, locks, puzzles, tools, mystery items, boxes, letters and much more.  Simply assemble your team, open up the Attache, choose a chapter and begin the most detailed and immersive escape room style experience you will ever play from the comfort of your own home. The Attache also contains a refill kit so that you can pass on the experience once you've completed the game. The Prequel and Bonus Chapter game materials are also available in the Deluxe and Collector's Edition Reward Tiers. 

The Attache takes Lucid Dreaming and kicks it up a notch by bringing the story to real life with physical puzzles that you must interact with in order to progress. Each and every item inside The Attache has been carefully curated and thoughtfully integrated into the game. Many objects are reused throughout the game in different ways, just as a detective refers back to prior evidence throughout an investigation. The puzzle experiences are focused on realistic and logical objectives that help your team unravel the mysteries as you solve them along the way. 

Just like in a real escape room game - The Attache will have you and your team discovering codes, symbols, numbers, letters and keys needed to open real locks and ciphers. By partnering directly with hardware manufacturers, Sherlock's Mysteries is able to include an incredible assortment of high quality mechanical puzzles at an affordable price. All of the locks can be reset and used again with the included refill kit in order to pass along the game to others, and they also make great keepsake items. 

Each chapter takes 1-2+ hours to complete but there is no time limit and multi-stage hints and solutions are available via the mobile app at any time. The app will also provide your group with a soundtrack and video series for each chapter. Although the game contains a meta puzzle that brings together all 10 chapters - you can play them in any order. That means that you can play with different friends, family or loved ones at any time regardless of where you are in the game. Sherlock's Mysteries was designed with escape room and tabletop game enthusiasts in mind. This means that the puzzles are intricately detailed and incredibly well integrated into the story line that unfolds as you progress. Since no outside knowledge is needed, The Attache will keep you engaged whether you've played 300 escape rooms or none at all.  For those with a keen eye and a hunger for puzzles, there are Easter eggs, mini games and plot developments that only the most astute observer can discover.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Sherlock's Mysteries: Lucid Dreaming is an incredibly ambitious project that has taken over a year of development to bring to life. Without our experienced team of escape room designers, graphic artists, fabricators and writers, none of this would have been possible. 

Although The Journal in Book Format has already been written and is ready for mass production there are still challenges that face us in the months ahead. 

Journal Challenge #1: 3 Different Versions. The Journal is being produced in Standard, Deluxe & Collector's Edition Formats. As with any publishing there are certain volume requirements to meet in order to bring the cost down sufficiently for consumers. To ensure the cost and timeline requirements are met, we have set out our initial goal high enough to produce The Journals en masse and achieve economies of scale.

Journal Challenge #2: Multilayered Graphics. To write an interactive puzzle adventure that caters to even the most sophisticated of puzzle connoisseurs, the novel must have incredible depth in the puzzle visualization. To ensure that the graphics are crisp, engaging & fair - we have made several rounds of prototyping across dozens of iterations so that the experience is perfect from start to finish. 

The Attache is undoubtedly one of the most detailed and comprehensive tabletop escape games ever to be produced and as such there are numerous design and execution risks that we have sought to mitigate. Since our team is comprised of professional escape room designers we have a unique advantage to understanding and assembling supply chain management and logistics. By partnering directly with manufacturers we are able to provide incredible cost to value ratio for our backers and guarantee only the highest quality items are used. We are confident that each and every item in the game is of movie prop quality and The Attache is an art piece as much as it is a puzzle adventure. 

Attache Challenge #1: Material production and sourcing. Luckily for us, the team at Sherlock's Mysteries is comprised of escape room designers and fabricators that have a manufacturing warehouse in Vancouver, Canada dedicated to creating turnkey escape room games. By leasing a portion of that space we are able to benefit from the manufacturing and fulfillment center which has high tech equipment ranging from Laser Engravers to 3D Printers, Large Format printers & CNC Machines. This means that most of the in-game materials can be produced and fulfilled in-house, thus reducing our exposure to outside factors. By leveraging our existing relationships with other suppliers (for things like ciphers, locks and hardware) we are able to buy in bulk and achieve economies of scale that are essential to our price points viability. 

Attache Challenge #2: Game play - for years there have been tabletop escape room games available on the market but as enthusiasts ourselves we were often underwhelmed by their scope and detail. Most games featured generic storylines and paper based puzzles that had us adding codes or folding paper to unlock the next step. We wanted to bring the game to real life in a 3 dimensional way and elevate the playing experience away from paper based puzzles. To do so we carefully picked and assembled a vast array of tools, clues, locks and ciphers that brings a level of tangibility and intrigue only accomplished by real world objects. Adding physical items is great but in order to create a compelling experience those items must be used and reused in a thoughtful way. Each and every item inside The Attache is deeply integrated into the experience and no object has just one simple function. After thoroughly researching and play-testing the vast majority of games in this genre, we are confident that The Attache will propose a bespoke and unforgettable experience for players around the world.

campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
The Journal is comprised of heavy weight paper and extremely well bound by our made in America publisher. The Journal will require you to fold, cut and draw on pages so although it is not re-usable, it still must stand up to 20+ hours of continued use across days, weeks or even months of effort. 

The Attache on the other hand is fully re-usable and comes with a refill kit so that the entire game can be replayed. Each of the game play pieces are made from high quality materials such as linen paper, oak wood, stainless steel, brass and aluminum. Even after multiple times playing through each chapter, many of the interior components will live on for decades and can be added to your keepsake and display cases forever.
Reusability and recyclability
Although everything in The Journal and The Attache is 100% recyclable we would prefer that our backers pass on the game by selling or giving it away once they are done. To help with this we have provided 1 or more refill kits in each of The Attache reward tiers.
Sustainable materials
The Journal is made from 100% recycled paper.
Environmentally friendly factories
By centralizing our manufacturing and fulfillment centers we are able to ensure that strict recycling and composting standards are met.
Sustainable Distribution
In an effort to reduce our carbon footprint we will be shipping pallets of stock to several distribution centers (in Vancouver, New York & France). This will allow us to keep shipping costs low by reducing the travel needed.

campaign.story:
Each Dinn starter deck represents one of Dinn’s six attributes, and characters. Each has a unique playstyle and focuses on specific elements of history, myth, and legend. 
The Sentient Deck: This deck focuses on human characters from myth, legends, and history. King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table are the primary inspiration for the first Sentient attribute starter deck. The playstyle is aggressive and straight forward. This is an excellent deck for beginners.
The Beast Deck: This deck focuses on famous beasts, creatures, and behemoths from myth, and legend. Everything from the mighty Leviathan, to the ferocious Minotaur, live in this deck. The Beast attribute deck gets better the closer to defeat it gets. Like a cornered animal, your opponent must defeat you quickly, or they’ll soon regret it.
The Horror Deck: This deck focuses on monsters, horrible creatures, or angry gods throughout history. The things that lurk in the heart of the Horror deck are terrible to behold. This deck utilizes the fear of the unknown. The Hero you play at the beginning of the turn, may not be the Hero on the field at the end of your turn.
The Divine Deck: This deck is made of gods, angels, demons, and prophets throughout human history. Divine intervention is almost always in your favor when you play these cards. The Divine attribute focuses on control. Specifically, how many cards you have in your hand, and your opponent has in theirs. Ten, five, two. These numbers will define the strength of your Heroes.
The Given Deck: This deck is made up of machines, creations, and engines scattered throughout humanity’s past, and future. The Given attribute focuses on continual improvement. The Heroes you play at the end of the game will receive benefits from the Heroes you played at the beginning.
The Essence Deck: This deck is made up of events, actions, and unchanging elements of life. The creatures of the dark forest, the unmovable mountain, or the simple virus. It plays by a very specific set of rules, and your opponent will be playing by those rules as well.
Dinn will launch with two types of booster packs.
A traditional booster pack: with over one-hundred cards. Every card could be a powerful addition to your deck.
Each card will have a unique ARG puzzle and a unique reward for the first person to solve them. The ARG story elements in the traditional booster pack will all be set in the past, providing valuable information about the characters and setting up the mystery.
A Story Pack: We’re also launching with a new kind of booster pack. A community-driven story pack. These will be released each month and will contain ten powerful cards, and will be designed in response to how the community is solving the traditional booster pack puzzles and last month's story puzzles.
As the community solves the story pack puzzles, the order in which they are solved change the story of Dinn in favor of specific characters.
Gabriel Whittemore: Design & Development
Will Dinneen: Communications
Dinn is a small passion project that we have been working on for the last five years. This is our first Kickstarter project and is largely aimed at gathering the funds required to commission the art for the remaining 200 cards we’ve developed.
Both Will and I have years of experience in communication, web and graphic design, and multimedia creation. These skills are paramount when developing the puzzles associated with each of Dinn’s cards.
The rest of our team consists of a trusted group of artists, graphic designers, voice actors, and animators that we bring on board to help us flesh out cards, puzzles and riddles.
We’re excited to bring this project to Kickstarter. Additionally, you can learn more about our team on our website (https://dinncards.com/the-artists/)
Thank you.
Gabriel Whittemore.

campaign.story:
Update on VAT & Sales Taxes
We've spoken to 3 international region-friendly VAT/tax experts, and guess what? It's complicated, confusing, and all about to change in 2021 when our game ships and the tax assessments need to be made. Loopholes are closing, regulations are tightening, previous tax-minimization schemes are disappearing, but we can say we're happy to help out as much as possible. Here's how:
We will pay for any VAT / tax fees on any shipping charges. Backers will only pay required sales/VAT taxes for their Core or Deluxe game purchases (and any add-ons). This avoids the dreaded double-tax stack-up that many backers face when including shipping charges into the tax equation.
Retailers in the UK/EU: you may have to pay VAT on your 6-pack bundle, but this is a recoverable expense, and will also depend on whether your store and our chosen distribution partner's warehouse are located in the same country. We should have better information on that when the pledge manager opens and once our final EU/UK distribution partner is selected.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our team of creative professionals has combined decades of experience in developing products for mass production. Even though this may be our first tabletop game, we're being advised by some of the top leaders in the industry who have helped guide our every step. Of course, we're also using top-tier manufacturing and fulfillment partners. 

That said, we live in a dynamic world which is currently being tested like never before. Changes in manufacturing partners, paper costs, shipping fluctuations, global economics: all can affect our final outcome and schedule. But be confident that all issues that may arise during our development process, from schedule delays to component quality, will be quickly and clearly shared with our backers via frequent updates. We're in this together now!

DISCLAIMER: as we continue to develop the game for mass-production, the artwork, components, names, and likenesses shown in the above illustrations are subject to change.

campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
By having a highly expandable and upgrade-able game system, The Shivers will always be new and evolving. The game has an intrinsic quality that will last through generations, not a quick fad that gets played a couple times then sits on a shelf (or worse, goes into the trash).
Sustainable materials
Our paper pop-up constructions and manuals will use FSC-type paper certified by FSC (Forest Stewardship Council), which ensures proper sustainable forest management is used to harvest trees for paper.
Environmentally friendly factories
Our pop-up manufacturing factory is accredited by FSC.org to ensure sustainable forestry and conservation practices to support their paper supply chain.
Something else
Our unique Story Card system of creating new episodes allows for players to print episodes on their own home printers (this functionality will be enabled on future expansions). This means no burden to supply chain or environmental impact from international shipping, as printing of new episodes will be on-demand, local, and with much less environmental impact.

Ready To Cross the Finish Line
We promised we wouldn't update you needlessly unless there were things that needed sharing, and we've tried to stick to that. As a result, things have been relatively quiet as we put the finishing touches on all our designs and waited for the printing process to conclude.

Hey, all! We just wanted to drop a quick note to let everyone know that the pledge manager will be closing at the end on the month (September 30th). There are still about 28% of you who have yet to fill it out, so we'd encourage you to get that taken care of as quickly as possible. Note, if you have a fluid housing situation or are experiencing emergency circumstances like many on the west coast, please please let us know if you can and we will make sure to work with you on whatever shipping solution is best for you. 
Pledge Manager closes September 30th

Hi, everyone! I know we've been quiet for a little while, but fortunately this is a case of "no news" being "good news." 
We are humming right along on production of the puzzle postcards (possibly even ahead of schedule!) and just want to share a brief update to let you know where everything is at. Here's a quick look at each facet of this project and where it currently sits:

Hey, everyone. This is just a quick note to let you know that I am about to push "send" to invite everyone over the PledgeManager for our campaign. For those who are new to all this, PledgeManager is a site that helps us organize everyone's info, allows people to add items as needed, and lets late backers trickle in until we close down. 
You should see an invite in your inbox or, possibly, spam folder, so keep an eye out for that. We'll likely have the PM open for at least a month, and we'll send out an update before we close it in case anyone needs to modify their shipping information.

And the Kickstarter is officially closed! I just wanted to make sure we took a moment to thank all of you for supporting us with Season 2. Despite this being our 4th Kickstarter campaign, in many ways it was very different, challenging, and surprising. We learned a lot that we will carry with us to our next project. 
In the meantime, we're hard at work on Season 2! Keep your eyes open for the invitation to the PledgeManager, which will be going out sometime in the next week, we anticipate. Here you can enter your shipping, edit your order, and add any additional items you want (like a box for Season 1 or the bonus art cards).

From when the campaign closes that day we have a few things to lock down with the pledge manager (we're using the original PledgeManager this time around) but you should be invited to provide your shipping information in the 1-2 weeks following.

We're on our way to 20k and getting closer to 400 backers! We've been hard at work on a lot of things behind-the-scenes, but today we want to give you a little look at one of the extra bits we decided to just include instead of making it a stretch goal: the bookmark. 
Many of you know that The Enigma Emporium has a little bookmark-slash-business-card that we slip into a lot of our outgoing orders. It's got our basic info on it, as well as a visual guide to a handful of commonly-used ciphers plus an easy alphanumeric reference. This started as just our spin on the common business card but quickly turned into a very popular piece and even one that was requested by folks who didn't receive one with their orders (which happened a lot due to different packaging and fulfillment processes).

Version française de cette page
2 years after the crowdfunding of Apocalypse: Sign of the Cross, Argyx Games is proud to present their new escape box: "LEGACY: Quest for a Family Treasure".
 Inspired by live escape games, "LEGACY: Quest for a Family Treasure" is a narrative puzzle: a unique and immersive co-op investigation game you can play at home. Use observation and deduction to solve puzzles, decipher codes and experience alternate reality gaming.
Marseille, Fall 2019. You receive the letter of a notary that comes with a mysterious black box. In his last will, your estranged father reveals the existence of a family treasure, hidden somewhere in Europe. To find it, he leaves you objects and documents that belonged to him as well as to your ancestor. You have to shed light on the past in order to be able to claim your inheritance...
Prototype of Legacy
 LEGACY includes 40 realistic objects & documents : 8-page newspaper, letters, postcards, photographs, a A3-treasure map, the map of the Paris World Fair, glass bottle, chess pieces, miniatures items (watch, shovel...), book page, business card, pen, sliding puzzle, cardboard 3D glasses... and even a 3D Eiffel Tower!  
 A smartphone or a computer with an Internet connection is required to play.
In LEGACY, you will:
Browse through letters, newspapers and various documents
Search for clues
Manipulate items
Decipher codes
Solve audio & video puzzles
Enjoy immersive background music & sounds
Interact with the real world
Use maps to find your way
Search the web
LEGACY contains 2 episodes: "Eiffel 1889" and "Hellas 2019", that can be played independently. The Kickstarter version of LEGACY will also include an exclusive puzzle, "The House".
The Kickstarter edition (pledge levels FORTUNE SEEKER and COLLECTOR) will include an additional exclusive video game puzzle, THE HOUSE. Depending on the stretch goals that will be reached, we will combine this game with one or several new physical documents and/or objects, added to the LEGACY box, for an even more immersive transmedia experience! 🎮
Screen capture of THE HOUSE (work in progress)
The narrative puzzles Pocket Investigations are similar to LEGACY, but shorter in playing time. Each scenario includes 5-10 objects & documents found inside a mysterious black envelope.
The FORTUNE SEEKER pledge level includes ALCHYMIA, our yet unreleased 'Deluxe' scenario (contains more objects & documents than a regular Pocket): immerse yourself in the alchemist's laboratory, try to transmute elements into gold and make the Philosopher's Stone!   
The COLLECTOR pledge includes, along with Alchymia, 2 additional episodes to be chosen among the following: PRELUDE, BABYLON, MERRY CHRISTMAS, CASINO KRYSOS, CLUNY, APOLLO 22, THE LOVE LOCK AGENCY.

campaign.story:
After the Cops... What Then?
Policing in the United States is in turmoil. Protesters fill the street, calling to de-fund and disarm uniformed police, transferring the money into mental health, addiction and other public safety or welfare programs. 
I'm a science fiction and sometime crime writer, so I asked myself what that transformation would look like from the perspective of the people in the middle of it. The answer I imagined is the meat of this story.
What It's Like
I've written about crime before. After the Cops is probably most like A Hole in the Darkness, which you can click on and read right now. Both focus on law enforcement as it's happening, with an emphasis on the difficulties and moral compromises made in the moment. It also bears some resemblance to NECROCHROME, which posits a radical change to homicide investigation. After the Cops is more realistic than NECROCHROME, however. There's little new technology on display in it. Its events could, realistically, be happening in 2022.
As mentioned, it's under 5,000 words, so you can read it in one sitting. It's the story of someone who signs up to be a post-cop community servant, navigating the changes and challenges of being unarmed and coping with a distrustful and fed-up public.
What I'm Doing
You can read A Hole in the Darkness and NECROCHROME, and other crime stories like A Series of Small, Precise Cuts or These People Mean Nothing to Each Other through the fiction library on my web site, www.gregstolze.com. All these stories have been underwritten by fans like you, so that they can be free for everyone and, hopefully, create more fans. This is what I'll do with After the Cops when it funds. 
Stretch Goals
2020 has not been hugely fertile for my creativity, so I'm not sitting on a backlog of unpublished stories, but I do have a couple stretch goals in mind.
At $1000, I'll record the story as a podcast for backers. If you haven't heard my voice, slide on over to my Soundcloud where you can listen to me playing various games and decide if you want that voice in your ear for more than ten minutes. I can promise a decent recording. Some of the game recordings suffer from the limits of Discord and Skype as signal bearers, but this podcast would be recorded solidly before release.
If we manage to raise $1400, I'll not only record the podcast, I'll put that out under a CC license too, so that everyone can hear it -- not just backers. 
Tangible Goodies
At different backer levels, you can get patches, linocut prints, or both.
The linocuts are all very different, combining different colors, textures and pigments in this abstracted "what's next?" graphic.
Here's what the patch looks like!
The patches are in hand. I've made ten linocuts so far, but I should be able to make many more before the plate runs out. But supplies are limited.

The risks are low.

French and German proofs will have to go out-of-house for approval, so that runs later. I’ve been holding off on making this post until I have definitive shipping information to tell you. Unfortunately I don’t have definitive information for you, but it is clear that we won’t be hitting our target shipping month. So I pulled together all the data I could from all of AEG to get you the best possible information I could. Short update today...
The Pledge Manager is closing in 2 weeks (the 31st). After that point, we will no longer be accepting late pledges. In addition, normally you can "add an extra copy" during the pledge manager if you were already a backer, that will also likely be turned off or limited at that time (we'll be sure to leave a copy for each backer). Why are we doing this?...

I got a ping asking for an update, which I’m always happy to do. So here is where things are as of now…

We are (fingers crossed) within days of finalizing all the files. The complexity of this project, particularly with all three languages, has definitely caused some late nights by the team and we’re all going to breathe a sigh of relief when these files get to the printer.

Holidays over. 
First week of "Oh man, we are so far behind from taking those days off" is over. 
Time for an update!!

Just a quick update...
Things are moving along. Translation are just about wrapped up, which is a bigger milestone than you might think, especially for such a big game. 

One of the great things about doing translated versions in-house is that the translators often catch small issues that we may have missed in the English version - nothing huge, just corner-cases that we may want to cover more fully or places where extra clarification might be a good idea.

Felt like it's been awhile since I've done an update, so I thought I'd fire one off. I honestly never know how often to do updates - I back a lot of Kickstarters and I could do with a few less TBH, so I'll keep this short.

Dead Reckoning is working it's way through the pre-production process now. There is a lot of tranlsation-related work going on as everything (cards, rules, books, sagas, etc...) has to be translated into German and French and then laid out as well. It is a TON of work, but it's getting done.
