These are just a few of the Champions you'll come to Command in Ascension Tactics...
Emri 
Emri is among the most ancient of Vigil’s Champions, a lethal assassin whose past is drenched in blood and cloaked in shadows.  While Emri’s power is drawn from the Void, the root of their long life remains buried in myth. Whatever the truth may be, for the thousands of years Emri has lived, they’ve always been a killer, traveling the world dedicated to the Void’s most ancient art form: the art of death. 
 Arha Sensei 
Among the greatest warriors in the Arha temple are the instructors, the Arha Sensei. Peerless teachers, legendary for their mastery of the Arha martial disciplines, and responsible for the training of all Arha warriors. To become an Arha Sensei, one must embark on a training regimen of unparalleled severity. The final test given, before a pupil was allowed to become a master, was known formally as The First Dawn. The trial begins with the intense pain of ritual blinding, the monks then meditate all through the night, focusing on the All-Seeing Eye; those who witness the rising sun through spiritual vision go on to join the ranks of the revered Arha Sensei; those who fail, remain blind and are exiled from the temple.
Runic Lycanthrope
Lycanthropy is a gift reserved for the most devoted of the Lifebound warriors. Humans who defend nature, despite extraordinary odds, are offered this rite by druids of the stone circle. If the warrior accepts, they will endure a month of nightmares, each a surreal puzzle, with an arcane rune of personal strength in its solution. On the night of the ritual, the warrior must etch each of the arcane runes into their flesh, binding lunar spirits with their mortal blood, transforming into a runic lycanthrope for the first time. 
Mechana Initiate
It is said that the ancient Mechana language did not have a word for truth, only perspective. This may be the reason that the Mechana are known for their continuous innovation and unmatched drive. Mechana Initiates are individuals who excel in dynamic thinking and are sought out by Mechana Engineers to reimagine everything from weapons of war to the laws of the universe. After time as an Initiate, the individual may move on to new projects derived from their unique perspective, but the transition from Initiate to Engineer is simply a matter of public perception, as the Mechana themselves don’t use these restricting terms to define themselves. 
We saw the 10th-anniversary of Ascension as an opportunity to unify the style, and develop an identity and aesthetic that says, “This is Ascension evolved.” 
When we look back at all the art we’ve made over the last decade of Ascension, we saw a story spanning thousands of years. Many of our original pieces looked like they could have come from a fantasy storybook, with the players taking on the role of heroes in the adventure. 
We decided to feature this element of our history with art that reminded us about the oceans of time we cross throughout the game. In Ascension, we’re looking back at a long past filled with gods and magic. When you’re playing Ascension you’re playing through these epochs, running into legendary heroes, monsters, and constructs along the way.  
To illustrate this we commissioned art focused on a central figure,  using metallic textures, and a lot less rendering than modern styles to create the feeling of an illustrated storybook or medieval tapestry. All that, but with a little Ascension flare. 
The goal was to develop an art style that told unforgettable stories and appears to have lasted for generations. It is a style inspired by stories like the Illiad, the Epic of Gilgamesh, and the best Arthurian lore.  Our 10th-anniversary art is intended to pay homage to our past while bringing us into a new age of Ascension.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As mentioned above, this game has many moving parts. More moving parts means more potential problems. Here’s a list of what needs to be accomplished:

-Miniatures that need to be sculpted, test printed, and then manufactured.
-Cards that need art, design, and printing.
-Boards that need to be designed, mocked up, tested, and printed.
-A rule set that needs to be fun, elegant, and teachable. 
-Scenarios that need stories, rules, and testing.
-Packaging needs to be designed, built, tested and manufactured.
-Customer service is key and needs to be handled effectively. 
-All this needs to come together into one very cool, very awesome package.

But here’s the awesome part, we’re nearly done with these steps. Preliminary art is done, sculpts have been printed, rules, scenarios and maps have been tested. From here, we’ll be working on meeting our stretch goals and making sure everything comes together for our patrons.

DELIVERY DATE

The estimated delivery date for Ascension Tactics is, it's important to reiterate, an estimate.

Different regions will likely receive the game on different dates, we’ll try to get things out so people receive them in a small window, but some of that is out of our control.

The core version of Ascension Tactics is nearly complete. we’re finishing up talks now with miniature manufacturers, and already have existing agreements with card and packaging companies, so we don’t see there being a problem delivering on time. 

REFUND POLICY
All pledges can be refunded up to 14 days after the end of the Kickstarter campaign, fees included. After which, we have a policy of no questions asked for a refund, but will be unable to refund you the charges incurred by Kickstarter and Stripe (as we will not be refunded by them after this 14 day period), Pledge Manager and also the other charges for your payment (PayPal, VISA, credit card...). This represents approximately 15% of the full payment. Once we have started to process and packed your order, when the first ship leaves China, refunds will no longer be available. If any part of an order cannot be delivered, then we will reimburse you the cost of this component, fees included. Refunds within the 14 days are reversed via Stripe to your credit card. Any refunds requested after the 14 days close of the campaign may be processed via PayPal or reversed via Stripe or your credit card. This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in the USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed.

TERMS & CONDITIONS
By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials, and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented in this Kickstarter project.

If you do not log in and confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email to confirm your pledge, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge if you contact us and confirm your pledge after the 8 week window has elapsed.

If you confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email, you agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our pledge manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods. We regret we are unable to ship to PO Boxes.

If these terms are not acceptable to you, then we suggest that you do not participate in this crowdfunding campaign and acquire the game when it is released in stores. Thank you for your understanding.

campaign.story:
Full Deck is an immersive, three-book escape puzzle collection, where you use a book of evidence, a serial killer's diary and a lone cop's sleep journal to piece together the  puzzles and mysteries contained within. 
Estimated total playing time: 10-12 hours!
For four long days in 2020, a serial killer terrorised a sleepy provincial town in England, and appeared to always be one step ahead of the Police. In order to fully close this case, the Police have now released three items, containing over 90 puzzles and mysteries, and are calling on you to help solve them...
 You can play Full Deck several ways:
Backing BOOKSHELF, which includes all three books
Backing ONLOOKER (digital) or CRIME BOARD (physical), which is a self-contained puzzle
Bookshelf 
Three distinct books make up the Full Deck set.
This  is a collection of three books, each set inside a crime narrative, where you have to piece together the clues and solve the 90 puzzles contained within.
The books consist of:  
A full-colour textured paperback book
Masterpiece - Released by the Police, this is a facsimile copy of the serial killer's diary. Read through the diary and see if you can uncover their motivation, plans and other nefarious ideas. The diary is written in broken prose, so you will need to have your most cryptic, riddling minds active to solve the challenges contained within.  
54 images of crucial evidence to solve the case.
Evidence - 54 specific items of interest to the Police, from ticket stubs to menu orders and receipts. This is a self-contained puzzle book, as each item also gives clues to a specific playing card value and suit. The items contribute heavily to the storyline, and will give valuable clues to solving the other puzzles.
The Evidence book also has answer grids. The Full Deck series uses a brand new answer validation system (BinCheck), so you will not need access to a computer to see if you are correct. This book will be fully printed in colour.
If you'd like to have have the actual pieces of evidence, please look at our Crime Board or Expert Reward. 
A full colour, glossy journal.
Redacted - A facsimile of the journal kept by the investigating Police Officer during the event. The pages have been written in detail, but you will need your powers of deduction (as well as some cross-referencing) in order to work out the information which has been redacted by the Police, for fear of reprisals or lawsuits. This book will be fully printed in colour.   
 Want to play the standalone game, with 54 pieces of facsimile evidence? Dust off your cork board, get your pins ready, and take a look at our Crime Board Reward...
 Crime Board 
54-pieces of facsimile evidence, from tickets stubs to crucial ephemera.
Also available is Crime Board. This is a physical collection of all the items of evidence, complete in a genuine evidence bag. Now is your chance to recreate your own crime board, by using these tickets, leaflets, photographs and receipts to build either a timeline of the events, or connect them together as a standalone puzzle.
Crime Board has a game built into it - each of the 54 items has a playing card suit and value hidden within it, so can be played either on it's own (find all the playing cards), or as part of the Full Deck game (for example, seeking out a name that visited a specific location from one of the pieces of evidence).
Some of the Crime Board elements in action!
Please note that the items in Crime Board are the same as those in the Evidence book, but we believe these add an exciting element to the game, and are perfect for a group of detectives to work through together! Below are some ways backers could play Crime Board:
Those with books might find the places items are mentioned at or hinted towards, and put them in those sections of the book.
Blu-tack a deck of cards on the wall, and see if you can place the right item on the right playing card (good for sifting evidence).
"Borrow" a rolling whiteboard from work and create a visual timeline.
Clear the table, and have friends over to sift and sort the clues, uncovering all the puzzles (remember, this is a standalone game, AND can be used with the books).
Reward Options 
For those on a budget, we are offering a digital-only copy of Evidence. If you love the idea of being your own detective, we are offering Crime Board, which is a physical collection of the evidence, supplied in a genuine evidence bag. For booklovers, you can back to get either the three copies on their own (Bookshelf Pledge), or you can upgrade to the Expert pledge, which includes all three books AND the Crime Board reward. Lastly, we have an extremely limited number of naming rewards available. Please note that these prices are below eventual retail prices.
Background
This has been created by Stephen, one half of The Escapages, publishers of Escape Books. We have published eight books so far, the most recent one, Flatpak, being successfully funded on Kickstarter in 2019. Flatpak was an interactive puzzle escape book in the guise of a furniture catalogue, and the full-colour print contained over 120 puzzles. 
"As a lifelong fan of crime fiction and drama, I have always been most interested in the little details; the crime board of evidence, the whiteboard timelines, the little baggies of clues, the serial killer's diary. I felt that there was an extraordinary opportunity to build a pacy narrative simply by using these materials alone. The result is this; an incredibly complex intertwining set of storylines, combined with photorealistic detail and some deliciously-challenging puzzles."
See Stephen talk about Escapages and the Full Deck project here (18 minute video).
Solve the riddles within the diary to help crack the case.
Details
How will the puzzles work?
There are three distinct types of puzzle included in Full Deck, outlined below. They are are ordered by difficulty, starting with the easiest.
Evidence - In this book are photographs of 54 key pieces of evidence from the Full Deck crime story. Contained within each item is a clue or hint toward an ordinary playing card suit and value - including two jokers.
Redacted - This book is the sleep journal of the investigating Police Officer, which has been check through by the Crown Prosecution Service, and key elements of the story have been redacted. The puzzles within this book rely on you drawing information from the journal itself, and Masterpiece.
Masterpiece - our killer wrote his plans and thoughts in prose, list, diagrams and poetry. You will have to dig through the book, sometimes linking information from Evidence and Redacted, in order to solve the riddles and puzzles contained within.
The journal will guide you, if you can only solve the redacted sections...
Schedule
To avoid any disappointment, we have created a schedule with enough breathing space to allow for any unforeseen minor delays, as outlined below. We aim to complete different milestones ahead of this, but hope that this gives some idea of what we are working toward.
August - October 2020 Completion of the text for Masterpiece and Redacted.
October 2020 Generation of the BinCheck grids. First Play test round.
November 2020 Typesetting of all three books.
December 2020 Printing of proof copies.
January 2021 Professional copy editing and proofreading. Play testing.
February 2021 Revisions made. Shipping costs and addresses confirmed.
March 2021 Worldwide dispatch.

Stretch Goals
We have built two complimentary products for Full Deck - the books, and the crime board set. Below are the stretch goals for them both:
As you can see, there are dedicated upgrades for both the books and the crime board. Please bear in mind that if you pledge at EXPERT level, you are contributing to scores for both! If someone backs just the books, that is added to the Bookshelf tally, and so on.
At the time of writing, we are already over halfway to our first Stretch Goal for both, so please read below to see how we can achieve this faster than you might expect.
We are trying something a little different for this campaign, and asking you to really help get the word out about this project on Social Media. To that end, we have built in a Sharing Stretch range of rewards too!
All you have to do is share the above link (bit.ly/BackFullDeck), and we will do the rest. Every validated click counts, and will earn more puzzles for the book set. Plus, if/when we reach 2,000 validated clicks, we will include a customised pin badge for all physical backers!
If you have a large fanbase online and would like a customised bit.ly link, please do get in touch via our messages, and we can provide one bespoke for you. Please get in touch for more details.

Shipping
Please note that shipping is not included in your pledge, and will instead by charged after the campaign using a pledge manager. There will be the option of standard or tracked shipping. Shipping is likely to be around £6 domestically, and £10 internationally, and will be calculated near to dispatch based on current rates and accurate weights. This shipping cost will not include any local taxes or import duties.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The Full Deck set of puzzles have already been play tested extensively using followers on our social media channels, the plot is fully designed and major elements of been written. Due to the challenges of COVID, we have put March 2021 as the completion date of the project, though we have planned a schedule that completes in advance of this. The experience of writing six puzzle books already, combined with successful work with play testers, proof readers and printers enables us to be confident in delivering a high quality and fascinating project.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
We will use high quality finish on our products that will make you proud to have them on your shelf.
Reusability and recyclability
We are utilising packaging where possible to become part of the final project. All materials will be recycled where possible.
Environmentally friendly factories
Our printer only uses environmentally certified and recycled materials. The wraparound packaging used for shipping is fully recyclable.
Sustainable Distribution
We promise to explore country-centred fulfilment, dependent on the volume of sales in key countries.
Something else
The project has been designed so as not to use any technology to solve the puzzles wherever possible. The aim is to be able to enjoy the books and solve the problems in a wifi-free log cabin.

campaign.story:
A  MODERN TWIST ON AN OLD TRADITION.
The beautifully designed  calendar that gives you the excitement of an Escape Room along with the reward of chocolate in your countdown to Christmas.  
 An Advent calendar combined with Escape Room puzzles.
  WHAT IS AN ESCAPE ROOM? 
An Escape Room is a brick and mortar location where you and your team must escape the room by solving the clues, puzzles and riddles. We wanted to bring the experience to your home at an affordable price, solving clues to get through a door without being locked in a room, truly...thinking outside the box. 
                Are you a brick and mortar Escape Room? - Check our Retailer pledge
                                                                      ________
A unique design that will fascinate and engage anyone who likes to keep their minds active. 
We have spent a year of planning and testing to make sure these calendars work for you. We hope that you enjoy playing the puzzles and look forward to opening each window before the big day.
                           "... It was great to see the delight on their faces when they knew they had found the correct answer."     - Beta tester parent.
Each A3 sized calendar has an array of Christmas related puzzles. Some will be quick to solve, some have to be unscrambled and some may need to be decoded with the help of the back of the advent calendar. Everything you need is on the calendar. However, if you get really stuck there is our website you can go to with step by step hints.
                               WHO ARE WE?
We are Escape Room designers who have been creating Escape Room experiences in Peterborough UK. We have created brick and mortar Escape games, mobile team challenges and have been commissioned for quick play games for 5 years now. 
We want to bring people together with the enjoyment of puzzle solving and get that fist pump moment when you have found the solution and then have to wait in anticipation for the next day.

Only 4 days left till the big day. We hope you have enjoyed your calendars so far. Due to the overwhelming support we will definitely be back next year, maybe with a couple of new designs. We will update you with some of our plans in the new year.

What we learned so far.

As stated on the calendar and in our campaign we put dark chocolates inside for your Christmas treat.
However, we have received some comments that the first few days have been tasting of mint. We tested the chocolates from the calendars recently and also when we received them in October and they were all dark chocolate.

December is here!

Hello everyone, we just wanted to send you a quick message. We hope you are excited to open your calendars and that you enjoy the journey of puzzles ahead of you. It has been a long time of planning, testing and creating to bring these to life and because of you they are now out there in homes waiting to be played. We hope they bring you a little bit of joy each day.

campaign.story:
Reverse - The Dark Village
The Dark Village is a narrative adventure game, playable solo or more. It invites you to investigate in a strange place in order to discover the truth about your past.
The game offers 2 different and complementary endings, and several hours of gameplay.
The game takes place in a small village at the end of the 19th century. You play as a person looking for answers about past events. 
The mechanics of the game is directly linked to the twist of the game, so we can't say more. 
It is a game of exploration and deduction, a kind of game where you are the hero but in an open world. 
The size of the box is optimized and it can be taken with you anywhere. You will only need a pencil to take notes and nothing else. An adventure that fits in your pocket.
The game comes with 10 booklets of 16 pages each, and the rules are very short, you start the adventure after a few seconds of reading.
The game will be printed on recycled paper, 90g sheets and handmade in France.
It's impossible to reveal more without spoiling the game itself, as the mystery is part of the Reverse experience.
An extract
The box
Mini edition on demand
The goal of Tiny Concept is to offer you original games, with strong themes or messages, manufactured in small series and especially on demand. There will be no printed copies in advance that may end up going to waste. Thanks to this short circuit, we can offer you really original games and experiment new ideas and concepts. This is a modest, original, minimalist and almost intimate adventure.
The mystery remains
In order not to reveal you the plot, nor the main mechanics of the game, we do not offer you the rules in PDF, nor a trial version.
The creations of Tiny Concept
Tiny Concept offers several free PNP games on the Do It Your Game store. 
One of the creators, Vianney Carvalho, already has several games to his credit. You can find the files on Boardgamegeek.com
Shipping
Gift
As we said earlier, we didn't want to add a stretchgoal that is not used in the game.
So we thought of giving you this little numbered certificate as a gift in the form of a card, which can also be used as a bookmark.
The number 500 on the picture of the card is only an example, we don't know the final print yet.
the last-minute gift

updates.update_userinfo: a story of paper and folds / une histoire de papiers et de plis
updates.update_content:
Hello friends backers

A news to keep you up to date and give you some details, now that we have the game in hand. 
We received the game from our printer. Because seeing the quantity to be realized we thought it would be more reasonable for our health to go through a professional, located in France, to give more quality to the game. And for that, we chose to print on PEFC paper, which respects the environment. This paper is semi-glazed, we chose this quality so that the game lasts longer in time, the color will not go away and the paper will be less likely to tear with the many manipulations (but that we let you discover). Moreover, the game will be of better quality, but also easier to fold for us, because with 48 000 sheets to fold by hand, we prefer to make it a little easier.

In the last news, we announced that we will soon start production. Which should have been the case if 2 big worries hadn't appeared.
The first one is our move, which should not have been done at this date, but after the production of the dark village. So we had to find a house and move in urgently. But now, it is settled and we are well installed... phew!
The second concern the English translation which was in the hands of our corector, but also those of his proofreaders, who unfortunately got behind schedule in order to make the best possible translation.

Hello
We hope you had a good holiday and are in great shape.
We come to give you some news. The correction and the translation are coming to an end, so we will be able to start manufacturing.
During this time we have started working on the second Reverse, but also on 2 role-playing projects, which will be offered in a rather special form, which we hope you will like.

campaign.story:
What is The Labyrinth Puzzle Challenge?
The Labyrinth is a unique multi-platform experience unlike any other - a combination of an escape room, puzzle hunt, mystery novel, and alternate reality game. You will receive a crate full of everything you need to participate in the challenge from the comfort of your home, including engaging physical hands-on puzzles, puzzle boxes, an online forum, models, photos, printed maps, tools, and ciphers. The goal of the challenge is to move through the rooms of a mythical labyrinth, solve the different clues in each room, and advance to the  center. Each puzzle leads into the next,  and to solve them all,  you will need to think outside of the box!
Over 55 Puzzles To Solve for Hours of Entertainment
The Labyrinth Puzzle Challenge will include hands-on physical puzzles, paper puzzles, mechanical puzzles, ciphers, folding puzzles, logic puzzles, illusions, riddles, and pattern games. We are designing each puzzle ourselves specifically for The Labyrinth, and are placing an emphasis on immersive puzzles with physical objects and unique solutions.
DECIPHER CLUES AND SOLVE PUZZLES
To complete the challenge, you must use clues to solve many smaller puzzles, which will lead to other clues in a larger interwoven narrative. Once you solve the smaller puzzles, you can  combine the solutions in order to unlock and solve the overarching meta-puzzles.
Solving all of the puzzles in the Labyrinth Puzzle Challenge will provide at least 8-10 hours of puzzle-solving and clue-cracking for a group of 3-4 people. The challenge can be played individually or with a group, and the game includes a huge number of puzzles and associated content. We have designed puzzles that will be accessible to people who have never participated in a puzzle hunt or escape room, as well as puzzles that will challenge even the most experienced puzzle hunters and escape room addicts. Some puzzles will be easily and quickly solved, while others require a more in-depth examination. The complete Labyrinth challenge is designed to provide hours of entertainment and immersion into this unique experience, with a story that unfolds as the puzzles progress.
 The Labyrinth Puzzle Challenge Will Include 55+ Puzzles With: 
- At least 8 hands-on physical puzzles. More will be added as stretch goals are unlocked.
- 2 Large-scale locked boxes with hidden compartments, and additional puzzles embedded within.
- At least 4 hand-crafted puzzle boxes with multi-step solutions. 
- Multiple paper puzzles that can be examined, manipulated, and assembled, including ciphers, posters, maps, and folding puzzles.
- The Labyrinth Solution Log Book - for recording notes, theories, and the puzzle solutions. Use the Solution Log Book to keep track of information for previous clues and solve the meta-puzzles.
- Online content including a solution-checking forum, hint-system, and additional online story components.
- 360 Degree Virtual Reality spaces for several of the clues,  as well as cardboard VR glasses to view them. Become immersed in the world of the Labyrinth and solve the clues hidden within its walls.
 The Idea
The idea behind The Labyrinth is to create a game of puzzles and riddles that anyone can participate in from anywhere in the world, and to encourage people to  use their imaginations and enjoy the experience of working to solve the clues in a unique treasure hunt.
There are many incredible existing large-scale treasure hunts, but many rely on all participants being in the same city. The goal of The Labyrinth is to give everyone who loves puzzles access to this kind of experience.
THE BACKSTORY:
In many of the sacred histories of the world's oldest empires, there are references to the legendary King Lars Porsena, who ruled the Etruscan Empire from the capital city of Clusium in 500 BC.
 Upon his death, Porsena ordered the construction of a tomb within a vast hidden labyrinth, a place to conceal the treasures of his empire.  Porsena tasked his most ingenious subjects with devising a series of challenges to fill every room along the path to the center, and decreed that  whoever could decipher these clues and reach the heart of the maze would claim the treasure. 
In 89 BC, the Roman general Cornelius Sulla sacked Clusium, and razed the monumental structure marking the Labyrinth's entrance to the ground. All knowledge of the labyrinth was subsequently lost with those who perished.
For centuries, archaeologists and explorers have painstakingly searched for clues and information about the entrance, with no results.
 Until, in a recent excavation, an ancient talisman was uncovered deep within what was believed to be one of regal Etruscan tombs. Working with astronomers to decipher the symbols on the talisman, the leaders of the excavation produced a series of coordinates for a remote location. A scan of the area with the latest sonar technology has revealed a series of previously undiscovered caves, which seem to connect to a network of tunnels that stretch for miles underground ...
Now, a team of treasure hunters has asked you to join them as they enter the Labyrinth and attempt to solve the series of enigmas that lead to the treasure room.
If you choose to enter, beware -- The Etruscan Empire devised the puzzles to provide a challenge for even the most clever solvers. They also created many additional defense measures to safeguard their treasures from outsiders, and an ancient force, embedded within the Labyrinth's very walls, continues to fortify this place against intrusion. The only way out of the maze is through its center, and if you are not careful, you could find yourself trapped within its endless myriad of rooms. Though the risks are great, an unimaginable treasure awaits you if you succeed.
To Play:
Step 1: Receive the full Labyrinth crate, with all of the clues locked within.
Step 2: Crack the codes, decipher the clues, and begin solving the puzzles.
 Step 3: Solve the physical hands-on puzzles, open additional locked boxes, and verify your solutions in the online forum. Discover the story of the Labyrinth as the clues unfold. 


Step 4: Write down each of the puzzle solutions. These will be used in the Labyrinth's meta-puzzles.
Pledge Levels
We are offering a variety of rewards for different pledge levels, and hope that there will be something for everyone in our range of reward tiers!
The Stretch Goals
From additional puzzles to new VR spaces, we have a number of stretch goals planned for the campaign. More will be added as each level is unlocked.
We unlocked all of our original campaign Stretch Goals! For the last two days of the campaign, we are adding in one additional bonus stretch goal, a new artifact for backers, hidden within one of the puzzles.
Timeline
 *Please note that this represents our conservative timeline, from the campaign through production and fulfillment, with built-in extra time for unexpected delays in manufacturing and shipping. We will of course try to send the rewards out sooner, and will continue to share project updates with backers.
The Budget Breakdown:
Fabricating the Rewards: 60%
Shipping and warehouse fees: 20%
Taxes and duties: 10%
Kickstarter fees and payment processing fees: 10%
Shipping
We are partnering with fulfillment and distribution centers to lower our shipping costs, and to ensure that backers' funds are devoted to the development of the puzzles, and not to the shipping. Please note that the list below shows estimates for the shipping costs based on current prices, and shipping will be charged after the campaign concludes through a pledge manager. Depending on your address and the cost of postage during the fulfillment period, shipping cost may be adjusted by marginal amounts.
Customs Friendly Shipping to backers in the US, EU, Canada, Australia, and China. Backers outside of these regions will be responsible for any taxes or duties that arise during shipping.
 Below is a Breakdown of Shipping Costs For Different Regions:
United States - Treasure Hunter in Training Puzzle: Free, All other Reward Tiers: $14
Canada - Treasure Hunter in Training Puzzle: $5, All other Reward Tiers: $22
United Kingdom and EU Group 1 (Sweden, Spain, Slovenia, Slovakia, Poland, Netherlands, Luxembourg, Lithuania, Italy, Ireland, Hungary, Germany, France, Czech Republic, Belgium, Austria) - Treasure Hunter in Training Puzzle: $5, All other Reward Tiers: $22
EU Group 2 (Romania, Portugal, Malta, Latvia, Greece, Finland, Estonia, Denmark, Cyprus, Croatia, Bulgaria) - Treasure Hunter in Training Puzzle: $5, All other Reward Tiers: $26
China, Macao, Hong Kong - Treasure Hunter in Training Puzzle: $5, All other Reward Tiers: $26
East Asia (Japan, South Korea, Singapore, Malaysia, Philippines, Taiwan, Thailand, Vietnam) -Treasure Hunter in Training Puzzle: $6, All other Reward Tiers: $36
Norway and Switzerland -  Treasure Hunter in Training Puzzle: $8, All other Reward Tiers: $30
Australia - Treasure Hunter in Training Puzzle: $6, All other Reward Tiers: $24
New Zealand -  Treasure Hunter in Training Puzzle: $8, All other Reward Tiers: $39
All Other Countries: Treasure Hunter in Training Puzzle: $15, All other Reward Tiers: $55+ **
**All other countries disclaimer: We are willing to ship worldwide, but please note that countries not listed in the shipping chart above will be considered as “ship at your own risk.” This means that we will not be liable for mishandled packages. Due to USPS restrictions, we will be unable to ship to the countries listed under "International Mail Service Suspensions" on the USPS Website: USPS Link 
Why Pledge During the Campaign?
Because this game has many unique components that we are manufacturing ourselves, we don't plan on ever being able to give The Labyrinth Puzzle Challenge a commercial release. Our plan for the Labyrinth is to run this Kickstarter campaign (and only on Kickstarter, not on any other platform), and then ship the orders to our backers. This means that if you would like to be able to experience this game, pledging to the campaign is the best way to do so, as we will not be offering additional releases.
The Labyrinth Puzzle Challenge is a passion project, one that is two years in the making. Our goal is to create a unique, well-crafted, and immersive experience, and we promise to create a game that we and our backers can be proud of. Thank you so much to our backers for all of the support!
A Note on the Types of Materials Used in the Standard, Deluxe, and Collector's Edition Tiers
We have received a few questions from backers concerning the difference between the materials used in the Standard Edition of the game and the upgraded components in the Deluxe and Collectors Editions, so we would like to take the opportunity to post a few samples of the materials used in the game.
We love the feel of wooden mechanical puzzles and puzzle boxes, and puzzles in the Standard version of the game will be made primarily out of Baltic birch and pine, both of which are a durable and high-quality materials that are the industry standard, and they will be sanded, stained, and sealed to provide a quality finish. Puzzles in the Deluxe version of the game will be made from varieties of hardwood that are considered to be more premium materials for woodworking (like maple, oak, and walnut), because of their richer grains and textures. These kinds of woods have a great feel to them, and they complement the look of the game as high-quality artifacts. Components that will be upgraded in the deluxe version of the game include all of the physical puzzles, including the puzzle boxes, larger locked boxes, and the mechanical puzzles (at least 15 puzzles that are integral to the Labyrinth, and potentially more as stretch goals are unlocked). Additionally, the paper puzzles in the deluxe version will be upgraded to art-quality prints on museum quality paper. In a nutshell, the standard version is more for backers who would like to play the game with well-crafted components, while the Deluxe and Collectible versions are more for backers seeking beautifully and meticulously crafted display-quality puzzles that are both part of the game and keepsakes in their own right. 
In the photo, the piece on the left is a drawer from one of the puzzle boxes in the standard edition, made of the baltic birch plywood. It is a lighter material, but still very sturdy and durable.
The two wood pieces in the middle are red oak (which is placed so that it is covering a spoiler), a puzzle box made from rosewood, and the sample on the far right is walnut, which are all materials that we are using in the deluxe and collectors versions of the game. (In the standard version, puzzles in the lighter baltic birch are sometimes stained to look like a darker wood.) The Deluxe materials are heartier, and have a smoother feel. We are very proud of both versions, and are excited to fabricate these puzzles for our backers.
Follow Us For More Information about the Labyrinth
We'll be posting campaign updates, sample puzzles, and special promotions throughout the Kickstarter, so head on our to the Labyrinth social media pages to stay up-to-date on all of the bonus content!
Instagram: @labyrinthpuzzlechallenge
Facebook: Labyrinth Puzzle Challenge
Email: ellusionadventuregames@gmail.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Fabricating the Rewards and Testing the Puzzles:
We have already designed the paper puzzles, puzzle boxes, and mechanical puzzles, and will be manufacturing them in-house. For this reason, we do not anticipate major manufacturing delays, as we will have a hand in every aspect of the manufacturing and fabrication process. We have also built in additional time in the production schedule to account for delays in shipments of raw materials (like the wood needed to build the puzzles) and equipment failures (like needing to repair a laser cutter, printer, or CNC machine.) 
We will also extensively playtest all puzzles to ensure that they are solvable, and also present the proper degree of challenge level. We have already tested the majority of puzzles during the development phase with a dedicated group of puzzle hunt and escape room enthusiasts, and will continue to do so should any design changes arise.
All puzzles and game materials shown in the campaign represent prototypes from our development and playtesting, and illustrate the standard of quality and quantity of puzzles within the Labyrinth Puzzle Challenge. Puzzle designs may change during the fabrication phase, but all designs will still represent this standard. We will strive to produce puzzles of the highest quality, and we will keep backers updated as the fabrication process progresses.


Refunds
All pledges may be refunded up to 14 days after the conclusion of the Kickstarter campaign. We will be unable to refund the charges incurred by Pledge Manager, Kickstarter, or other charges for your payment (for example: PayPal, VISA, credit card...). This represents approximately 10-15% of the full payment. Partial Refunds may be issued after this period on a case-by-case basis in extreme instances if requested. After we have started the packaging and shipment process (3-months prior to the shipping date) we will no longer be able to process refunds of any kind.
Please also note that anyone who does not complete the pledge manager survey by the required deadlines will not be eligible for a refund. Additionally, not filling out the pledge manager survey may cause a delay in the shipping of their rewards.

Shipping
Organizing the shipping and fulfillment schedule for a puzzle hunt with multiple components is a complex undertaking, and we will be partnering with a fulfillment company to ensure that the shipping process runs as smoothly (and as cost-effectively) as possible. We want to ensure that pledge funds are devoted to the production of the game, and not to high shipping prices. Shipping will be charged following the conclusion of the campaign by our pledge manager. While shipping estimates are based on current shipping costs, changes in postage rates may result in adjustments to these amounts. We are offering customs-friendly shipping to the US, Canada, EU, UK, AU, NZ, and China. Backers outside of these countries may need to pay additional customs, duties, taxes or VAT charges.

campaign.story:
DO YOU LOVE PUZZLES?  PLAYING CARDS?  BOTH!?  If so, we've got just the thing for you!
Hello! Welcome to my Kickstarter Campaign for an exciting and innovative deck of playing cards called ENIGMAS. And I'm thrilled to tell you all about this project and the creative team behind it. 
My name is David Kwong and I am both a New York Times crossword puzzle constructor and a magician. My entire life is about puzzles: from creating magic tricks (another type of puzzle!) to writing secret codes and ciphers.
ENIGMAS combines all of these exciting and intriguing worlds. Puzzles within puzzles within puzzles, within a luxury deck of custom playing cards. And all of this is themed on an estate shrouded in mystery called Riverbank ...
Included within this fully functional, seemingly regular deck of playing cards are four very special cards, each with its own puzzle for you to solve. These puzzles are not too hard, I promise! They just require you to think slightly outside the box. Fun for all ages!
Solving all four puzzles will unlock an incredible, multilayered, eight-step puzzle hunt expertly designed by Dave Shukan, master puzzle-maker. Combine answers from every puzzle you've solved along the way and you will reveal the final, meta-puzzle answer. A true puzzler’s paradise! 
Included with ENIGMAS are Four Puzzle Cards
Unlock a multi-layered Puzzle Hunt themed on the Fabyan estate.
ENIGMAS are themed on a fascinating historical place -- a mysterious estate outside of Chicago called Riverbank. Over one hundred years ago, the scientists at Riverbank worked on cryptography projects: the estate was filled with secret messages and codes. And exotic animals like alligators, peacocks, monkeys and bears roamed the property!  
Riverbank Estate (c. 1915)
Illustrator Billy French has masterfully captured all of these bizarre and beautiful elements into the ENIGMAS design. The card backs are adorned with historically accurate imagery from the Riverbank estate, like its windmill and lighthouse. Owls, representing wisdom and learning, are perched on the bookshelves, guarding its secrets. 
The elegance of ENIGMAS begins with the tuck box. It was carefully and meticulously designed to be the perfect home for these beautiful playing cards. Enter through the gates, guarded by eagles to enter the exciting world of ENIGMAS. 
From the thick, Premium Rhino Grey Vellum paper stock to the Navy & Powder Blue Pantone Inks encased in a striking layer of clear foil, we've elevated these cards in every possible way -- a deck of pure luxury. Finally, each tuck is secured with the Riverbank name and it's iconic ram's head postage stamp-style deck seal.
ENIGMAS Tuck Box complete with premium vellum paper stock and high-gloss details
While the ENIGMAS face cards may appear familiar, they are far from the standard found in most modern decks. To keep the ENIGMAS deck authentic with its historical past, The United States Playing Card Company has graciously provided us with historical artwork for the cards faces that date back to the early 1900s.   
Historical Early 1900's USPCC Squeezer Court Cards
The scientists at Riverbank championed “Knowledge is Power” where they were most known for their work on codes and ciphers.  Have we hidden codes on the back of the deck for you to discover and decipher? 
YES, WE MOST CERTAINLY DID!
In this deck of cards you'll discover codes and hidden messages. Is there something going on with this bookshelf? You bet! Are there more codes elsewhere? You double bet! 
ENIGMAS wouldn't be complete without a set of Jokers...or in this case, the Riverbank Peacocks!
ENIGMAS Set of Jokers
ENIGMAS Uncut Sheets - these are the playing cards pulled from the factory press before being cut into cards. A collectors dream!
The Limited Edition Red ENIGMAS puzzle hunt deck will only ever be printed once as a companion deck to the Original Blue ENIGMAS.  This means the only way to obtain this deck is by backing this Kickstarter with at least 1 Blue ENIGMAS deck.
Similar to that of the Original Blue, we will be using premium paper stocks, inks and foils however in the Limited Edition Reds, an extra layer of embossing will be added and a very special die-cutting on the back design.  These die-cut windows will showcase the playing card back design secured inside the tuck box. See below:
Original Blue ENIGMAS meet the Limited Edition Red ENIGMAS
Original Blues & Limited Edition Reds
exposed view of the L.E. Reds die-cut tuck box
Over the past 9 months, this extraordinary team has worked feverishly together researching, creating and illustrating both this stunningly unique deck of playing cards and the extremely fun puzzle hunt that comes with it! Special thanks to the Budos Band for providing the soundtrack to our campaign video. 
Meet the ENIGMAS team:

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The team behind ENIGMAS has produced over 15 decks of playing cards and over the years we have learned the process of perfecting the craft and have been very successful at creating new and innovative ways to design and produce playing cards. When producing a deck of playing cards we work closely with the manufacturer, in this case with The United States Playing Card Company, overseeing every detail and confirming that the quality is up to our highest standards. We also check and recheck all the proofs, constantly searching for any flaws in color, contrast, border registration, and alignment of artwork. 

Additionally, we carefully select the paper stocks and finishes of the playing cards, along with the Pantone inks and foils involved with the manufacturing of the tuck box. With current state of the world as a result of COVID-19 it is hard to determine if there will be any delays in the future preventing this deck to be manufactured however at this time, the USPCC is fully operational and we do not anticipate any major issues, delays or setbacks in the manufacturing process of the ENIGMAS playing cards. If you have any questions or concerns at all, please feel free to message us through Kickstarter, and we will respond to you in a timely manner. Please note we cannot control the rate at which messages may be received, please allow at 24 -48 hours for a response.

campaign.story:
Introducing two brand new expansions that add dimensions of extra gameplay possibilities to TOKYO TSUKIJI MARKET & TOKYO METRO!
TOKYO TSUKIJI EXPANSION adds new fish markets, ships, and renting opportunities to the acclaimed open economic simulator in the Tsukiji fish market of Tokyo. 
OSAKA METRO EXPANSION builds on the original unique system design of Tokyo Metro, with a brand new map and set of action cards that can be used for a quicker game!
TOKYO TSUKIJI MARKET is player driven economic game with many layers and endless modular possibilities. It utilizes an array of fish markets, external markets, and player owned harbors where you can build a fishing fleet and sell fish at your own pricing.
TOKYO TSUKIJI EXPANSION builds on the modular system of Tsukiji Market by adding incredible new markets that allow for things such as ship rentals, market crash consequences, variable swordfish auctions, and much more!
TOKYO METRO is a one of a kind investment train game that blends seamlessly with a worker placement system and spatial strategy. You'll be able to invest in 12 train lines with stocks, speculate against others, invest in stations for income, move on an actual map of the Tokyo Metro system, and much more!
OSAKA METRO EXPANSION takes advantage of the innovative mechanics in Tokyo Metro, but brings a brand new tighter map of the Osaka Metro and a whole new unique set of action cards. The game is a punchier, quicker take and brings the opportunity to use the new actions cards with the Tokyo map, and vice versa.
TOKYO TSUKIJI MARKET
Watch the how to play video above for an overview, or read the rulebook at jordandraper.com/rules. You can even try the game for free below on Tabletop Simulator!
TOKYO TSUKIJI EXPANSION
View the beta rules for Tokyo Tsukiji Expansion by clicking above, or try the game yourself on Tabletop Simulator by clicking the image below! 
TOKYO METRO
Watch the how to play video above for an overview, or read the rulebook at jordandraper.com/rules. You can even try the game for free below on Tabletop Simulator!
OSAKA METRO EXPANSION
View the beta rules for Osaka Metro Expansion by clicking above, or try the game yourself on Tabletop Simulator by clicking the image below!
To learn more about the games below, head over to jordandraper.com. You can add as many of these games as you like by increasing your pledge by the amount shown in that games section, and I will collect your add on choices when the campaign ends. There is no extra shipping cost to add anything shown here to your pledge!
This special version of Currency Sakana is only available by backing the Kickstarter! If we hit our 72 hour stretch goal, it will be available along with any other currency for just $15. Sakana Fireburn features a blazing natural coloring that is achieved by heat treating the metal coins at extreme temperatures under just the right conditions. Every coin is unique!
Mirror is the second zine from Jordan Draper Games, co-designed with the talented actor and designer Freddie Watkins, it features group exercises that bring introspection, healing, comedy, and much more. You can even play it over video call during the pandemic.
"Mirror is a group session zine with a collection of exercises designed to provide a moment of personal and communal reflection. Our every day life is full of distractions, this zine explores how ritual and engagement can help us to think positively towards ourselves and each other. "
Of course it is! By pledging during this campaign you will not only receive a discount, but you'll help bring these beautiful expansions to life that myself and other play testers have spent a long time developing. The games are not just pretty, don't take my word for it, read on below!
"Tsukiji Market is the most interesting economic game in recent memory I’ve played. The variability in the base game after dozens of plays has allowed me to see each game branch into interesting and unique strategies. The expansion markets make the game even more interesting and strategic. This expansion content may push this game into top 5 territory for me." -Joe Wiggins
TSUKIJI MARKET FIRST IMPRESSIONS - MARK WATSON
"I expect this is going to end up on a regular rotation when I attend games nights; it hits the sweet spot of being straightforward enough I wouldn't hesitate to introduce it to a table of new boardgamers while having enough meat on it's bones that even the more seasoned players are likely to find something to chew on, and all in a fairly small footprint and sub-two hour playing time." - Mark Watson

"I can’t think of a game that has provided me with more unique and enjoyable experiences in recent memory than Tokyo Tsukiji Market. Where you go in to the game with the intention of flooding the market with cheap Mackeral using your barge, or you want to corner a strategic edge over swordfish, or sell your salmon to yourself at the foreign market, every game provides a wildly different experience based on what markets are available. The expansion also provides a number of new and diverse strategies to explore, and I’d highly recommend it to both new and experience economic gamers. TTM combines the economic elements of a shared economy from Container with the highly variable and asymmetric gameplay of Sidereal Confluence and the result is something special." -Andrew Plassard
 TOKYO TSUKIJI MARKET FIRST PLAY IMPRESSIONS - RYAN MCSWAIN
"Jordan Draper fit so much game into this tiny box. The graphic design and component quality are top notch, and the gameplay is fun with loads of replayability...The whole table felt really engaged throughout the game, and afterward they spoke about the process and outcome at great length. I get the idea this will hit the table again, along with the rest of the Tokyo series." -Ryan McSwain
TOKYO METRO - CHRISTIAN K
"Tokyo Metro is a cool game that puts a ton of gameplay in a tiny charming box. It has an awesome innovative take on worker-placement, tons of player interaction and mixes euro-style mechanisms and economic-style scoring in strange and exotic ways." -Christian K
SOUNDS LIKE TOKYO, JOE - TOKYO METRO REVIEW - JASON MOORE
"There is something about the work of Jordan Draper, the designer of Tokyo Metro, et al, that I find uniquely captivating. Every cog is the perfect size and shape, everything does its job just so. They’re intricate, and they speak to an informed overview of the hobby, as well as a desire to recreate aspects of it in a unique way.
There is so much about this game that impresses me – and I really enjoy it. The wooden components are great; the money looks gorgeous. The rulebook is clear; the box remarkably compact – and the game that pulls itself out of it is a colossus." -Jason Moore
WORKER PLACEMENT MEETS CUBE RAILS - TONY CHEN
"The game is definitely and deliciously a train game through and through. It’s a cube rails with stock portfolio management. It’s an economic game with cash flow management. It’s a route planning game with profit stealing and sabotage. And it does it all through its central mechanism of worker placement.
Tokyo Metro is a beautiful marriage of economic games and worker placement. We highly recommend it if you like economic games, particularly ones focusing on cashflow over incentive management." -Tony Chen
GOING UNDERGROUND - TOKYO METRO REVIEW - CRAIG TAYLOR
"Without a shadow of a doubt, Tokyo Metro is the most interesting game I played in December 2017, in a December where I played a disproportionately high number of new games. There’s decent depth contained herein without outrageous amounts of complexity to enable it.
This game is exciting, but not in the conventional way of ‘contains glossy components’ or ‘hyped from a super marketing drive’. It excites me due to mechanical rigour, providing a platform for an exceptionally interactive experience. Furthermore, I can say, without reservation that it is not like anything else I’ve seen before." -Craig Taylor
TOKYO METRO REVIEW - EXTENSIVE RAPID TRANSIT SYSTEM - MEEPLE MOUNTAIN
"There are so many exciting things to talk about in Tokyo Metro. In a lot of ways, the game reminds me of some of my favorite games.
All of the components fit in a box much smaller than most games with similar depth. The artwork and graphic design of the game fades into the background while you’re playing but keeps me focused on the game...interesting and detailed enough but not intrusive enough to pull my focus from the gameplay. In order to make the overall aesthetic and small box work, the board and stock chart are made of cloth and I really like this change. The cloth boards work incredibly well and I hope more publishers opt to make that decision." -Meeple Mountain
A FASCINATING GAME - TOKYO METRO - BLAKE MORRIS
"TOKYO METRO is part of a larger gaming concept which includes various types of games... I also strongly recommend the metal money (a double set if you can afford it!), which may not be available much longer. I can’t think immediately of any other “train” game incorporating worker placement. The mechanism involving timed appearance of various action cards keeps the game from becoming stale and repetitive...I recommend it strongly to anyone who wants to play a meaty game without too much complexity." -Blake Morris
TOKYO METRO REVIEW - THE BOARD GAME DETECTIVE
"Beautiful production. This seems to be a signature of Jordan Draper. I love the unique cloth map with it’s vibrant colours and iconic design. The cards and wooden/resin pieces are all really lovely too. It’s obvious there was a lot of attention to detail in this production…The most portable heavy game I own! TOKYO METRO‘s unique combination of both aesthetic design and game design is worth a look." -The Board Game Detective
AN ISLAYTHEDRAGON REVIEW - TOKYO METRO - ALEX SINGH
"I didn’t know what to expect when I first played TOKYO METRO and even after having played it, I don’t know if I could give you an elevator pitch for it. It’s an odd duck in the train game world, but one that I find strangely enjoyable. Investing and symbiotic relationships are a surefire way to get my attention and TOKYO METRO executes it in such a delightfully strange way that I’m sure to be exploring the metro for some time to come." -Alex Singh 
Like all of my projects, I ship to every country in the world! As we have shifted to friendly shipping in the EU, CA, AU/NZ, and the US, there will be a separate VAT charge based on your total pledge if you live in Canada or the EU. The most you will have to pay is +$5 for Canada, and +$10 in the EU. This charge will be calculated and charged after the campaign is over, likely through Backerkit. All other locations will have no added charges.

campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
In partnership with Panda Manufacturing, we aim for the highest possible quality, durability, and quality control that a mass produced game can achieve. My design goal is to create a product that will last you as long as you wish to have it, even if passed down through generations, while still making it possible to end the products life cycle through recycling.
Reusability and recyclability
Whenever possible I make sure the materials and components in my games are recyclable, or reusable. I am constantly making improvements to ensure nothing ends up in a landfill. Part of this mission involves adding continuous new mixed game rules to the TOKYO SERIES as a whole, breathing new life into your existing games.
Sustainable materials
All paper production is sourced from 30% recycled paper.
Environmentally friendly factories
Panda Manufacturing uses ethical business practices both in its environmental choices and culture. I looked hard to find a manufacturing partner that I believed in for both their material and employment ethics. They are BSCI certified and I keep up a constant conversation with them about ways we can both improve board game manufacturing to help the planet and the humans who inhabit it.
Sustainable Distribution
There will be a single sea freight trip, and then a single shipment of your game afterward. If electric freight shipping were available on the ocean, I would gladly pay extra for it, but until then we will continue with the best we options we have. My freight partner OTX is very efficient and reliable, making the freight trip accountable and trackable to ensure we have the best route.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
• Production
Production is partially handled in-house (yes, we are control freaks) but more complex elements are being manufactured by print professionals. We're working hard to make sure that all components appear the same as shown in the prototype images. Please note that due to material availability and manufacturing processes, you may still see a slight difference (i.e. color saturation, paper texture.)
All the web components of the games are being hosted securely and all have backups, so you shouldn't worry about not being able to access them in the foreseeable future.

• Art & Design
We're actively working on the creative part of Chapter One. To make sure there are no delays on the creative front, we've decided not to wait until the end of the campaign and we've already hired the illustrator & extra writing staff. If we reach certain stretch goals, there may be additional artwork to produce, but we don’t foresee this causing any delays.

• Shipping
We are planning to begin the shipping process immediately following the end of the campaign. We're doing our best to subsidize your shipping costs as much as we can, even if it means covering the whole fee for the package for Journey backers in USA & Canada and most of the shipping fee for the EU.
Delivering hundreds of envelopes around the world is not an easy task, and we all understand there are many factors that could cause delays. This is why our biggest pledge for all 13 games offers most of the games to be shipped in one box. This way we majorly reduce the chances of one of your 13 envelopes to be lost, damaged, or delayed when sent as a letter mail.
Please note that if you're outside of US & Canada and you add the "Almost Subscription" add-on that offers all your 13 envelopes to be shipped separately, the shipping will be considered to be “at your own risk”, meaning we cannot be responsible for mishandled packages.
Any issues with delivery will be handled individually and in-house. We're prepared to send replacements when it makes sense.

• Additional Fees & Customs
One of the reasons we're heavily subsidizing our shipping costs is because VAT, customs, or other local shipping fees are unfortunately not covered and processed on our end. We currently have only twenty EU & Asian backers, so we are prepared to serve you personally and case by case.
To be more accessible for International backers of all 13 games, we added the "Almost Subscription" add-on that offers all your 13 envelopes to be shipped as letter mail, not in a box. According to our research, letter mail is exempt from VAT in most countries, so we're hoping this option will help you save some $.

• Refunds
As of launch, we haven't found any pledge managers for post-campaign processing we're happy with, so we'll be handling everything in-house.
You are welcome to manage your pledge during the campaign (we really hope that 40 days are enough for you to make a final decision and we will make sure to send an update 48/24h before the end of the campaign to remind you to manage your pledge.) Once the campaign ends, we will send out final surveys and we will start the shipping process immediately. Once your order has been processed for shipping, we will no longer be able to offer refunds. 

• Unforeseen Events
While we can't anticipate everything, we feel that we are prepared to deal with all the issues if and when they occur. We are committed to you all and will always keep you updated about any changes that might affect this project. We respect our backers and we have a moral obligation to ensure everyone receives what they pledged for. By pledging to this project, you are indicating that you understand and give consent to the risks, challenges, and pledge terms laid out above. Thank you for your support, we are excited to share this project with everyone!

campaign.story:
Welcome to the Generic Universal RolePlaying System!
With GURPS, you can be anyone you want – an elf hero fighting for the forces of good, a shadowy femme fatale on a deep-cover mission, a futuristic swashbuckler carving up foes with a force sword in his hand and a beautiful woman by his side . . . or literally anything else! Thanks to its flexibility, quality writing, and ease of use, GURPS has been the premiere universal roleplaying game for over three decades! 
More than 1,500,000 copies are in print – not counting foreign editions. GURPS Lite, a 32-page distillation of the basic GURPS rules, is available for free download. We also have dozens of GURPS adventures and e-books available on Warehouse 23.
Whatever your favorite roleplaying genre might be, GURPS can handle it. More about GURPS . . . 
The GURPS team, under the direction of GURPS Line Editor Sean Punch, has prepared a dozen different PDFs . . . and this is your chance to possibly grab all twelve of the new PDFs for only $3!
Starting with the latest expansion to the GURPS Action series (see Warehouse 23), your pledge of $3 secures you a PDF copy of GURPS Action 6 - Tricked Out Rides. This 10-page PDF, written by Sean Punch, is a quick-and-dirty toolkit for adventures where sports cars pack more gadgetry than fighter jets, and miniguns fit behind headlights!

One new PDF is great, but the project gets more exciting for all of the backers as stretch goals are unlocked. With each unlocked stretch goal (see below), we'll add another one of the twelve new PDFs to your rewards . . . that $3 pledge becomes an even better deal as more backers join the campaign.
Please share this campaign with all of your friends!
Are you looking for an even better deal? Check out the $99 reward! In addition to the new PDF and all unlocked stretch goals, you will also receive $125 in credit to spend in BackerKit on GURPS PDFs of your choice. See the add-ons section, below, for more information.
NOTE: Only PDFs published by Steve Jackson Games and currently listed for sale on Warehouse 23 will be available to project supporters. We cannot list PDFs by other publishers or PDFs that we do not currently sell.
Do you want even more PDFs? During the BackerKit survey (see below), we will offer these -- and many more! -- PDFs as add-on items. You may increase your pledge by the listed amounts and then, in BackerKit, make your exact PDF choices. All PDFs will be delivered through both BackerKit and Warehouse 23, our online store.
While we will not immediately offer every GURPS PDF that is available at Warehouse 23 in the BackerKit survey, we will do our best to meet your requests. If, once the surveys open, you do not see your preferred selections, please email help@sjgames.com for support and the team will add your choices to the survey.
NOTE: Only PDFs published by Steve Jackson Games and currently listed for sale on Warehouse 23 will be available to project supporters. We cannot list PDFs by other publishers or PDFs that we do not currently sell.
For those of you who cannot wait for this campaign to be complete to get your hands on more PDFs, you can find the entire catalog of GURPS PDFs at both Warehouse 23 and DrivethruRPG. Remember, though, that choosing add-ons during this Kickstarter campaign helps push us closer and closer to unlocking the stretch goals. The more funds we can raise during the project, the better our chances of unlocking all twelve PDFs!
Can we unlock all twelve PDFs before the clock runs out?
PDFs will be delivered through both BackerKit (see below) and our online store, Warehouse 23. We encourage you to create a Warehouse 23 account if you do not already have one so that your PDFs can be added to your Warehouse 23 library.
Learn more about Warehouse 23 here!
This project offers only PDFs. There will be no print rewards, and no print add-ons, so that we can concentrate on delivering the PDFs as fast as possible. This means no printed books, no dice, and nothing that would require shipping physical items. PDFs only!
BackerKit Surveys
We will be using BackerKit to collect email addresses and manage any add-on choices that you may make, and failure to complete your survey will mean that you will not be able to download your rewards. We will post an update when the BackerKit surveys have opened and, at that time, we will post the survey deadline date.
Once the Kickstarter campaign is over and all rewards have been delivered, the PDFs unlocked during this project will be released on Warehouse 23. At that time, each will be priced as individual titles; the special price of all unlocked PDFs for only $3 will only be available in this campaign.

On Monday, we're launching the GURPS Pyramid Scheme here on Kickstarter! Three new Pyramid issues -- one each for fantasy, modern, and future players and GMs -- every one of which expands in size as project stretch goals are unlocked. To better prepare you for the new campaign, we've now shared the article listings (both starting articles and stretch goal articles) for each issue:
Fantasy/Magic I article list

For those of you who have been asking about a second GURPS PDF Challenge, we're ready to announce that Steve Jackson Games' GURPS Pyramid Scheme is almost ready for Kickstarter launch. While not an exact copy of the approach used for the PDF Challenge that all of you supported earlier this year, the GURPS Pyramid Scheme campaign means more GURPS support for fantasy, modern, and sci-fi games.

Thank you, everyone, for your support of this campaign! As of earlier today, the last of the Warehouse 23 files have been distributed, shifting this project officially into the complete column. We could not have done this without all of you!
What's next for GURPS? Sean and the team are working on several new releases, and we have plans to take what we have learned from this PDF challenge and try something new in the future. Please follow the Warehouse 23 Kickstarter account for email notification when we launch a new project.

The Warehouse 23 fulfillment process has started! This will be done in stages and as quick as we can manage, but it will definitely take some time to get everyone's PDFs added to their Warehouse 23 accounts. Please hold off on contacting the team with project questions; we will post another update here once Warehouse 23 fulfillment is complete. 
How long will this take? Unknown. Darryll started the process earlier today and it is going to take weeks, possibly several weeks, to wrap up this stage of the project. We're still on track to complete the campaign by the estimated delivery date, and possibly sooner than that.

Thank you to everyone who has wrapped up your surveys! 
For those of you who have not yet completed your surveys, please remember that these must be finished by the end of August. At the end of the month, we will issue refunds for any incomplete surveys and you will be removed from this project. 
PDF Rewards

After a fairly smooth smoke test, we decided to open the doors so we can start the survey and delivery process. 
When will I get my PDFs?
PDF Purchases will be distributed periodically via Backerkit. After you complete your survey, it may take up to 7 days for you to receive download links in BackerKit.

Hey folks!
Moments ago I flipped the necessary switch to begin the Smoke Test for the GURPS 2020 PDF Challenge! Approximately 150 of you will be randomly selected across the various pledge levels to complete your surveys and collect your PDFs. We need your help to make sure that the whole BackerKit can roll out soon!

We've crossed the finish line with more than $57,000 in pledges. You didn't just unlock all 12 PDFs (remember when $45,000 seemed far off?) - you kept on going. Thank you for your support! 

More impressive is that when I say "you," I'm talking about more than 2,700 backers. That's . . . staggering. It's a big vote of confidence for short PDFs (at least some of the time!), future Kickstarters like this one, and GURPS. 

Again: Thank you. And thanks to Phil Reed for orchestrating everything, Steve Jackson for encouraging us to run with it, our writers, Steven Marsh for matching those writers with topics and art, and Nikki Vrtis for laying out a dozen PDFs in no time flat. It was a team effort in every sense!

- Sean "Dr. Kromm" Punch

updates.update_content:
TL;DR - Production is complete. Currently awaiting space on a container ship, hopefully later this month.
Fellow Cosmonauts,
I've said it before, and I'll no doubt say it again - life in low-earth orbit can be rather dicey. Only a few weeks ago, NASA and the Canadian Space Agency discovered the station's Canadarm2 had been struck by orbiting debris, ripping a hole through the arm's insulation. CSA referred to the hit as a "lucky strike", as neither the robotic arm nor the astronauts aboard the station were harmed.

TL;DR - Production is wrapping up, currently waiting for an opening in overseas freight.
Fellow Cosmonauts,
It's been a busy few weeks for the International Space Station. A historic crewmember made his way safely home, China launched their first entry into the space-station race, and NASA admitted to a complete lack of space-unicorns (so far). But despite all that going on, what I want to talk about is variety.

Fellow Cosmonauts,
While the current state of the International Space Station is common knowledge, we speak about its construction much less frequently. What started as left-over parts for the Mir space station, the ISS eventually expanded to become the largest object ever put in space - and the most expensive (and complex) object ever constructed. So it's no surprise that the construction of the station was riddled with problems. Funding cuts, shifting geopolitical climates, engineering setbacks - these were all just part of the job. In the end, it took thousands of engineers on earth and hundreds of astronauts in space to complete the station, equipped with everything from robotic cranes and NASA-designed space-bolts to run-of-the-mill hacksaws and duct tape.

Fellow Cosmonauts,
As much as the theme of Intrepid focuses on the potential disasters aboard the International Space Station, a typical day on the ISS is much more mundane. When not eating and exercising, astronauts generally fill their day with routine maintenance - replacing filters, repairing equipment, storing cargo. While not terribly exciting, these tasks are what keeps the station running smoothly. According to Colonel Terry Virts (commander of Expedition 43 aboard the ISS), life on the station is 99% calm and routine.

Fellow Cosmonauts,
We're only a few weeks into the new year and already, significant events are taking place. As part of the first spacewalk of the year, astronauts aboard the ISS worked to finalize the installation of Bartolomeo, a new, European science facility. Bartolomeo was delivered last Spring and has been slowly working through the installation process. This spacewalk was supposed to be the final step, but a couple of faulty power cables forced the astronauts to abort. Of the six cables needed, two would not fully attach to the facility. And while Bartolomeo is fully capable of running with only four power cables connected, the astronauts decided it was better to wait until everything was perfect before moving forward.

Fellow Cosmonauts,
Let me be among the first to wish you a happy new year. 2020 was a real challenge for so many people all over the world - including astronauts aboard the ISS, who have dealt with aging technology, space debris, air leaks, and even COVID-19 restrictions. Just like us, the ISS crew had reason to celebrate the beginning of 2021. Since they couldn't use a ball drop to count down the end of the year (nothing really drops in micro-gravity), the astronauts did the next best thing and released a ball upwards into the station.

Fellow Cosmonauts,
Earlier this month the world celebrated the 20th anniversary of continuous human life aboard the International Space Station. Since its original launch, the station has undergone massive renovations - what started as a single module (the Zarya) has expanded to a sprawling network of science laboratories, life-support systems, storage platforms, and living quarters.

Fellow Cosmonauts,
It takes a lot to become an astronaut. You must be in peak physical condition (NASA's long-duration flight physical exam is no joke). You must have a master's degree in a STEM field. You must have a minimum of two years of professional experience in a related occupation. Something tells me my years working on this game probably wouldn't count.

Fellow Cosmonauts,
I don't think it would be overstating things to say 2020 has been a crazy year. Sometimes it can be tempting to look up at the stars and dream of an easier life off the planet. But just a quick glance at recent headlines and you realize, just maybe, you've got it a bit easier than the astronauts aboard the International Space Station.

Fellow Cosmonauts,
It has been an extremely eventful few weeks - both here in the Uproarious offices as well as 254 miles above the Earth. NASA astronauts aboard the ISS recently had to spend a few nights with their Russian counterparts while ground control hunted for a mysterious air leak aboard the station. Unfortunately, the leak was never found and NASA ultimately called the exercise off. Thankfully, the leak is extremely small and poses no immediate threat to the astronauts. However, it serves as a stark reminder that even a minor problem aboard the ISS can have deadly consequences.
