NOTE: The book is not yet 100% complete; writing is still in the works! Please check the estimated delivery in the reward descriptions. Thanks for your understanding and patience as the book moves through the writing and review stage.
Digital mockup.
Welcome, gamemasters! The Book of Dungeon Encounters is a 48-page 8.5" x 11" saddle-stitched book that is packed with 100 different dungeon encounter ideas. These are for use with almost any fantasy RPG, especially old-school RPGs that use square grids for combat, though imaginative gamemasters will no doubt find ways to adapt everything detailed within these pages to any system, including those that use hexes for combat maps.
The book is presented as a giant d100 table, giving the gamemaster 100 different encounter ideas that can either be randomly rolled or selected to construct a dungeon. 90 of the encounters are presented as descriptions only -- no maps -- and range from low-level fights against dungeon beasties all of the way to strange gateways that lead to other worlds.
Ten of the encounters include square grid maps that were created using the SkeletonKey Games 2e Adventure Tiles. (Please see below for more information.) 
Regardless of how you use the encounters in the book, all of them exist for two reasons:
To give the gamemaster the tools necessary to run a dungeon adventure with little to no prep time; just grab some stats from your favorite book of monsters and mix in the ideas in this book and you're ready for freeform dungeon crawls!
 Inspiration! Maybe an entry doesn't meet your exact needs, but each one will help drive your creativity and give you ideas. As always, change everything within the book to fit your tastes and needs!
Digital mockup.
For those of you new to my work, I am Philip Reed. I have been working professionally in the game industry for over two decades and have completed hundreds of projects over the years (both on my own and with different publishers). 
This time around, I have brought on co-authors so that we could get the voices and ideas of others mixed in with my own. By adding other authors to the book (please see below), the encounters are more varied than if I were to tackle all of them on my own.
For an look at my approach to crowdfunding efforts, please see these recent Kickstarter campaigns to learn more:
 Fantasy City Sites and Scenes - A 48-page book of city locations and encounter ideas. The project closed in April 2020, and all rewards have already been delivered to the supporters. 1,701 backers! See the Kickstarter page for more information. 
 Fantasy City Sites and Scenes II - A 48-page sequel to Fantasy City Sites and Scenes, this book introduces sixteen new locations and several new encounter ideas. All PDF rewards have been delivered and the print book has mailed out to the project supporters. 1,783 backers! See the Kickstarter campaign for more information. 
 Dungeon Crafter's Sketch Book - A 60-page collection of tables and forms,  designed to inspire gamemasters during dungeon creation. Available in square and hex editions. The print rewards shipped to backers within one month of the project closing. 425 backers! See the Kickstarter campaign for more information. 
You can find the complete list of projects that I have run on Kickstarter right here. Please follow me here on Kickstarter to receive email notification when I launch a new campaign!
Alexander “Alex” Augunas is a tabletop RPG veteran best known for his work in the Pathfinder and Starfinder RPGs. He is a frequent Paizo contributor, owns publishing company Everybody Games, and is a blogger, host, and Actual Play gamer for the Know Direction Network. You can learn more about Alex and his company at http://www.everybodygames.net, or support his Patreon at http://www.patreon.com/EversagaRPG. 
James Case is a writer, academic editor, and full-time developer at Paizo, Inc, where he works to bring the worlds of Pathfinder and Starfinder to life through Paizo's organized play program. He was also, for a time, the second-most-famous bubble blower in Yoyogi Park. He now resides in Seattle, which he finds pleasantly cooler than his hometown of Honolulu, Hawaii. You can find him on The Twitter at @toriariaria. 
Ron Lundeen lives in the rural hinterlands outside of Seattle, Washington, where he finds the climate a pleasant change from his native Illinois. After a lengthy career as a corporate attorney, Ron took a full-time position with Paizo, Inc. as a developer, working with freelancers to create fabulous worlds and monstrous threats for the Pathfinder and Starfinder roleplaying games. He also designs games in his free time, creating a dizzying variety of perils, plots, and legends. Ron also runs his own gaming company, Run Amok Games, which you can visit at www.runamokgames.com.
Lars White is a writer, game designer, and sometimes artist who calls the PNW his home. Lars’ is the creator of the Dirt roleplaying game and lead writer for SkeletonKey Games’ Dossier Decks. He likes animals, weird things, and pastries.
Digital mockup.
Do you already own my other fantasy RPG supplements that were created thanks to the support of Kickstarter backers? Then you're looking for either the $1 (PDF) or $18 (print, U.S. only) reward levels. All of the other listed rewards are for those gamemasters who missed out on my earlier projects.
Scattered throughout the book you will find ten encounters that include mapped locations within a dungeon. Each and every one of these maps were created using the SkeletonKey Games 2e Adventure Tiles. For those of you who use miniatures and square grid maps in your sessions, you can purchase the necessary tiles from SkeletonKey Games to create these locations at miniatures scale. Click here to visit the SkeletonKey Games website.
Some of the maps feature tiles created using the new Adventure Tiles: Darkharrow Crypt . . . that is now funding on Kickstarter!!! Check out and join the campaign today!
(Tile artwork used with permission of SkeletonKey Games.)
So that we don't accidentally cause project delays, there will be no stretch goals for this campaign. I'd much rather deliver on schedule than risk running late with delivery of the rewards.
I know that the lack of stretch goals will cause some of you to turn away, but I ask that you keep this in mind: The 52-page PDF reward is only a buck, making this a great deal for any gamemaster who is searching for more dungeon encounter ideas. 
Delayed Blast Gamemaster is a systemless fantasy RPG zine for use with most games. This gamemaster-targeted resource is packed with monsters, adventure hooks, and all sorts of random stuff. Please see the individual Kickstarter campaigns (issue one, issue two, and issue three) for sample pages and to learn more about the zine.
A few of the entries in The Book of Dungeon Encounters reference monsters/treasures found in the Delayed Blast Gamemaster series. These zines are not necessary to use those encounters; a clever GM will simply devise their own ideas using the names as inspiration. 
You can find the zine in PDF today at DrivethruRPG.com.
The Dungeon Crafter's Sketch Book is for the gamemaster who enjoys creating dungeons. (Kickstarter page here.) This 56-page book (60 including the cover, inside covers, and back cover) is filled with page after page of square grids: space for you to draw your dungeon ideas. Scattered throughout the book are several random tables to inspire you as you create your newest dungeon. Please see the $3 and $33 reward levels. 
Did you miss the Fantasy City Sites and Scenes and Fantasy City Sites and Scenes II Kickstarter campaigns? Now is your chance to get these two books in print (and in PDF)! Please see the $13 and $58 reward levels (at right).
To learn more about each project, please visit the Kickstarter pages.

Presented in a systemless format, this book is for use with many fantasy roleplaying games and is as colorful in appearance as it is in the descriptions of the many potions described inside.
Please see the Kickstarter page for more information.
Also available in PDF at DrivethruRPG.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
After years of experience with Kickstarter, running and backing projects, combined with decades of experience in publishing, I think _most_ of the largest challenges and risks have been avoided. The book is still being written and I have brought on co-authors to help with the load and provide their own ideas to the encounters collected within the pages of the book.

However, things can go wrong. As an individual, I do not have access to a company to assist with packing and shipping rewards (a friend helps!), and I have no control over life. Everything should ship on schedule, but things can (and sometimes do) go wrong. If something goes off the rails, I will post an update to explain the situation.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
For those of you who have been asking, the Amazon print-on-demand edition of The Book of Dungeon Encounters is now ready. You can find the book at:
Amazon.com
Amazon.co.uk
Amazon.ca

So far, we have:
Delivered all PDF rewards.
Shipped all physical rewards . . . and many have already been delivered!
Checked off Kickstarter's "mark as shipped" button almost 2,000 times. (If you've never had the pleasure of clicking close to 2,000 buttons, I advise not giving it a try. It is as unfun as it sounds.)

We're getting the first reports that The Book of Dungeon Encounters is now reaching project supporters. Thank you, everyone, for letting me know that the books are making it. Please click the "mark as received" button here on Kickstarter when you have your rewards. That's one of the many tools that Kickstarter uses to track campaigns, and checking the "mark as received" button when your book arrives helps my standing with the site's computers.

It's official, gang! All of the books are now officially in the mail, and we now wait for the USPS to process and deliver your rewards. At the moment, in looking at stamps.com, only a handful of the packages have been processed by the USPS; hundreds of packages are still waiting for them to handle things. I wish I could give a definite "you'll have your rewards by Day X," but recent experience with the USPS is showing that anything can happen.

updates.update_userinfo: Three Bonus PDFs: Starship Sensor Contacts
updates.update_content:
Amy spent the weekend packing and shipping rewards, and now I can confirm on stamps.com that the first packages are in transit and on their way to supporters. It looks as if the USPS is running very slow -- out of the hundreds of packages that have been dropped at the post office so far, only a small number truly show in transit. With the recent USPS problems, it is impossible to say how long it will take for the books to reach you.
I will post an update once the last of the printed rewards have been mailed out.

updates.update_userinfo: Physical Rewards Arriving and Update on The Book of Collected Rumors
updates.update_content: All of the books are now in and next is the packing and shipping of the physical rewards. Amy reports that she will start the work this weekend, and should have everything in the mail over the next week or two. I'll post an update once the last of the rewards are in the mail.

The printer sample arrived yesterday, and the quality is as excellent as ever! The colors are bright, printing sharp, and the paper is the best that Mixam offers. I've been happy with their work on previous projects, and this one is just as good as their earlier print jobs.
I'm reviewing the pages this morning (so far there is one page to tweak), and I'll likely place the final print order this weekend. That should mean that the finished books start mailing out late in August or early September.

campaign.story:
Adventure Tiles: Darkharrow Crypt is a collection of detailed 2D terrain tiles designed for use with traditional and virtual tabletop RPGs. The tiles in this series are modular and can be arranged in nearly infinite configurations using tiles from a single set or by combining different sets into the custom dungeons of your dreams. There are currently two tile sets in this campaign, the Dwarven Tomb and the Necromancer's Cave. Both sets are included in all pledge levels and we are close to unlocking a third set. 
A close look at some of the Dwarven Tomb details. This set has both untouched and plundered versions of every tile.
The Necromancer's Cave tiles are filled with undead details and come with "empty" alternate versions for additional utility.
These tiles are included in all reward levels.
STRETCH-GOALS 
All tiles not marked in red will now be included with ALL pledge levels. That's over 100 tiles with stretch-goals (and counting)!


We are launching the campaign with a modest 16 tiles (64 and counting with stretch goals). Because we have set a realistic and easily achievable funding goal, we expect this set to grow very quickly. The idea here is to increase the value of the set for backers while keeping the buy-in extremely low. Ideally this set will more than double in size and we will be able to add additional sets under the Darkharrow Crypt banner. Who knows what sort of horrors might find their way into this campaign.
Get the Dungeon Core Set as part of the "Darkharrow Crypt + Core Dungeons" or "Darkharrow Crypt + Complete Dungeons" reward levels.
 The Dungeon Core Set contains over 40 tiles and is a great starting point to build a massive dungeon. Check it out on DriveThruRPG for more info and a preview.
This small section of dungeon was built with three Dwarven Tomb tiles and three Dungeon Core Set tiles.
These four sets are part of the "Darkharrow Crypt + Complete Dungeons" reward level and three of them are available in VTT and POD for the first time as part of this campaign.
For more information on these sets, please follow the links below.
Dungeon Expansion 01
Dungeon Expansion 02
Dungeon Expansion 03
Dungeon Encounter 01
This chamber-of-questionable-function was built with three tiles from Dwarven Tombs, one tile from Dungeon Expansion 02, and two tiles from Dungeon Expansion 03.
All rewards in this campaign include the tiles in three different formats so you can use them in whatever way suits your gaming needs.
* POD (print-on-demand) tiles will require backers to cover printing and shipping costs via DriveThruRPG.com
PDF: Adventure Tiles PDFs are formatted with one tile per page. Each high resolution tile uses a printer friendly white background to save your ink/toner. Spaces are one inch squares.
VTT: Files included for virtual tabletop use have a dark earthy background in the negative space to enhance the subterranean look and feel. Spaces are 100 pixels square with each tile being 600 x 600 pixels.
Print-On-Demand: A coupon to order a printed version of each set is included with every pledge. These can be redeemed through DriveThruRPG.com and the printing cost along with shipping will need to be paid when the printed tiles are ordered. The printed tiles are double sided 6" x 6" squares which are printed on high quality coated stock. Printing costs will vary depending on how many tiles are in the final set after stretch-goals are unlocked.
Curious about the POD quality? Check out the video below to see for yourself.
Need some killer ideas for encounters using your Adventure Tiles? Look no further than The Book of Dungeon Encounters by Philip Reed.
This book is a collection of 100 different dungeon encounters that gamemasters can use with almost any fantasy roleplaying game. Some of the encounters even feature maps made with the Adventure Tiles found in this campaign.
 All rewards in this campaign will be fulfilled via DriveThruRPG. Once the rewards have been completed you will receive links to download the rewards and permanently add them to your library on the site. Backers will also have the option of purchasing POD tiles at-cost straight from DriveThru.
Some artwork © 2020 Dean Spencer.

updates.update_userinfo: Fulfilling the Stragglers and a New Campaign
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone, 
I hope you are all enjoying your Adventure Tiles by now... But, I know there are a handful of you who are not. This is because I am still awaiting your survey responses. If you have not, please fill in your surveys and get them back to me this week. On Friday, November 6th, I will be sending out all final rewards. If you have filled our your survey I will use that email and if not, I will use the email associated with your Kickstarter account. I just want to get this all wrapped up without having to fulfill rewards one backer at a time.

Hey all, I promise not to spam you with this type of thing but SkeletonKey Games is having a huge digital sale on our older e-Adventure Tiles right now. We have over 100 sets at a 75% discount covering wilderness, ice, sewers, urban, and more. We also have our sci-fi series of eFuture Tiles on sale.

updates.update_userinfo: The Forgotten Temple has been Discovered!
updates.update_content:
Hello Backers!
I have just sent out links to Adventure Tiles: Forgotten Temple, the final set unlocked in this campaign. Go forth and delve into the depths of Darkharrow Crypt with my gratitude. I wouldn't be doing these fun projects without you and I hope you will join me for more in the future.
There will definitely be more Adventure Tiles and probably some encounters to go along with them. I've also got plenty of other crazy stuff in the works. Here's a sneak peek at something on the horizon.

campaign.story:
Journal d’Indochine is a set of scenarios and campaign resources for the Call of Cthulhu 7th Edition roleplaying game set in French colonial Vietnam (~1925 to 1955); a land in turmoil as Vietnamese partisans resist French colonial oppressors and Japanese invaders.
We funded the Journal d'Indochine! Time to raise a glass and celebrate. We would like to give our gratitude to you; to our backers, contributors, artists and play-testers who are making Journal d'Indochine possible. THANK YOU!!
Important Links
Sons of the Singularity News and Blog Page - future Development Updates will be placed here
Sons of the Singularity Facebook Page
Contact Sons of the Singularity at sons.of.the.singularity AT gmail.com
Journal d'Indochine Webpage
Pre-Order Store on Backerkit
!
The first half of the 20th century was a time of chaos and political ferment in French Indochina. As foreign imperialists struggled to maintain their precarious grip on the region, the people of the land worked to overthrow their tormentors. Radical religious movements like the Cao Dai sprung up to spread the blessings of a strange and unfathomable God. Hòa Hảo Buddhist militias supported the prophecy of the return of a king. Binh Xuyen gangsters schemed to gain territory for their criminal enterprises. All the while student revolutionaries preached new, secular philosophies that promised utopia for the downtrodden workers.
While the world seethed with conflict and change, hidden entities from far off in time and space have taken root in the jungles, gained foot holds on the beaches and found supplicants in the cities of Indochine. Some of these entities offer the temptation of enlightenment and power to those who could unlock their eldritch secrets. While some of these entities simply desire some hors d'oeuvre after a long hibernation.

Journal d'Indochine covers a region and time period that has rarely been covered in the rpg world. It is designed to help the Keeper and players quickly get up to speed on French Indochina’s history, themes, and factions. Journal d’Indochine will include vital information on the region, as well as numerous “Lore Sheet” handouts.
The creators of Journal d’Indochine have spent many years in Asia and have firsthand knowledge of the locations featured. We have also hired Vietnamese consultants, in an effort to maintain cultural and historical authenticity.

Journal d'Indochine Book
Journal d’Indochine will be a 200+ page book containing the following:
4 “play out of the box” scenarios.
Each scenario crafted for different play-styles, including campaign, sandbox, dungeon crawl, intrigue and betrayal mechanics.
A collection of Narrative Frameworks and hooks for campaign play.
Full of rich historical events and fascinating factions, including Binh Xuyen gangsters, Vichy French, OSS operatives, Japanese imperialists, Hoa Hao Buddhist militia, mythos cultists, and many more.
Tons of art, maps, journal entries and useful Keeper's Aids (templates) for a wide range of civil and military documents.
Photos from personal and familial archives, including never-before released photos from the Battle of Dien Bien Phu.
  Legionnaires Field Manual
At the Leng stretch goal level, the Legionnaires Field Manual will be unlocked and available for Backers at the Legionnaire Capitaine / Đại úy level and above. The book will contain the following:
At least 100+ pages in length
At least 2 new scenarios (S5 & S6)
New Player Factions, including the French Foreign Legion
New scenario hooks and new Lore Sheets 
At least 10 new pre-gens
Botanist’s guide to Flora from the Plateau of Sung
New weapons and equipment list
New art
Scenarios
(This section will be updated as development progresses)
S1: The Fertile Red Lands of Cochinchina (1926)
The French-Indochina Rubber Corporation pursues its own interests through subjugating the local population and bending the jungles to its will. A local tribe having been almost wiped out by the invaders retreats into the jungle where they plot and plan revenge on the colonial invaders who have set roots down in their land. Little do the invaders know; they are not the only invaders that have also taken root in the Red Lands of Cochinchina…
The Fertile Red Lands of Cochinchina is a “sandbox” scenario where investigators can explore at their leisure… or at their panic…
S2: Black Sea Rising (1945, June)
The tides of war have turned against Japan. In a last-ditch attempt to win the war, Japanese Naval Intelligence and elite members of the Gen’Yosha launch Operation Moon God Ascending, an attempt to barter with a Deep One colony in Ha Long Bay. Can anti-Japanese forces disrupt Operation Moon God Ascending before doom is unleashed on humanity?
Black Sea Rising is a faction related scenario good for “one-off” plays or OSS and Viet Minh Faction campaigns.
S3: Expedition Lemont (1946)
Since Lemont’s last expedition at the turn of the 20th Century, men of dubious ambitions, lured by the possibility of fame and riches, have attempted to retrace the footsteps of the priest rumored to have gone looking for Yian-Ho, a mystical city of gold.
Deputy High Commissioner Henry de Constance, who came in contact with the priest research into the mythos, convinced his superiors of the need to undertake another expedition to the Southern Wetlands. According to him, a new expedition would be a “splendid anthropological undertaking.”
Expedition Lemont is meant to be played as a campaign. It is composed of four separate modules that will take the investigators from Saigon to the Holy See in Tay Ninh and beyond.
S4: Battle of Dien Bien Phu (Name TBD)(1954)
French Foreign Legion soldiers parachute into the valley of Dien Bien Phu, while Viet Minh commandoes move to penetrate and sabotage colonial French positions. During the climatic  battle that ended the first Indochina war, troops encounter another an invader lurking in the battlefield.
S4 will be an intense “dungeon crawl” adventure, played from the perspective of soldiers of the French Foreign Legion or the Viet Minh player factions.
(The following will be bundled with the Legionnaire Field Manual)
S5: The Parchment of Tam (1945, March)
Investigators travel to Huế to find the mysterious “Mr. Long”, a missing Viet Minh informant with strong ties to Emperor Bảo Đại and the Forbidden Purple City. Their search uncovers both ancient and modern secrets, and a plot that can turn the tide of the Pacific Theater of War. The journey may also cause the Investigators to go insane.

Deep Ones at Ha Long Bay

 Jason Sheets & Jesse Covner (Writers & Developers)

Jason & Jesse at first KhanKon. Jason is GMing a Trail of Cthulhu game. Jesse (with the cool hat) is attempting to translate the word "Nyarlathotep" for a Chinese player.
Sons of the Singularity is an indie RPG design and publishing house established by Jesse Covner and Jason Sheets in 2018. In 2019, we successfully Kickstarted "The Sassoon Files" for Call of Cthulhu and GUMSHOE.
Our goal is to make role-playing games and scenarios which are entertaining, exciting, thought-provoking, and genuine. We are two left-handed American guys who met while living in China more than a decade ago. We now (2018) live in Japan. We both like the works of H.P. Lovecraft and Charles Stross. Jason is the "Wicked Son" and Jesse is aspiring to be the "Wise Son" (Passover reference).
Francis Acquarone (Creator)
Francis, using eldritch premonition techniques at the race track.
Francis’ developed a passion for writing and rolling out scenarios that feature a good mix of historical facts, political intrigue and dark horrors. Born in Montreal, Francis spent nearly two decades living in China managing foreign trade missions before relocating back to Canada.In his spare time, Francis spent considerable time in Vietnam retracing his grandfather's footsteps all the way to Dien Bien Phu. A bachelor of history and major in East Asia Studies, Francis is looking forward to add his knowledge, personal experiences and vision to the Journal d'Indochine.
Patrick Chandler (Creator)
Patrick communing with a Deep One.
Patrick Chandler is a Canadian writer/editor, with over a decades worth of short stories for education and entertainment. He is a gaming enthusiast, and enjoys RPGs, board games, and Magic: the Gathering. He is co-host of MTG Podcast One Scry Away. Patrick now lives in Vancouver, but has lived in China for ten years, unraveling its secrets and mysteries. 
Ludovic Chabant (Creator)
Ludo, reconnoitering a cultist-affiliated ranch.
Ludovic has been playing and GMing roleplaying games for more than 20 years even though, weirdly enough, he bought and played his first D&D book only last year. After entering the hobby through one-on-one games of The Dark Eye (a German D&D clone) with his neighbour, Ludovic quickly moved on to Cyberpunk 2020 and Vampire: The Masquerade. By the end of high-school, he had discovered Call of Cthulhu and has since then played more horror games than any other genre. Ludovic currently works as a video-game engine software engineer. He doesn’t enjoy killing Investigators — it just happens, it’s not his fault.
Thuận Nguyễn (Artist)
Thuan projecting himself 70 years into the future.
Thuận Nguyễn is an artist and illustrator working in gaming industry, which is great because video games is his primary hobby. He also works as a freelancer creating book covers and illustrations. He currently lives and works in Hà Nội, Việt Nam.  You can find his work at his Artstation page.
Jennifer S. Lange (Artist)
Jennifer investigates a place with indescribable colors and many angles.
Jennifer S. Lange is an artist and illustrator working mostly in the gaming industry and also creates book covers and fine art, and her own fantasy world Genius Loci. The number of her rpg characters is legion, but she hasn't lost count yet. She lives in Lübeck, Germany, with her fiancé and two cats. You can find her work at her website.

Lin Hsiang (Artist)
Hsiang is preparing his own wanted poster.
Lin Hsiang is an illustrator based in Taiwan. He studied Bachelor of Illustration at Sheridan College in Canada. He has done many book cover and game card pieces. He has also done a couple of graphic novels.  He has been working as freelance artist for the Legend of Five Rings card game for Fantasy Flight Games for three years.  Please check his portfolio at:  https://www.artstation.com/willhsiang

We are also excited about the prospects of collaboration and cross-promotion with other content creators, artists and publishers. If you would like to discuss how we might work together to enrich the RPG community and improve our offerings, please contact Jesse.
After - Kickstarter Fulfillment
We are using the Backerkit pledge manager service and DriveThru RPG to handle payment of shipping and other fulfillment fees, so all shipping fees will be collected after this Kickstarter has ended. Your pledge does not include the cost of shipping.
 Off-Set Print & Book Shipping
If the project reaches the R’lyeh ($22,000) stretch goal, we will commission a traditional off-set print run at our printing vendor in the United States. This will produce a higher quality book. However, it will probably add two months to the delivery schedule.
We will collect the shipping fee for the book within our Pledge Manager.  The fees will be approximately as follows:
Digital to POD Items
Certain add-ons and unlockable scenarios are delivered as a digital product on DTRPG, with the option to buy a Print on Demand (POD) version at print cost.  These items include the 12x18 posters, additional scenarios, and the Legionnaire's Field Manual, but not the main book. If you received any of these as a reward or add-on, you will receive a coupon for the price of the PDF.  To print out the item, you will need to go to DTRPG and order the printed version, at cost, and pay for shipping on that site. 
We estimate that POD printing costs for the posters and the Legionnaires’ Field Manual, including additional scenarios, Player Factions, and other content, will be between $6 to $12 in total.

Sons of the Singularity will attempt to send you the finished product in such a manner that your order is tracked and you will not be charged extra fees. campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have already successfully Kickstarted and delivered three RPG books (200+ pages). We are confident in our abilities to deal with unforeseen events.

Writing and Edits - We have written all scenarios (and much of the other content) to be included in the book. The scenarios are thoroughly play-tested.

Art Production - Commissioning additional art, especially if we achieve our stretch goals, may delay delivery of project.

Fulfillment and Printing - We intend to use DriveThruRPG for fulfillment, however, we will run a traditional off-set print in the United States if we achieve relevant stretch goal. A traditional off-set print run will likely require us to push back the delivery date. We have an American printer we worked with in the past, and we have relations with some European printers should we do a EU and American print run.

campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Reusability and recyclability
Our book will be printed by either Versa Press or Lightning Source or another printer which uses sustainable practices.

According to Versa Press, they use recycled papers, as well as FSC certified text and cover stock. If we use this company, we will ask them to use a large percentage of recycled paper in the book.
Sustainable materials
With Lightning Source, "each of its paper suppliers to be environmentally responsible as well, and not use papers sourced from endangered old growth forests, forests of exceptional conservation value, or the Amazon Basin."

Versa Press prints with soy and vegetable oil-based inks.
Environmentally friendly factories
According to Lightning Source, "books are printed in ultra-short runs or only when an order has been received. This print on demand model of book manufacturing reduces supply chain waste, greenhouse emissions, and conserves valuable natural resources."

Versa Press is FSC® certified. (FSC-C005010).

campaign.story:
R&D stands for Research & Design
GMs! How many times has this happened to you? 
You send the Troubleshooter team on a mission filled with disinformation, death traps and Catch-22s, confident they will industriously slaughter themselves in a jiffy. Yet, mysteriously or even treasonously, by the time debriefing rolls around, they still have several clones left! (Sure, they failed the mission but that’s expected.) Isn’t there some way to make the game more baffling, convoluted and amusingly fatal for the Troubleshooters?
What you need is Project Infinite Hole, a sourcebox full of tasty tidbits from Alpha Complex’s most thought-provoking service group, Research & Design! And yes, it will provoke a lot more than just thoughts.
What’s Inside? Mayhem!
Project Infinite Hole is the first service group supplement for the latest edition of Paranoia. Here, you will find three books that can make your players weep for joy, and occasionally, panicked fear.

 The R&D Happy Testing Catalogue: 64 lovingly crafted pages describing 40 experimental devices fresh from the R&D labs! Fluffy Safety Armour, Jaws of Death, iEye and more are sure to delight your players! Wait, that’s not right. Oh, it will delight sadistic Paranoia GMs. That makes more sense.
 The Gamemasters R&D Service Book: 80 pages that explore this service group in detail, including how R&D works, how it does not work, new locations, new NPCs and the thrilling Troubleshooter In-field R&D Adjunct system (TIRDA) that lets players combine equipment cards to create what’s sure to be a complete and utter cock-up. (That is not a dirty word! Get your mind out of the gutter, Troubleshooter!)
 The R&D Mission Book: 128 pages giving a busy GM two missions that start the first ever (we think) Paranoia campaign! You also get the Top 10 Best R&D Experiments (filled with three-act structured mission hooks) and advice on adding a trip to R&D into every Troubleshooter mission. Yes, players really will be thankful for that!
You also get the R&D Deck with 120 new cards: 18 R&D-themed Action Cards, 15 Armour and Defensive Devices, 5 Bot Modules, 25 Coretech Apps, 25 Surveillance Devices and 32 Weapons. (These include the 40 devices in the R&D Happy Testing Catalogue, but also a lot more!) All equipment is experimental, meaning there are different effects depending on whether the Troubleshooter was barely competent or suspiciously incompetent. (Remember, equipment failure is a choice and will be punished accordingly.) No longer will you say, ‘Uh, you miss with laser pistol. Next!’ Instead, you can say, ‘Your Duct Tape Gun misses and hits an air duct, which is suddenly pulled down on top of you. Next!’
You can download the draft of the first mission, Filling an Infinite Hole, right HERE!
Why Kickstarter?
For that matter, why an R&D box set? Back in older editions of Paranoia, a trip to R&D for some rather questionable gear was a standard part of Troubleshooter missions. After the briefing, Troubleshooters went to R&D whether they wanted to or not. (Oh, but they wanted to, at least more than they wanted to be terminated.) In the previous edition, this was expanded to become a Service where Troubleshooters did minor but stressful jobs for any of the eight service groups.
We grew up playing Paranoia, and have fond memories of all kinds of R&D devices going boom, ping! and sometimes POW BANG POP WHAM WHIZZ CLICK WHIRR, and then boom! To be honest, we missed that! So when we sat down to think of the next expansion for Paranoia, this immediately came to mind. And it would not leave, no matter what we ingested.
By launching a Kickstarter for the R&D sourcebox, we can provide unique offers (like designer notes and create-a-device) while offering all-new ways to torment players. (Err, their characters.) As with our Acute Paranoia Kickstarter, all of the sourcebox content (books and cards) has already been written, edited and made ready for citizens everywhere.
It also allows us to explore a first for Paranoia: An actual campaign. How is that possible when most Troubleshooter teams have the shelf life of raw soylent? We extended one plot over four different missions. You can keep characters between missions or create new ones, as players will remember what is going on. And yes, this is all centred on an R&D experiment named Project Infinite Hole.
Pledge Levels
We have put together a multitude of ways you can demonstrate your loyalty to The Computer, and eagerness to aid R&D with their critical mission to enhance and improve the already perfect Alpha Complex.
The R&D Testing Fun Pack!
R&D is so much fun that we wanted to offer a big reward: The R&D Testing Fun Pack. (Is the testing fun? Are we testing fun? Is the pack full of tests and fun? Yes.) In this commemorative pack, those backing at Green or higher will receive:
6 Green Pencils for Troubleshooters that say ‘Fuel Rod (mini)’.
1 GM Pen that says ‘Knowing Rules is Treason’.
Safety Poster Card with real (read: fake) R&D lab warnings such as ‘Inhaling Particulates is Theft DO NOT BREATHE’ and ‘If Alarm Sounds, Push People Down and Run Away’.
Pad of R&D Experimental Equipment Release Forms, ready to inflict on your players.
25 ‘Heroes of R&D’ trading cards featuring the most important and/or dangerous people, locations and experiments that are part of this fine service group. Also containing rules for dropping them into missions.
Exclusive short mission, never to be found elsewhere: ‘Smocks!’. An experiment in armour technology goes missing while the Communists fight the Communists for control of the Communists. Guess who gets to fix both problems?
All in a special presentation pack!
These items are exclusive to the R&D Testing Fun Pack, and will never be available anywhere else!
Stretch Goals
R&D is all about getting wonderful, cutting-edge devices to Troubleshooters so they can justify budget expenditures. (Also, fight traitors sometimes.) So why not offer our most loyal citizens some cutting-edge stretch goals? They are rather nifty...
 Anyone backing at the Red level or higher will get all unlocked stretch goals as PDFs! Praise Friend Computer!
Package Deals
In our Traveller Kickstarters, backers could purchase packages to fill out their collections. This proved such a hit that we are now offering Paranoia Package Deals! You can pick any or all of these, and simply add their cost to your pledge level - we will be in touch after the Kickstarter to finalise which packages you pledged for. We will even ship them out as soon as the Kickstarter is over and all your details have been collated (typically within a month of the Kickstarter completing) so there is no waiting!
£35 The Card Package: Keep your players’ hands full with four card decks: More [REDACTED] Societies, Mutant Explosion, the RAM Deck, and Perfectly Safe Gear.
£50 The Mission Package: Run your Troubleshooters through completely safe and relaxing missions: Implausible Deniability, Yellow Clearance Black Box Blues, and Truth or Dare.
£70 The Box Package: Do you really like boxes? Do you also like Paranoia? Then get this package and receive both the Starter box set and the Acute Paranoia expansion box.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All of our Kickstarter projects have succeeded and backers received their rewards. That said, we know there is always room for improvement and we continue to learn how to do this better. For example, we are adding more value to pledge levels by offering all stretch goals to anyone backing at Red level or higher. 

As with our previous Paranoia Kickstarter, everything in the sourcebox (including the 120-card R&D Deck) has already been designed, written, and tested on live gamers. (Only a few gamers were hurt in the making of this sourcebox but, in our defence, they kept using their phones at the table.) This lowers the risk since you do not have to wait and hope somebody in the UK writes this thing. (Note: The first four stretch goals are complete, with art and layout complete, and ready for final proofing and printing. We are waiting to see what else gets unlocked before panicking and screaming at freelancers, ‘THIS OTHER STUFF NEEDS TO BE DONE NAOW!’) 

The coronavirus continues to plague the world, but we have ensured its effects will be minimal as the majority of the actual development of Project Infinite Hole is already done, and we have several different printers alerted on different continents (China, Eastern Europe and North America) so we can select the best choice if and when the virus flares up once more.

Lead designer WJ MacGuffin is keeping a suspicious eye on things here on the Kickstarter page, and he will be answering your questions as fast as his old brain can handle. (He is still running Cerebral Coretech 10.15 Minx, so it might take a little while.)

R&D stands for Rebar & Dust. 
R&D stands for Riots & Destruction.
R&D stands for whatever you want. It is your box set now.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Good morning, loyal Citizens!
Just a quick update on shipping...
Short Version: Everything is now out of the door and on its way to you!
US Version: Everything is processed and more or less on its way to you all. Two caveats... First, the USPS has been having some 'interesting' times of late, with packages stalling in their system for a number of days. We are not sure why this has been happening, but packages do get moving and delivered eventually - so, your sets are on their way to you but may well take a bit longer than usual. Second, there was a bit of a mis-shipment with the Fun Packs, with a bunch getting diverted to us here in the UK. We caught this, but it means 41 backers in the US will be getting most of their items via USPS but their Fun Packs from the UK. We shipped these out yesterday so should be in the US within the next few days (where they will then hit USPS, with the above issues).

Good morning, loyal Citizens!
As it turns out, there is another update!
First off, if you are not in North America and pledged for the R&D Fun Pack, please note it will be sent to you in a separate package - so don't panic if you receive everything else first!

Good afternoon, loyal Citizens!
I am glad to report that, weary as the Mongoose staff are (because we have just carried a ton and a half of boxes up the stairs or, as we measure them, ten adult Dolphins...), we are happy that Project Infinite Hole sets are now here!

Good morning, loyal citizens!
Just another quick update to let you know that everything has arrived at our US warehouse and we have just sent all your shipping details to them. It will take them a day or three to get everything out of boxes and organised but shipping should begin for citizens in the US, Canada and Brazil next week!

Good morning, loyal citizens!
Just a quick update today.
It looks like the US shipment of Project Infinite Hole has cleared customs and is, as I type, on a truck making its way to the warehouse. It will take a day or two to process once arrived but we will start getting sets out to everyone as soon as we can - should be just a matter of days now!

Good morning, loyal citizens!
For reasons unknown (redacted?), the ship bound for the UK (carrying Project infinite Hole for everyone outside North America) was delayed in its departure. However, it is now on its way and you can track its progress right HERE.
We do have some backers in Gibraltar, you may be able wave to the ship as it sails past you in a week or so!

Good morning, loyal Citizens!
Two bits of news for you all today - first the good news...
The ship carrying Project Infinite Hole to North America has set sail and is currently mooching its way across the Pacific. As always, you can track its progress right HERE!

Good afternoon, loyal citizens!
Some good news for you - Project Infinite Hole is being loaded onto ships as I type this and will be setting sail for the UK and US this week.
The projected arrival dates are March 11th for the UK and March 14th for the US. However, things are a bit variable at the moment with international shipping, with boats getting diverted and customs really quite slow at times in both countries.

Good afternoon, loyal Citizens!
Some good news today - this morning we received the entire set of production proofs for Project Infinite Hole. We have checked them, double-checked them and declared everything Doubleplus Good!

Good afternoon, loyal citizens!
More physical proofs of Project Infinite Hole arrived today, including the dice box for the Security Clearance dice. We have spotted only a couple of minor things that need tweaking on the card sets, so we will be moving through this phase at speed.

campaign.story:
"Something suspicious happened last night at the Silver Spoon Speakeasy… and now word on the street says there’s a heist in progress! As the city’s foremost private eye it’s your job to make sense of the clues, solve the puzzles, and identify the criminal masterminds before they steal the goods. ”  
The Code and Key Escape Rooms is partnering with Studio Cypher to release a short puzzle game based on our team-building puzzle game, The Silver Spoon Caper.  
We enjoy puzzles, stories, and engaging team experiences and we love providing unique games through our physical escape rooms. As many of you know, we are always looking for new ways to share these passions with others. We’ve created tabletop puzzle boxes, mobile escape games, outdoor escape rooms, and puzzle events and now we're creating a fun, detective and noir-inspired digital puzzle game! Thanks to Kickstarter’s Lights On initiative we’re able to raise money for The Code and Key and offer this amazing game as a reward!
We've been hard at work to bring the Silver Spoon Caper to life!
You know us - even a global pandemic can’t keep us down! In the midst of being stuck at home, we're working hard on the future projects we have in the works - including a brand new puzzle box and another exciting outdoor escape room partnership with Bloomington Parks and Recreation this summer! But before we can close the social distance, we are creating a delightfully devious digital puzzle experience that combines visual challenges, detective work, fun visuals, and mind-bending logic puzzles in an enjoyable experience for one or more! 
We've expanded the story of the original escape experience and added new characters!
The Silver Spoon Caper takes place in the 1920's prohibition era and draws on Noir detective vibes for the artwork and story. Players help Harriet Lane as she uncovers a murder in a speak easy, encounters puzzles related to the criminals' plans to steal from an unknown location, and brings the criminals to justice in the middle of the heist! This game blends challenging puzzles with detective work and allows you to time yourself as you complete the game. We made this game family-friendly while staying true to the context of the game by including only textual and symbolic references to alcohol and murder.
Help Harriet solve who committed a murder at the Silver Spoon Speakeasy!
We are particularly excited to be partnering with Studio Cypher, a local Bloomington, Indiana game development company, to adapt our successful large group team-building puzzle experience into a digital game. We’re thrilled with the results and are finishing up production of this game to help us raise money to support The Code and Key’s projects and staff while our physical location is closed.
Studio Cypher has graciously allowed us to include their most recent project as a reward during this campaign to the $10 pledge tier and above. Diorama Detective is a  quirky Augmented Reality iOS detective game which allows you to recreate crime scenes and take pictures of evidence to solve the case! 
The Team behind the Game:
Alex does the spreadsheet stuff, Kate does the fun stuff, and Adam does the puzzle stuff!
The Code and Key Escape Rooms specializes in immersive puzzles and storytelling and works to build community through engaging puzzle experiences.
Studio Cypher - Life Improving Games
Studio Cypher is an independent game developer that refuses to be limited by location or format. They want to put amazing games everywhere! They bring their 15+ years of game design experience to the Silver Spoon Caper and we’re delighted to know and work with such an amazing business.
Rajin Shankar - Artist Extraordinaire
Rajin Shankar is the amazing artist behind the characters and art in the Silver Spoon Caper. He is working on his own game, Pet Putt, in his spare time.

Thank you for helping us create amazing experiences and thank you for supporting us so that we can create puzzles, narratives, and experiences that challenge you to think creatively. We hope that what we’ve done here will inspire you to create your own puzzles and stories!

We at the Code & Key are running this part-time while working from home and taking care of children but we've been able to carve out time in the evenings, when kids are taking naps, and on the weekends. We're pretty proud of what we've been able to do with the resources we have and we're excited to be collaborating with Studio Cypher and other amazing artists to be able to make this a reality. campaign.story:
After four years of producing our successful, episodic series at  Immersion Escape Rooms and creating multiple custom-designed group adventures, we are expanding our reach beyond Charlottesville, Virginia. We have developed a new interactive mystery that will immerse and puzzle players across the country from the comfort of their own homes.  We’re tapping the passionate members of the Kickstarter community to support our efforts. Let's take The Messenger beyond a single prototype so that fans of immersive fiction and escape rooms can experience our tightly woven narrative from anywhere in the United States!
Its contents are a mystery and it appears that anyone who receives the parcel must follow a strict set of rules, or suffer the consequences:
The parcel must remain in the current owner's possession.
One must never reveal any details concerning the parcel's delivery or its contents. 
Wrapped Parcel
However, the previous owner, Shaun Lyons, has broken the rules, targeting you as the parcel's next recipient. It's now up to you to decipher the information and find a way to break the cycle. The fate of your soul and those of others rests on your ability to solve the mystery. Tick Tock...  
PLAY

The Messenger is a rich and immersive story told through a combination of mediums including handcrafted documents, video and audio files, artifacts, and online content. Upon receipt, you'll enter an intriguing world of fiction that blends actual events with engaging storytelling. Progress through the story by solving puzzles and making connections. With every solution, the story becomes more clear and you'll soon realize that you hold the key to unlocking a dark past that has been plaguing the souls of recipients who have been bound by the same fate for centuries. It's up to you to break the curse. 
We are offering The Messenger as a complete experience, loaded with hours of content and gameplay. It does not require a subscription. Everything you need to solve the mystery and reveal the entire story is included. We are holding back some details to protect the integrity of the mystery, but here is a peek inside: 
 The Document Collection:  Sift through letters, newspaper clippings, floorplans, and other aged documents.
 The Wooden Book: A uniquely crafted, wood-bound notebook filled with encrypted text, symbols, hidden meanings, and more. Decipher this tome by using the included materials, make connections, discover characters and plot points, and reveal what the parcel's past recipients have failed to uncover.
 Narrative Items: Physical items that will aid you in solving the mystery while learning more about the parcel's previous owners.
 Audio Cassette: An old recording from 1993.
 USB Drive With Shaun's Research: A collection of digital files including audio and video recordings, documents, and links to hidden websites. 
 Sealed Envelope: Break the seal and find help with the mystery. 
 File Access: Playing the audio cassette or retrieving content from the USB Drive is not required to fully participate in the experience. You will receive a link to Shaun's personal database, giving you online access to content on both the USB Drive and the Audio Cassette. 
In addition to The Messenger rewards, we've also crafted some extras. These unique enhancements can be chosen as stand-alone items or added on to other rewards by adjusting your pledge amount to include the additional cost. 
The Messenger Collector's Coin: This oversized, antique plated metal coin bears imagery from the mystery on the front and the Immersion seal on the back. This reward is included in The Messenger:  Collector's Edition. 
Collector's Coin Prototype Designs
The Wooden Journal: A 4" x 6" wood-bound 80-page journal that has all of the aesthetics of the Wooden Book included in The Messenger editions, but delivered with blank pages. A unique and creative place to keep your notes safe. 
The Wooden Journal
Why are we doing this? That answer is simple, we're storytellers. Our goal is to engage audiences in unique ways and we've made it our passion to share our love of immersive fiction and escape rooms with the overwhelmingly supportive Charlottesville, Virginia community for the past four years. Opening up our creativity to a larger audience is a goal we’ve aspired to reach from day one. We want everyone who enjoys what we do to experience the stories we've only just begun to tell. We hope that The Messenger is just the first of many. 
Once our Kickstarter campaign successfully wraps we will immediately begin materials sourcing and production. We have made relationships with suppliers and will begin placing orders and receiving materials based on the quantities needed to fulfill our commitments to backers. 
We estimate that we will begin pre-assembling parcels one month after our campaign ends. We will also finalize our digital and online content during this time period, including additional story elements and puzzles.
The following months will be dedicated to producing our unique Wooden Books and Journals. Depending on demand, we may elect to craft these in-house, however, we do have connections to several local artisans and custom book manufacturers who will be able to provide additional production support, if necessary.
In the closing month before we launch we will finalize and QC all of our parcels in preparation for shipping. We aim to have all parcels delivered to backers before the Holiday season.
We sincerely appreciate each and every person who has supported us throughout these past four years and we welcome new community members to join us on this journey. With your help, we will be able to reach our goal and bring this exciting project to fruition. It has been a pleasure sharing our story. Please drop us a line here or e-mail us directly at hello@immersionescaperooms.com. We are looking forward to hearing from you!

campaign.story:
Help build an awesome book of twenty boss battles and climactic encounters for your D&D games.
The best 5e fantasy roleplaying games are often the most unpredictable. When the plans of the Gamemaster meet the actions of the characters, the incredible creative energy that results can spin encounters off in different directions, creating a largely spontaneous campaign story that keeps the GM and the players alike on the edge of their seats. But when it comes to the climactic boss battle encounters that cap off single adventures or entire campaigns, it’s often much harder for GMs to work things out on the fly.
That’s where this book comes in. 
Fantastic Lairs cover art by Jack Kaiser
Scott Gray, James Introcaso, and Mike Shea have teamed up to lighten the load of shaping and developing your game’s climactic encounters. Fantastic Lairs is a book of capstone lair encounters for your 5e fantasy RPG, designed to inspire and fit into your own campaign. Each fantastic lair includes evocative artwork, a beautiful full-color map, and a well-designed and playtested boss encounter for characters of various levels.
Check out the free sample, which includes two fantastic lairs you can use right now! We're also releasing virtual tabletop-ready maps for these two lairs so you can run them easily online.
The initial campaign goal for this book includes lairs for 1st- through 10th-level characters, each of which includes instructions for scaling it for different levels of play. After breaking through five stretch goals, we will now add lairs for 11th- through 20th-level play. The book will now include twenty lairs for all four tiers of play. 
Fantastic Lairs is the joint brainchild of all three members of the design team, each of whom brings a wealth of creative skill and experience to the project. From over fifty initial concepts, the team narrowed down a selection of twenty ultimate boss lairs for development in this book.
Your support for this project will fund the design, development, editing, artwork, and cartography that will make this book a reality. The more support we receive, the better the book will be. 
Internal view of Caves of the Cockatrice (Illustration by Allie Briggs)
The Lairs
Thanks to our backers' outstanding support we will have the following twenty lairs in this book.
Lair of the Cockatrice (1st Level). A shadow-infused cockatrice keeps a stone garden in a lair built around an ancient and corrupted fey gateway.
Centipede Cultists (Tier 1). A band of centipede-worshipping cultists feed living sacrifices to their pets in a fallen temple of Asmodeus.
Nevermind (Tier 1). The Dead Roses, a band of cutthroats led by the murderous bandit captain Adilia Rose, hide out between jobs in a seedy tavern built from a titan's skull.
Lord Whiskers (Tier 1). A band of wererats led by the megalomaniacal Lord Whiskers gathers up all the city's silver to be destroyed in their trap-infested sewer lair.
Nature's Rage (Tier 1). A blood-drenched druid and a horde of beasts plot revenge against the despoilers of nature in the ruined zoo of a murdered noble.
The Fiery Belly of the Beast (Tier 2). The half-dragon Tharandra Everflame and her kobold minions steer a machine of war and fire through defenseless villages.
The Lamia Job (Tier 2). The characters must infiltrate a mysterious bank vault to reveal the murderous plots and corrupting illusions of a lamia mastermind.
The Blood Palace (Tier 2). In a lost ziggurat of blood, a sinister spirit naga and its enthralled gnolls need the adventurers' help — to feed their hidden hydra.
Sticky Toffee (Tier 2). The confections at Auntie Bea's Sweet Treats are more than they seem — as is the shop's night hag proprietor.
Those Who Are About to Die (Tier 2). The characters face waves of brutal combatants and devastating hazards in this arena of blood, death, and fire.
Bumpy Ride (Tier 2). A mage uses his airship and an array of deadly incendiary devices to terrorize other wizards into subservience, and the characters must put an end to it.
Deadtention (Tier 2). An oni poses as the kindly headmaster of an academy for young sorcerers, where he uses a dark ritual to sacrifice faculty members and increase his power.
Ithrix Blackblood (Tier 2). A young black dragon uses his acidic breath to keep a band of trolls under his sway in an ancient cyclopean ruin.
The Blue Dragon Spellthief (Tier 3). The characters pursue a blue dragon mage set on robbing an arcane vault filled with volatile magical artifacts.
The Blade Queen's Throne (Tier 3). The characters must retrieve a secret word required to save the world — but that word is protected by a powerful marilith for its demon lord master.
Tomb of the Dragonlords (Tier 3). In the desert tomb of an ancient dragon queen, a dragonborn mummy lord guards a magical jewel that might destroy the world.
Blood Rain (Tier 3). A cloud giant vampire moves across the sky in a red cloud castle defended by monstrous thralls and vampire spawn, raining blood upon the land that raises ghouls in its wake.
The Lich's Sanctum (Tier 4). In an astral sanctum that defies natural physics, the characters battle an ancient lich responsible for the deaths of nine worlds.
Put the Monster Back (Tier 4). The tarrasque breaks free of a secure facility designed to hold the worst monsters of creation, and will tear through the walls of reality, devouring entire worlds unless the characters stop it.
Blood and Gold (Tier 4). In a shattered celestial temple, an ancient gold dragon is possessed by a demon prince encased in a spike buried in the dragon's chest, and threatens the mystical pillar that holds the multiverse together.
 (Many of these lair names are placeholders for now, and are likely to change.)
Surprise-dra! (Illustration by Jack Kaiser)
Art Book. Every backer will receive the digital version of the Fantastic Lairs Art Book, containing the art and maps for each lair, suitable for showing to your players. Those backing the print-option tier will also have the option to buy a physical art book at the cost of printing and shipping.
Reward Tiers
We have two simple reward tiers for this project: the $15 digital tier and the $20 physical tier. The physical tier will give you the ability to buy print-on-demand copies of the book and any print-based stretch goals at the cost of printing and shipping, fulfilled by DriveThruRPG.
Stretch Goals
We have already broken through ten stretch goals adding ten lairs, a monster appendix, and an art book for all backers. We have also unlocked a hardcover option for all print-on-demand backers. (Backers of the $20 print-on-demand option tier will be able to order either softcover or hardcover versions of the book at the cost of printing and shipping.) We have more stretch goals coming in the future.
We’re also going to put together adventure outlines that we’ll be releasing to all backers as a digital-download PDF supplement to Fantastic Lairs. Each of these adventure outlines will provide DMs with the narrative bare bones of a potential adventure arc — or even a full campaign — linking and leading into some of our own favorite fantastic lairs from the book. Each outline is like a summary that you can use as a starting point and narrative guideline to build a full adventure or campaign, highlighting potential plot points, cool backstories, great locations, exciting encounters, memorable NPCs and monsters, and more.
These outlines will be written by TK Johnson, LaTia Jacquise, Lysa Penrose, Jen Vaughn, Leon Barillaro, Willy Abeel, Casey Machado, Collette Quach, Rich Lescouflair, and Jess Ross.
We're also adding THREE final, special boss lairs based on suggestions given to us by backers. Voting in the backers-only poll is now live and will end at the same time as the Kickstarter!
The Physical Tier and Print-on-Demand
As we have in other projects, this project will deliver physical rewards as print-on-demand books from DriveThruRPG. You will be responsible for the costs of printing and shipping once the books are done. Both printing and shipping costs vary depending on the size of the book and any increases in costs from the printers, but they are usually very reasonable (roughly $11 for the softcover and $23 for the hardcover + shipping).
Delivering books through a print-on-demand publisher helps us keep the costs down as much as possible. It's the most efficient way to get this physical book into your hands.

campaign.story:
For 10,000 years and more, empires have risen under the aegis of those that have gone before, rising to heights undreamed of, but all will come to ashes in the end! 
A truly epic adventure saga, Aegis of Empires, is here for 5th Edition DnD, Pathfinder RPG (1st Edition), and Pathfinder Second Edition! This spectacular 600-page fantasy-horror adventure path can be played in any world but is specifically designed for the incredibly detailed Lost Lands Setting (which project lead Greg Vaughan spent nearly a decade perfecting with the classic adventures of Necromancer Games and Frog God Games). Your heroes must trek across the Kingdoms of Foere, Reme, the Vast, and beyond to uncover the clues of an ancient mystery, a lost prince, an expedition to the ends of the earth, and a silent apocalypse stealthily creeping to overwhelm the land, from the start of their careers up to 17th level! This spectacular saga from the powerful pens of Alistair J. Rigg, Jeff Swank, Matt Goodall, Steve Helt, Tom Knauss, Anthony Pryor, and Greg Vaughan includes a 48-page Player's Guide to introduce the history and lore of the region, compatible with all three game systems, and then follows it up with six additional adventures and their appendices full of new magic, monsters, equipment, player handouts, and more:
 Book 1: The Book in the Old House – by Alistair J. Rigg – Help a young knight rid his ancestral manor of its haunts and discover the beginnings of a deeper mystery going much further back in time.
 Book 2: The Ebon Soul – by Jeff Swank – Heroes face an ancient vampire’s curse and must deal with the consequences and troubles of a forgotten empire’s underworld that proves to be very much alive and well.
 Book 3: When Comes the Moon – by Matt Goodall – The mountain outpost of a religious order from a bygone era starts to look like the setting for a werewolf hunt, but memories of older times continue to have ramifications in the present day as the hunters become the hunted on the mountain peaks.
 Book 4: Legend of the Burning Star – by Steve Helt – Seek an ancient meteor crater holding riches in sky metals, but past expeditions seeking it came to naught…until a never-before-seen journal surfaces and puts the players on that path once again.
 Book 5: Race for Shataakh-Uulm – by Tom Knauss – Heroes traverse a haunted and desolate land to claim the meteorite’s riches before others jump their claim and discover the unspeakable fate of the original explorers.
 Book 6: Knight Fall in Old Curgantium – by Anthony Pryor – The quest comes full circle to the capital of the Hyperborean Empire, ruined in ancient holocaust yet whose menace threatens to arise once more and bring calamity to the empires that have arisen in its place as destiny turns to doom!
The above covers feature some of the fantastic interior artwork in each adventure, but we've also commissioned sensational new cover images from some of our favorite artists as our first set of stretch goals below! Within these pages you'll find savage adventuring action and tantalizing treasures for your favorite system, with each chapter steeped in the lore of the Lost Lands!
As if our versions for DnD 5E and the 1st Edition of the Pathfinder RPG were not enough, Aegis of Empires represents an especially exciting opportunity for fans of Pathfinder Second Edition, as this is the very first third-party PF2E project with this kind of epic size and scope, designed by the same company that partnered with Paizo, Inc. to create their massive upcoming Kingmaker Anniversary Edition Adventure Path, Companion Guide, Pathfinder RPG Bestiary, and the Kingmaker 5E Bestiary! 
Chock full of amazing artwork and beautiful maps, this adventure saga brings home the towering cities of Foere and Reme, the sweeping vistas of the Kingdom of the Vast, and journeys through back alleys and sewers, soaring mountains and rolling plains, and of course the occasional creepy dungeon and mysterious monastery! 
This is a classic fantasy saga blending elements of cosmic horror and deep lore in a rich and evocative setting. I can confidently say this compendium won’t be shy sitting on your shelf next to the very best adventure path sags and mega-modules like Slumbering Tsar! We hope you’re as excited to see this project come to fruition as we are, and we appreciate your support joining the project, sharing and commenting on social media, and spreading the word to make this book truly Legendary!  
In order to keep this Kickstarter simple, we are asking you to select one game system (5E, PFRPG, or PF2E) for your base pledge. We know that many of you play multiple systems, and we are delighted to offer that option as well, so you'll have the opportunity to add those extra systems to your original pledge in our Backerkit survey at the end of the campaign, where you can indicate which PDFs and print books you wish to add at a special discounted price on top of your base pledge.
Add $40 - Get an additional Aegis of Empires PDF for a different system (add twice if you want all three systems)
Add $80 - Add an extra print book of the Aegis of Empires (for any system). Each additional print copy after your base pledge is at the discounted $80 price.
NOTE: If you do plan to add on extra copies in Backerkit later on, send us a message through Kickstarter when you pledge letting us know which extras you plan to get, so we can keep a running tally of how many people want each system! 
Every copy of the Aegis of Empires Adventure Path Deluxe Compilation includes a chapter for the Player's Guide that introduces the lore and history of the campaign for players and GMs alike, but some GMs might want to get a separate copy of the 48-page Player's Guide to hand out to their players for reference during play without having to hand the giant 600-page adventure book around the table! 
Add $10 - Get a print copy of the Aegis of Empires Player's Guide (including rules for all three game systems)
Add $5 - Get an additional PDF copy of the Aegis of Empires Player's Guide that can be gifted or personalized to someone else
In addition, the Aegis of Empires Adventure Path includes a healthy dose of horror themes in places. GMs who wish to play up that side of the campaign can grab a copy of the Gothic Campaign Compendium, packed with 256 pages of horror-themed character options, monsters, spells, magic items, books of forbidden lore, expanded rules for madness and mutation, and three horror adventures (including two by Aegis of Empires maestro Greg Vaughan)! 
Add $20 - Get the Gothic Campaign Compendium (Pathfinder RPG) PDF
Add $40 - Get the Gothic Campaign Compendium (Pathfinder RPG) print book and PDF (only 50 copies remaining)
While the compiled version is only available for Pathfinder RPG, all of the horror-themed supplements that were combined into the Gothic Campaign Compendium also are available for 5E, though as 10 individual PDFs rather than a single compendium, but we are making them available to you as special a PDF bundle!
Add $20 - Get the Gothic Campaign Compendium (5E) PDF Horror Bundle (10 PDFs)
The Aegis of Empires project is a straightforward one: no crazy bells and whistles, just a rock-solid, incredibly detailed, action-packed adventure saga by amazing authors that will challenge the courage and cleverness of even the most experienced players!  
We'll be talking with some of our favorite people throughout the course of the Kickstarter campaign, and we'll post links to their blogs, podcasts, and other links here as they go live! 
Check out Legendary Games CEO Jason Nelson, Aegis of Empires Project Creator Greg Vaughan, and author of adventure #5, Race for Shataakh-Ulm, Tom Knauss on with the amazing Paco Jaen from GMS Magazine!
 Check out Jason and Greg on with Cameron from Comics, Clerics, and Controllers!
https://comicsclericsandcontrollers.podbean.com/e/cerial-across-aegis-with-jason-and-greg/
   And Jason and Greg tag-teaming with Dan Davenport at #randomworlds!
https://gmshoe.wordpress.com/2020/06/02/qa-jason-eric-nelson-greg-vaughan-aegis-of-empires-adventure-path-for-5e-pathfinder-1e-and-2e/
Is this an official "Lost Lands" product?
It is an officially licensed Lost Lands product, using all of the same people, places, deities, politics, and history from ancient Hyperborea to modern Foere, Reme, and beyond that make this such a rich and immersive place to set your game. If you want more details on this campaign setting, you can pick up the 518-page World of the Lost Lands book at DrivethruRPG, compatible with every game system! Those wanting a more in-depth look at the Grand Duchy of Reme and surrounding lands, which are featured in several of the early adventures in this saga, can pick up the 154-page Grand Duchy of Reme sourcebook at DrivethruRPG.
Can I play this campaign in other worlds?
Absolutely! There is a great deal of world lore embedded into the Aegis of Empires Adventure Path, with historical and cultural information about the cities, nations, and wilderness regions used in the adventure path presented in the Player's Guide and the appendices of the adventures. You can place the adventure path within a self-contained region of your own home world, using the campaign background provided in those sections of this book, or adapt it to connect to existing people and places in your own campaign world.  
Do you have any other Kickstarter projects that are not yet fulfilled?
All other Legendary Games Kickstarter projects have been completed, aside from waiting for print books to arrive and ship for Ultimate Kingdoms and the 5E version of Legendary Planet (PDFs already sent for both). 
How much do I add for shipping?
You add nothing for shipping with your initial pledge. Shipping will be billed later through Backerkit for all print orders. 
Why Backerkit?
In the past we've used our own spreadsheet system to organize rewards, pledges, and backer information, but for this project we're giving the Backerkit system a try to see how it compares in terms of speed and efficiency. All reward fulfillment requires Backerkit checkout, and you'll create a Backerkit account (if you don't already have one) when you select your reward. Making this account verifies your shipping address (and allows you to change it directly in the system without having to email us separately in case you move) and your pledge selection. We'll also send out a post-Kickstarter survey through Backerkit so you can select any additional items you'd like to add to your pledge, such as additional versions of the book for different rule systems. Please complete the Backerkit process ASAP so we can get you your rewards quickly!
