campaign.story:
Nemesis Lockdown is a standalone expansion to the hit Board Game Nemesis (BGG rank overall #33, thematic #10). It builds on the tense, cinematic experience Nemesis is known for, adding even more opportunities for emergent, dramatic gameplay. Become an unlikely survivor, locked in an underground base with something terrifying. Turn up your paranoia, as you try to guess what other players are up to, or what the contingency plan is. Work to learn the weaknesses of your nemesis – or run like hell. Switch off the lights in someone’s lab section. Take a dangerous trek to the outside bunker. And whatever you do, be ready for unexpected!
The game comes with all the components needed for a cinematic Sci-Fi horror experience and doesn't require the Nemesis Core Box.
Nemesis: Lockdown offers 1-5 player semi or full co-op experience that takes around  90-120 minutes and will be different every run! This stand-alone expansion also works with majority of the previous Nemesis content: other Alien races and most of the characters. 
During this campaign you can also get classic Nemesis Core Box (only in English) and all the previous expansion (in 6 different Languages)! 

Click for more info!


Nemesis Lockdown previews 
Nemesis Core Box
Nemesis: Lockdown setting
I should have known when they asked us to prepare the landing platform. There are only two reasons to make a night sample transfer. It’s either too urgent to wait, or it’s a black op. Both spell trouble.
My survival instinct, honed by twenty years of work in the Sample-Return Receiving Facilities, was screaming, considering the rumours that reached even our remote site.
Maybe if I bailed right there, I wouldn’t be crouching in a dark lab, sweaty palms clutching a scalpel, and this damned soft voice repeating over my head: “Containment Breach, Containment Breach…”
Things only got bleaker when they told us there would be human BSL-5-ET subjects coming. Extra-terrestrial samples and living people don’t usually mix. They SHOULD NEVER mix. Something went really bad out there, and we got caught in it.
When Martinsen and Sovich processed the first sample, I only caught a peek from behind the armored glass. There was one word on the container.
“Nemesis.”
I wasn’t there when the actual breach happened. There were screams over the intercom. The main power went out. Soon, I saw Martinsen and one of the human subjects running to me from the isolation ward elevator, as if the devil himself chased them. I’ve seen it for a split second, before they were caught. I’d rather take my chances with the devil, than with the thing that took them.
Now, it’s been fifteen minutes since I last heard any shots. The pain in my mangled leg subsides. I get up and slowly make my way to one of the security stations. Am I the only one left? No, thank god! Sovich is still kicking. I have her on a live feed from the main terminal. She’s…
Changing the logs! Switching her name for mine. Frigging rat! When the board learns we had a containment breach, there will be hell to pay, and she wants to make sure the bill is on my name.
Now, she turns towards the main console. In the middle of it, under the protective glass, is the A3-5 button, a big chunk of red plastic. They told us it enables the “Code Red Emergency Protocol” but we had no clearance to know what the protocol actually is.
Don’t do it, Sovich. You might just nuke us. Don’t…
Of course she does. She wants to play the good girl, an upstanding citizen.
Well, there’s still time to fix everything. No one will call until morning. We’re on a dark side of the planet now, blocking all signals. I need to get topside, to the secondary console in the other building. Re-write the logs, access the classified procedures, and see what new trouble she got us into.
The only things between me and my salvation is a broken airlock, a long stretch of hellish surface, and enough gamma radiation to hard-boil an egg. I’m betting these things can’t walk outside.
That would be too frigging unfair...
Gameplay details
This time, you are trapped inside the laboratory hidden somewhere on Mars. This construction has several floors you will be able to travel through via elevators or stairs.
Each section of the board will have a separate power supply that can be cut off at any second. When that happens, elevators stop working, and the corridors sink into pitch-black darkness. This offers an interesting way to slow down the alien pursuit … or to trap other players.
Movement and space management has a very different, tenser feel in Lockdown!
Lockdown will come with an entirely new mechanic called the “Contingency Order.” It represents one of many possible emergency plans (such as “nuke the station” ). The only way to discover which one is active is through investigation and elimination.
Obviously, it’s up to you whether you’re going to share your hard-earned knowledge with other players.
Having a detailed energy system for different sectors of the board allowed us to put more emphasis on the light – or the lack of it. This makes room for more interactions between players and makes controlling the flow of energy through different sections one of the important elements of the game.
There are also items that are a source of light, but they won't last long and will require energy. You may always decide to go through the darkness, but this will make card Events more dangerous and incurs other penalties, such as using different (less accurate) die for shooting.
Lockdown comes with a set of new, freshly designed rooms that thematically reflect a secret base on the surface of Mars. It also contains a whole new set of neutral items, character-specific items, and craftable items.
In our previous campaign, we loved the experience of working with the community to create a new alien race, or to determine the look and professions of the crew members. This led us down a very creative path, and brought amazing, diverse ideas into the game!
With Lockdown, we want to follow up on this experience. In this Kickstarter campaign, you will not only be buying a game, but you'll take part in its creation too!
Nemesis Lockdown comes with high quality, non-essential companion app. It will provide many exciting gameplay modes, a dedicated soundtrack, as well as support for an advanced solo mode.
Thanks to the app, we bring new depth to solo play that will now include the "traitor" tension from semi-cooperative games, as you will never know if you can trust what the app tells you.

campaign.story:
Art by Julianne Griepp
From the creative mind behind Icarus: A Storytelling Game About How Great Civilizations Fall, comes Spenser Starke’s next project Alice is Missing, a silent role-playing game about the disappearance of Alice Briarwood, a high school junior in the small town of Silent Falls. 
Developed by Hunters Entertainment and published & distributed by Renegade Game Studios, Alice Is Missing is a unique kind of roleplaying game in which players only communicate using their phones, sending text messages to each other as they unearth clues about what happened to Alice.
The game is played live and without verbal communication. Players inhabit their character for the entirety of the 90-minute play session, and instead of speaking, send text messages back and forth to the other characters in a group chat, as well as individually, as though they aren’t in the same place together. 
Haunting beautiful, deeply personal, and highly innovative Alice is Missing puts a strong focus on the emotional engagement between players, immersing them in a tense, dramatic mystery that unfolds organically through the text messages they send to one another. Right at home with games like Life Is Strange, Gone Home, Oxenfree, and Firewatch, it’s designed to feel as much like an event-style experience as it does a role-playing game.
Alice Is Missing runs over a single session of 2-3 hours, with 3-5 players. In the first 45 minutes, players create their characters, their relationships to Alice, and their ties with each other. The next 90 minutes are spent uncovering secrets and unearthing clues in an attempt to discover where Alice is, and who is behind her disappearance.
Though text messages seem to be the most common mode of communication in our modern era, they are rarely utilized as a storytelling medium.
The integration of texting into the gameplay unlocks a brand new way to play RPGs that is unlike anything you’ve likely experienced before. It’s personal, immersive, and perfect for remote play.

Powered by simple but unique card mechanics that give everyone equal footing in telling the story, the game runs without a GM, or gamemaster, and instead empowers the players to create the story together.
While in-game time is fluid and the text messages could take place over the course of a day or more, the actual gameplay lasts a total of 90 minutes and is accompanied by a beautifully cinematic, licensed music playlist (featuring artists such as Message To Bears, This Patch of Sky, Justin LaPointe, and Be Still The Earth) which acts as both a timer and a soundtrack for the game.
You’ll start by choosing characters, drawing a motive for how that character acts, and assigning relationships to one another. Then, using the appropriate prompts on your character card, each player will record a secret voicemail to be played at the end of the game.
You’ll then establish some important information about your town of Silent Falls by choosing suspects and locations you think could have played a part in Alice’s disappearance. Lastly, you’ll receive Clue Cards that will be used during the game to generate information about the mystery you’re unraveling.
Once the timer starts and the game begins, you’ll flip your Clue Card when the number on the timer hits the number on the Clue Card’s back. This will often result in you drawing a card from the Suspect or Location deck and combining it with the prompt on the Clue Card to create the information your character uncovers.
This clue is then worked into the text conversation between the characters organically.

These clues will continue to be revealed throughout the game, building tension and heightening the stakes until the 10-minute card flips, and the game comes to its climactic end.
 Once the timer goes off at 90 minutes, players will have the opportunity to send one last text message before the secret voicemails play over the closing music track. Once the voicemails are finished and the current song ends, the game comes to a close. 
By putting its lens on the relationships, tensions, and story arcs between the characters looking for Alice just as much as the search for Alice itself, the game challenges players to explore aspects of emotional intimacy and personal connection in a unique and accessible way.
Alice Is Missing inherently deals with mature themes and potentially-difficult topics such as gender, sexuality, violence, and grief. We’ve been lucky enough to bring on the incredibly talented Lauren McManamon (Girl Underground, Good Society: A Jane Austen RPG, Codex) as our editor to ensure these topics are approached in a thoughtful and responsible manner. 
We’ve also included important tools to help navigate these themes at the table (and off the table) to ensure everyone has both an exhilarating and positive experience.
Though the game has been in development for the last year, in an unintentional way, it mirrors the reality we now face during this era of social distancing; the craving for connection despite the distance that may be between us.
Alice is Missing provides a unique way to play without the traditional hang-ups that come with trying to structure a Virtual Table Top session. Since the only time you'll need to 'go to the table' is to grab a card. The meat of gameplay exists on your mobile devices.
 We’ve put a great deal of work into ensuring Alice Is Missing will be available as a marketplace item on Roll20 not long after the campaign ends. With the lack of in-person gaming opportunities given the current social distancing orders in place around the world, we hope by making the game available in this format quickly, it will allow players to share a unique roleplaying experience together from the comfort and safety of their own home.
The Roll20 version of the game will not replace the use of players’ phones for sending text messages back and forth during the game. It will instead serve as your shared table during online play, allowing everyone to interact with the cards that drive the narrative forward.
 For those of you who would rather not use Roll20, we are offering a PDF with a Print on Demand cards via DTRPG to use with your other messaging systems of choice. It’s important to emphasize, however, that the cards need to be communally accessible individually via a cloud or other software to manage remote play in this way.
We plan to release the digital version of Alice is Missing in July 2020. We plan to release the physical version to our backers in November 2020, with the game being made available to stores soon after through a global publishing deal with Renegade Game Studios. We will use DriveThruRPG for all of our digital fulfillment.
 For this project, we will be charging shipping as we fulfill each item. YOUR PLEDGE DOES NOT INCLUDE THE COST OF SHIPPING. 
We will be using a pledge manager to collect information from backers. 
 We will be using Gamerati for all of our domestic and international fulfillment purposes.
Domestic Shipping: For traditional USPS shipping, we expect to charge ~$8 USD per package through our warehouse for the physical pledge.
International Shipping: We will be working with our fulfillment partner for available countries in order to ship via local shipping options. 
We expect the cost of shipping for the physical package to be as follows: 
Australia and New Zealand: ~$8 USD
Canada and the European Union: ~$12 USD 
Europe (Non-EU): ~$19 USD
Rest of the world ~$25 USD
NOTE: The final cost of shipping may differ from our estimations.

Welcome Back to Hellenica: Story of Greece. We are excited to offer our new expansion for the game, Leaders & Legends!
Leaders & Legends is an expansion for Hellenica: Story of Greece that adds unique leaders to the game allowing players to modify the characteristics of their city-state.
Each leader confers a special bonus on the city-state that recruits them. For example, Heracles aids in fighting Mythological Creatures while Socrates makes your research more productive. Each leader is represented by a deck of cards that appear in a market that players review to recruit the leaders that they want. But, watch out, other players may be desiring the same leaders as you and leaders will not serve two city-states!
New to Hellenica? No problem! 
We are offering the Limited Edition Core Game (jam packed with Stretch Goals from the previous campaign) on this campaign as well!
Limited Edition Hellenica Core Game - A whopping 11.8lbs of gaming goodness!
An explosion of creativity and violence erupted in the Aegean Basin in 800 B.C. that defined ancient Greece. This combination of science, mythology, development, and war was led by powerful city-states like Athens, Sparta, Corinth, Troy, Byzantium, Corcyra, and Thebes. These states vied for control over their rivals and dominated the lesser states around them. In time, some of them became so well known that they are remembered even today.
Everything inside of the Limited Edition Hellenica Core Game
Hellenica: Story of Greece is a 3.5X civilization game in which you harness the powers of one of seven beginning city-states to dominate the world around you. Your goal is to become the preeminent symbol of Greece for all posterity by completing a combination of secret and public goals. Will you be remembered as a warmonger or a peaceful philosopher? Great priest or apostate? Will you develop a devotion to the gods or focus on the advancement of your people? Can you guide your civilization during these turbulent times? Will your vision of Hellenic civilization be remembered for all time, or will you merely be a stepping stone for another…?

campaign.story:
Expand the stories behind your favorite board games!
For years, CMON and Guillotine Games have collaborated on multiple projects, bringing unforgettable settings and characters to the tabletop. The worlds created inspired the imagination of thousands of players all over the world, providing them with exciting adventures, full of danger and battles against all forms of evil.
Now, we joined forces with great authors and illustrators from the comics world to take it to the next level and explore these settings like never before! Get ready to experience Zombicide, Cthulhu: Death May Die, and Zombicide: Invader in a whole new way, with beautifully illustrated, brilliantly written, hardcover graphic novels. And on top of it, get exclusive extra content not only for the comics but for the board games that inspired them! 
Author of Italian comic book series and novels, Stefano is 54 years old and lives and works on the shores of Lake Iseo, near Bergamo. He began his comic book career in 1990, writing stories for many characters including TMNT (Mirage Studios), SPIDER-MAN (Marvel), LIFE ZERO (Panini Comics), ANGIE DIGITWIN (TIM). For Sergio Bonelli Editore, together with Luca Enoch, he created the fantasy character of DRAGONERO.
Author of comic book series and novels, he lives and works in Milan as both a writer and cartoonist. His career began as a graphic designer and illustrator, for publishing and advertising houses. In 1992 he created his first character "Sprayliz", for the comics magazine “L’Intrepido”. For Sergio Bonelli Editore created the series “Gea”, in 1999, and “Lilith” In 2008. For the French market he wrote the sci-fi fantasy series “Morgana” and historical detective story “Rangaku”. In 2007, Enoch published "Dragonero", written together with Stefano Vietti, a graphic novel which, since 2011, became a monthly series, and is still published worldwide. 
Alessio Moroni is a cartoonist from Turin, Italy. He made his debut in 2016 as artist and co-creator of the creator-owned series "Darwin", written by Giulio Gualtieri. He works as penciller and inker for the series "Caput Mundi" for Editoriale Cosmo, "WeRace" for Scuderia Ferrari, and "Orfani" for Sergio Bonelli publisher. He carries on collaborating with Bonelli on "Dragonero".
A comic book artist from Salerno, Marco started his career drawing a documentary series on prehistoric monsters for Zenescope. He continued to collaborate in the US market with IDW (TMNT) and Aftershock Comics (Volition). Co-creator of the anthropomorphic western Djungle, by Panini Comics, he also worked on a Chiuaua Werewolves for Sony Hero Records. 
Riccardo is an Italian comic book author, illustrator, game designer and conceptual artist. He worked with Kappa edizioni, Mondadori, Le Lombard, Editions Soleil and Les Humanoïdes Associés. He created the character of Rigor Mortis the Evil Genius, for which he wrote comic stories and published novels between 1994 and 2005. He also worked on the board game Kragortha, and the card games Looterz (CMON) and Aye, Dark Overlord (Pendragon/Giochi Uniti). He currently works for Sergio Bonelli Editore on the Dragonero and Dragonero Adventures series, and on the new ongoing series Sottosopra.
Simone is a comics drawer, inker and colorist born in 1979 at Udine, Italy. He has worked with several publishers in Italy including: CMON, Sergio Bonelli Editore, Disney, BD edizioni, Red Whale, Kinder & Ferrero, Piemme, Salani editore, Gotem Studio, Rainbow, Soleil, and Renoir Comics.
Giancarlo has worked as a comic artist since 1991. With a group of colleagues, he created the series Fullmoon Project (1991 Eden) and Hammer (1994 Star comics). In those years he also worked for Lazarus Ledd (Star Comics). In 1996 he started collaborating with Sergio Bonelli Editore, drawing several characters (Nathan Never, Legs Weaver, Dragonero, Orfani...). He has also collaborated with Editions Soleil (2012 L'or des Fous) S.Paolo Editions/Marvel (2006/07 Next 02 – Spider-Man) and Disney (2004 Kyllion).
Filipe Pagliuso is an artist based in Brazil. He graduated in Graphic Design and started to study drawing and painting on his own after that. He worked for companies like Games Workshop and CD Projekt Red, and is currently part of CMON’s Art team. He collaborated in many different projects, bringing to life several cool characters like some of the Abominations from Zombicide: 2nd Edition, and the insanities in Cthulhu: Death May Die. 
After completing a BA Honors in Fine Art, Stefan worked in various design fields, including 5 years in Games Workshop’s Production and Design Studios in Nottingham as a Photoshop consultant, project coordinator and digital illustrator. From 2004 he started working as a freelance illustrator. He started working primarily for the games industry, helping visualize and realize the weird and wonderful ideas from the minds of some great companies around the world. Stefan now lives with his family in West Yorkshire, working full time as part of the CMON team, creating artwork for titles like Death May Die and A Song of Ice and Fire.
Pedro Núñez is a painter and illustrator based in Madrid, Spain, and has more than 15 years' experience in the entertainment industry as a concept artist, designer and art director. After working for animation studios and TV commercial projects, he worked as a concept artist in the entire KONAMI - Castlevania Lords of Shadow saga including the tittle for NINTENDO "Castlevania  Mirror of Fate". Pedro then moved to Nottingham to join the GAMES WORKSHOP art department as an illustrator, with which he has collaborated for the past 10 years. As a freelance artist, in addition to working for GW, he has regularly collaborated with Bigchild Creatives, developing art on projects such as "Rum & Bones", concept, cover, and character art for the "A Song of Ice and fire" miniatures game. Currently, Pedro has joined the staff of Bigchild creatives, being hired as art director where he will continue adding his talent to such well-known licenses as Zombicide.
Born in 1978 in the north east of Italy, Paolo is an illustrator, cartoonist, colorist and mosaicist. He works for various national and foreign publishing houses, like Marvel, Dark Horse, Glènat, Soleil, and Sergio Bonelli Editore. For the latest he also works as a consultant, managing the colors section of the series Dragonero. He uses digital media for everyday work, but continues to love the use of watercolors or acrylics for his more personal work.
Marina is the lettering manager at Sergio Bonelli Editore. After studying drawing for fabrics in Como, Italy, and following a screenwriting course in Milan, she began her career in 1984 as a freelancer in Rizzoli Editore and in Sergio Bonelli Editore. She has worked in SBE since 1985, dealing with manual and digital lettering, font creation and editing font, and supervision and control of technical file parameters. Other collaborations: Glenat, Dargaud and freelance authors. Great passion: the creation of manual calligraphy.
Born in 1991 in Alzano Lombardo, Italy, Matteo is a lover of basketball, fantasy books, comics, cinematography and art in general; the music nourishes his creations. After completing high school, Matteo started his career as a graphic designer in advertising. Life brought him to enroll at the Politecnico University of Milan. During the studies, he continued to work in an independent graphic design studio, with a focus on 3D graphic modeling and advertising. Among others, he collaborates with another graphic studio specialized in sportswear design focused on basketball. In 2017 he graduated with a Bachelor’s degree of Communication Design. In the same year he started the collaboration with Sergio Bonelli Editore, within the Dragonero comic series team – the beginning of his career as graphic designer in the publishing field.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our 44th Kickstarter, and there are some vagaries in terms of timing when it comes to anything produced in China, such as:
Production delays
Shipping delays
Customs delays 

The estimated delivery date for this project is February 2021, but keep in mind this is only an estimate. Also, due to the logistics of international shipping, backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others.

We've done our best to minimize this as much as possible, and we are always happy to refund pledges if for some totally unforeseen reason the game can't be delivered at all.

REFUND POLICY

We can refund you within 14 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. After that, we have a policy of no questions asked, though that’s minus Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we can’t get back from them after 14 days). However, if we’ve begun packaging your pledge for shipment, no refunds are possible. If a component cannot be delivered AT ALL, we refund that completely, including fees.

All refunds after the 14 days close of the campaign may be processed via PayPal or reversed via Stripe to your credit card at our discretion. Refunds within 14 days are reversed via Stripe to your credit card. This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project was active.

If you do not log in and confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email to confirm your pledge, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge if you contact us and confirm your pledge after the 8 week window has elapsed. Unconfirmed pledges make it difficult for us to plan production and logistics, and in the past have led to project delays. For this project we do not intend to allow this to happen, which may mean if you confirm your pledge too late, exclusive items may not be produced in sufficient quantity for your pledge.

If you confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email, you agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our pledge manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods. We regret we are unable to ship to PO Boxes.

All backers that have selected “No Reward” on Kickstarter, that wish to receive a reward for this campaign, must make sure to confirm their order by the Pledge Manager Deadline. We will announce the date for this once the Pledge Manager becomes live. All “No Reward” pledges will be treated as donations once the Pledge Manager Deadline has passed.

If you do not accept these terms please do not pledge on this project, but instead wait for the retail release.

To make sure you have the best gaming experience, all CMON products are warrantied against manufacturing defects for 2 years from the of date purchase from CMON (proof of purchase required). If you open your game and see that something is missing or broken, our customer service team will work hard to get you replacement parts and make things right. Simply contact them at https://support.cmon.com/hc/en-us. Note: Warranty does not cover accidental damage, theft, loss, or any other event that is not a manufacturing defect.

campaign.story:
What is The Emerald Flame? 
Hours of puzzles with an interwoven narrative packed into a beautifully illustrated tabletop game. 
Like a blend of escape rooms, board games, and interactive fiction, The Emerald Flame tells an exciting story over three distinct episodes, each packed with puzzles of varying difficulty designed to challenge and engage players of all experience levels.
Commissioned by the Koschei Historical Society, you will take on the role of a historical expert and embark on a quest to piece together a recipe for a transformative elixir by deciphering messages, interpreting alchemical diagrams, and manipulating mysterious artifacts. 
Play cooperatively as a group or go on a solo adventure! Each of the 3 chapters takes about 2-3 hours to solve, totaling 6-9 hours of gameplay. 
PostCurious, the company behind the “insidiously clever” puzzle adventure The Tale of Ord, invites you to be part of the story and uncover what many have sought for centuries: what hides in the glow of The Emerald Flame.   
The Emerald Flame requires no setup, and no complicated rules. You will need an internet-connected device for the use of a web browser, but there is no outside knowledge or research required.   
Explore the objects, solve puzzles, and submit your solutions into an online chat to get responses in real time. If you get stuck on a puzzle, don’t worry! You’ll have a detailed online hinting system at your disposal should you need a nudge in the right direction.
 CLICK HERE TO VIEW THE RULES DOC 
The base game will include a refill kit that will allow for one additional play-through by another group. UPDATE: Because we have hit a stretch goal, Kickstarter backers at the Junior Alchemist and up level will receive a 2nd refill kit. More on the refill kit below.   
It would mean so much to us if you would help us reach our funding goal by pledging for a copy of the game! We do also understand that everyone’s circumstances are different in these uncertain times. As long as supplies last, Patron and Apprentice backers will be able to upgrade their pledge at a later date when things are hopefully more certain.    
UPDATE: The enamel pin poll is open in update #8. Because we reached our $150k stretch goal, the winner of the poll will be included for Junior Alchemist backers, and BOTH pins will be included in the Apprentice Pack! 
Join us for puzzles throughout the campaign! 
The story of The Emerald Flame revolves around working with the Koschei Historical Society to analyze a legendary alchemist’s work… but The Koschei Society first needs your help to find that work! You are being invited to join the investigation at its earliest stages and help them follow a series of clues that will hopefully lead to the location of the alchemist’s hiding spot.   
We expect to find 5 artifacts, one of which will be posted on the Koschei Society forum every Wednesday evening, before being shared publicly on Thursdays in our campaign updates and on social media. You can join the forum to see the puzzles early and/or to solve them with others as a group!
To join the forum, find the two words hidden somewhere on this Kickstarter page. One will complete this link www.koscheisociety.org/__________ (10 letters) and the other will give you a 5-letter password (enter in lowercase) to access the page. Regardless of whether or not you join the forum, any backer who submits all 5 correct answers before the end of the campaign will be entered to win a special art prize! You can submit your answers at www.koscheisociety.org/submit.
If you're having trouble figuring out the password, take a look at the banner below and see if a tilt in perspective helps. :)   
Now that we have hit our funding goal, we’ve got lots of great stretch goals for The Emerald Flame, including upgraded components and additional items! You can help us reach them by sharing the project on social media - the more people we can get it out to, the more we can unlock all sorts of goodies! 
 Share the project and follow at the links below!

Always another puzzle! With The Emerald Flame in your hands you can discover 3 secret messages hiding in the box artwork.
About the refill kit: Now that we have hit our first stretch goal, the refill kit will include one set of replacements for the non-reusable components, should you want to repackage and pass the game on to someone else. PDFs will be also be provided for the paper components in case extras are needed or if you are playing with a friend remotely. One of our next stretch goals is an additional copy of the refill kit, which would mean a total of 3 possible play-throughs of the game.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Design & Artwork

The main design and artwork in the game is fully finished, with the exception of some last details and final formatting. These will be done immediately after the Kickstarter campaign ends while we wait for the funds so there should be no delays on the creative front. If we reach certain stretch goals, there may be some additional artwork to produce, but we don’t foresee this causing any delay as it can be completed during the sampling phase.

Manufacturing 

This will be PostCurious’ first time working with a manufacturer, which comes with its own challenges. The Emerald Flame is a complex game to produce, so sampling with the factory may take some time. The production copy will be fully inspected by us to make sure everything looks and works the way it should. Please note that due to material availability and manufacturing processes, some components may appear different than shown in the prototype images. As with any project that has complex custom components, there is also a risk of changes or delays, which is why we’ve factored in extra time for manufacturing. We want to make sure the game is perfect for all our backers, and will always keep you updated in case of any changes.

Shipping & Fulfillment

Delivering hundreds of games around the world is not an easy task, and there are many potential factors that could cause delays. We’ll be partnering with Quartermaster Logistics for backers in the Americas, Australia, and Asia, and GamesQuest for backers in the UK and Europe. Both companies are experts in the field and we have full confidence in their ability to troubleshoot whatever obstacles may arise. Please note that while we guarantee customs friendly shipping to USA, Canada, UK, EU, AU, NZ & China backers, we cannot be responsible for VAT or customs charges incurred outside of these regions. Please also note that shipping will be charged after the campaign, and the numbers shown in the shipping chart are estimates only.

Countries not listed in the chart of the “shipping” section above on this page are considered to be “ship at your own risk” areas, meaning we cannot be responsible for mishandled packages in those regions. It is unclear how Brexit will affect shipping into the EU, but we’ve been assured by GamesQuest that there are contingency plans in place should the outcome create obstacles in fulfillment. We do not expect this to affect anyone’s rewards, but we will keep you posted if any changes occur. 

Unforeseen Events

Throughout this process there is always a large number of variables at play, and many factors that could cause delays or changes. This could include severe weather, a global pandemic, or other unexpected circumstances. It is impossible to predict the outcome of such events or how they might affect the production of this project, but we will do everything we reasonably can to make sure the rewards are produced and delivered as promised. We are 100% committed to our backers and will always be sure to notify you with any changes that might affect this project’s content, timeline, shipping, or otherwise. 

Refunds 

Refund requests received within 14 days of the end of the Kickstarter will be honored in full. Refunds requested after two weeks have passed will be subject to a 15-20% cancellation fee due to Kickstarter fees and administrative expenses. Once your order has been processed for shipping, we will no longer be able to offer refunds. Please note that anyone who does not complete the pledge manager by our required deadlines will not be eligible for a refund, and may encounter delays in receiving their rewards. 

By pledging to this project you are indicating that you understand and give consent to the risks, challenges, and pledge terms laid out above.

campaign.story:
Island Siege was first released in 2014. We sold out quickly, and then got busy putting out other games. Well, here it is again. Jump in fast and tell your friends because this project only lasts a short time!
Coin Count Update
With the increasing number of metal Campaign Coins that we're giving away, here's a table to help you determine what you're getting with the total funding amount of $30,000: 
I'll try to keep this updated through the project's end, each time we pass a $1K threshold.
What is Island Siege?
 Number of Players: 1-4
 Play Time: 12 minutes per player
 Ages: 14+
Island Siege is a card game of colonization in the West Indies. Players build forts using stones from their supply, then move colonists to forts to populate them. Colonists in turn construct buildings and ships, which then house the colonists. Buildings provide players with special abilities, while ships are sent to lay siege to the opponent’s forts.
The goal is for players to get all of their colonists into play on their forts, buildings and ships. Be careful, though, whenever a fort is destroyed by an opponent’s fleet all of the colonists on that fort and its buildings are returned to the player's imperial board to start again! Alternately, players may win by earning 20 gold from constructing buildings and ships. Winning requires a keen balance of building and laying an Island Siege!
You can download the not-quite-finished rules here. You can get solo rules here, and Captains expansion rules from here!
If you're more the video-watching sort, here's an Island Siege preview that includes how to play Island Siege, by the Board Game Mechanic.
Here's what players have said about the first edition of Island Siege.
Purge Review of Island Siege 1st Edition
Top Two-Player Game - The Board Game Captain!
Lynn, Ales and The Board Game Captain ran through their top ten 2-player games, and the Captain called Island Siege his favorite! (That's a fancy title page!) The Island Siege part starts at around 31:30.
 Customer Reviews
 The anniversary edition of Island Siege contains
 Engraved dice - No more stickers! The Anniversary Edition will contain engraved resin dice. Also, one of the dice will be a different color to indicate it is only used when enough colonists have been moved off of the imperial board.
 Two sets of  Kickstarter-exclusive metal Campaign Coins (26 total)! These metal coins will only be part of the Kickstarter experience. The retail version of the game will include cardboard punch board coins. EDIT: Stretch goals have unlocked extra coins, and more coins get unlocked each time we cross a $1K funding boundary!
 Components and rules for up to four players! The original two-player game included red and yellow colonists. The Anniversary Edition also includes green and blue colonists as well as additional coins, cubes and other components necessary for four players.
 Deluxe two-layer player imperial boards. The new imperial boards includes an island with a quarry to store accumulated stones and a port to dock your ship. The boards will be printed on a thick cardboard. Indentations keep pieces from shifting.
 Ramparts and Coquina expansions from original. The original Island Siege Kickstarter featured two expansions that weren't available in the retail version of the game. Ramparts adds 24 new forts, buildings and ships, while Coquina introduces soft pink coquina stones and cards that make forts much harder to eliminate.
 Solo rules and components. Dan has created new rules for playing Island Siege against the Ghost Captain!
 Stretch goals! Including 20 extra Captains cards and rules, 2 extra boards and rules for the Monuments expansion, and even more deluxe Campaign Coins!
Coquina, Ramparts and the Ghost Captain
Three expansions are included with the base pledge. These aren't stretch goals - they are included in the base pledge!
Coquina
The Coquina expansion is included in the base Island Siege game pledge level. There are six new cards - 3 forts, 2 buildings and a ship card. It also contains 5 new stones - all of them pink to represent the soft coquina stones that compressed and gave way around cannonballs shot from ships instead of shattering. Since there are not  pink dice faces in Island Siege, these stones can only be removed by a second wave attack.  
Ramparts
The Ramparts expansion from the original print run is also included with the base Island Siege game pledge. Ramparts includes 24 additional forts, buildings and ships.
Ghost Captain Solo Rules
The Ghost Captain rules allow for the game to be played solo. Can you best the Ghost Captain?!
To add any of these items, just increase the pledge amount by the cost of the item(s) you wish to add. If you are not pledging for the base game, then you can use the Add-Ons Only pledge level to pledge just the add-on amount. 
Shipping is one flat rate to your location. Add as many items as you want and the shipping rate won't change!
Extra Island Siege Games: $29
To add extra copies of Island Siege, just add another $29 to your pledge. 
Coin Set (13 coins): $10
The base pledge will come with two sets of these super-high quality coins (26 coins in total) but if you want more then just add them to your pledge! Edit: More coins are being unlocked with stretch goals through the end of the project!
Dice:  $10
Do you already have the Island Siege first edition but want to upgrade the dice? Or maybe you're getting the game but want to have a set of dice for each player!
These are the same dice as will ship in the base version of the game - etched, with a different color symbol on each face. The three base attack dice will be one color, while the bonus dice (used when the first level of the imperial board is clear) is darker, as a reminder that not all of the dice should be rolled by default.
APE works with companies around the world to do game fulfillment.
You will be notified of the shipping to your area when you select a pledge. 
Note: Adding items to your pledge does not change the shipping rate. You will be charged the same shipping rate for ordering a copy of the base game as you would for ordering two copies, or six copies, add-ons, etc.!
We put Island Siege on Tabletopia so that you can play online and still practice social distancing.
 Design: Dan Manfredini
 Art: Jared Blando
 Cover Art: Jim Maxwell
 Layout: Daniel Solis and Kevin Hill
 Publisher: Kevin Brusky and APE Games
Dan Manfredini, Designer
Dan Manfredini is a game designer from Round Rock, Texas. He has designed games such as Senshi, Far Space Foundry, Venture Forth and several others. He loves designing and developing games and is excited to bring this edition of Island Siege to life. When he's not designing, he loves playing games with his wife and two sons. @GameDesignerDan 
Jared Blando, Artist
Jared Blando is a professional freelance cartographer and conceptual artist who works in the RPG, book, and gaming industry. Though he is best known for his RPG fantasy maps, he is also prominent in the board-game and publishing industry. He has a penchant for historical works and miniature gaming, as well as petting cats and watching Star Trek. If you get a chance, check out his website his Patreon or his How to Draw RPG Maps book series: World Maps and RPG Cities!

campaign.story:
Immerse yourself.
Do you enjoy completely losing yourself inside movies, theater, games, or escape rooms?
If so, we have the perfect, mind-blowing experience that will challenge you, surprise you, scare you, and change the way you see the world around you.
We are Directors of Wonder, a collective of inspired thinkers and creators that is challenging the status quo in entertainment and gaming. You will not simply play our game. You will be our game. We will transport you to a place you’ve never dreamed could exist, to a world of wonder.
Think CSI meets Escape Rooms meets Immersive Theater.
Jump down the rabbit hole and experience a story that surpasses your wildest dreams.
Do you have what it takes to solve a crime mystery?
This immersive online experience, featuring live interaction with real actors, is completely unique in the world of gaming and entertainment. It revolves around the disappearance of 20-year-old Xam Vanderbeek, a popular and successful DJ, and the son of the U.S. Ambassador to The Netherlands. You can experience this game together with friends, family, or colleagues from the comfort of your home.
The disappearance of Xam Vanderbeek will take you on a mysterious journey into the world of online crime investigation. The local police are counting on your help in finding the missing DJ.
How it works
Grab your friends;
  Enter the live stream for your team’s mission briefing;
  Access the Amsterdam police database;
  Download your case files;
  Research photos and scans of the evidence;
  Monitor security cameras;
  Interrogate your suspects through a live video-connection;
  And use your crime-solving and investigative skills to find the missing DJ, Xam Vanderbeek.
  Prepare yourself for a mission filled with action and excitement. The clock is ticking! There is no time to lose. Xam is counting on you!
Will you be able to solve the mystery in time and bring Xam home to his family?
About the game:
What: A unique and immersive crime-solving experience featuring interaction with real actors.
  Where: The game is played online from the comfort of your living room.
  Duration: The game takes approximately 1.5 hours.
  Cost: You purchase one ticket that covers a group of up to five (5) players.
  Language: All game narrative is written in English.
  Time zones: United States (PST, MST, CST, and EST) and Europe (GMT +0, GMT+1, and GMT +2).
  Recommended age: 16+.
  How to play:
When we launch the project you will receive an email with your unique ticket code
  You select a date and timeslot for your experience using your ticket code at www.xamvanderbeek.com. We have timeslots accommodating players within U.S. timezones and European timezones.
  After selecting your date and timeslot, you will receive a second email with all the necessary onboarding information, and the first details on the case of the disappearance of Xam Vanderbeek.
  You’ll need:
A group of escape room lovers (up to 5 players). You can play by yourself if you choose to, but we recommend a group of 2-5 players. You and your friends don't have to be in the same room and can join in from any location around the world;
  A team name;
  Your investigative skills. (No actual coding or hacking skills are necessary to solve the mystery);
  A desktop PC, laptop, or a tablet;
  A webcam or the camera on your tablet or device;
  One or more mobile phones;
  A stable internet connection;
  Pen and paper;
  Don’t forget the snacks!
PLAY

High-level timeline
Pre-production
January 2020: Game Concept Development and Prototyping
  February 2020: Story Development
  March 2020: Prototype Testing
  April 2020: Crowdfund Campaign Setup
   May 2020: Kickstarter Campaign
  Production
June 2020: Puzzle Development and Casting
  July 2020: Cutscenes Production and Online Development
  Post-Production
August 2020: Video Editing and Online Development
  September 2020: Live Actor Rehearsals
  October 2020: Playtesting and Fine-tuning
  November 2020: Game Launch!
Prototype testing in March 2020
Our team at Directors of Wonder has a background in crafting immersive theater shows, short films, interactive websites, VR/AR games, and escape rooms.
Our experience and skills in these fields have been combined to create our first online immersive experience: The Disappearance of Xam Vanderbeek.
After visiting multiple immersive theatre shows in the US, UK, and The Netherlands and playing many escape rooms across the globe, we felt our talents could be, and should be, merged together into a broader online gaming experience driven by a strong narrative.
Typical escape room experiences have the same flaws:
Weak storylines with limited player agency;
  Puzzles that don’t match the narrative. (Ever had to do a wooden puzzle in a science lab themed escape room during a zombie outbreak?)
  Hint-systems that break the immersion with employees giving hints through an intercom or walking into the room;
  Location-based so if you don’t live in the area, you are out of luck.
  We’re changing that by creating completely immersive experiences that:
have a compelling interactive narrative where the player is in control of the story;
  use puzzles that make sense in the world the story takes place;
  feature unobtrusive hint-systems. Our game is well-designed and well-clued. We aim for a success rate of 100% without making the game too simple.
  enable players to enjoy a mind-blowing experience from the comfort of their home.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The project will happen whether this campaign is successful or not, but without the crowdfunding funds, we will need to scale down considerably on the experience. The funds from our Kickstarter campaign help to build The Disappearance of Xam Vanderbeek into the experience it deserves to be.

In our private lives, we have backed many successful crowdfunding projects that never saw the light of day due to unexpected production costs, shipping costs, problems with patents, etc. Therefore, we’re focusing on reducing our risks as much as possible. The Disappearance of Xam Vanderbeek is a completely digital experience that will be built entirely in-house by our own team. Eliminating third parties gives us complete control over our end product, and as this will be a digital-only experience, we’re skipping the hassle of dealing with factories, patents, expensive shipping options, etc.

The biggest challenge we are facing now is the impact of the Corona-virus. This could impact the project timeline as we have planned to shoot a couple of cut-scenes at locations that are currently closed. We will keep a close eye on the situation and adjust the project approach if needed to prevent any serious delays.

campaign.story:
The oil-soaked bridge leaps into flames.
Skeletal hands burst from the soil and clutch at your ankles.
The massive stone you stand on flies through the air and crashes into the cloud giant as you leap off and attack.
Every battle take place somewhere, thus every battle features terrain. Sometimes all you need is a place to stand, maybe some trees or ruins to provide cover, but sometimes you want more. You want your terrain to have a major impact on the story or the heroes' tactics. You want the the Fire Swamp or the Bridge of Khazad Dum.
That's what Terrain Toolbox is for.
Terrain Toolbox provides 48 sample terrains you can drop into combat, like a blood mage's circle, solid clouds, and lightning pillars. Each sample terrain includes cosmetic and rules variations, giving you hundreds of possibilities. Plus the book offers advice to create your own terrain. 
Terrain Toolbox was originally published for 4e and Pathfinder 1e. Both editions are now electrum best sellers on DriveThruRPG now have great reviews (you can find some below). Now we're excited to bring Terrain Toolbox to 5th edition and Pathfinder 2nd edition.  
Stretch Goals
We plan to use stretch goals to further expand the Advanced Encounters line with books like Vile Vapors and Alternate Objectives, and to bring all the books to Pathfinder 2e.
Alternate Objectives features advice for creating encounters where you need to do more than just kill the bad guys to win. It also includes six sample encounters complete with maps and new monsters. Like Terrain Toolbox it was originally released for 4e and Pathfinder 1e.
Vile Vapors presents 20 rare and unusual vapors to terrorize your players, including ghoul fog, lavender reek, and stygian dioxide. With gasses that dissolve  memories, transform flesh to copper, or grant mind-bending  visions, none of the vapors are your typical stinking cloud.

$12 – Additional Print Copies: An additional print copy of Terrain Toolbox for any edition (5e, 4e, Pathfinder 1e, Pathfinder 2e). 
$4-20 – Separate Shipping: For those getting Terrain Toolbox and Alternate Objectives in print. If you want you can pay additional shipping to get Terrain Toolbox as soon as it is ready instead of receiving it together with Alternate Objectives. $4 US and UK, $6 EU, $8 CA, $10 AU & NZ, $20 to the rest of the world.
Note of Shipping
Backers at any level get PDFs that are part of their pledges as soon as they are released.
Print backers receiving Terrain Toolbox get that book as soon as they are released.
For print backers getting both Terrain Toolbox and Alternate Objectives, the default is to wait until both books are released and ship them together. We do not have an exact timetable, but expect 2-3 months between releases. If you prefer to get Terrain Toolbox shipped separately, you can add an additional shipping charge as described under Add-Ons above.
Reviews of Previous Editions of Terrain Toolbox
Terrain Toolbox is already available for 4e and Pathfinder 1e. You can follow the links below to read the full reviews.
Endzeitgeist's Review - “Get this. Seriously. You won’t regret it.”
EN World Review - "It easily qualifies as a 'must have' for any 4E DM looking to take encounter building to the next level."
Paizo.com Customer Reviews - “You need it. Five stars.”
DriveThruRPG Customer Reviews - “It's a nice supplement for using some cool terrain in your games.

We use DriveThruRPG to fulfill our PDF and print orders. Their print-on-demand technology gets you the books faster and saves on shipping costs.
 We'll deliver PDFs to all backers as soon as the PDFs are ready (print backers don't have to wait.)

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Indie Game Studios has experience in over 50 Kickstarter projects. Our previous success and the assistance and guidance of the experts we are working with will enable us to also deliver this project on time. With the current complications to production cycles caused by Covid-19 there may be some additional unexpected delays in our timetable but we are confident that we have built enough time into our planned schedule.

That said, there are always complexities and considerations in a project of this scope that may cause delays. Indie Boards and Cards will use contract manufacturing to make this game, freight forwarders to get games through customs, and 3rd parties like Amazon, the US Post Office, and FEDEX to ship the games to you – we don't control everything and there are lots of opportunities for delay. We have a track record of making everything work out for backers in the end – so please be confident and supportive of our efforts to get this great game into your hands.

REFUND POLICY
We can refund you within 14 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. After that, we have a policy of no questions asked, though that’s minus 20% for Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we can’t get back from them after 14 days). However, if we’ve begun packaging your pledge for shipment (usually 4 to 6 weeks before the actual shipping date), no refunds are possible. If a component cannot be delivered AT ALL, we refund that completely, including fees.

All refunds 14 days after the close of the campaign may be processed via PayPal or reversed via Stripe to your credit card at our discretion. Refunds within 14 days are reversed via Stripe to your credit card.
This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed.

DAMAGED OR INCOMPLETE PRODUCTS

We understand that all backers want to receive their items in pristine condition; however, the realities of worldwide shipping can sometimes make this difficult. We guarantee that the product you receive will be complete and all internal components in perfect condition. We will do our best to ensure that your package arrives in good condition, but all decisions on box replacements will be made on a case by case basis. Due to the difficulty and expense in replacing boxes, depending on your region, we will not be able to replace some boxes with minor cosmetic damage only.

RETURNED PRODUCTS

If you refuse to accept your package on arrival we will not issue you a refund for the cost of the pledge.

FAILURE TO RESPOND TO SURVEY

Surveys will be completed through Crowd Ox. If you fill out the survey after the designated time frame, your package may be delayed in sending to you by up to a few months. If you do not fill out the survey until after the declared end of the project, we may not be able to send it to you.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS
By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials, and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project was active.

If you do not log in and submit your project survey results (ie, provide us with your shipping address) for your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge (at additional cost for international backers) if you complete your project survey after the 8-week window has elapsed.

Tiny Epic Pirates is a 45 minute, 1-4 player game of high-seas adventure, utilizing a variable RONDEL action system and action combo-ing!
Every player's Rondel is unique, every game!
In Tiny Epic Pirates you take control of a Pirate ship with the goal of burying vast amounts of wealth on secret island hideaways.
Each turn, you move your Captain Token around your ship’s action wheel, selecting which action to perform...
It isn't just other pirates standing in your way of burying treasures! The Royal Navy has their eye on you and the more notorious you become, the more eager they are to stopping your exploits. 
An encounter with the Navy will surely slow your progress, so you best be avoiding them. To do so, you're going to need a good ship and a great crew!
There's a lot of scallywags out there looking for adventure! So assembling your crew won't be very hard, but pulling together a winning crew... that's a different story.
Your crew will play a major role in Tiny Epic Pirates. Each crew member brings different advantages to battle and to the actions you'll take. 
The dice listed at the top of each crew card, and your captain's card, represent what number you'll need to roll to score a hit on another ship! Having multiples of a single number can result in lots of damage, but spreading your numbers out can result in more consistent results. The choice is yours!
The icons listed at the bottom of each crew card, and your captain's card, represent bonus actions that can chain together for epic turns! If the first icon matches your chosen action, you'll get to take the action of the second icon for free.
In addition to your crew, you'll have your reputation and your exploits. As you prove yourself in battle, your legend will grow and so will your ability to command your ship.
Winning battles against other pirates, and against notable merchants, will increase your Legend Level. Each new level offers immediate benefits, as well as increases to your ship's movement and the number of dice you roll in battle.
But enough talk, you're no landlubber. You can learn more about Tiny Epic Pirates by engaging with us in the comments, watching the videos below, or by downloading the rulebook below.

Deluxe Content: Crimson Silver Mini Expansion
The Crimson Silver Mini Expansion introduces new Floating Fortresses and Silver as a new resource!
Players are able to visit the Floating Fortresses as they move around the board and perform upgraded versions of Trade, Plunder, and Crew Up. Players may also lay siege to these Fortresses for additional rewards. But beware, the Floating Fortresses have a contract with the Royal Navy and if any Pirates show their dirty face around there, the Navy will be on their tail!
Even with the threat of the Navy though, the precious Silver these markets are known for is simply too alluring to avoid. A lot of blood as been spilled over this Silver. So much that it's known around these seas as Crimson Silver.
***Kickstarter-Limited Exclusivity - Deluxe content will not enter regular distribution. However, it will be available in limited supply at conventions, through contests, online at the BGG promo store, and directly from Gamelyn Games on our website or through our Amazon store.
In Tiny Epic Pirates: Curse of Amdiak, rumors of the unthinkable are spreading quickly around the islands. Rumors of dead pirates returning to the sea... aboard an ominous ghost ship helmed by the legendary pirate Amdiak...
Several new game elements are added to play including cursed gold, a ghost ship that haunts the players as they try to steal the cursed gold, ancient relics, haunted map cards and even skeleton crew!
Players gain cursed gold by stealing it from the ghost ship and attacking other pirates who possess it. Cursed gold can be traded for an ancient relic said to hold ashes of Amdiak. Bury this relic and break the Curse of Amdiak!
If the ghost ship finds catches you though, your captain becomes cursed and you lose your cursed gold. Once cursed you will be able to recruit powerful skeleton crew to mindlessly obey your wicked command!
Do you dare to set sail on ghostly waters?
The Curse of Amdiak expansion will come in a box of the same thickness and quality of Tiny Epic Pirates. It will share the same width and height as well. Making them great for storing side by side!
The Curse of Amdiak expansion is available in the 'All-In Deluxe' reward tier or as an add-on in the pledge manager service after the project.

Risks and challenges
The publication of a board game is a highly involved process. It can be prone to many mistakes and delays, even for experienced publishers.

We are proud to say that we're prepared for the task at hand and have years of experience in successfully producing board games and fulfilling Kickstarter projects.

Here are the steps we take to prepare and reduce the likelihood of mistakes and delays:

1. We have done significant pre-production. This includes having all the illustrations for the game complete and the graphic art over 95% complete. The production quote is in hand and ready to be initiated.

2. We are working with an experienced manufacturing partner. We are familiar with their production requirements, timelines, payment schedules, communication methods and Chinese freight arrangements and costs for when it comes time for shipping. We will provide tracking information for the boat when the games leave China.

3. We are working with an experienced fulfillment partner. We are confident that they can handle any amount of work we send their way. They have fulfilled many projects and have proven to be communicative, punctual and respectful when dealing with our customers.

Above all, I am 100% dedicated to backer communication. I will be transparent with our process and involve our backers as much as possible. I will be present daily during the project to answer any questions and I read every comment. I will provide regular updates and supply photos of the progress.

Thank you for your trust in us! Let's bring Tiny Epic Pirates to game tables around the world!

campaign.story:
We have now designed a special edition of "The Enigma Box" at a new, affordable price.
We will deliver in only 4 months!!! 
Enigma Box (vol. 1) could make a great Christmas gift for you or your loved ones! Languages: English, Spanish, French and German.
This challenging campaign is based on historical events and is full of enigmas and mysteries that will test your wits. We call on all adventurers, gamers, mystery-seekers, puzzle-solvers, and curious minds to immerse themselves in one of the biggest collection of enigmas ever. Using the most advanced technology you will travel to incredible locations around the world without ever leaving your front room.
We would like to present to you, Enigma Box "Arcanum", which brings back the experiences, games and enigmas from our previous campaign “The Enigma Box” but in a new format that is compact (Five scenarios) and affordable.
You can play on your own, with friends, or with anyone fit to face the challenge. It is designed and supported by world-class experts in the fields of technology, history and entertainment.
Corrections and Improvements
We have learned from experience and have made several improvements based on feedback from our backers:
Improved the texts, translations and explanations.
Corrected errors throughout the game and improved the riddles.
● Enjoy the ultimate gaming experience from the comfort of your home. Travel on an adventure across time and to far-off lands. This campaign uses the most advanced technology and delivers a collection of ancient riddles into the palm of your hand.
● Your goal is to decipher the mystery of the “Arcanum Arcanorum”, the Secret of Secrets, the unique item that will change the destiny of humankind.
● You will use the latest technology including virtual reality, augmented reality, 3D printing and more.
● This challenge will boost your mental dexterity and intuition, increase your world knowledge, encourage next-level thinking and enhance your problem-solving skills. Most importantly, you’ll have a great time!
● This is a game for people of all ages, genders and backgrounds. You do not need any prior skills or knowledge to fully enjoy the adventure.

Will history know your name?
The places, explorations and investigations in this game are based on real events.
Using our intuition, the latest technology, and a bit of luck, we uncovered hidden messages revealing the coordinates of a late 19th-century box buried in the French Pyrenees. What we found is part of an unprecedented discovery that allowed us to access knowledge, data and cryptograms belonging to a secret society.
With all-new research, enigmas and revelations, the team from “The Rhomb” has designed an international challenge and a new form of entertainment, revolutionizing gaming and creating a never-before-seen experience, giving you a chance to discover the “Arcanum Arcanorum,” the Secret of Secrets.
What is the PRESS saying?
We have appeared and been referenced internationally in the press and our projects and investigations have been shared millions of times on social media.
Some comments:
We invite you on an odyssey through a world full of plots and enigmas. This intense experience will take you to a number of exotic places without ever leaving your front room!
We do not wish to reveal all the secrets and mysteries of the box, as it hides many secret riddles and games that you will discover as you progress through the adventure. However, we want our players to be informed before joining this adventure.

Included:
The box contains all the elements of the Enigma Box "Arcanum" challenge that you will need to play. It also hides secrets and components that you must discover to solve other enigmas. It contains all the necessary tools to guide you as you progress through the adventure.
● Welcome pack (a card and letter from the Rhomb Society). The first thing you see will be the welcome letter, which provides access codes for the site and app, allowing you to unlock 3D scenes and virtual objects with your phone (iOS or Android).
● Booklet. The Arcanum book is a key element. Here you will find instructions on how to advance in the game, as well as hints, images, exclusive information, and everything else you will need to complete the adventure.
● More than 40 riddles and puzzles. The box contains over 40 riddles, including a Substitution Enigma, a Scylates tool, Chinese Shadows, and many more never-before-seen puzzles. You will need to discover and solve these either on your own or with your team.
● 15+ investigation tools and historical documents. You will find clues such as x-rays, passports, paintings and photos. Each of these elements forms part of one or more riddles. You must use your ingenuity to uncover how they fit together, when to use them, and how they will help you progress through the adventure.
● XXL Game Map with exclusive physical and virtual content. All great journeys and amazing tabletop games need a map. We have created a special map where you will find riddles and clues, and locate physical 2D figures you will use to build or depict diagrams. This is your base of operations, helping you move around the world as you try to unveil the Arcanum Arcanorum, the final secret hidden beneath the history, alchemy and astrology.
● Metaphysical and alchemical figures (2D). We have prepared a series of figures which will assist you with various challenges. Some are alchemical figures with symbols you must align, while others contain historical references, but they all serve a purpose that you must discover.
● Enigma cards. You will find different cards featuring challenges, characters and symbols that you must use when you find yourself stuck or want to learn more about the story.
● Five 360º places/scenes. You will also be able to unlock new areas and access new scenes by inserting the correct coordinates and keywords.
 Augmented Reality: With augmented reality, you will visualize virtual objects that will help you advance in the adventure. These elements are distributed throughout the game and can be found within the box and its components. Using it is simple: just scan a code and the "magic" of augmented reality will appear in front of your eyes.
The App
The box is an entry point into a journey to remote destinations where you will access confidential and exclusive information. To use these functions, you can download the app on your phone (iOS or Android) or access them via your computer.
For those seeking even greater prestige and fame or who wish to deepen their knowledge with exclusive information, we have designed the limited edition Enigma Box "Arcanum" Deluxe package. No more than 1033 units will be available!
The Enigma Box "Arcanum" Deluxe package contains the same elements as the original box plus several additions:
 Welcome card and membership card. 
 Advanced Riddles
                                                                                               - Exclusive alchemy riddle
                                                                                               - Labyrinth with advanced content
                                                                                               - A 3 phase circular cryptogram
● Virtual reality (VR) glasses.  Each unlocked set of coordinates will allow you to access a specific place where you can investigate different scenarios. When using your (optional) VR glasses or computer, you will be transported there with 360º vision, allowing you to look all around for clues and riddles to move the adventure along.
IMPORTANT: Do I need to put on my virtual reality glasses? No, the glasses are optional , You can view the same content from your mobile phone (or computer) by moving into the same virtual environment.
● Metaphysical and alchemical figures (3D). A series of figures will assist you with the challenges. Some of them depict alchemical figures with symbols you must align, while others contain helpful historical references, but they all serve a purpose that you must discover.
● Historical documents. Unpublished images and photographs from the discovery of the box and its opening.
Exclusive Deluxe Content
“Jules Verne’s Secret." This scenario includes a treasure trove of exclusive content:
 Physical fragment of Jules Verne’s book dated back to 1879 with an accompanying riddle.
Cryptogram-based riddle created by Jules Verne.
 360° virtual environment of Jules Verne’s office. You will have the opportunity to investigate Jules Verne's office in a virtual environment where you will find secret compartments, documents, and more! 
Virtual object in augmented reality based on the novel From Earth to the Moon. 
 Scan file of Jules Verne’s tomb to investigate or print in 3D. 
We want to thank our backers for their support when we reach specific goals, so we will establish a system for unlocking new challenges, pieces, riddles, and 360º virtual spaces. This will enhance the experience and add a new dynamic to the game.

OTHER REWARDS
Historical Documents
You will receive a copy of the documents found in a box discovered in the French Pyrenees along with exclusive images, videos of the discovery, 360° photos taken during the investigation, and a file with a scan of Jules Verne’s tomb, which you can investigate closely or print in 3D.
 Jules Verne Mystery - Escape Room Online - 
Immerse yourself in an online adventure full of puzzles and riddles and reveal one of Jules Verne’s best-kept secrets. Virtual sets, surprising puzzles and historical revelations are waiting to be discovered.
Includes virtual reality scenarios, augmented reality objects and a virtual assistant for clues.
The objective is to find the “Arcanum Arcanorum,” the Secret of Secrets, hidden in a specific place in the world and kept there by powerful groups and secret societies.
To locate this object, you must use the Enigma Box (vol. 1), which contains the documents, maps, riddles and materials you will need to uncover the secret. You will need to apply your ingenuity and investigative skills to advance in this adventure, either on your own or with companions who may join you in your quest. You will also make use of the most advanced technology in the fields of virtual and augmented reality.
 How to play with our Board Game Map: 
 Check out some videos and reviews from our previous game “The Enigma Box."
We are offering you a radical game experience unlike any you’ve played before as you undertake this adventure from your own home. We have created an incredible story based on real events, with a gripping atmosphere, the most astonishing riddles, the most advanced technology, and the potential to go down in history.
Although you can play alone, your journey will be more enjoyable if you are accompanied by friends, as you can work together, help each other when you get stuck, share different perspectives and discover clues that you may have missed.
The clues and riddles contained in the box, along with the virtual worlds you can access using your computer or smartphone, will help you find coordinates and keywords to progress through the adventure. The provided booklet will guide you through each location in the world so you know exactly what to look for and which enigmas may be involved. However, not every detail is important. You will need to find the exact combinations of objects, riddles and information to solve the mystery.
Once you have all the numbers for a coordinate, you must enter them using the app or your computer. This will unlock a new spot in the world that you must investigate using virtual reality, counting on new content made available via augmented reality.
Your next objective is to find the place in the world that will unlock the next clue, using the 360º VR content and the riddles in the box. You must traverse the most mysterious places on the planet until you reach your final goal and discover just what the Arcanum Arcanorum really is.
The Enigma Box (vol. 1) instructions, booklet and welcome pack are written in English, German, Spanish and French and contain everything you’ll need to complete the adventure. The game relies mostly on visuals, rather than words, although some riddles and puzzles will have a few words in English only.
New technological trends have heralded great changes in the world around us and have opened up new possibilities for investigation techniques and video games. We embrace these developments to create a truly immersive adventure unlike any you’ve seen before.
We have fully incorporated VR technology and AR technology into the game. Enigma Box "Arcanum" uses an array of technology:

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have already carried out a Kickstarter campaign in the past that we delivered successfully, and that experience helped us understand better the whole process of product creation, manufacturing and shipping logistics. We were aware of all possible risks while creating a new product, so you can be sure that our project has been undertaken by professionals who did their best to keep it free from mistakes.
We have extensive experience in launching games, Escape Rooms, puzzles and also in the management of new technologies. There is a risk that we will have to implement some modifications during manufacturing, and this might happen mainly due to the following reasons:

● Creativity: When using some original documents and historical elements from the public domain, it may occur that for copyright reasons we have to change some creativity.

● Sizes, formats and qualities: We already have found several suppliers of the materials, as seen in the prototypes. We have agreed on sizes and qualities, but there is a risk that during the mass production process some formats might need to be slightly modified due to the manufacturing process.
We will do our best to keep everything under control and to make sure that the final product will not be significantly affected.

IMPORTANT NOTE: Our experience tells us that we will need around 3-4 months to finalize the production. We believe we will be able to deliver on time for Christmas 2020, but we can't commit 100% as we rely on more than seven different providers so some delays may occur. It will also depend on the pace of production as well as the freight companies. But we'll do everything we can to deliver on time.


IMPORTANT: Intellectual property and copyright

In the research, design, development and production of Enigma Box (vol.1), we have made use of different elements, images and historical documents. We have maintained maximum rigor, ensuring that all elements are in the public domain. We have acquired the rights to certain images and visuals, as well as ensured that the copyrights of the elements used have expired.


Challenges

The hardest part is done, however, as plans and materials are ready for mass production. Our products have a variety of materials and objects and should any not be available when production begins, be it due to lack of stock or discontinuation, it will be replaced with a similar item.
