campaign.story:
Thousands of years ago, the ashes of nuclear fire changed the world. The weapons of mass destruction ceased to work as the laws of physics altered. In their wake came elementals and demons, creatures from the darkest dreams and nightmares of mankind. Magic returned to the world. Humankind arose from the ashes and rebuilt society, just as the vile Empire of the East wielded the demonic powers of Orcus to sweep across the globe. Now it falls to a small group of resistance fighters to reclaim freedom for humanity!
The Empire of the East Sourcebook for DCC RPG
Welcome to the Empire of the East role-playing game sourcebook, designed for the Dungeon Crawl Classics rules set, and also compatible with Mutant Crawl Classics. Herein you’ll find information regarding Fred Saberhagen’s seminal trilogy of novels, which set the stage for his rich fantasy world and were among Gary Gygax's stated Appendix N inspirations for Dungeons & Dragons.
Officially licensed by the estate of Fred Saberhagen, this hardcover sourcebook offers everything you need to play DCC RPG campaigns in the world of the Empire of the East. Lead designer Jason Vey has adapted the world in a simple, clean style that is easy to integrate into your DCC game, and Harley Stroh provides one of the introductory adventures included inside. Presented with stunning cover art by Ian Miller, you will find inside:
Rules for magic tailored to the post-apocalyptic fantasy setting of the Changeling Earth, including new spells and summonings to enrich any DCC campaign
Character options for adventuring in this world
A discussion of demons, elementals, and monsters, including stats for creatures compatible with any DCC and MCC campaign
Lost technology of the Golden Age of Man, and its effect on the Changeling Earth
Statistics for all of the major characters from the trilogy, also usable as NPCs in any DCC or MCC campaign
Two short low-level adventures to start your campaign
And more!
Using this sourcebook requires the DCC RPG core rulebook. While this sourcebook contains all you need to play a campaign, Saberhagen’s novels are an invaluable resource in understanding the setting.  We highly recommend you also read the Saberhagen Empire of the East series, available as a modern compilation or in the original three individual volumes, titled The Broken Lands, The Black Mountains, and Ardneh’s World (or Changeling Earth). 
Take up your sword, gather your spells, and stand with Ardneh’s armies against John Ominor and his forces of darkness!
Physical format. This book is offered in PDF form, as well as hardcover print format. Final page count is estimated at 80-90 pages.
Do I need to own the DCC rules? Yes. This is a sourcebook for DCC RPG. You can buy the DCC RPG core rulebook at the Goodman Games online store.
Do I need to read Fred Saberhgagen's Empire of the East novels? You don't have to, but we strongly recommend it. They are great books and will expand your gaming experience considerably!
Inside the DCC Sourcebook
DCC: The Empire of the East has been in development for years. Adapted by lead designer Jason Vey, the sourcebook takes you to the Empire of the East and gives you just enough information to create your own adventures there - while also leaving you room to design your own campaigns.
As with all DCC products from Goodman Games, the book is lavishly illustrated.
Chapter one covers adapting the existing character classes. 
Chapter two covers magic, including new rules for spell enervation which can be substituted for corruption to capture the aesthetic of Empire of the East. Eighteen new spells are presented, including several related to the summoning or control of demons, djinnis and elementals as discussed in Fred Saberhagen's novels. There are two new patron AIs presented, capturing the role of Ardneh and Orcus from the original novels.
Some readers may be asking, why is Empire of the East presented as compatible with DCC instead of Mutant Crawl Classics? This hardcover can be used easily in either system, but due to the high presence of magic we're presenting it as a DCC "base." 
Chapter three presents monsters. There are seven creatures, as well as new rules for demons, djinns and elementals.
Chapter four presents personalities of the Changeling Earth. These 16 NPCs from the stories can be used as allies or enemies in your campaign.
Chapter five is science, technology and magic. Those of you who have read the novels know that "the Elephant" plays a mighty part in the plot. We do not burden you with detailed stats for the super-science of the Changeling Earth but instead give general guidelines for inserting these items into your game.
Chapter seven presents two new adventures set in the Changeling Earth: Invaders, a level 0-1 adventure by Jason Vey, and The Demon Key, a level 0-1 adventure by Harley Stroh. 
The Empire of the East Novels
In the distant future, society has crumbled. Dark forces now rule the land, keeping all humans under their oppressive thumbs.
In the darkness of the shadows and whispered on the winds, there is talk of a rebellion. In the swamps, a small band has formed. Determined to regain their freedom, the rebellion, heavily outnumbered, plans to overthrow an army of thousands . . . with the help of one incredible weapon.
It is only a legend, a story left over from the Old World before magic and the wizards came to the land. A weapon of technology. It is the mystical Elephant, and whoever masters it holds the key to freedom, or defeat.
One young man, determined to avenge the death of his family, sets out to join the rebellion and find Elephant. What he discovers will change everything.
The Empire of the East novels are still in print decades after their original publication. You can find vintage editions online. The author's estate has recently released updated e-book editions, which are available in Kindle format on Amazon. You can find them here:
Empire of the East Book I: The Broken Lands
Empire of the East Book II: The Black Mountains
Empire of the East Book III: Ardneh's World 
What is DCC RPG?
The Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game is a modern RPG that reflects D&D’s origin-point concepts with decades-later rules editions. From the company that was publishing old-school modules before the OSR ever existed, DCC RPG is not an old-school clone, but a re-imagining of what D&D could have been, utilizing the game’s primary sources of inspiration. To quote from the back cover:
You’re no hero.
You're an adventurer: a reaver, a cutpurse, a heathen-slayer, a tight-lipped warlock guarding long-dead secrets. You seek gold and glory, winning it with sword and spell, caked in the blood and filth of the weak, the dark, the demons, and the vanquished. There are treasures to be won deep underneath, and you shall have them.
Return to the glory days of fantasy with the Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game. Adventure as 1974 intended you to, with modern rules grounded in the origins of sword & sorcery. Fast play, cryptic secrets, and a mysterious past await you: turn the page…
You can learn more from this prior Kickstarter for the game's 4th printing. You can buy the 7th printing here.
 What is MCC RPG?
Triumph & Technology Won by Mutants & Magic!
You’re no zero.
You’re a wasteland wanderer: a mutant, a seeker, a robot-killer, a stoic shaman guarding forgotten ancient sciences. You seek triumph and technology, winning it with mutations and magic, soaked in the radiation and quantum fields of the mutated, the savage, the semi-sentient, and the artificially intelligent. There are treasures to be won in the taboo lands and ruins, and you shall have them.
Return to the glory days of science fiction gaming with the Mutant Crawl Classics Role Playing Game. Adventure like it’s 1978 again, with modern rules grounded in the origins of post-apocalyptic role-playing. Fast play, a mysterious future, and 100% compatibility with the DCC RPG system await you — just activate your artifact…
Mutant Crawl Classics is a stand-alone post-apocalyptic RPG compatible with DCC RPG. It is a good complement to the Empire of the East sourcebook. You can buy the MCC RPG core rulebook here.
What? No Stretch Goals?
No stretch goals. In this current age of uncertainty, we simply want to print, ship and deliver this book in a timely manner. We invite you to appreciate this beautiful hardcover for what it is - and run some great games using this book!
Shipping & Handling
Shipping and handling costs are not included in the pledge levels. At the end of the Kickstarter, shipping and handling charges will be invoiced via a pledge manager. If you are unsure how expensive international shipping can be, please ask us for an estimate.

campaign.story:
HEL: The Last Saga is a cooperative fantasy adventure viking board game, created by the duo behind SMOG: Rise of Moloch by CMON, game designer David Rakoto and art director Christophe Madura.
The game offers players the chance to lead a small group of Heroes, each with their own rank, occupation and background. Despite all these differences, these survivors will have to cooperate if they want to survive the cold, hunger and hostile threats, but they will also have to unveil the mysteries surrounding the disappearance of the colony founded by their lost King to be worthy of the Saga that will retain their name.
HEL: The Last Saga is a highly narrative campaign game, with paragraphs to read according to what the players accomplish. The game mechanisms mix exploration, tactical combat with resource management. Storytelling and background are ubiquitous and replayability comes from the unique way you have to replay a failed mission.
Click on the image to know more about the HEL-in
Click on the picture to know more about this add-on
Click on the picture to know more about this add-on
Click on the picture to know more about this Add-On
Click on the picture to know more about this Add-On
Click on the picture to know more about this Add-On


 NARRATIVE ALL THE WAY
Tell. Listen. Choose or test. Everywhere. Anytime. The game engine is based on the discovery or the triggering of events that lead to narrative chapters. These events can be hidden on the game board, placed on the turn track or on any other game component. The story  unfolds as you resolve these chapters by making choices, performing tests or simply listening.
UNIQUE HEROES
Play strong characters. Each Clan member has their own story, strengths and weaknesses. You will learn about them as you play them, by acquiring new individual Hero cards in a non linear way. Some of these cards will be the result of choices you made during the adventure.
SCENARIO BASED 
Conquer a mysterious land, found a colony and resolve mysteries. Scouting missions, search or rescue parties, raids, escape, defence, investigation, or intrigue. Whether it's located on the modular and expandable wilderness game board or in the colony camp, each scenario provides a new challenge to overcome in order to gain access to the next scenario.
PREDATORS & PREY 
Face hidden threats, which are controlled by a predation-based AI system. Use your perception and your pets to detect these threats before you face them, as an ambush can be fatal. Your enemies are vicious enough to target the most vulnerable or the highest ranking members of your group.
WORSHIP SYSTEM
Beg your gods to help you. Use your willpower, offerings, and the fervour of your companions to obtain permanent modifiers that will benefit all who share your faith.
SURVIVAL... 
Exploit scarce resources to survive and keep your clan together. Hunt for food. Collect that precious wood that will be a source of heat and an essential material for your constructions. But above all, maintain high morale to avoid sinking into defeat.
...HORROR
Night will eventually fall. For months. Second half of the campaign will take place into darkness. But only for Heroes who survive long enough to see the sunset. Forget every little knowledge or petty victory acquired. New rules. New threats. New objectives.

The USA, European Union, Canada, Australia, and UK will be “Shipping Friendly”. Backers from these countries will not pay import taxes.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
General

This is our ninth Kickstarter and we’ve learned a lot from our previous eight. Producing thousands of products and coordinating their delivery to homes across the planet is a complex business, and there are many things which could go wrong. This is why we build in as much time for the unforeseen as possible. We want to ensure that we have the space to deal with any unexpected setbacks and still get your game to you before the estimated delivery date.

To give you a frame of reference for exactly when you will get your game, Mythic Battles: Pantheon, Time of Legends: Joan of Arc season 1 and Reichbusters: Projekt Vril have been delivered. Super Fantasy Brawl is being printed and ongoing for a delivery by the summer, Solomon Kane, a big scope project, is at the printer and will be delivered in two waves this year. Time of Legends: Joan of Arc season 1.5 is on track and the first elements will be soon sent to production. Enchanters: East Quest development is finished and is going to production now and Steamwatchers is on track and will go to production this summer.
For all our games, we communicate with our backers with regular updates at least once a week, plus our posts on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and our videos on YouTube.

Please note that the components, component counts, quality and rules, are all work in progress and subject to change.

Delivery

Our experience in our previous KS has shown us that there can be variances in terms of timing and remaining in schedule when it comes to anything produced in China, such as:
Production delays
Shipping delays
Customs delays
At the same time there are also the unpredictable factors; recently it was the Coronavirus outbreak, but there can be others such as weather conditions, strikes and others.
The estimated delivery date for this project is June 2021, but please bear in mind this is only an estimate. Also, due to the logistics of international shipping, backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others.

Shipping

By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials, and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented in this Kickstarter project.
If you do not finalise your pledge and pay for shipping by the closing date of the pledge manager, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge if you contact us and confirm your pledge after the pledge manager has closed.
If you confirm your pledge by the closing date of the pledge manager, you agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our pledge manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and that outside of countries specifically listed as being “friendly” (above) you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods. We regret we are unable to ship to PO Boxes or APO addresses.
All backers that have selected “No Reward” on Kickstarter, that wish to receive a reward for this campaign, must make sure to confirm their order by the Pledge Manager Deadline. We will announce the date for this once the Pledge Manager becomes live. All “No Reward” pledges will be treated as donations once the Pledge Manager Deadline has passed.

KSE

As KSE, or Kickstarter Exclusives, are marked the products that will not be available to retail. Mythic Games retains the right to continue to sell those in the Pledge Manager, the Mythic Games website, as well as conventions.

Refunds

We have a no-questions-asked refund policy.
All pledges can be refunded in full up to 14 days after the end of the Kickstarter campaign. In addition, if any part of your order cannot be delivered, then we will reimburse you the full cost of this component regardless of the date.
If you apply for a refund more than 14 days after the end of the Kickstarter then we will only be able to refund 85% of it. The difference is the amount of the unrecoverable fees paid to process your order.
Once we have started to process and pack your order, refunds will no longer be available.
Refunds within the first 14 days are reversed via Stripe to the credit card you used to pledge originally. Any refunds requested after the 14 day period may be processed via PayPal or reversed via Stripe or your credit card. This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will also be in USD.
If these terms are not acceptable to you, then we suggest that you do not participate in this crowdfunding campaign. Thank you for your understanding.

Latest News -
Factory 3d Print Prototype - Update #1
As much as we love the classic four-sided-die, it has long been awkward to use. It's difficult to pickup, it doesn't have a satisfying roll, and it isn't the most intuitive die to read. With that in mind, we are creating the DIAMOND d4.
Uh... What?
The concept is simple, we are taking the octahedron shape of a common eight-sided-die and repurposing it as a d4, with the numbers one through four repeated.
Please note that the dice in this image are hand-finished resin castings made from the 3d prototype. Final quality will be greatly increased.

TWO COLORS TO CHOOSE FROM
 After the campaign, surveys will be sent out on Kickstarter to select your color choices. We are rolling this campaign out with two color options.
PROTOTYPING
The DIAMOND d4 is designed and we have reviewed the first factory prototype. We did have one change and are awaiting the revised prototype. We have found a manufacturer and simply need the funding to move forward with tooling and production on this revolutionary new way to generate a random number between one and four.
TREASURE TABLES
Every reward will include access to a series of d44 Treasure Tables that are being developed with backer input.
KEEPING IT SIMPLE
We are keeping this campaign deliberately simple. Shipping is being charged right here on Kickstarter, there are no add-ons, and any stretch goals will either add to the color options or be digital content geared for use with the DIAMOND d4.
Thank you for your support. We apologize for the crazy video animation.

campaign.story:
Railroad Ink Challenge is a quick playing roll and write game for 1 to 4 players from the creators of the critically acclaimed Railroad Ink. Grab a board and a dry-erase marker and get ready to reach networking nirvana! Roll the dice and draw the routes to connect the exits around your board. Expand your network with railways, highways and stations to collect points, but you will be penalised for any open connections, so plan carefully!
A game of Railroad Ink Challenge is played over 7 rounds. The goal is to connect as many Exits to each other as possible by drawing Routes that can create Networks. The more Exits you connect to the same Network, the more points it will be worth. Bonus points can be earned for your Longest Railway, your Longest Highway, and by drawing on the Central Spaces of your Board.
Roll the dice!
Draw the routes!
Connect the exits!
Further bonus points can be obtained by achieving the all-new Goals, but beware: the players who achieve them faster get greater rewards, so you’ll have to keep an eye on what your opponents are doing and try to complete the Goals before they do. A different set of Goals will be available each time, so no game will be the same.
But wait, there’s more! Draw unprecedented, mind-bending route configurations thanks to the new dice! Connect special structures to your network to trigger new effects: factories allow you to duplicate a die, villages give bonus points if they are close to a station, universities unlock extra special routes... use these effects wisely and you’ll score big!
There are even new expansions! Create placid forest landscapes in the Lush Green Edition, or use oases to protect your cacti from the arid desert climate in the Shining Yellow Edition! Each expansion also comes with its own goals to fulfill before your opponents, for an even greater challenge.
The new core rules included in Railroad Ink Challenge are not compatible with the classic Railroad Ink components: the boards and the basic Route dice are different, so you can't seamlessly mix the two versions. You need the new boards and Route dice to play with the new core rules.
However, the expansions are 100% compatible back and forth between the classic Railroad Ink and the new Railroad Ink Challenge:
you can play Railroad Ink Challenge by using any of the old expansions (River dice, Lake dice, Lava dice, or Meteor dice) with the new boards and Route dice 
you can play the classic Railroad Ink by using any of the new expansions (Forest dice, Desert dice, or any other that will be introduced during this campaign) with the old boards and Route dice 
Stretch goals are a staple of Kickstarter campaigns, and they are usually tied to reaching a certain funding level. We’ve been gradually moving away from this concept during our previous campaigns, and we want to continue this trend.
To unlock stretch goals for Railroad Ink Challenge, you will have to join "Challenges" by playing a special games of Railroad Ink Challenge and submitting your score: depending on the amount of submissions we will receive, and the scores achieved by the community, you will unlock Points, unlocking more stretch goals! The currently open challenge is Challenge #11 (click here for more details). You can also help us to unlock it faster by sharing this facebook post.
You can submit your score for with the form at the link below. 
Click on this image to submit your score!
We will gradually reveal additional Stretch Goals, Challenges, and Fan Boost Prizes during the campaign, so watch this space! 
Submit your score and/or share our facebook post to unlock the Underground Expansion!
We need your support to bring Railroad Ink Challenge to reality. Let's do this together!
You can help us make the game better for everyone. Collecting funds in advance will allow us to enhance the final quality and content of the game.
Many addons and stretch goals will be Kickstarter Exclusives that won't be available later in distribution. It's now or never!
Get more value of what you pledge and a competitive discounted and tracked shipping rate.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our fifth Kickstarter campaign, but we have a much longer production experience. We are an established board game publisher, and we already brought to market several other products, like the original Railroad Ink, Potion Explosion, Alone, The King’s Dilemma, Similo, Dragon Castle, and many more.

The development of the core rules of Railroad Ink Challenge is already complete; we already have the production quote for all core components and add-ons, and an agreement with our manufacturer. This should make the production process quick and straightforward. However, when you produce anything in China, unexpected events may always lead to delays with production, shipping or customs. We already took several steps that will help us minimize any of these, though.

To reduce shipping problems, we will use fulfillment companies, which is the best option when you have a large number of orders to ship in a short period of time.

Finally, we will always be transparent and openly communicating with backers. We will be updating you on a regular basis and we will be present during the whole process to answer any questions and read every comment.

The estimated delivery date of Railroad Ink Challenge is December 2020, but keep in mind this is only an estimate. Also, due to the logistics of international shipping, backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others. We'll do our best to minimize this as much as possible.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Blinks is the world's first smart tabletop game system. 1,135 backers brought it to life on Kickstarter in 2018. We've now shipped over 15,000 Blinks games, sold out at every major convention, and now we're back with more games!
clips of just 6 of the games taking tabletop to the next level
We've curated the top 6 games from our community of game designers. All six knocked our socks off! These designers harnessed the technology to create truly original games. You'll put your reflexes to the test, battle with your wits, and ambush your best friends.
After 6 years of development, Blinks are finally ready for you!   
 What previous Kickstarter backers are saying
“They are absolutely amazing! My brother is hooked on puzzle 101 and since i have 12 blinks i can have two people do two puzzles, it has been a fantastic experience, kids and adults all love them, thanks again i really couldn't be happier. PS- Flic Flop is a riot!" - Leonard R.
“Got my set over the weekend and we haven’t stopped playing. Really addictive games and my kids love them. Thanks for all the great games” - Tim B.
"Blinks is a definite winner." - Tina Roth-Eisenberg 
Each Blink is a game piece and a game cartridge
Can teach other Blinks how to play
There is no limit to the number of Blinks you can play with
Blinks stow in a little Sushi Roll carry case, Yum!
Darkball
by Che-Wei Wang  
Darkball is a first of its kind game in which players put their timing to the test against a speedy disappearing ball and each other. Darkball rewards accuracy, reaction times, as well as creativity. As the pieces are rearranged, the ball can travel in any direction, and down any path with no limits to the number of players or ways it can be played. 



Paintbrush
by Carol Mertz and Mary McKenzie
Paintbrush is a deeply strategic game with pieces act as both brush and canvas. Players take turns rearranging the dynamic pieces to spread their color onto as many blank canvasses as they can. Simple mechanics mean the game can be picked up easily, but the strategic depth allows for repeated play and the possibility of mastery. 



Group Therapy 
by Brett Taylor
Separate the introverts. Cluster the extroverts.
Can't we all just get along?! It's your job to get these Blinks what they need most: extroverts want neighbors, introverts need their space.  It's a focused frenzy for one or many!


Reactor
by Aaron Santiago and Spencer Kee  
Reactor is an intense and competitive contest where each player must react to the alarms of the reactor core before their opponents by buzzing in before anyone else.  Reactor takes inspiration from competitive fighting games, and distills them down to an intense contest of reflexes and concentration.


RAID
by Mark Mayer and Justin Baker
RAID places you in command of a viking horde, competing with other players to grab as much territory as you can. It's an intense game of strategy and prediction, as each player secretly inputs orders into the AI-powered Blinks game pieces, then watches as skirmishes play out in real time.



Pirates & Lasers
by Theo Johnson, Ian Cummins, Priscilla McGann, and Michael Cooper 
Pirates & Lasers is a strategic struggle between ghost pirates and incompetent laser-wielding tourists. Keep the ship sailing as long as you can while lasers tear your ship asunder, managing resources and preventing damage to critical areas.

Growing Game Library
You are backing much more than just the latest 6 games. We've produced 14 others others in the Core and Expansion Sets. These games have been to all of the major game conventions, and were labeled the top 10 games at E3 in 2019, then subsequently sold out until now!
Core Set
Fracture is a new kind of territory control game where players fracture and rebuild the entire board on each turn. From a simple set of rules emerge surprisingly complex strategies.
Berry – Blue. Red. Yellow. Make all Blinks one color on your turn or be the first to score 10 points and you win. This unique strategy game favors the clever and punishes the greedy.
Bomb Brigade is a tense, high-stakes game of chance where players must rely on their quick reflexes and courage to survive. There is really only one rule: don’t blow up.
Puzzle101 – INFINITE PUZZLE FUN Challenge yourself or work with friends to solve an endless supply of self-generating puzzles! A terrific way to break from your screen and improve your spatial reasoning skills.
Wham! – DEFEND THE GARDEN  Set up your garden in any size and shape, then defend it from pesky moles who are up to no good. How long can you keep the increasingly aggressive pests at bay? Show them who's garden it really is
Mortals – BATTLE ZOMBIES & THE CLOCK Be the final survivor in this post-apocalyptic action game. On a dying planet, two teams battle the clock, stealing time from each other. It’s the final countdown... and watch out for the Zombies!
Expansion Set
Astro - FRENZIED SPACE RACE An asteroid field rich with rare space ore awaits you. Can you collect enough to fill your cargo hold before your competition does? This action-packed space adventure will get your jets going.
FlicFlop - It's shuffleboard from the future! Flick your Blinks across the table to score points, and take advantage of your opponent's mistakes to further your lead. You'll need accuracy, timing, and finesse to win this kinetic tabletop game.
Speed Racer - GO GO GO Your car is speeding down the road to nowhere. You’ve got to keep building as fast and furiously as you can, or you’re headed for a dead end. How long can you last in this endurance challenge?
Honey - HIVE'S A'BUZZIN This idle puzzle game challenges you to create the most optimum hive for your bees. The right combination of flowers, worker bees, and broods will keep the hive buzzing and the queen happy.
ZenFlow - RELAX Sometimes you need to relax and bliss out at your desk. Be mesmerized by swirling colors and patterns as Blinks share their happiness. Witness emergent behaviors and find your zen.
Widgets - UPGRADE YOUR GAME NIGHT  The Blink becomes your favorite new game accessory! Light up your game night, whether for Blinks games or not. Need to roll dice, but don't have the space? Use the dice widget. Settle the score with a coin flip. Spin your own wheel of fortune. You could even use these widgets to invent your own game!  We've created 3 unique games with use widgets: Takeway Dice, Spinomino, Flip Bet 
Let's make this easy! Blinks come in packs of 6 games, the more Blinks you have, the more games you can play... Also more Blinks makes each game bigger and better. As of this Kickstarter, there are now 3 sets to choose from, no need to choose now, you'll get to select which sets you are getting in the pledge manager after the campaign.  

Shipping Fees
To simplify the fulfillment process, all shipping fees will be collected in BackerKit. We know you'll want to add lots of goodies after the Kickstarter campaign and this way we can simply calculate one shipping fee. Note that customs may apply for some destinations. 
Retailers
We love brick and mortar game stores and want to help you make Blinks a part of your magic circle. Lock in discount pricing for Kickstarter by pledging at any level on the campaign and gaining access to the pledge manager.
Blinks Game Mats
A number of the Blinks games have matching game mats that can be ordered following the campaign as well. They keep your Blinks in mint condition and we were surprised to see just how much they add to the gameplay.
Custom art game mats designed by the game designers, available in our pledge manager and for order after the campaign
Make Your Own Games
All tiers can purchase Developer Tools offered after the Kickstarter and in the pledge manager.  Blinks is open-source software and hardware and we are dedicated to a strong developer community. In fact, that's how all 6 of the Community Set games were made. 
Want to learn to code? This is a great way to get started and one of the most supportive communities of developers ever. Blinks are based on the ubiquitous Arduino platform, and has you saying Hello World in 15 minutes. Developer and consumer Blinks are exactly the same hardware.
Share your love for Blinks with friends and family by sharing the link and text below or write your own.  We wouldn't be here without you and it's awesome to have you with us.

The only thing cooler than Blinks themselves is the team and community behind them. Blinks is a product of curiosity, exploration and excitement from the design, tech, and gaming communities. From workshops at Maker Faires to game jams with Playcrafting, IndieCade, and the NYU Game Center, lots of people have been brought together by Blinks.
Kickstarter Video by Tom Caswell
And More...
Nick Bentley, Luis Rodriguez, Diana Peterson, Lingyi Rose, Justin Lamb, Nick Soni, Winston Struye, Shiyun Liu, Justin Ha, Kris Atanasoski, Junege Hong, Armin Minassian, David Khananov, Pedro Benitez, Andrew Saldivar, Xiao Yang Feng, Bill Cowles, Sophie Lefebvre, Celia Pearce, Em Lazer-Walker
 While at the MIT Media Lab in the Playful Systems group, I was researching emergent behavior, complex systems, and cooperation. I was simulating natural systems such as swarm behavior like a flock of birds, ant colonies, or fireflies and forest fires. I designed little hexagonal tiles that could think for themselves, respond to touch, and communicate with each other.
My fellow lab mates asked if they could design games for the platform. I agreed to a short game jam session and in under 3 hours, we had designed the first game for Blinks, Fracture. It went on to be a finalist at IndieCade. This is how it all began.

Risks and challenges
I've run 4 successful Kickstarter campaigns and delivered above and beyond on each and every one. Our last campaign for Blinks was by far the most ambitious, with everything built from the ground up, and I can proudly say, the hardest part is behind us. We have the world's best toy manufacturer producing our parts and a supply chain that has been through thick and thin. We've built to tolerances that simply put, look beautiful and feel great. And most importantly, we are adding slack so that we can scale quickly. It probably means more to hear from one of our previous backers so feel free to read the hundreds of comments on our previous campaigns, here is one I think captures it nicely:

"Got mine in California and you guys knocked it out of the park with this product!! From package to product to overall experience, this is truly one of those rare cases where a maker can out-Apple Apple by giving more attention to detail than any large company can."

"Thank you Jonathan & Move38 Team for this piece of great product. Thanks to you I will still believe that Kickstarter projects can be achievable. You all made a really good job!!!" 

In short, this product is already designed and tested and now it only gets cooler because the new games are new software, and while I would typically not be caught dead saying "software is easy," I will say, I think at this point, it is much easier than the hills we've climbed to bring a new and unusual game system into the world.

From a small group of incredibly dedicated people, working with some of the most talented people I've ever met, we achieve a lot, do it with transparency and would love to have you join us.

campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Blinks have been designed to be cherished as beautiful design objects to be held in the hand. They come with a protective carrying case or "Sushi Roll" that keeps you from losing your Blinks in addition to keeping them in great condition. The games are designed to last until the end of time, just like traditional board games before them, but far sturdier than paper or cardboard.
Reusability and recyclability
Beyond the bullet-proof materials that create the durable enclosure for Blinks, they are open-source and reprogrammable. Blinks can be used to play the games they know and games that haven't even been invented yet. Tired of Blinks being Blinks? No prob, you can use the Arduino IDE to turn your Blinks into your very own smart device.
Sustainable materials
Blinks packaging is made entirely of biodegradable materials, specifically paper pulp and paper products instead of the all too common plastic inserts or blister packaging.

updates.update_userinfo: Are You Missing Your Sushi Roll?
updates.update_content:
Hey Blinksters,

Hope you all are doing well in the new year. This update is short and sweet to make sure that all outstanding Kickstarter items are taken care of by the end of the month. Move38 has a  wonderful new team member and they are making sure that your Blinks arrive safely and completely.

updates.update_userinfo: Sushi Rolls Shipping, Game System Released, and Making Blinks Games at Global Game Jam
updates.update_content:
Hi Backers,
We have just a few quick notes for you today. Read on for the exciting updates.

Replacement Sushi Roll cases shipping.

updates.update_userinfo: Happy Holidays (+ An update for our EU Backers)
updates.update_content:
Hi Blinksters!
We've made it, 2020 is almost over and we hope Blinks will continue to brighten up spirits. The Move38 team is celebrating the holidays and looking forward to bringing lots more joy to 2021.

I'd like to share a last bit of good news for our EU Backers. Thank you so much for your patience as we delivered Blinks without Sushi Roll cases to make sure you could play and enjoy your Blinks without delay. I can confirm that the replacement Sushi Roll cases have safely arrived at our warehouse in the UK just earlier today and they'll be unpacked soon to be shipped out to all of you still awaiting Sushi Roll cases. We'll share tracking information when they ship (likely the following week).

Hi Backers,
To those of you with your Blinks, we're thrilled with the response! While most orders have been fulfilled, there are still some outstanding items. This update includes information for everyone, so read on to find the latest on your shipment status.

Hello Backers!
Just want to clarify some shipping details for everyone. We had to tier the shipping in order to account for multiple factors of when items would reach our fulfillment centers. We did this to be as agile as possible in sending out what we could as quickly as possible.

updates.update_userinfo: The moment you've been waiting for.....
updates.update_content:
Hi Backers!
This is the moment you've been waiting for....Blinks are finally shipping! You read that right. We are so thrilled to have them coming to you.

Shipping Update

updates.update_userinfo: Blinks Shipping, Grade A Sushi, and Getting Games in Your Hands
updates.update_content:
Hi Backers,
We are incredibly excited to announce that your pledges are packed up from the manufacturer and are on the first leg of their trip. Once they arrive at our warehouses, you'll receive an email with a tracking number when your individual package is packed and labeled. The first packages will arrive at doorsteps as early as late next week.

updates.update_userinfo: Delivery Schedule Update, Dev Kit Assembly, All the Game Mats and more!
updates.update_content:
Hi Backers
We’re so close!
Detailed Shipping Timeline
Late Thursday night, we received our last updates to the shipping schedule as the assembly of your Blinks will be completed and ready at the port on September 22nd. I know this comes as sad news as the projections showed a September arrival, but some materials took longer than expected to finalize. Even the games got some last minute polish. We want you to be able to enjoy your Blinks for a lifetime, so .

Hi Backers,
Can you believe it's already August. We are back in the office preparing some materials and getting the Summer Sets out the door. Meanwhile, our manufacturing partners are incredibly hard at work building the nearly 25,000 Blinks you've ordered, including the first ever Community Set Games. We've been making final tweaks to the games, getting all the support material in place, and helping our partners put it all together.

Hey Backers,
This week is truly momentous for Move38 and Blinks as we continue to work on your Blinks, new Sushi Roll cases, and Community Set games. Additionally, we are making sure you'll have more and more games to play going forward.
Our goal with Blinks is to provide a platform for creativity, not just for games that Move38 thinks up, but for games from Blinks players and the developer community.

campaign.story:
Welcome back to the city, adventurers! Fantasy City Sites and Scenes II is a 48-page (plus cover, inside covers, and back cover) 8.5" x 11" book for gamemasters who are in need of inspiration. The book details sixteen different city locations and offers up a selection of encounter ideas, all of which can be used on their own or added to the content described in the original Fantasy City Sites and Scenes book. (See the original Kickstarter campaign to learn more about the first book. Update on the first book: all PDF and print rewards are complete! The print rewards finished shipping to backers on May 19, 2020.)
Do you already own my other fantasy RPG supplements that were created thanks to the support of Kickstarter backers? Then you're looking for either the $1 (PDF) or $18 (print, U.S. only) reward levels. All of the other listed rewards are for those gamemasters who missed out on my earlier projects. 
 City Sites. The sixteen locations described in the book (each a two-page spread) presents new buildings that may be dropped into your campaign . . . and along with it, the characters and events detailed alongside the building. You won't find a dry collection of statistics and facts in this book. Each entry was written to spark the gamemaster's imagination and provide GMs with just enough to take the idea and make it their own! 
 City Scenes. Pages 36 through 48 (plus the inside back cover of the printed book!) are packed with new day and night encounters. These encounters do not duplicate any found in the original Fantasy City Sites and Scenes book, meaning that this section greatly expands the gamemaster's number of choices when it comes time to randomly select a city encounter.
So that we don't accidentally cause project delays, there will be no stretch goals for this campaign. I'd much rather deliver on schedule than risk running late with delivery of the rewards.
I know that the lack of stretch goals will cause some of you to turn away, but I ask that you keep this in mind: The 52-page PDF reward is only a buck, making this a great deal for any gamemaster who enjoys running city encounters and adventures.
Over 1,700 supporters came together to make the Fantasy City Sites and Scenes campaign a success! (Kickstarter page here.) Did you miss out on the original book project? Now's your chance to score both the original and the second volume at the same time! See the rewards, at right, for more information and to join in!

The Dungeon Crafter's Sketch Book is for the gamemaster who enjoys creating dungeons. (Kickstarter page here.) This 56-page book (60 including the cover, inside covers, and back cover) is filled with page after page of grids (hex or square, see the reward descriptions), space for you to draw your dungeon ideas. Scattered throughout the book are several random tables to inspire you as you create your newest dungeon. There are a limited number of print copies available; please see the reward listing for more information.
Did you miss out on the Kickstarter campaign for A Dozen Sinister Rumors? Now's your chance to grab these 17 different PDFs and expand you collection of GM tools!
If you wish to buy single PDFs, and not all 17 of these titles, you can find each one at DrivethruRPG.
***
Probably the most common question that comes in every few weeks is: "How can I get your books dedicated to the Star Wars newspaper ads of the seventies and eighties?" The books are tough to find, so I am offering a handful of copies in this campaign for those who missed out on these books.
Sample pages from one of the three books. Each is 96 pages, 8.25" square, and hardcover.
I do not run an online store, so that means I rarely offer these books for sale. Still, there have been enough requests this month alone that I felt it was time to list these as a reward in this latest Kickstarter campaign. These are great gifts for fans of the Kenner Star Wars action figures of the seventies and eighties.


***
The bulk of the artwork in this book is used under license from Shutterstock.com, created by Asanee Srikijvilaikul, Larry Jacobsen, koya979, NextMarsMedia, Oliver Denkar, Petrafler, Runa0410, Ryzhkov Sergey. Some artwork © 2015 Dean Spencer, used with permission. All rights reserved. Additional artwork by Adela Quiles & Armando Ayala (BPB Games) and Hopsy Graphic Art, used under license.
Video music The Journey by Music by Marcus.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
After years of experience with Kickstarter, running and backing projects, combined with decades of experience in publishing, I think _most_ of the largest challenges and risks have been avoided. The book is complete, and all that remains is funding and the project review stage where project supporters are encouraged to crowdsource spotting and correcting the typos that are surely somewhere inside the work.

However, things can go wrong. As an individual, I do not have access to a company to assist with packing and shipping rewards (a friend helps!), and I have no control over life. Everything should ship on schedule, but things can (and sometimes do) go wrong. If something goes off the rails, I will post an update to explain the situation.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

It's done now, though, and that marks that last action needed to classify this as complete.
Many of you already have your rewards. If you do not see your print rewards by this time next week, please message me here on Kickstarter and we'll dig into the matter. For those of you outside of the United States, or any of you who selected the PDF rewards and would now like to order the book in print, Fantasy City Sites and Scenes II is available in print-on-demand at Amazon.

campaign.story:
The Book
Agent 8462 is an interactive puzzle book. Solve a puzzle and record the solution. All solutions in a section combine to solve the final puzzle in that section. No two puzzles are the same. Each will require a different combination of language, numeric, pattern recognition and observational skills. You can read, write, fold, cut, explore and manipulate the book however you wish to solve the puzzles.   
The Story
They made the arrest on Wednesday. Everyone thought that would be the end of it, but on Thursday you receive a delivery. 
You didn't pay any attention to it when you picked it up with the rest of the mail, placing the pile on the dining room table while you made your morning coffee. As usual, you had pressed snooze one too many times to fit in a proper breakfast. 
You sit at the table to drink your coffee while watching the news headlines. Idly sifting through the mail you notice something other than bills. An envelope, made of high quality paper, with your name and address handwritten. The contents feel thick, certainly not a couple of sheets of paper. You open the envelope to reveal a book, a note is attached:
"I need your help but you must prove you are up to the task. This book contains a series of tests to see if you have what it takes."
You grab the envelope searching frantically for clues of the books origin. No return name or address, only a strange symbol. You know this symbol, you know this is serious, you must take immediate action.
Cautiously you open the book to reveal your first test and begin your journey into the unknown.      
How to play
At the start of each section you will be provided with essential tools and information for the tasks ahead. Each two-page spread is a puzzle to solve. Record your answers as you go where it says Solution. It is important to keep an eye out for other useful clues along the way. The puzzle at the end of each section will combine all the previous section’s clues into one final task. 
Technical Details
Book - Paperback
Puzzles - 60
Dimensions - 9" x 6"
The Campaign
This Kickstarter is the first offering of the book. All puzzles have been written up into a draft book which is currently being worked through by a group of testers. Once testing is complete the book will require final formatting/editing before being published and sent out to backers.
FAQ
Is Agent 8462: Initiation a real book?
Yes, Agent 8462: Initiation is a real, physical book.
What language is the book written in?
English
What do I need to play?
You will need a copy of the book, a pencil and scissors may also come in handy.
Can I skip ahead?
To a certain extent, yes. For example, in the first section there are 10 puzzles. Puzzles 1-9 can be completed in any order but all the answers to puzzles 1-9 are essential to solve the final puzzle in that section, puzzle 10.
Where can I go for help if I'm stuck on a puzzle?
There will be hints in the back of the book (written back to front and upside down to avoid reading unwanted hints) as well as a forum on Agent 8462 containing hints from the author, game testers and other players to give you a nudge in the right direction.
Do I need to buy anything else to play?
If you already own a pen and a pair of scissors then a copy of Agent 8462: Initiation is all your need. 
The Creator
A puzzle enthusiast based in North West England who has spent the last year designing and redesigning potential puzzles to fit the theme and style of the upcoming book - Agent 8462: Initiation. An interactive puzzle book.

campaign.story:
Art by Simon Stålenhag
Simon Stålenhag is the internationally lauded artist and author of Tales From the Loop and Things From the Flood, narrative art books published by Free League that stunned the world with a vision of an alternate Scandinavia in the 1980s and ‘90s, where technology invaded tranquil landscapes to form an entirely new universe of the eerie and the nostalgic.
In 2017, we published a tabletop roleplaying game based on Tales From the Loop, which was a smash hit and went on to win five Gold ENnie Awards, including Best Game and Product of the Year. A tv series adaptation of Tales From the Loop was launched just a few days  ago on Amazon Prime Video.
Now, you can take another step into the amazing world of the Loop. In Tales From the Loop – The Boardgame, 1-5 players take the roles of teenagers who investigate the mysteries originating from the Loop, a huge underground science facility with strange effects on the suburban landscapes around it – just make sure you’re home in time for dinner!
Tales From the Loop – The Boardgame is designed by Martin Takaichi and includes high-quality miniatures by Paolo Parente's Dust Studio.
Prototype of Tales From the Loop – The Board Game
Art by Simon Stålenhag
In 1954, the government ordered the construction of the world’s largest particle accelerator. The facility was completed in 1969, located deep below the pastoral suburban countryside, outside of the big city. The local population called this marvel of technology the Loop. Over the years since it was built, strange phenomena have started to appear in the area - mysterious creatures stalking the land, machines malfunctioning in inexplicable ways.
In the Tales From the Loop - The Board Game, you take the roles of local kids and play cooperatively to investigate whatever phenomena that threaten the islands (or perhaps just the local video store), and hopefully stop them. Each day starts at school, but as soon as the bell rings you can use whatever time you have before dinner and homework to go exploring! Player actions are integrated, meaning there’s no downtime as you wait for others taking their turn. It also makes cooperating with your fellow players dynamic as you can react to things that happen in a turn and don’t have to plan it all out from the start.
At least four scenarios will be included in the base game (more can be unlocked as stretch goals), and each scenario takes approximately 90-150 minutes to complete.
Full Setup of Prototype of Tales From the Loop – The Board Game
All the components of the core game are listed below. More components can be added if stretch goals are unlocked:
Miniature produced by Dust Studios based on Simon Stålenhag's design
The Loop isn’t the only technological achievement in the ‘80s that never was. Advanced AI, robotics and magnetrine development are highly advanced as well. Riksenergi, the governmental agency tasked with running The Loop, employs different machines to automate a large number of functions on the islands. While some have drivers or handlers, most are running on their internal AI code.
In Tales From the Loop - The Board Game, these machines are represented by beautiful miniatures sculpted by Yannick Hennebo based on Stålenhag's original designs and manufactured by Dust Studios. They are molded in high-quality PVC plastic and are between 25 and 40mm tall. You can buy extra minis as addons, check the Addons section below.
In the STANDARD EDITION, the miniatures are delivered unpainted. In the DELUXE EDITION, the miniatures are delivered PRE-PAINTED by Dust Studio.
Miniature prototypes by Dust Studio - not final product
ADDON MINIATURE SCENARIO PACKS
In addition to the machine minis included in the core set, you can add models of a Gorgosaurus dinosaur and the "Visitor" robot, along with scenarios to use them with, Addons to your order - check the Addons section below. Each pack includes a model and 20-30 Scenario Cards. The Gorgosaurus and the Visitor are available unpainted or pre-painted by Dust Studio.
Below is a video demonstration showing what a turn can look like in the game, by lead designer Martin Takaichi. It doesn’t go into detail about every rule (there’s the downloadable rulebook for that, see below) but gives you a good sense about how the game flows and general gameplay.
To let you to try out Tales from the Loop – The Board Game for yourself, we’ve decided to provide a Print & Play kit for download. It doesn’t contain everything that will be in the final game, but four characters and one scenario is enough to play the game with three other friends! If you just want to read the beta rules the rulebook is available for download.
Do keep in mind that this is in only a prototype in Alpha state – things can and will change from the P&P version to the final version. In fact, that’s another reason we wanted to do this, to get feedback from you so we can make the game the best it can be. Use this survey to provide feedback and report on errors.

Prototype of Tales From the Loop – The Board Game
In addition, backer Timothy Clark has made two excellent videos that go through how to set up the Alpha and pretty much all the rules for the game in a clear and engaging way. If the Alpha rules PDF put you off, or you simply prefer to learn by example, do check out these two videos:

Simon Stålenhag is the internationally acclaimed author and artist behind Tales from the Loop, Things from the Flood, and The Electric State. His highly imaginative images and stories depicting illusive sci-fi phenomena in mundane, hyper-realistic Scandinavian and American landscapes have made Stålenhag one of the most sought-after visual storytellers in the world. Tales from the Loop was ranked one of the “10 Best Dystopias” by The Guardian, along with such works as Franz Kafka’s The Trial and Andrew Niccol’s Gattaca.
Martin Takaichi has been a board game enthusiast since first discovering Drakborgen (aka DungeonQuest) in 1985. Over the years he made a slow transition from not only playing games but first modifying them and then designing them as well. The first published game where he was part of the design team was Crusader Kings – The Board Game.
The design team beyond Simon and Martin consists of project manager Tomas Härenstam (lead designer of Crusader Kings – The Board Game and roleplaying games ALIEN, Forbidden Lands and Mutant: Year Zero), map artist Reine Rosenberg, graphic designer Christian Granath, co-designer Nils Karlén, and last but not least Paolo Parente and his Dust Studio who produce the miniatures as well as all physical components of the game.  Dust is an acclaimed manufacturer of quality miniatures since 2005, producing their own Dust 1947 line as well as miniatures for board game companies like CMON, Monolith and Mythic Games.
Free League Publishing is a Swedish publisher dedicated to speculative fiction. We have published a range of award-winning and critically acclaimed tabletop roleplaying games, board games and art books set in strange and wondrous worlds.
Our game range include the recently launched official ALIEN RPG, the Tales from the Loop RPG (winner of five ENnie Awards 2017, including Best Game), sandbox retro fantasy Forbidden Lands (winner of four ENnie Awards 2019), postapocalyptic Mutant: Year Zero (Silver ENnie for Best Rules 2015), space opera Coriolis - The Third Horizon (Judge's Spotlight Award 2017), dark fantasy Symbaroum, and Crusader Kings – The Board Game.
We have also published the art books Tales from the Loop and Things from the Flood  by Simon Stålenhag, as well as the illustrated edition of the Lovecraft classic The Call of Cthulhu by French artist François Baranger.
This project is promoted by Green Inbox
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
When you pledge on Kickstarter you put your trust in a project before it is completed and you contribute, with this trust, to making Tales From the Loop - The Board Game a reality. We value that kind of trust and we value the model of Kickstarter too. It is built on trust and Free League Publishing will honor that model and prove our trustworthiness in delivering Tales From the Loop - The Board Game, as we have with the 21 Kickstarter campaigns we have completed over the past five years.

WHAT ABOUT THE CORONA VIRUS? These are difficult and uncertain times, and at present, our international distribution of physical products has been temporarily suspended due to restrictions following the outbreak of the Corona virus. However, the Free League design team continues to function normally (albeit working from home), and the Dust Studio production facilities are up and running, so we forsee no significant impact on the final production of the game. By the time we will ship the game to you a little over a year from now, we certainly hope and expect distribution to have resumed again.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

All refunds after the 14 days close of the campaign may be processed via PayPal or reversed via Stripe to your credit card at our discretion. Refunds within 14 days are reversed via Stripe to your credit card.

This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed.

campaign.story:
Series One from The Magic Puzzle Company is a set of three new 1,000-piece jigsaw puzzles with original art and a magical surprise at the end.
We set out to create the most entertaining jigsaw puzzle you’ve ever done by combining the traditional jigsaw puzzle experience with ideas from the worlds of tabletop games and magic.
We commissioned incredible, original art from independent artists, designed from the very beginning to be used in a jigsaw puzzle
We designed a surprise ending using techniques from optical illusions and magic that adds an extra experience to the end of the puzzle
Each puzzle has over 50 easter eggs to find as you solve (and they come with a guide to help)
Each puzzle is 28" x 21", and has 1000 pieces. That's about 4% larger than the normal size of a 1000-piece jigsaw puzzle.
We imported the highest-quality puzzle cardboard in the world (1.9mm Eska "blue" stock) from the Netherlands and invented some new printing techniques so the pieces snap together and stay snapped
These puzzles have been extensively playtested to make the experience as smooth and engaging as possible from the moment you open the box to the moment you place the last piece of the last segment
When you're done with the puzzle, everything can be reset and all of the secret compartments close back up with velcro so you can share the puzzle with a friend or solve it again later.
No puzzle dust!!
Puzzle Art
Most puzzles start with stock art of some trees or cats or something. We wanted each of our puzzles to make a fantastic, tiny world. And we wanted the art to tell a story as you solve it. So we worked closely with independent artists like Sarah Becan, Boya Sun, and Felicia Chiao to create beautiful one-of-a-kind puzzle images loaded with tiny details, story quirks, and easter eggs.
"The Happy Isles" by Sarah Becan
"The Mystic Maze" by Boya Sun
"The Sunny City" by Felicia Chiao
Custom Dielines
To make the magical ending work right, we had to customize the shape of every single piece in all three puzzles. While we were at it, we also made sure that the individual puzzle-piece shapes highlighted the cool art details instead of cutting them in half.
Jigsaw puzzles start as one big piece of cardboard, and then a specially designed cutting tool called a die comes down like a stamp and slices it into a thousand pieces.
The die for the "Happy Isles" puzzle
Usually, the tolerance for that slice is about 3mm. But to pull off the magical ending in our Series One puzzles, we needed a 0.5mm tolerance. Nobody had done that before, so we had to work closely with our puzzle factory create new quality-control and die-cutting techniques to make it happen. Some of the roughly 3,000 blades that make up our dies actually had to be precise to within 0.1mm — 30 times more precise than a regular puzzle. 
An excerpt from Simon’s briefing for the puzzle factory
 One of the nice side effects of making a more precise die and using super high-quality puzzle cardboard is the pieces click together in a really satisfying way and stay together even if you need to move the puzzle.  
 Magical Surprise 
It’s always exciting to pick up a new puzzle with an image you like and then open the box and start putting together the corners and edges. But after a while, you get to the part of the puzzle where you need to assemble 400 pieces of blurry sky. And then when the puzzle's about 75% done, that feeling of “what am I doing with my time” creeps in. Eventually the last piece finally goes in and the puzzle is over. We’ve always found that part a little anticlimactic.
So we came up with a whole new way for a puzzle to end. When you place the last piece of what you thought was the end of the puzzle, you unlock a whole new part of the experience — a final act that includes both a magical illusion and a completion to the puzzle's narrative. We playtested these puzzles hundreds of times with people all over the world to figure out how to make this special ending as clear and engaging as possible, and we hope you're going to love it.
"The Happy Isles" 1000-piece puzzle
"The Mystic Maze" 1000-piece puzzle
"The Sunny City" 1000-piece puzzle

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Although every project comes with risks, we've done our best to minimize them. This isn't our first project and we're partnering up with a few other experienced companies. However, we rely on our suppliers just as you rely on us, and hope for a relationship of mutual understanding.

We've worked with different manufacturers in the past and don't work any more with those not living up to our expectations. That's why we choose a new manufacturing partner that has done games for major publishers and creators and who has come recommended with impeccable credentials. 
Some events may be out of our reach. One such event is COVID-19. To take such events into account we've talked with the manufacturer and gave ourselves some more time to deliver the game. We would love to tell you your game will arrive earlier, instead of the other way around...

Shipping is always a risk, especially when shipping international orders. After production is complete, we'll be shipping the game worldwide through several fulfillment centers, ensuring that we have "Friendly Shipping" (no import taxes) to the US, EU, Canada, Australia and New Zealand. We'll also be subsidizing a portion of the shipping cost for all pledges to keep your costs down. Like before, we're using a highly renowned fulfillment partner for an ultra smooth fulfillment process. For more information see terms & conditions above.

The EU has recently implemented stricter tax regulations on online sales in general and crowdfunding in particular. We thus are obliged to collect and pay VAT on the value of the total of the pledge and shipping amount. VAT varies between 17% and 25% with most countries at 20% and above. The total amount is calculated on the amount paid for the game and the shipping. We have taken these costs into account so you will not need to worry about them. It is important to note that VAT is a sales tax that is separate from import taxes or duties. We will cover import duties in the USA, Europe, Canada, Australia and New Zealand so you do not have to worry about those. Other regions might incur import duties.

Adventures in Neverland has been developed over 5 years, with numerous play-testers and groups in different countries. A new batch of test groups will be brought in after the end of the Kickstarter (and COVID-19) to test the final content and to blind test the rulebook.
 
Lastly, although we are working very hard to expand our range of games, we put originality before anything else. Every game we publish must be an original masterpiece, drooling with flavor by itself. We will do everything in our power to achieve this goal. Like our previous games, we will listen to the backers. Together Adventures in Neverland will be a unique game, dedicated to J.M. Barrie's legacy!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Just a quick update:
Last week we've received the white sample from our manufacturer. It is used to check all the sizes and quality of the components, as well as to give us an idea what the final product will look like. Although the name suggests it, not everything is white! The wooden tokens are already printed and engraved, and the dice are colored too. The upgraded dice even contain some faerie dust! The engraving on the tokens is very detailed and the dice are pretty big. The box, however, is huge and sturdy, just like we intended (and need, mind you)! Overall we're very happy with nearly everything, despite some minor comments. We'll give this feedback to the manufacturer so they can correct it. Have a look yourself:

Hi everyone,
We've got some updates for you!
Rulebook
Last time we talked about the rulebook undergoing its final editorial check. That's finished now and we're happy to share the final rulebook with you. Of course it's still possible some tiny errors slipped through, so if you find any, or have any other comments, please let us know!

Hi everyone, it's time for a new update. First off, we'd like to show you the starting events you've unlocked as a stretch goal during the campaign. You can choose to play with any number of starting events. The Crocodile adds an extra threat to the board, the Merchant hands out free items, and Night will change the island, making some special locations inaccessible. The Crocodile was already shown in the rulebook, but we'd like to give you a look at the other 2 new events today. First up: the Merchant.

BoardGameGeek 'most anticipated game 2021'
After one week we’ve already received a lot of votes on the BoardGameGeek poll. There’s still time to cast your votes and help Adventures in Neverland reach the top of the list, to become one of the most anticipated games of 2021 on BoardGameGeek! Check out our previous update if you don’t know how to vote or don’t know what we’re talking about here.

updates.update_userinfo: Voting for the final top 20 most anticipated games!
updates.update_content: Thanks to everyone that voted for our nomination on BoardGameGeek! There were 627 game entries competing over 29 different categories. We are happy to announce we have been nominated in 2 different categories (Thematic & Fantasy), and also made the Overall category! Thank you! Now it's time to cast your votes for the final top 20 most anticipated games for 2021. Together, let's make Adventures in Neverland one of those games :)

Happy new year!
We hope you're ready for 2021! We have some new exciting updates to give it a good start:)
Most anticipated games of 2021

What a year...
At the start of this year, nobody would have thought that our way of living would be turned upside down during the course of this year. COVID19 has the world in its grasp still, though we'll hopefully part with it soon. Looking back at the start, we didn't even know if we should launch on our planned date. Since it was in the middle of the first lockdown. Luckily we did decide to go forward with this Kickstarter to make this Neverland dream come true!

updates.update_userinfo: A guide to Adventures in Neverland
updates.update_content:
Also called... the rulebook
A little more than a month has passed since our last update, so it's time to update everyone on the progress again. The rulebook has entered the final stages before completion. It's now off to editors to proofread and check everything for continuity and uniformity. We've left some room for any additions or changes. Also the component page will still undergo major changes with new renders, but we don't want to keep you waiting any longer to show what the rulebook will look like. So without further ado:

All aboard!
Most of you have already filled in the Kickstarter survey, which we'll only use to add your name to the inside of the box. For those of you that didn't: the DEADLINE to enter your name will be November 4th (1 week from now)! If you miss the deadline your name will not be added to the box. For more information see the previous post.

The days are getting darker and shorter, and the leaves are slowly changing colors to fit Peter's outfit!
