campaign.story:
Missed the Kickstarter? Want more episodes? Visit our website:  https://thedetectivesociety.com/ 
Think of your favourite TV detective drama. Now replace the central character with you. That’s The Detective Society.
The Detective Society delivers a package to your door each month, filled to the brim with incredible puzzles and an exciting, intricate plot. You can play by yourself, with your partner or with a team of your friends or colleagues.
Our six-package game creates a deep, immersive, narrative-driven world for you to explore, all from the comfort of your own home. 
Everything you need to complete each package will be included inside: you’ll need to solve fiendish puzzles, decipher cryptic codes and use your powers of deduction to figure out how to solve the case.
But you don’t just interact with the physical items in the package - a complex digital world will sprawl out in front of you, requiring you to investigate the lives of the characters and interact with them via SMS, email and online messenger services.
Think of it as a TV show meets an escape room meets the internet.
Each package is a stand-alone mystery which contributes to the overall plot, so if you want to try before you buy then pledge for the first package of the series and we're certain you'll be back for the next five as soon as you've finished investigating.
 Receive a package to your door! Our packages are delivered straight to you, filled with incredible puzzles and a deep, immersive world.
 Team up or play alone! You can play by yourself, with your partner, or with a group of friends or colleagues. Each of the packages should last around 90 minutes.
 Interact with the world! Contact the characters by email or message, stalk their social media accounts and scour the internet to help solve the puzzles.
 Become immersed in the story! Put yourself into the shoes of the detective to find out what really happened to Claire Makova.
 Continue your journey! Each package follows on from the previous one, presenting you with new challenges and exciting plot twists.
We created a short demo version of the game so you can get a feel for the kind of thing that we design. 
The demo is a completely different case to the Disappearance of Claire Makova, so don't worry - no spoilers. Also, the demo was designed to take 20-25 minutes, as opposed to the actual packages, each of which should take between 90 - 120 minutes to complete.
We sent the demo over to a few gaming channels to have a play with. You can see Gaming Rules's experience here:
 And you can see slickerdrips trying out the demo here:
Immersive Real-World Puzzles
All of the puzzles that we design are rooted in reality; you won’t get any abstract puzzles here! For example, you might need to use technology from your every-day life to solve the case. You may need to text somebody to get the password you’ve ‘forgotten’, or explore websites to discover email addresses, or even message somebody over their social media to gain access to a secret. Nothing is off limits.
If you're a sucker for old school however, then there’s no need to worry. Solving the case also relies on a variety of object-based puzzles. Piecing together information found in newspaper clippings, maps and photos will also play a vital role.
Our core belief is that the answers to all our puzzles should be firmly rooted in the reality of the world. Can’t think of a solution? Imagine what a real-life detective would do in your situation and you’ll figure out what to do next.
Padlocks and Decoders
Padlocks, ciphers and codes are all key to solving the case. For example, if somebody has secured a folder containing vital information - you’ll have that folder in front of you, padlocked and available for you to try and open! Or, if you’ve intercepted a coded message with no instructions on how to decode it, then you must work out how it's been encrypted and decipher it to reveal what's hidden.
Multimedia Content
The puzzles will be given added depth and complexity by our use of multimedia content, which will also add to the realism of the world. For example, you might receive a voicemail from a character in distress, or a video message from a contact with vital information, or you might even find yourself watching CCTV as the police raid a building that you’ve identified as the location of a suspect.
By utilising video and audio content, we will make you feel like you have a real connection with the characters, thereby raising the stakes.
Telling a good story is at the heart of what we do. It’s our belief that puzzles are much more fun if they’re embedded in an engaging narrative. The story of our first season is full of twists and turns, complex characters and high drama moments - and you and your detective skills are placed right at the heart of the action.
 Season One: The Disappearance of Claire Makova 
The first season focuses on the case of the daughter of a diplomat, Claire Makova, who suddenly disappears. The Detective Society have been hired to find her, but the deeper you delve into Claire’s disappearance, the more secrets you uncover.
By using your puzzle solving and investigative skills, you will begin to pick apart the mysterious events that led to Claire going missing. Only you can solve, The Disappearance of Claire Makova. 
New Destinations
We have been inundated with requests to ship to other countries. We want to ship to regions other than the UK, EU and USA, but want to be upfront about the risks of customs charges.
With that in mind, we are happy to announce that we are now also shipping to Canada, Australia, New Zealand and Switzerland. 
You can see full shipping details on our website: https://thedetectivesociety.com/shipping-information/
All shipping to the United Kingdom is included, as that's where the packages are produced and shipped from.
We will also be shipping to the EU and the USA. Backers from these countries will pay no import taxes. We have reduced the normal international shipping costs to take into account that shipping is included for UK backers.
The shipping cost is charged in addition to your pledge. To see the shipping cost applied, select your reward and then your country and then shipping price is automatically added to the pledge.
Your shipping address will be collected after the Kickstarter ends and we’re close to the delivery date. 
The season is made up of six episodes and you will receive one a month. We'll ship each of the episodes to all players simultaneously. This will help avoid any spoilers, whilst also giving all players the chance, if they wish, to experience each episode at the same as every other player, making it an exciting live event.
How will this work with your Kickstarter pledge?
If you pledge for “First Package” then you will receive your first box at the same time as everybody else, when The Disappearance of Claire Makova season goes live (eta July 2020). You can then choose to buy the rest of the season, either via a one-off payment or by buying the packages individually when they are released.
If you pledge for “All Six Packages” then you are purchasing the whole of the live season - you will receive one episode every month and bonus content in between each of the packages. The story of Claire Makova will run alongside your life for the entire six months!
Who can play the game?
The game can be played solo, with a partner, or with a group of friends or colleagues and is recommended for players aged over 14 years, due to the peril the characters find themselves faced with. 
What language is the game in?
The game will initially be available in English with translations into Spanish, French and German should we reach our translation stretch goal. Our aim is to translate it into more languages after release, so if you want it available in your language, get in touch and we’ll put you on our priority list! 
We have grand ambitions for the future of The Detective Society.
Firstly, as we have reached our third stretch goal, we will be able to produce a second season, with the first package of Season Two being available once Season One finishes.
Then we endeavour to continue designing and building new, exciting packages and storylines, delivering them to the homes of thousands of people every month.
Each new season would be full of exciting and thrilling plotlines where you, playing from home, are at the centre of the action. Our intention is that each season will expand in scale and ambition, melding immersive experiences that can be played at home, with full, high-quality digital content.
For six months at a time, your life could be filled with a new immersive case, enhancing your day-to-day existence with a fulfilling and exciting experience.
The game is designed by Joe Mills and Tristan Rogers and the company side of the business is managed by Dan Wiseman.
Joe has been instrumental in the success of some of the best escape games that London has to offer. His journey began with Time Run, which was voted the 'third best escape game in the world' in 2019; Sherlock: The Game Is Now - the official BBC TV series tie-in and most recently he has created and launched one of Design My Night's top picks for a night out in London: the immersive puzzle-based cocktail experience, The Case of the Poisoned Chalice. He has been working in the escape game industry for 6 years and is excited to now be delivering his puzzles to a new mass audience.
Tristan is a game designer, actor and award-winning writer. He's worked in some of London's top theatres and has written on numerous programmes for BBC Radio. He’s worked with Joe designing puzzles at various escape games, most recently penning the plot for The Case of The Poisoned Chalice.
Dan is our managing director and brings his vast business and marketing experience to the team. For over 10 years he has been building and operating successful businesses, including a digital marketing agency. He is connected to the Detective Society through a mutual love of all things gaming-related, evidenced by his constant stream of RPG game ideas. Dan made his first RPG when he was just 13 years old. We’re delighted to have him with us to build the business and get our project delivered successfully!

Why we started
We are all big fans of immersive theatre, true crime and escape games. What we decided to do, as a company, was to pioneer a new type of entertainment, which meshes all three together. More than a play-along TV series, we wanted to create a gaming series that puts YOU in the shoes of the TV detective.
We're excited to be able to share this with you. We hope you decide to become part of The Detective Society.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with any project, there are of course various risks and challenges involved - problems with design, procurement and shipping can all occur. We have minimised these risks as best we can: the six packages are fully written, with the first package already having been successfully play-tested. As a team we have successfully produced a variety of games, and Dan has, over the last decade, overseen a large number of product launches, with e-commerce being his specialty. Our budgets are thorough, and we have built in significant contingency to deal with those issues we cannot foresee.

There is of course the elephant in the room that is Covid-19. As you might have seen in our video, lockdown here in London is causing us to work from home. Fortunately, we can do all of our design work remotely over video chat and, while there are some issues with delivery networks, all our suppliers are still hard at work and able to supply us with everything we need. As things stand, we are still confident that we can deliver on time. However, should this crisis deepen further, and cause major disruption to these supply and distribution networks (both here in the UK and worldwide), then this may impact our ability to deliver according to our planned schedule.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

STRETCH GOALS
Thank you for helping us surpass our initial funding goal to complete Loxstone Manor: Part Two. We are hard at work creating this for you folks!
We have added four stretch goals that will enhance the project by creating more immersive gameplay in the following ways:
UNLOCKED: Stretch Goal #1 - $1,500: On-screen Game Version
Reaching stretch goal #1 will allow us to create a playable on-screen version of the game which can be downloaded to allow Loxstone Manor to be played without printing. Additionally, this will facilitate easier virtual gameplay over services like Zoom - which have been extremely popular with Loxstone Manor players.
Stretch Goal #2 - $3,000: Loxstone Manor Website
Once stretch goal #2 is reached, we will be able to launch an interactive website dedicated to additional Loxstone Manor materials, storylines, expansion chapters, merchandise, and immersive downloads.
Stretch Goal #3 - $5,000: Audio Immersion
To further our goal of a competely immersive escape game experience, we will use stretch goal #3 to record audio accompaniment for gameplay.
Stretch Goal #4 - $9,500: Video Immersion
For the ultimate ambiance, we will use stretch goal #4 to create visual accompaniments that will follow along with the storyline to create a completely immersive experience.
By combining all of these stretch goals, Loxstone Manor will become one of the most immersive, interactive and detailed Escape Game + Murder Mystery brands on the market.
We wholeheartedly appreciate your support and will continue to create unforgettable escape experiences!
_________________________________________
Loxstone Manor is a Three-Part Print & Play Escape Room + Murder Mystery Game.
A mysterious post card and envelope filled with a large sum of cash arrive at your rundown detective agency....
Make your way to Loxstone Manor, then enter the Realm of Shadows to find the clues, connect the evidence, and solve one-of-a-kind puzzles to discover who killed William Loxstone.
Are you up for solving the case?
PLAYERS: 1-8 • LENGTH OF PLAY: 60+ MINUTES • AGES 12+
Part One is available for free download on our website: www.BlackKeyEscapeRooms.com
____________________________________
A Letter From Our Family During Coronavirus (COVID-19)
Dear Friends & Family,
We hope you are all safe, home, and healthy during this unbelievably devastating pandemic health crisis.
While we may not be able to help cure this virus, we have spent the past few weeks creating “Loxstone Manor: An At-Home Escape Adventure Part One” in hopes that we can help alleviate some of the boredom, anxiety, and metal fatigue you may be facing in your household while practicing social distancing.
Our family and team has decided to offer Part One of Loxstone Manor as a Pay-What-You-Can product so everyone can have some fun during these tough times.
As with many small businesses across the globe, we have had to close our doors until further notice and are relying solely on this game to help ensure that we will be able to support our family and team, keep the lights on, and reopen once this crisis has been resolved.
We have recieved an overwhelmingly positive response to Part One, so we have decide to finish the game by creating Part Two & Three. With your help, we hope to continue providing lasting memorable experiences for everyone who plays Loxstone Manor.
We understand your family may be going through the same daunting situation, so if you aren’t able to afford to contribute to Part Two, please help us in other ways by sharing our campaign with your friends, family, and on social media.
Stay healthy and stay home - we are all in this together!
Warmest regards,
Your Friends at Black Key Escape Rooms

campaign.story:
Welcome to the Weird West of Deadlands, the original horror western roleplaying game for the Savage Worlds core rules!
 In this award-winning, best-selling setting, gunfighters, braves, hucksters, martial artists, shamans, mad scientists, the blessed, and more square off against far more than desperate bandits. An event called "The Reckoning" awakened an ancient evil, and you'd best hope the howls you hear on the High Plains are just a pack of ravenous wolves...
 "The Year is 1876, but the history is not our own..."
These words introduced Deadlands to the world back in 1996, spawning decades of amazing tales and memorable monsters. Now the granddaddy of Horror Western games is back with a brand new edition. 
The cover that started it all, the original Deadlands, by Brom!
It's now 1884 in the official timeline. The Civil War ended in 1871 at the Battle of Washington, an epic conflagration of steam and steel. The Great Rail Wars are over as well, finishing not with a whimper but the bang of  Dr. Darius Hellstromme's ghostfire bombs at the gates of Lost Angels.
Even the Servitors, the Reckoners' chosen champions on Earth, have been defeated—at least for a while. Reverend Grimme vanished in a massive flood that destroyed his city, Raven's Last Sons were defeated by the Great Summoning, Stone was foiled in the barren expanse of Death Valley, and Dr. Hellstromme's latest scheme to open the gates of Hell proved fruitless.
We told the tale of the Servitors in four Plot Point Campaigns, still available and ready to play with just a little tinkering for this edition on our website!
In response, the Reckoners have turned their blasphemous gaze back to the grassroots of evil. They've given life to dark desires and horrible abominations that live in the shadows of the isolated frontier, far away from the attention garnered by the overt plans of their Servitors.
The heroes of the Weird West join with the secretive Twilight Legion in the distant outposts, chaotic boomtowns, and lonely settlements of the West to fight evil and quell the fear that gives the Reckoners their power.
So gather your posse of heroes and hit the trail, from the frozen north to the arid deserts of the Southwest, from the industrial East to the fractured canyons of California's "Great Maze." 
The Weird West awaits with adventure, mystery, and more monsters than you can shake a Peacemaker at.
Think these Mojave rattlers look nasty? You should see the rest of it!
Deadlands is the long-awaited return to Pinnacle's oldest and most popular setting. First published in 1996, the original "Deadlands Classic" system won countless awards and its bold, bright orange books are still a striking and valuable addition to gaming shelves the world over. 
For those who want the whole experience, Deadlands has a rich and varied history to explore!
Deadlands has told some epic tales since it first burst onto the scene in 1996, but you don't need to be steeped in its storied past to join in the hootin' and hollerin'. If you're an old hand, we think you'll find it both familiar and refreshing.  If you're new to the world or setting, this is the perfect time to join the wagon train (and if you've lapsed, we forgive you for that, partner). We've recapped and summarized the monumental events of the last 24 years so you can catch up.
This new edition is the biggest revamp of the game's background and rules since the Reloaded edition from 2005. It's been revised, rewritten, and refocused by both Deadlands Line Editor Matthew Cutter and original creator Shane Hensley.
Back in the Saddle, by Aaron Riley!
All the rules have been updated and adapted to the latest version of the Savage Worlds Adventure Edition. You'll need that book to play. You can add it to your pledge as an Add On if you don't already have it, or you can check out the PDF now.
Arcane Backgrounds are tightened up. Those nasty Harrowed had the same overhaul we gave them in Lost Colony (including letting the Devil out!). There are new and streamlined rules for dueling. And of course a passel of new Edges, gear, infernal devices, and powers to blast the tarnation out of the creepy crawlies coming to do your party in.
For you Marshals (that's what we call our Game Masters), there's a comprehensive overview of the Weird West after the events of the Servitor Plot Point Campaigns, including new plots, perils, and intrigue for cowtowns, boomtowns, and old favorites like Lost Angels, Tombstone, Deadwood, Dodge, the City o’ Gloom, and a few new locales we might surprise you with! And of course this handsome tome also includes enough rascals, varmints, and critters to keep a posse busy 'til doomsday.
This is more than just a rules update--it's a world update! And check out that gorgeous new graphic design by Karl Keesler, with art by some of the best in the business!
Now that the tales of the Servitors have been told in their individual Plot Point Campaigns, Deadlands is returning to its roots with more local yarns of dread, terror, and violent action. The new edition and supplements to follow turn their baleful eyes from the world-shaking events of the Reckoning to isolated frontier towns or sinister machinations in the few larger settlements. The Twilight Legion must root out the evil that lurks in all-too-human souls, the lonesome hills nearby, or the dark woods at the edge of town.
To showcase the return to more personal tales of horror and adventure, we've created the Horror at Headstone Hill campaign set!
The campaign features a single county in Wyoming and the terrors that lurk in a booming mining town and environs. Your heroes roam about the map, interacting with the locals, solving mysteries, fighting abominations, and—with luck and a steady shootin' iron—eventually lower the "Fear Level." That's how you defeat the Reckoners' terrorforming, amigos, and Horror at Headstone Hill showcases it front and center.
The Horror at Headstone Hill Campaign Boxed Set!
The Deadlands: Horror at Headstone Hill Boxed Set contains an introductory booklet on the region for the players with notes from Tombstone Epitaph reporter Lacy O'Malley and the Twilight Legion, a Marshal's guide detailing all the locations on the map and a full sandbox-oriented Plot Point Campaign, a poster-sized map of the county, and a selection of player handouts to drive this incredible tale of six-guns and sorcery to its bloodstained conclusion!
 Something happened at Devil's Tower recently. Something terrible. A being called the Cackler raised a powerful sorceress of legend, Morgan Le Fay, sending ripples through the many worlds of Deadlands. From the Dark Ages to the far future planet of Banshee in Lost Colony, the "Morgana Effect" has caused subtle changes from the world we knew before.
The Cackler and his unholy posse ride the range in this world-changing graphic novel by Shane Lacy Hensley!
 The Morgana Effect is a big story that ripples (quietly for now) through all the settings of Deadlands—including the upcoming Deadlands: Dark Ages, the Weird West, Noir, Hell on Earth, and already released Lost Colony. It's also a story-based reason to change the rules and some parts of the setting we've been hankerin' to adjust for a while. You can read more about the latter here, but we think even those of you who have been with us since '96 will welcome the changes once you take 'er for a test ride.
Over the years we've seen some amazing gaming setups, but collecting and painting a comprehensive collection of cowpokes and critters can be both time consuming and expensive. That's where the Deadlands Pawns come in. 
The Deadlands Pawns Boxed Set contains over 100 Deadlands characters and critters printed on thick punchboard!
We've created a selection of heroes, villains, and monsters in thick punchboard (the sturdy stuff board game tokens are made from) to represent some of the most common and iconic encounters in the Weird West. These figures are even die-cut to the contour of the character image to make each pose as dynamic and striking as possible.
The Deadlands Pawns Boxed Set contains 8 sheets of thick punchboard, containing over 100 pawns to bring the Weird West alive on your tabletop. If the set does well, we will expand the line to include additional Deadlands sets and pawn sets for our other lines. 
That's enough jawin'. Now let's talk about what's really important...what you get for helping us bring the Weird West to life!
We've set up the reward tiers to be as simple as possible while still covering the most popular combinations you sidewinders always ask for. We've done 21 of these Kickstarters now, so we have a pretty good handle on things. But if you don't see the particular combination you want, just pledge for the book and add on anything else in the pledge manager we'll launch sometime after the campaign closes.
Read full details for Retailers in our Savage Retailer newsletter here!
The core book for Deadlands: The Weird West is a 192-page hardcover book, in our usual "graphic novel" size, and glorious, bloody, full-color throughout. That amazing cover is by Aaron Riley, a fan favorite of the entire Savage Worlds line!
Deadlands Boxed Set contains the hardcover core rulebook, brand new poster map of the Weird West, GM Screen + Adventure, Set of 25 Bennies, Set of 7 dice, and a set of 12 Archetype Cards, along with Power Cards, Adventure Cards, and Infernal Device Cards—all housed in a sturdy and attractive box to match your Deadlands: Lost Colony Boxed Set!
The Deadlands the Weird West Core Boxed Set includes a copy of the hardcover rules as well as a brand new poster map of the Weird West by the phenomenal Cheyenne Wright, a set of 25 Bennies, a set of custom-colored dice and Wild Die, and a Game Master's screen and introductory adventure, Double Down at Sundown, by Rob Wieland!
Want to see the new screen? Here it is, partner! The tri-fold screen is our usual landscape format with gorgeous art on one side and all the charts and tables the Marshal needs on the other!
The new GM Screen for Deadlands: the Weird West! Click here to view Federico Musetti's gorgeous art as a larger image.
Horror at Headstone Hill Boxed Set contains a Player's Guide booklet, a Marshal's book with a full Plot Point Campaign, a poster map or Uinta County, and several pages of player aids and handouts. Art not final.
Deadlands Pawns Boxed Set contains 8 sheets of thick punchboard containing stunning full color miniatures die-cut to give you over 100 miniatures for use in your Deadlands games. Art not final.
After the Kickstarter is over you'll be invited to a pledge manager so you can add any additional Pinnacle products you want to your order. Want the Rippers Resurrected Expedition Amazon supplement or Deadlands: Lost Colony or Rifts® for Savage Worlds Boxed Set? These will all be available to ship with your order.

And if you want to budget or add Deadlands-specific Add-Ons to your Kickstarter pledge now, here are the prices. Thanks as always for your support of our little company!
We always like to sweeten the pot. Help us reach our funding goals and we'll add a passel of digital and physical rewards. The first is a set of the cool new Harrowed "Dominion Cards" by Cheyenne Wright! If we reach that Stretch Goal, a set of cards will be added to every Deadlands Core Boxed Set. campaign.story:
I love the end of the night. When someone is about to go home, and I say "How about a game of X before you leave?" They smile and sit down. They can't resist because they know:
The game is fast (like 10 minutes to play)
It's quick to teach (like get started in 30 seconds)
There will be tension and exciting moments
It ends the night on a satisfying note of getting in one more quality game
This game series exists because I want there to be more games like that. We've focused on easy to teach before, but these are SUPER easy to teach.
But there is enough strategy that after the game your mind will wander back to a couple of key turns, and you'll wonder if you should have played just a little bit differently.
And they have those turns...
That turn in GPS where the spinner lands on the spot that helps you but not your opponents. 
That turn in Sequoia where you have to decide if it is worth fighting for the best spot or better to grab multiple spots where there is less competition. 
That turn in Mountain Goats when you bump the leader off the mountain right before they win. 
And Holy Toledo, these games are just $15 each. 
These games were designed for adult gamers, but they are playable with the whole family, including kids as young as 5 with some coaching.  They're also great options when your non-gamer friends ask to play a game, and you want something that you can teach and start playing quickly.
In Mountain Goats you work to move your goats to the top of 6 different mountains where they can score points as long as they stay there. You can share spaces with other goats on the way up, but there is only room for one goat at the top of each mountain. If someone else's goat moves to the mountain top, they will kick you off and you'll have to start your trek over.
It's a game about timing. You need to not just get to the top of the mountain, but get there when no one else is in position to knock you off.
It's a game about keeping your eye on your opponents. Maximizing your score, but also making sure you don't let anyone else score too much.
There is the fun chance to knock each other off the mountain. But it doesn't feel too mean because you can only knock back goats that are in a scoring position, and it isn't a huge setback. It is just a normal part of the cycle of the game.
Read a draft version of the full rulebook for Mountain Goats. 


In Sequoia you are trying to grow the tallest trees in 11 different forests. After your 10 turns, if you have the tallest tree, then you get the victory points from that forest. Second place gets a small consolation prize.
Each turn, you get to grow two of your trees. Which trees you choose will determine if you win or lose. Do you keep fighting in a forest with competition, or start growing your tree somewhere else? You'll have to wrestle with the dice to grow the tree you want.
Sequoia is a game of choosing your battles.
The dice will always give you choices, but they will be hard choices.
Ties in each forest are decided by extra tie-breaker rounds that can lead to epic finishes.
Read a draft version of the full rulebook for Sequoia.

You're launching GPS satellites into space. They need to orbit the earth in the correct order. But your launch windows are limited. You can only launch satellites where the spinner points each turn. It is your job to pick the best satellite for each launch to get your birds in order before your opponents.
GPS is a game about how fun it is to spin that spinner. And it is a very satisfying spin.
It is a game about rooting for the rocket to land on your number.
GPS is a game about putting yourself in a position where the spinner is most likely to help you.
 Read a draft version of the full rulebook for GPS.
You won't be paying for any extra air in your boxes. The games set up big, but they store small. There will always be room to shove one of these into your game bag.
It is a little bit shorter and a little bit wider than a box that holds two decks of cards side by side. It is also about twice as thick so the lid will stay in place much better.
1. For the purpose of shipping, the 3 small games pack (GPS + Sequoia + Mountain Goats) will count as just one game.
2. DO NOT manually increase your pledge amount to cover the shipping cost. It will make both our lives much more complicated when it is time to complete the pledge manager.
3. If you want to pledge for additional games we publish, just manually increase the amount you are pledging. $15 for GPS, Mountain Goats, or Sequoia. $39 for the small games three pack. $34 for On Tour Europe and USA, QE, Bites, or Loot of Lima.
4. Shipping prices will be the same during the pledge manager and you will be able to add more games then at the "additional game" shipping price.  
5. The price of GPS, Mountain Goats, and Sequoia will probably be higher in the pledge manager. We want to offer Kickstarter backers the best possible price.
6. Instead of offering a discount for buying a full case of games, we have steeply discounted the shipping rates for buying additional games. This way you can order the exact number of games your group needs.
7. This campaign is Canadian, EU, UK, and USA, and Australian friendly.
8. There are two main reasons the Canadian and European shipping costs more than US shipping. Since we ship fewer games to these fulfillment centers, it costs us more per game to get them there. And, we have to pay taxes when we bring the games into these regions so that you don't have to pay any taxes when they are delivered to you.
Email help@boardgametables.com if you want to carry one of these games in your Friendly Local Game Store, if you want to offer them through distribution, or if you would like to localize them for your country.
Chad is the owner of BoardGameTables.com and the designer of Sequoia.  Here are some games he loves that aren't getting talked about enough: Blockers, Capital Lux, Factory Funner, The King is Dead, Nations, Greed, Prospectus, Haggis, and Startups.
Katy has to answer all your support emails and messages. So please be nice to her. With a wide range of gaming tastes she can be found playing Lisboa one night and a Harry Potter RPG the next. But it gets a little weird when she role-plays as a wizard during the game of Lisboa.
Anca is the co-artist and graphic designer for On Tour, QE, Bites, and Loot of Lima. She has a poster featured in the Board Game Geek Artist series. Her husband and baby girl are always involved in the projects, from mandatory play testing and prototyping, to artistic suggestions. 
Daniel Profiri is the co-artist for this series. Whenever he's not illustrating board games, he's drawing photorealistic portraits and working on interior design projects. 
Stefan Risthaus is the designer of Mountain Goats. He lives in Northern Germany and likes playing and developing games with history as a theme, but also quick fillers and family games. His wife also designs games and is the first and most important play testing person for his games.
Hartmut Kommerell is the designer of GPS. He has forgotten a lot of the math theory he once studied, but still uses the skills to design games and to puzzle around at work. With a 6-headed family, he can always test games with players of any age.
Estimated delivery January 2021. Our normal math would project a November delivery. We added a couple of extra months because there is a lot of uncertainty right now, and shipping in November/December can add extra delays as everyone else is trying to get stuff in by Christmas.
As with all our Kickstarters, we will fully refund your pledge at any time before we ship the game to you. For any reason. No limits. No restrictions.
Right now some people have some understandable concerns about the health of the economy and small businesses. It is our policy and will continue to be our policy to always keep enough cash on hand to fulfill (produce and ship) all outstanding Kickstarter commitments and preorders.
This is a short campaign, so don't delay.

Risks and challenges
Everything feels a little riskier than it did a month ago. There are risks that COVID-19 will disrupt manufacturing capabilities in China or global supply chain. Right now it looks like the virus is controlled in China and there should be only minimal effects manufacturing the games, getting them to us, and shipping them to you.

The game will be manufactured by Panda Game Manufacturing. They are the industry leader. We have printed several games with them before. No one is more qualified to make these games and we have already been working with them for months to make sure it goes smoothly. They did have some delays earlier in the year. They handled them safely and superbly and are now operating at 100% capacity again.

campaign.story:
Hi, we're board game designers James Ernest and Mike Selinker. In 2010, we published Lords of Vegas, a high energy casino-building game. It cemented itself as one of the best games we've ever made, and a favorite of such series as Tabletop, Shut Up & Sit Down, and The Dice Tower. Our 2014 hard-to-find expansion Up! enabled more strategic casino-building and added pieces for more players. But since then, we haven't been able to bring anything new to the game's legions of fans.
Until today, that is. Last month, we regained the rights to Lords of Vegas. After five years in the hopper, we're publishing the long-awaited expansion Underworld, filled with mobsters and shady dealers. We're bringing out a 10th Anniversary Boss Bundle, a lush mobster briefcase stocked with poker chips, a felt-lined tray, player piece upgrades, and gambling dice. We're making a 15th anniversary edition of our book Dealer's Choice: The Complete Handbook of Saturday Night Poker. And you can get the previously released versions of the base set and Up! here. We want to reward our fans for supporting our game all these years.
If you've never heard of the game, you might want to know... 
The base set, Up!, and a theory of what the Underworld box might look like.

Lords of Vegas is a city-building eurogame in which players are casino moguls turning the desert of Nevada into something even nastier. The game starts in 1940, when Las Vegas is merely cheap motels and one-room poker houses. Of course, you bulldoze them. Over the next few decades, you construct glittering meccas of gambling and debauchery. You can build, remodel, reorganize, and sprawl your casinos along the Strip. Should you come up a few million short in your plans for world domination, take those dollars to a competitor's casino and roll the dice on a gambling spree. Here's what it looks like in play.
The game comes with a beautiful board of the Vegas Strip, illustrated by the masterful Franz Vohwinkel. It has 48 casino tiles, 55 cards, 40 player markers, and loads of paper money—and, oh yeah, 48 dice. Yes, we made a eurogame with 48 dice. 
Here's Mike to explain how it works.
And here's Quinns of Shut Up & Sit Down walking you through it.
With the strongly recommended expansion Up!, your casinos build skyward, gaining you  more wealth and power. This expands the game to 2-6 players using the base set and Up! The expansion has 48 riser tiles for elevating your casinos, 20 player markers, even more money, and 24 more dice, bringing the total to a spine-rattling 72 dice. If you have a copy of the base set but have never gotten your hands on Up!, please take this opportunity to do so. You'll never play the game the same way again.  
The Underworld expansion is a brand new set of characters, events, and properties to enhance your game with that seedy-side-of-Vegas feeling. See below for that. 
Here are some nice people saying nice things about Lords of Vegas:
"Lords of Vegas is the perfect simulation of the reality of gambling in Vegas, only sometimes you win."—Wil Wheaton, Tabletop 
"Lords of Vegas is the economic warfare game that we find ourselves recommending the most. The reason that no one should play Monopoly. Ever."—Shut Up & Sit Down 
"I have not seen this level of intensity. It goes back and forth fighting over these (casinos). One of the best games of the year."—Tom Vasel, The Dice Tower (both Vasel's and Eric Summerer's top 10 of 2010)  
"Buy the game. Now. Do it! I'm the Lord of Vegas."—Storm of Paul & Storm, alongside the luminaries Matt Lees, Emma Larkins, Peter Adkison, Matt Forbeck,  Aubrey Cello, Patrick Hillier, and Ignacy Trzewiczek
Cover design for the Underworld box, illustrated by Fastner & Larson.

Underworld is the Lords of Vegas expansion we've been wanting to make for a decade. Ever since the game came out, people have said, "This is great, but where's the seedy underbelly of Vegas?" We've got it for you in Underworld. Faster than you can say "Those are Terry Benedict's casinos!" you'll be deep in the muck with mobsters, thieves, grifters, and, worst of all, accountants. Here's Mike with the lowdown.
This expansion comes with a new Underworld board by Franz. It depicts downtown Las Vegas, the current site of the Fremont Street Experience, north of the main board's Vegas Strip. This is a work in progress. 
Underworld board by Franz Vohwinkel. Image not final.
Underworld contains 52 cards, all lovingly illustrated by the talented Nate Taylor. Here's how they work. At the start of every turn, you flip out a new Underworld card onto the Underworld board. You then gain a new action called Acquire, which allows you to spend money to buy a single Underworld card. Some give you points in different ways, while others give you money over time. Others provide powers that you can use to alter your gameplay. One card might make sprawling easier, while another gives you more opportunities to gamble every turn. Eventually, who and what you have in your Underworld cards can drastically change your board position by the game's end.
Playtest versions shown. Images not final.
Right now, if you own Lords of Vegas, you can help us perfect this expansion. We've created a print and play with rules and cards, which you can download by going to this page and clicking on the button marked Lords of Vegas Underworld Print and Play. Once you've played with it, go to our feedback form and tell us what you think!
Each copy of Underworld comes with two promo cards: Time Share and The Big Score. (See below for how to get our charity promo card, Vegas Shutdown.)
Underworld is the expansion we've wanted to make for over half a decade. With your help, we can finally introduce the mob to Lords of Vegas.
The Boss Bundle is inside your very own mobster briefcase. Image not final.
For diehard Lords of Vegas fans, the 10th Anniversary Boss Bundle is the option you want. It's a mobster briefcase box with places to hold the components from the base game, Up!, and Underworld. Check it out. 
Prototype of the Boss Bundle briefcase box. Image not final.

When you pull this game off your shelf, we want you to feel like a casino magnate. The briefcase box is 320 mm x 320 mm (fits nicely into a Kallax shelf) but feels weighty and substantial. There's a leather-like exterior, a felt interior, and a removable felt-lined tray with snug spaces for each player's components. It's the box we always wanted Lords of Vegas to be in.
Prototype of the Boss Bundle briefcase box interior, with the felt-lined tray pulled out. Image not final.
The tray is dark wood with a felt-lined interior. There are separate compartments for the casino tiles, Up! risers, property and Underworld cards, and poker chips. The scoring markers, dice, and parking lot markers fit into the recess between the tray and the briefcase wall. The rulebook, base set board, and Underworld board set into the top.
Prototype of the poker chips. Image and quantities of each denomination are not final.
Fans have asked for poker chips for years. The Boss Bundle'spoker chipsare still in design, but these are some initial concepts. We plan to include 20 each of $1 million, $2 million, $5 million, $10 million, and $25 million chips. The chips we like are high-density plastic with a metal chip inside making them 11.5 grams similar to a clay chip, but more durable. (Poker chips are also available as an add-on for $55 a set.)
Prototypes and designs for the bags, gambling dice, player pawns, and cars in the player upgrade kit. Nothing here is final.
The Boss Bundle also comes with a player upgrade kit. We'll include 60 wooden cars (of a different shape for each player) to use in place of the markers for parking lots. We are including a deluxe version of the scoring tokens, possibly airplanes so you can vroom around on the scoring track like it's a runway at McCarran Airport. The player pack will come with six velvet drawstring bags, one for each player. It will also contain a pair of larger casino gambling dice. (The player upgrade kit is also available as an add-on for $45 a set.)
Digital prototype of the Vegas Playmat. Image not final.
The Boss Bundle will also come with a Vegas playmat. This is a 24x28" neoprene playmat which features both the base set board (The Strip) and the Underworld board (Downtown Vegas). The playmat comes with the Boss Bundle, but is too big to fit in the briefcase box. (The Vegas playmat is also available as an add-on for $40.)
Since all people who get the Boss Bundle should have all three boxes, we've added to the bundle a unified rulebook that incorporates the rules of base, Up!, and Underworld.  (The unified rulebook is also available as an add-on for $5.)
The 10th Anniversary Boss Bundle comes with a copy of the base set, Up!, Underworld, and Dealer's Choice. Or, if you already own the base set and Up!, you can get it without those at the Boss Bundle (New Stuff Only) level. You can also buy most of these items as add-ons. See below for details on how that works.
If you want something really unique, check The Big Score Bundle with You In It. That gets you illustrated into one of our promo cards like The Big Score. You or someone you really like will become a Lords of Vegas denizen forever. We'll send you 10 of your promo card so you can leave your calling card when you next rob the Strip blind. 
The Dealer's Choice cover from 2005. Phil's drawing a new one for the 15th anniversary edition.
In 2005, we joined with our buddy Phil Foglio, whom you might know from the Hugo Award-winning graphic novel series Girl Genius, to write and illustrate the definitive book on dealer's choice poker. We called it Dealer's Choice: The Complete Handbook of Saturday Night Poker. After it went out of print, we were often begged for copies. So we decided to get the rights to that book back too. We're excited to offer a brand new 15th anniversary edition of Dealer's Choice, complete with a new cover. This new edition will be a staple at every poker night you attend.
The Dealer's Choice softcover contains the rules to 200 poker games, including old favorites like Omaha and Chicago, and bizarre new constructions like Demolition Man, Black Jack Shellacque, Frankenstein, and Night Baseball of the Living Dead. Plus we've added a bunch of additional games courtesy of our columns in Bluff Magazine. The book also features valuable tips for how to host a poker night, how to design your own games, and how to talk like a poker player. Every copy of the book comes with a PDF and an ebook. It's cool. 
 Here's a handy table of what's included in each reward level.   
We also have a $1 level for those who just want access to our PledgeManager after the campaign. We know times are tough, so if you are stressing right now about finances, you can just pledge a dollar and we'll let you upgrade later. 
You can also buy many of the elements of the Boss Bundle as add-ons, using the prices in this chart.

Each backer who receives physical goods will pay the actual cost of shipping their rewards. Final shipping rates and costs will be loaded into our PledgeManager, and you will pay for your shipping via the PledgeManager as well.  We'll charge backers as close to our actual shipping costs for their shipping address as we can for each order. Lone Shark is not making any profit on shipping and handling. Including add-ons in your order will increase shipping costs. See below for our current shipping estimates, based on shipping out of our fulfillment sites of Florida, England, and Australia. (And yes, those "Rest of World" numbers are horrible. If you're from those places, we're really sorry about that,) 
Again, these are estimates. You'll be charged exactly what it costs us to get it to your location, wherever that is. 
We are game designers. James founded Cheapass Games and the head crustacean at Crab Fragment Labs. His games include Kill Doctor Lucky, Tak: A Beautiful Game, Button Men, Pairs, and Unexploded Cow. Mike is the lead developer and/or designer of Betrayal at House on the Hill, the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game, Apocrypha, The Ninth World, Risk Godstorm, and Thornwatch, as well as the author of The Maze of Games, The Kobold Guide to Board Game Design, and Puzzlecraft. Mike and James co-founded Lone Shark Games, and together designed Pirates of the Spanish Main, Unspeakable Words, Fightball, Gloria Mundi, 12 Days, and many other games, and recently collaborated together with the Brothers Chaps on Trogdor!! The Board Game.
Lone Shark Games is a Seattle board game and puzzle company that has made such Kickstarter-fueled games and books as The Maze of Games, Apocrypha, The Ninth World, Thornwatch, and Puzzlecraft. We also are responsible for the design of Betrayal at House on the Hill: Widow's Walk and the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game. You can get all our stuff at our webstore.
We're joined by some great artists on Lords of Vegas. Franz Vohwinkel does our boards; he's known for his work on Magic: The Gathering, Dungeons & Dragons, Dominion, and boardgames like Ra and Princes of Florence. Steve Fastner and Rich Larson did the covers for our base set and Up!, and are famous for their comic and pinup art. Nate Taylor is illustrating the Underworld cards; you may know him from his collaborations with Pat Rothfuss, especially The Princess and Mr. Whiffle. 
This is a strange time to be asking for money for a game. Here's some things we know.
1. It's the 10th anniversary of this game, and that only comes around once.
2. We don't know when things will get better. The economy could rev back up quickly, or things could get worse. We just can't know.
3. We can't print the game without help.
So, encouraged by lots of fans on BoardGameGeek, we decided to go ahead with the campaign. Still, most of our opportunities to promote the campaign—conventions, magazines, Twitch play around a table—are not available to us right now. We could use your help. Please share this post as much as you can with people who like games. You can also put this badge on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or Kickstarter icon.
We also want to give back to the Las Vegas community, which was open when we shot our videos. So we're making a promo card called Vegas Shutdown (named in honor of our other favorite Vegas board game, Henry Stern's Vegas Showdown). Since it's a charity thing, and Kickstarter doesn't do charity campaigns, you can't buy it here. But if you pledge for a physical reward in this campaign, you'll have the first opportunity to get copies of the promo card for an additional $5 each in our PledgeManager. Every charity promo card purchased will help Three Square Food Bank take care of workers affected by the shutdown of the casino industry. Here's the card.
That's our reasons for doing this now. Once you're done taking care of your needs for yourself, your family, and your community, if you decide you like the game and would like to contribute, we'd really appreciate it. Thanks, and we hope to see you playing Lords of Vegas around a game table soon.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Needless to say, we're concerned about the coronavirus pandemic's effect on the production and shipping of this campaign. 

We're acquiring inventory of the last printing of the base set and Up! from Asmodee. We're making new editions of Underworld and Dealer's Choice for this project, and we don't anticipate any manufacturing problems with those. Underworld is being printed by the same printer who printed the base set and Up! They're in the United States, which costs more but avoids problems with tariffs and shipping from China. We expect that our factory and warehouses will be open by the time these need to go to those steps, but of course we cannot know for sure. We are committed to getting the games to our backers whatever difficulties arise in the next few months.

The 10th Anniversary boss boxes are considerably more complex. We've set the shipping date on those for Christmas, but our experience with these types of projects on Thornwatch, Tak, and Apocrypha leads us to be careful about specific dates, given some instability in the supply channel now. We are planning to ship these editions separately from the games themselves, so if you pledge for a Boss Bundle, you'll get your games and books at the same time everyone else does. We'll keep you in the know as the Boss Bundle is developed. Thanks in advance.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The Cave by Arik Roper
Let darkness be our walls and silence be our roof.
Summers are short, winters long. The towns are overcrowded. Food is expensive. Guilds control trade; nobles control the taxes while priests pray for our damned souls.
Out there, beyond those walls, are beasts, bogies, monsters. They inhabit the forests, live under the fields, dwell in the ruins of our burned-out fortresses. They kidnap the lone wanderer, harry our caravans, and when they are bold, they attack our towns.
This land is wild, untamable, and in it we struggle to survive. We who thought we could conquer it, subjugate it—we are guests here, our days numbered.  
New to Torchbearer? Read Thor's primer here. Download our introductory chapter here. And our work-in-progress character sheet here. 
A Second Edition: One Book Becomes Three
We have been hard at work on a new edition of Torchbearer for over three years now. Based on the feedback we received from you and from our own campaigns and demos since we launched in 2013, we wanted to make a couple of tweaks to the game. Well, those "couple of tweaks" rapidly spiraled into a massive revision. Check it out:
New format and layout! The game is now a two-book set: The Dungeoneer’s Handbook and The Scholar’s Guide 
Clarified, revised, refined and expanded rules from seven years of playtesting and feedback
The Dungeoneer's Handbook
275 pages, digest-sized (5.5" x 8.5")! Hardcover, linen wrap, swanky end papers, nice paper!
Revised character creation which includes tighter Nature question results
Revised leveling costs
10 levels for all classes (up from 5), including revised benefits for levels 1-5
New class: Theurge, a mad seer possessed by the immortals
New arcane spell memorization system, The Memory Palace
New divine magic system, The Immortal Burden
New invocations and spells with revised, clarified format
A Scholar's Guide to Dangers Various and Sundry
332 pages, digest-sized (5.5" x 8.5")! Hardcover, linen wrap, swanky end papers, nice paper! 
New easy-to-process difficulty factors format throughout
Revised skill format—much easier to parse
Revised and clarified reward system
Iconic monsters all in a revised, cleaner format 
New loot tables—with more treasure!
New camp and town events (they're so good!)
New demo adventure: Revised and updated Dread Crypt of Skogenby! 
The Lore Master’s Manual
We came up with so many new rules and ideas around the game that they wouldn't fit in two books. So we're offering a third book full of optional material for the game. It includes:
200 pages, digest-sized (5.5" x 8.5")! Hardcover, linen wrap, swanky end papers, nice paper! 
New class: the thief, go from a knife-wielding cutthroat to the shadowy power that rules this town
New class:  the shaman, fueled by the Immortals of Beasts, channeling their wild power
New stock: the Troll Changeling; they're part troll, part human and all trouble
New conflicts: Banish, Abjure, Bind and Battle
New settlements like Borderland Fortress, Shire and Walled Town
Lots and lots of gear in a comprehensive list
Rules for making base camps—good for tackling those megadungeons. 
Economic rules so you can crash the economy of your town
Travel rules
Simple guidance on town adventures
More spells and invocations
More monsters!
Wild new rules for spiritual quests 
And more!     
Books are not enough to express the full majesty of Torchbearer.  We have revised and refined our action card deck as well as the equipment and light cards. The game master screen has been updated to include the revised edition information. And we're adding metal coins, custom wooden dice and a wooden card holder on top of all of that. 
But these items are not merely gorgeous swag to adorn your gaming shelf, we have designed each of these items to be a useful, efficient part of the Torchbearer experience at the table:
Action cards facilitate conflicts, making them move more smoothly.
Equipment, condition and light cards offer easy reading of your current load out for you and for the rest of the table.
Use the coins as a prop for loot or use them to track light during an expedition or hit points during a conflict.
The dice are marked to clearly represent the 4+ target number of Torchbearer, but we've also included pips so you can use them to roll for armor and on tables! Dragons for scoundrels, axes for successes and the sun for a 6. 
And the card holder ties it all together. You can drop your action and equipment cards into the slots on the left. While on the right you can use your copper, silver or gold coins to track your light and hit points.  
Feasting Table pledge tier items (yes we know we need more dice)
Metal coins shown here by Campaign Coins. This is what you'll get in your set!
You can pledge for one of our bundles or—ominous horns sound—you can add these items onto your individual pledges. We even made a chart for you, because it wouldn't be Torchbearer without one…       
updated 5 PM EDT 4/21
These are prototypes of our dice!
You’re a scoundrel, a villain, a wastrel, a vagabond, a criminal, a sword-for-hire, a cutthroat.
Respectable people belong to guilds, the church or are born into nobility. Or barring all that, they’re salt of the earth and till the land for the rest of us.
Your problem is that you’re none of that. You’re a third child or worse. You can’t get into a guild—too many apprentices already. You’re sure as hell not nobility—even if you were, your older brothers and sisters have soaked up the inheritance. If you’re cursed with visions from the Immortals, the temples won’t take you in. You question their authority and subvert their power, so you are outcast like the rest of us.
And if you ever entertained romantic notions of home-steading, think again. You’d end up little more than a slave to a wealthy noble.
So there’s naught for you but to make your own way. There’s a certain freedom to it, but it’s a hard life. Cash flows out of your hands as easily as the blood from your wounds.
But at least it’s your life.
And if you’re lucky, smart and stubborn, you might come out on top. There’s a lot of lost loot out there for the finding. And salvage law is mercifully generous. You find it, it’s yours to spend, sell or keep.
A Roleplaying Game of Desperate Adventure
Torchbearer is a roleplaying game of desperate adventure. The expeditions you undertake are taxing on your body, your mind and your very nature. To survive, you must carefully manage your food, water and light resources. To excel, you must fight for what you believe in. To prosper, you must fill your bags with loot and treasure.
This triumvirate of competing needs creates a delicious tension unique to Torchbearer. Players are asked to weigh these forces in every decision they make. Some may seem easy or frivolous to start, but the deeper you become enmeshed in an adventure, the heavier and more costly each decision becomes. 
Varg, Karolina and Beren by Jordan Worley
The system is based on our award-winning Mouse Guard roleplaying game system. Using the same core rules, character builds and conflict system, we have created a grimmer, harsher world. One that can stand the test of time, providing you with years of adventures.  
System Preview
Eager to dive right in and create an adventurer? Download the introduction to the Dungeoneer's Handbook and our current character sheet.
Prefer to plot, plan and sketch maps? Download The Light Dims and Prepare Thyself chapters from the Scholar's Guide. We'd love to see the world you build. 
Want a detailed overview of the system mechanics? Check out Luke's new currency cycle diagrams.
Torchbearer has been in print since 2013. Over the years, we've had a goodly number of folks play the game. Some of them even liked it. Perhaps the words of these wise sages will convince you to join our cause:
“Torchbearer has actually become my favourite system ever for fostering role-playing on a long-term basis… If you like your roleplaying dark and brooding, and it’s been a while since you shanked a kobold, this book is absolutely worth your time.” — Shut Up and Sit Down
“A roleplaying game where adventurers are filthy, choices are meaningful, and light is as precious as loot.” — Team Covenant
“Playing Torchbearer feels a bit like a good roll in mud: In the moment everything is sticky, wet, and slimy, but that’s kind of the point, right? If you’re even for a second serious about your nostalgia for ‘3d6 line roll’ D&D...you owe it to yourself to play or run Torchbearer.” — Cannibal Halfling Gaming
“A combat-laden adventure, far from civilization. This is a survival game... even a rat bite can ruin your day.” — Gamasutra 
As we grow in wisdom and experience, we gain levels! And when we benefit, so do you all. We shall share with you all whatever bounty we reap:     
WE F-ING DID IT! GOLD! I GET MY GOLD TIPPED PAGES!
Our cover artist for the Dungeoneer's Handbook is Arik Roper. Arik is a massively talented artist living in Brooklyn. He's done some of our favorite covers for some of our favorite bands: Earth, High on Fire and SLEEP. When we heard he was available we hunted him down in the wilds of Brooklyn and made the most dignified pitch we could muster.   
Fortunately for us, Arik has a soft spot for nerds with dark, weird dreams. He signed on not only to do the cover but a number of interiors as well. We're honored to have him as a part of our adventuring band. Maybe if this goes well we can talk him into doing more work for us…  
Our music track—In Tenebris Lux—was composed specifically for this project. It is a collaboration between Bismuth and Vile Creature. 
Vic + KW: Vocals
Tanya: drum programming, bass, synth, vocals, mixing, mastering
Our video was orchestrated by the Master Burner, Chris Allingham using art by Kurt Komoda and Jordan Worley.  
We are are small group of friends living in New York and New Jersey (and Helsinki). We have been making roleplaying games since 2002. 
We have created/designed/published: The Burning Wheel, Burning Empires, Mouse Guard, FreeMarket, Torchbearer, Inheritance and Miseries & Misfortunes. 
We strive to make baroque games contained in beautiful books.   
The Burning Wheel Gold Revised Edition
And we have won numerous awards for our games: Origins awards, Golden Geeks, Indie RPG awards, even a thing called an Outie that Ken Hite gave us back in 2003.
Our Beliefs
 We love roleplaying games. If you ask us, you’ll hear us go on and on about how and why we love them.
 We make games we want to play and we play them as much as we can before releasing them. Corollary to that, we play by the rules we design, and design our rules to be used. A game cannot be experienced through reading it, and though our games often come in the form of books, they are meant to be played, not read. 
 Each of our games is an attempt to say something new about the art of roleplaying games and game design in general. Each of our games is an iteration of the last, built on the experience of players at the table in an attempt to advance the state of the art in a small way.
 We speak through our work. Our thoughts, concerns and questions about the world around us are expressed in our work. Rather than editorializing or explaining, we prefer to let the work speak for itself. If you disagree with ideas presented in our games, it is our hope that you design a game to express your own concerns.
 We love our fans. We thrive on hearing about how you play, and talking with you about our games and games in general. That said, and this is a hard thing to say, we make games for us, not you. We hope our games will challenge and fascinate you, not cater to or coddle you.
 We are unconcerned with popularity or convention and will sacrifice a great deal in service of a compelling idea. Though it’s painful to admit, we accept that our games will likely never be popular with a broad audience.
You can read more about our Beliefs and Instincts here.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Welcome friend

We begin today another adventure with Burning Wheel Headquarters. We have been creating and publishing games since 2002 and we love to surprise and delight our fans. Let us run through some risks and challenges both for us and you on this project.

We have never failed to deliver on a project, but we are launching into an extremely uncertain world now. We wouldn't launch unless we had every item buttoned up—and we do—but still, anything can happen.

We always under-promise and over-deliver. That is a challenge for us. Whatever you see on this page, we want to deliver it to you in an even more magnificent form. We don't know exactly what that will be, but as I said, we aim to surprise and delight.

Something always goes wrong. Always. For past projects it has been shipping cock-ups, misprints and Luke & Thor feuding over design for four years. For this project who knows what will go wrong? Something will, but we will handle it. We always do.

This is our biggest project to date with the most gaming material combined with the most moving parts. We feel like we're ready to begin the long process of getting this game to you. That said, we have no idea what we're doing, but we have excellent partners and 20 years of experience in delivering really good games.

Shipping is complicated, slow and expensive. It just is. We've done our best to find the fastest, safest and cheapest solutions for you (pick two). If shipping is too expensive for you, we respect your economical opinion, but there is no way we can satisfy your needs in this matter. 

And lastly, we present to you the biggest challenge of this project: We seek allied adventurers and other brave souls to join our band and assist us on this great quest. If you can carry a pack, heft a spear or bear a torch as part of our adventuring band, then we welcome you on our quest. We are in dire need of such friends. 

Be courageous: Join us and help hold aloft a burning beacon to drive back the weird darkness of this world. 

Agents of chaos need not apply, any who do shall be cast into the abyss.

Onward,
—Luke, Thor & BWHQ

campaign.story:
Kiitos - Outwit with Cleverness
Kiitos is an English language card game of word completion for 2 -4 players. Kiitos is the Finnish word for thank-you. When you force someone to finish your word, you say "Kiitos" to them.
Kiitos is a strategy word game. Combining a mixture of luck and skill, it plays fast, but can spark deep thinking.  It is unlike any other word game, with a novel mechanism.  
It has the feel of a classic game. It can feel a little bit like a trick-taker. Each word can evolve unexpectedly, and it can feel like a succession of wordy puzzles, where you can try to bamboozle your opponents with cleverness. 
It's a perfect couples game, and is ideal for playing with your word game-loving mum or at lunchtime with your work mates.  
It can be an intense 2 player game, a bit more relaxed at 3, and almost a party game at 4 players.    
How to Play Video
Stella and Tarrant from Meeple University have made a how to play video for Kiitos.  
  For the rulebook and to see what is in the box scroll down past the reviews. 
Reviews
'Sesquipedalian Steph' from 3 Minute Board Games loves the longer words.
'Kiitos is definitely one for the word nerds, who are looking for a bit more interaction, and opportunities to mess with your opponents, than Bananagrams or Scrabble affords you. The recommended age range is 12+, but you could absolutely soften the rules for precocious word-babies. 10 year old me would have loved it. It's small, portable, quick to set up, easy to teach and a complete bastard to master.' Steph, 3 Minute Boardgames.
---
Before Steph's video, Jarrod from 3 Minute Board Games gave a quick preview of Kiitos within a longer video.
 "Oh my Lord.  It is one of the most legitimately fun games Steph and I, and my friends, have played in ages. It is one of those games where I played it, and afterwards, I was like, why isn't this in every bloody toy store? This should be sold alongside Uno. It's just really fun, really addictive. ... Keep an eye on this one. Wow!" - Jarrod, 3 Minute Board Games   
 ---
Daddy Louie from the Circle of Nerds gives us his review:
"So what do I think of this game? I think it is great. It's great family fun. It's good for anyone that enjoys word style games, like I said, Scrabble, Boggle, things like that. I think this changes those mechanics enough to make it fun and exciting for both experienced and new gamers. The age group that it targets is just perfect for me and my family, because that is right around the age of my children. So we enjoyed this and I think that you'll enjoy it as well."  Louie Martinez, Circle of Nerds 
  ---
Michael from Expand Your Game - has a written review.
"This is the most unique word game I have played recently as 'Kiitos' has  a unique trick-taking mechanic that also adds bluffing elements. It creates a hot potato feeling as you don't want to finish another player's word but do want to force players into finishing your words. This is a great unique and compact word game that I would recommend to anyone that grew up on Scrabble or classic trick-taking games." -Michael at Expand Your Game 
 ---
Jordan Plays Blue also gives Kiitos a whirl:
"... I enjoy the puzzle that is trying to finish words, spell words, get them to be put together properly. I think Kiitos does that really well. It is an interesting twist on having to spell words kind of collaboratively, but still only scoring if you're the one that finishes the word. I especially like the variant where you can add to the beginning or ends of words. I think that adds a lot of opportunities, especially at the beginning of words, to maybe add prefixes to words, things like that. I think that works really well" -Jordan from Jordan Plays Blue
 ---
The Dice Men Cometh podcast - Episode 302 (from about 28 minutes) - talk about Kiitos. 
'The game is fun and quick and its one of those games that you can kind of play until it stops being fun. You can play it for a couple of rounds or you can play it for hours if you've got the right wordsmiths around you.' - Dice Man Garth
'Good job Matty T. It is exceptional for a small little boxed game' - Garth again.
 ---
Rowdy with a Chance of Meeples podcast/youtube channel have some entertaining banter about Kiitos.
'Very,very clever. There's a lot of depth in this game. I was very impressed ...
People who are clever with wordplay are really going to like this game ...
This was really good. This was really,really fun.' - Sean from Rowdy with a Chance of Meeples
Quotes from Board Game Geek
"Kiitos is exactly what I want in a word game - quick, fun and addictive. My wife and I have really enjoyed playing this one." - Shem Phillips, designer of Raiders of the North Sea and co-designer of Viscounts of the West Kingdom
"Excellent game with hidden strategies.  If you have the ability to work out what cards your opponent holds you can beat someone who knows more words than  you :-) Plurals, ING words, knowing odd spellings, or just plain creative thinking can dig you out of holes. And in what other game are plays like "Improbabilty" and "Californium" both common and fun?  There is joy in changing "ASTIC" from 'plastic' to  'Masticate'." - BGG user Peppermallow
"Awesome game! Cunning and extremely playable. Great for travel too!" - BGG user funkypsiko   
Unique new game mechanics
Most other word games boil down to anagramming 7 or 8 letters; Kiitos is different. It is about making words with the letters in your own hand, and the letters that may or may not be in your opponents' hands. The rules are simple, but the emergent strategies are surprisingly deep.
The idea for Kiitos came to me as flipping the traditional spoken word game of Ghost on its head. In Ghost players alternate saying a letter trying not to be the player who says a whole finished word. In Kiitos, there is a concept of owning the target word, you do want to finish your target word, but the available letters are limited to what cards are in all of the players' hands. Then you want your target words to finish, but you don't want your opponents' target words to finish.    
Kiitos works in British English, American English, New Zealand English, Australian English, Singaporean English, Canadian English etc. or a mixture of all of them.
The Project
Kiitos has been designed and extensively play-tested (it's been my go-to lunchtime game at work for over a year). The graphic design to the manufacturer's templates has been completed. This Kickstarter is to see the first print run into production. It is going to look great on the shelves of gameshops and bookshops next to the other word games. 
Each copy of Kiitos will come in a magnetic latch box and comprise the rulebook, 72 letter cards, 8 challenge cards, 3 double-sided rule cards, 4 seasoning cards (for variant play) and a wooden "lock token".
The cards will be 57x87mm (2.25 x 3.42 inches) 300gsm cards. They'll have a plastic coating to extend their life.
The game will be manufactured by Whatz in Shanghai, China. The cost will be kept low to come under the VAT and GST limits for various countries, including the UK and Ireland. Manufacturing and shipping will occur approximately two to three months after the end of the campaign. 
 The Letter Cards
The distribution of the 72 letter cards will be on the inside cover of the magnetic latched box. The distribution of the letters roughly equals how often they're used in English words, except there is no letter Q. The game plays better without a Q.
 The Double-sided Rule Cards
There are three double-sided rule cards. Each has a basic green side, and an alternate orange side. The game starts with the cards on their basic sides. When you successfully have your target word completed you must flip one of them. It can't be the same as the last one flipped which is what the lock token is for. 
Minimum 4 letter word / Minimum 5 letter word: Flip this one to control the momentum of the game. 4 letter words in combination with some intelligent guesses at what might be in your opponent's hands can lead to a series of your words being completed.
Positive Pile x1 / Positive Pile x2 : This is for end of round scoring. The letters from completed words end up in your positive pile. You want to try to make them worth more. If you flip this too early it can be flipped back on you. This can lead to stand-up endings and the winner being decided by the last word chosen and the last letter flipped.
Kiitos / Super-Kiitos: This is the core of the game. Do you build the words from left to right, or build the word by adding letters to the front and back? The strategies for each are completely different. It can be easier to take control of momentum with the Kiitos side up. Can you stop the Positive Pile x2 card from being flipped back? 
 Challenge Cards
Challenges are where Kiitos really shines. To challenge a word an opponent picks up a challenge card, and then the word gets looked up in a dictionary or in a word checking app. The loser of the challenge put the challenge card into their negative pile.
It is not cheating if you can get a false word past your opponents.  Sometimes you might let non-words through, because you can continue it with the next letter. Sometimes you grasp at straws thinking a word you may have made up just might be a real word, and you can get lucky. Kiitos edge-tests the dictionary like no other game. The decisions around challenging can be challenging in themselves.
 Seasoning Cards  
The seasoning cards add variant play. They change the strategies significantly and will exercise your noggin. Use zero, one or more of them.
Seconds : May play a second letter when not setting the target word. So you can play a second letter, but should you? Sometimes, yes, sometimes, no. A whole new skill for you to try not to get wrong.
Completos : Can finish a word when setting target word. Normally you can't, but now you can. 
Squeeze In : When changing the target word you may place your letter between the other letters. This went better in playtesting than a full anagramming one and had less analysis paralysis, but added some interesting decisions.
Flip: Flip a letter from the deck to start a new word. Limits your choices a bit, and you will come up with a lot more words beginning with E.  
 Rulebook 
 Click here for a pdf of the rulebook  
Rewards
The price for a single copy of Kiitos is under the VAT limit for the UK and for the Republic of Ireland. 
Multiple copies in the same package may attract VAT or GST in your country. GST/VAT applied at the border and any other custom fees are the responsibility of the buyer. 
The Kiitos prototype was sent to reviewers and to Meeple University for the How to Play video. The prototype was made with larger cards than what the final manufactured version will be. The box will also be smaller. It will be the same size as the Flipology box (a great little game from Cheeky Parrot games, also in New Zealand, also printed by Whatz, click here for more about Flipology). 
The logo on the box will also have the easier to read KIITOS logo, rather than the visual pun of the Finnish flag making the two low case Is. This is to make it more readable on a retail shelf. The Finnish flag logo will still appear on the rulebook  and the backs of the letter cards.
The box size will be like on the left. The prototype is on the right.
Web Links
Ludogix's Kiitos page - there's lots more information about the game, example plays, and a strategy guide.
Board Game Geek's Kiitos page - forums, photos, ratings, etc.  
Thanks
Graphic Design by Alastair Manning. 
The music on the introductory Kiitos video is Paper Planes - Durden ft. Airtone by DURDEN (c) copyright 2016 Licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution (3.0) license.
Animations on the introductory Kiitos video by Ethan Cox. I hope my editing and voice-over don't distract too much from the great animation. 
Thanks to Ashley Barnes, playtester in chief and all the other enthusiastic playtesters.
Thanks to all of the reviewers for the time and effort they've put into their reviews. The reviews are unpaid. Meeple University was commissioned to produce the How to Play video, because I wanted a really top notch one. I thank them too.

G'day original Kiitos backers,
There are two bits of exciting Kiitos news:
Kiitos is going to a second print run. The only thing that will change is the rulebook. I've done a major rewrite to try to make the rules clearer. The rules haven't changed, just the way that the rulebook is structured. Before it was made in a step by step learning order. The new one presents the "full game", but with clearer explanations at what to do at each step. If you've struggled with the first rulebook, then the new one hopefully makes it easier for you. The is still up on Youtube too.
