updates.update_content:
Delivery status : I have got word through that backers in the UK, the USA and some parts of Europe have begun to get their copies. New Zealand backers should be receiving their copies this coming week. Canadian ones seem to have made it to Canada and are in your postal system. Australian ones frustratingly seem to be still in China. 
A solo game: I have got word from some people that Kiitos looks great, and they are excited to play it, but they are stuck in lockdown and they'll have to wait to meetup with someone to play it with. I thought about it last night and came up with a wee solo game (as in small wee, not NIntendo Wii). It isn't much like Kiitos as Kiitos doesn't lend itself to any kind of solo play. So it is something completely different, and it is a very small game. It is called LISP (for Lockdown Inspired Solitaire/ Patience). I've done a Windows Paint hack job on Alastair's rulebook (Kiitos's graphic designer. Sorry Alastair) to make a and I've uploaded it to the I've only played it a few times myself. If you're stuck indoors by yourself with a shiny new copy of Kiitos it could be worth a try.

Kiitos everybody. We did it.

campaign.story:
Clinic Deluxe Edition / KliniK Ausgabe Deluxe
You will choose your edition during the survey
COVID-19 Rules book is in English, German, French, Spanish, Italian, Korean and Chinese. Components language independent.
 This a very special campaign for me. 
I was married to a nurse and Clinic, the board game, has been massively inspired by the discussions I had with my wife when she comes home from work. 
When I released Clinic Deluxe Edition in 2019, I never thought, or WE never thought, that a giant pandemic would hit the planet.
 And I am now feeling strange about having my game on the table, all around the world, with gamers thematically trying to fight against different diseases based on abstract colors of white, yellow, orange and red. I feel as if I should do more, but what can I do to help the world's medical staff who are suffering in this war against a virus of which we know very little...
That's why I have designed a new cooperative variant called - COVID-19 Pandemic - in order to help the world in finding a vaccine in a near future. 
1 x new Propagation tile
100 x COVID-19 tokens
1 x Syringe tile
a rules booklet in 7 languages! + Portuguese and Greek in pdf
YES ... Clinic Deluxe Edition has become a cooperative game in this small expansion.
With this variant, players are now playing together. They choose a level of difficulty based on the current knowledge of COVID-19:
a degree of Contagion for the virus
a level of Lockdown of the population
The combined choices influence the arrivals of Patients and the development of the virus inside the players' clinic buildings.
All the players are taking decisions together, hiring the best doctors and building the best services to have the fewest deceased, and the most saved, patients at the end.
The major change is that the Doctors, the Nurses and the Orderlies can get infected, and you need to also treat them with safe Doctors. The non-infected staff will become scarcer and scarcer during the game...
You can download the English rules, as well as versions in French, Spanish, Italian, German, Korean, and Chinese (coming soon...)
Components are language independent, so you just need the rules that will be added in the Vaccine Reward in your preferred language!
Please note that the rules are still in balancing phase 
You are welcome to play Clinic Deluxe Edition with or without the COVID-19 Pandemic variant on Tabletopia.
Click on the image to be linked to our previous Clinic Deluxe Edition campaign.

Alban Viard is a mathematics teacher. He lives in Beaune, a small city in Burgundy, France. He has designed and developed several boardgames during the last 8 years such as Tramways, Small City, CliniC, Card City XL, Town Center and many expansions for these games. He loves stacking everything and is always impressed by the 3rd dimension.
Ian O’Toole is an Irish illustrator, graphic designer and gamer working out of Perth in Western Australia. He has over fifteen years’ experience working in many creative fields,  producing illustration, design and 3D animation for a broad selection of industries. Ian has created the artwork for such notable boardgames as Lisboa,The Gallerist, Vinhos Deluxe, Escape Plan and more recently Age of Steam and on Mars in April 2019. Ian works in a wide variety of styles and particularly enjoys drawing from design trends throughout history. Ian works from his home in Perth, where he lives with his wife, two children and dog.
Nathan Morse has edited, translated, and/or written the rules for more than 300 published games, including The Gallerist, Troyes, Lisboa, Vinhos, Kanban, King of Tokyo, Bruxelles 1893, Madeira, Deus, Ginkgopolis, Magic Maze, The Big Book of Madness, Black Angel, Tramways, and Small City. He has a particular hunger for games with emergent complexity, and lots of player agency. Nathan is also obsessed with creating what he calls “holistic summaries” of games and their expansions, which integrate all the rules into a single stream of color-coded instructions; simply skip those you’re not using. He has played and taught more than two thousand different games, and is thrilled to share the joy of a good game with you!
Todd Sanders lives in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, where he works as a graphic designer, publisher and furniture maker. He has great renown as a solo board game designer. Many of his games have already been published, and in the past three years Ludicreations funded KS campaigns for his card games IUNU, They Who Were 8, and Mr. Cabbagehead's Garden. Other games should come later this year... I have heard good things about Pulp Invasion, a second, stand-alone game in the Pulp Universe with a sci-fi theme...
Many people have worked during the last 5 years on this project. Todd has made a great map to sum up and to locate people around the world.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Van Ryder Games has successfully funded and fulfilled many projects. We learn more and more with each experience. Our goal is to get the product to you, our supporters, as quickly as possible, but we won't sacrifice quality for speed.

There are the usual risks of printing, shipping, customs, and other unintended delays, but you can be sure we will deliver the game to you as promised. Feel free to check our track record or ask any of our returning backers!

A few remarks we want to share with you regarding our approach for our projects, including this one.
1. Communication is of the utmost importance to us. Please ask any and all questions and we will answer as quickly as possible.
2. Our stretch goal items (if any) are determined by us before the campaign begins, in the event all of them are achieved we will not add more as it puts our project timeline and cost at risk.
3. Your comments and feedback are REALLY important to us. If you have an idea, concern, or compliment, please share it with us! We can't promise to implement or act on every idea that comes our way, but we will certainly consider and listen to each one!
4. We pledge to keep a positive attitude regardless of the success or failure of this project and we ask that you do the same.
5. To have fun! Kickstarter projects can be stressful, but these are games and the most important thing is to have FUN!

Please note the following is our policy on pledges and refunds.

Refund Policy

All pledges are final upon the completion of the funding period, however, we may, at our sole discretion, refund your pledge in full if the request is made within two weeks of the end of the campaign. Any request for a refund after more than two weeks has passed, if accepted by us, will be subject to a 10-20% cancellation fee to account for KS fees and our administrative expenses. Please note that, anyone that does not complete the pledge manager by our required deadlines will not be eligible for a refund for any reason, including the assessment of additional shipping fees for expenses related to the delinquency of the backer completing their survey information.

Abandoned Pledges

We require that our pledge manager and/or survey be completed in a timely manner so that we can process orders efficiently and on time. Completing your survey late at any point beyond the deadline we communicate AND/OR failure to pay shipping in a timely manner when the surveys are (re)opened, could result in significant delays in receiving your rewards, additional shipping expense, duties, taxes, or other fees to be paid by you, and you will not be eligible for a refund for any reason. We give plenty of time to complete the survey, so please do so in a timely manner to avoid any inconvenience or delay. Any survey that is not completed within 30 days from final fulfillment (defined as the last date of shipping of KS rewards for your region) will result in your pledge being considered abandoned and any amount pledged will be considered a gift in support of the project.

By pledging to this project you understand the risks, challenges, and pledge terms we have laid out here, and agree to be bound by them. If you do not agree to these terms, please do not pledge for this project and wait for the possibility of the game to become available direct or in the retail market.

updates.update_content:
What is happening with Final Girl?
Hey everyone,  here we are with the June update. Production continues and the factory is looking good to wrap things up on that front soon.  We are waiting back to hear exactly when it will be finished, but I've been told all of the non-printed items (plastics, wood, etc.) are done. Fun fact, it is actually pretty unusual to have those items done before the printed materials, but due to the unique challenges we've had with this project the printed materials (cards, rules, boxes, etc.) will be the last things finished.

First off, we wanted to thank everyone for the support over the last month or so. It was a very difficult time and your love and support meant the world to us. We've done (and are doing) what we needed to do to take care of ourselves, our families, and each other. But as they say, the show must go on.
What is happening with Final Girl?

What is happening with Final Girl?
Well first off, thanks for everyone's patience while we waited for and gathered information to make sure we could communicate everything we want to in this update. It has been a busy and often stressful month or so since we last updated. So let's get into it...

What is happening with Final Girl?
Well as expected, there is not too much to cover this month in terms of production, so this will be a text-only update.
Final Girl workstreams:

What is happening with Final Girl?
The PPCs (pre-production copies) have arrived, that's what!!!! This is an exciting time and hopefully, you forgive us the few extra days of waiting this month as we wanted to wait for the PPCs to arrive before we posted January's update. We'll get to the PPCs below, but first, let's look at the workstreams.

What is happening with Final Girl?
We are in the thick of it with the manufacturer in terms of the production process. We are keeping a close eye on the logistics environment even though we are still a few months away from shipping - the landscape in that regard isn't great right now, but hopefully, that improves by the time we are ready for freight shipping from the Factory.

What is happening with Final Girl?
Now that all of the files have been provided to the manufacturer, a bit of a waiting game occurs as now it is up to our partners at LongPack to turn our vision into a physical product. We are very excited to now be in this process as it means we are still on schedule and on track!

Muwahahaha! Surprise!
Did we scare you with this surprise update?!?!? Hahaha just kidding, you are probably just excited. 
Well, given the season, we wanted to pop in with a bonus update. There are a lot of reasons to celebrate! For one, tomorrow (Oct. 30) is our self-imposed deadline for finishing up all of the files to be packaged and sent to the manufacturer. This is a huge milestone, and represents the completion of the work (barring any tweaks as a result of our pre-production copy review) by the design and development team. We are going to celebrate this milestone with something really cool, a bit of a surprise... and we need your input! More on that in a minute...
Hey everyone! Another month gone by and a whole ton more work done on this project! Is everyone excited for the Halloween season? Check out this Frightmare Cover!

TLDR: We are making a landmark edition of EDGAR ALLAN POE'S TALES, MYSTERIES & CONTRIVANCES to celebrate Poe’s counterculture roots and literary genius. The Thornwillow edition combines the finest in letterpress printing and hand bookbinding with the skill and gothic sensibility of one of the world's most renowned tattoo artists. 
A landmark edition that celebrates Edgar Allan Poe's counterculture roots and literary genius.
Plus, to occupy you during this time of social distancing, a cryptic puzzle will emerge over the course of the campaign that you can work on in isolation or connect with other sequestered backers around the world via FaceTime or Zoom and build a team. This project unites a local and global community of people like you. You don't have to be alone. And remember... there will be a magnificent PRIZE for the first one to unravel the secret. These are dark times.
We launch this campaign knowing that your attention, your worries, and your resources are being pulled in many directions.
We did not choose Poe with this moment in mind. We did not imagine this book as an allegory for what the world is currently experiencing. But, as with Poe’s infamous ‘Red Death’, you often don’t see what is coming at you until it is too late, and now, these visceral writings of Edgar Allan Poe are speaking to us and to our world as we are living it today.
Now, more than ever, is the time—the time to unite, the time to support one another, to support artists, and to read. In our darkest hours, we turn to art to ignite our imagination, to feed us with ideas and inspirations, to distract and entertain us, to bring us together around shared stories that give us hope and make us human.
Without further ado, my dear ladies and gentlemen, we invite you back to Thornwillow to meet our next book:
EDGAR ALLAN POE TALES, MYSTERIES & CONTRIVANCES
Edgar Allan Poe
Few authors have left a legacy as enduring and influential as Poe’s. The first author to make his living as a professional writer, he not only composed some of the most famous and haunting short stories of all time, but single-handedly invented the genre of detective fiction, and was one of the earliest authors to explore the bounds of science fiction. In the span of his short life, he produced a groundbreaking body of work that has defined the genres of horror and mystery for the last two hundred years. And yet, he lived a life almost as dark and dreary as any of his tales, coping with alcoholism, gambling, poverty, and eventually mysterious death. 
Edgar Allan Poe in 1849 four months before his death.
An iconic writer for this tumultuous time.
We have grouped our collection of Poe’s most iconic writings into three categories, containing his infamous tales, groundbreaking mysteries, and contemptuous contrivances. 
Our edition contains the following Tales, Mysteries & Contrivances... 
The Tales:
Metzengerstein
MS. Found in a Bottle
Berenice
The Man That Was Used Up
The Fall of the House of Usher
The Man of the Crowd
The Masque of the Red Death
The Pit and the Pendulum
The Tell-Tale Heart
The Cask of Amontillado
The Dupin Mysteries:
The Murders in the Rue Morgue
The Purloined Letter
  The Contrivances:
How to Write a Blackwood Article
A Philosophy of Composition
 ...and features a world class historian to navigate you through the twists and turns of Poe’s tales and life... meet Jill Lepore.
World renowned scholar Jill Lepore guides us through Poe's stories and life.
Here to guide us through the dark passages of Poe’s most twisted tales (and his equally twisted life) is acclaimed Harvard historian and two-time Pulitzer Prize finalist, Jill Lepore. With wit as incisive as Poe’s pendulum, she brings her expertise to bear on a man famous for concocting riddles, mysteries... and outright lies.
 ... and putting on paper the ink he usually reserves for human skin... meet John Reardon. 
The edition is dramatically illustrated with bone-chilling original artwork by Brooklyn tattooist John Reardon, whose signature style presents a vivid and haunting representation of Poe’s sinister worlds.  
Tattoo artist John Reardon at work.
Reardon is recognized  as one of the most talented tattoo artists working today. For more than two years he has been developing more than 28 original works of art for this edition. With this collaboration, we will put on paper the ink he usually reserves for human flesh.
Original artwork accompanies each of the Tales, Mysteries & Contrivances
The leather binding at the highest tier will be hand tattooed by Reardon himself directly on the book. AND at several of the highest tier subscriptions, you can opt to visit his studio where he will tattoo YOU. But more on that later. 
We are dedicated to teaching and perpetuating the arts and crafts of the written word.
For more than 30 years, Thornwillow has been committed to making books that enhance the relationship between the reader and the written word. Thornwillow books are in the permanent collections of the Metropolitan Museum, the Smithsonian Institution, the White House, and the Vatican. 
Some of the tools that will that will be used to bind your book.
In this digital age, we are committed to teaching and perpetuating the related arts and crafts of the written word. We still make our books by hand, letterpress printing every page on heavy archival stock and binding each copy with the finest materials and utmost care.
How our books are made
All of the design, printing, and binding are done at Thornwillow in our workshops in Newburgh, New York. We are perhaps the only fine press publisher in the world to unite these related arts and crafts of the written word under one roof, and we are committed to teaching and perpetuating them for readers today and for years to come.
Our Heidelberg cylinder letterpress on which the book will be printed.
We start with a beautiful layout.  The text is set using classical ratios of type to page, giving each book luxurious margins and elegant proportions.
Once the book is laid out, the text is printed letterpress on our Heidelberg Cylinder Press. The type is literally pressed into the heavy archival stock, so that you can feel the letters as you run your fingers across the page. This is an ancient art—the same process by which Johannes Gutenberg printed his books 500 years ago.
Each book is then folded into eight page signatures, collated and sewn together.
The books are then bound by hand by our master craftsmen, who create the highest quality bindings in the world.
As a testament to the care and attention that goes into the crafting of every Thornwillow volume, your unique copy of Poe’s Tales will be individually numbered and signed.  And, in recognition of your patronage and your participation in  the global arts and crafts movement we are endeavoring to ignite, your name will be recorded on the Subscribers List accompanying every volume.
We cannot do it without you. We need your support to bring this edition to life and to immortalize the work of one of the world’s greatest authors. Without your help, however, our project will remain locked away in a tomb of unrealized ideas and lost inspirations..
Now more than ever we need your help to keep the lights on. 
In supporting this project, you are not just making the publication possible and adding a beautiful and important book to your shelf— you are supporting a community of writers, artists, and artisans— designers, printers, and binders— you are uniting a global community of book makers and book readers who share a love of books and celebrate the written word. Please join us.

A Note on Our Pricing:
We are extremely grateful to pre-publication subscribers like you. Without your support, it would not be possible for us to do what we do. You are patrons of the edition and investors in our mission. In acknowledgement of the essential role you play in our world of books, your name is included in the subscriber list. Years from now, readers will know who made this edition possible. As Franklin Delano Roosevelt wrote: "People die, but books never die. No man and no force can abolish memory."
By way of thanks, we offer our work at reduced pricing to people like you who come in early to support a project and help it get off the ground. Our prices increase as availability decreases. After the pre-publication subscription period ends on Kickstarter, we will make the remaining copies available for sale on our website. They will be at higher prices than during the campaign and as the edition sells out, the prices will increase until the edition sells out. (NOTE: Often certain versions of the edition are fully subscribed during the Kickstarter launch, particularly the full leather tiers. Also the number available on the campaign in some instances is less than edition size because we have held some copies back for steady collectors). When an edition is down to just a few remaining copies, the prices tend to be much higher than they were at the beginning. This rewards patrons like you who supported our work early. 
Publisher Luke Ives Pontifell in the Thornwillow stacks.

You are not just making this publication possible, you are also making it possible for the artists and artisans working every day at Thornwillow to dedicate their lives to this beautiful and important work. You are integral to the modern day arts and crafts movement that together we are endeavoring to advance. You are engaged in a direct, personal relationship between bookmakers and book readers. You are part of a local and global community of people who celebrate the written word.
To learn more about our work and for other ways to support our mission please visit www.thornwillowinstitute.org. To subscribe to the Thornwillow Dispatch (our monthly subscription box including a letterpress publication and finely printed goods for your study) visit www.patreon.com/thornwillow.

We have a great deal of space at the press and our small team is able to work safely and far apart from each other. So, we do not anticipate problems with fulfilling this project. updates.update_userinfo: Update on Edgar Allen Poe production schedule
updates.update_content:
Greetings from Thornwillow:

I have some good news and some bad news to report. The bad news is that our edition of Edgar Allan Poe: Tales, Mysteries and Contrivances is going to be a bit delayed. We ran into a number of problems during this difficult time ranging from a broken part on our Heidelberg press that took longer to fix than expected because the mechanic had to travel from out of state, to a batch of bad plate material that we received which resulted in our having to remake all of the plates for the book, which is a very long and time consuming process). That said all of these problems are now behind us and the printing should be finished in the next two weeks. The bindery is ready to proceed the moment the books come off press. So, though we will be late in delivering books, we do not expect to be dramatically late. I will keep you posted and hope to report good news soon.

Dear Friends of the Press,
As a supporter of our recent Edgar Allan Poe project (which is typeset and soon ready to go on press), I wanted to make sure you were aware of our newest project. Today, on the eve of a presidential election and inspired by the interwoven histories of printmaking and protest, Thornwillow is proud to present…
Declaration: Signs of Change

Ladies and Gentlemen, Backers of Poe, and Poe Puzzlers,
It gives me great pleasure to announce that...
We have a winner!!!!!!
Colonel David Harper, head of the Department of English and Philosophy at the U.S. Military Academy at West Point (where Poe himself was enrolled for some time) has won the Thornwillow Edgar Allan Poe Mystery. He has correctly deciphered and answered all 8 of the questions, and, as the first and so far only person to figure it out, will receive the PRIZE COPY and, if inclined, be tattooed himself by artist John Reardon.

A note on Coronavirus: After much debate and consultation with our suppliers, partners and supporters about whether or not to launch this game right now, we have decided to proceed with this Kickstarter for the reasons discussed under Risks and Challenges.
Veilwraith is a fantasy card game set after the end of the world featuring deck building elements for 1 player. It can can also be played multiplayer with up to 4 Veilwraiths, where each player must have their own copy of the game.
Players: 1 (up to 4 with extra copies)           Time: 30-40 minutes                       Ages: 12+ 
Although set in the same universe as the Kilforth games, Veilwraith is an entirely new game with completely new mechanics! Why not let the dulcet tones of Ricky Royal talk you through the gameplay...
From the award-winning team behind Shadows of Kilforth and Gloom of Kilforth: A Fantasy Quest Game - the sell-out game from Tabletop Gaming Magazine's Top Ten Games of the Year - and 1066, Tears to Many Mothers - the beautiful historical card game, nominated for a Golden Geek Award and an Origins Award and winner of a 2018 Best Art Award - Veilwraith is a new and unique adventure experience in a shattered and broken world.
VANA: In the seared lands or ‘Vana’ that has been left behind after the end of all things, fragmented memories of trapped souls continue to try to break through the shattered Veil. 
The blackened Vana lands
DEJA: Some spirits remain because of an intractable bond with the life they left behind, and some remain because of strong magicks, or curses, or the tragedy of their fate – these souls are the Deja. Their very presence threatens to drain your soul unless you can help them find peace.
The cursed Deja
ANIMA: Other more malicious entities patrol the Vana too, clinging to a shadowy vestige of wraithlike half life. They are the twisted Anima – creatures and spirits driven by madness and evil: demons, monsters, damned souls, and puppets of the Overlord Himself.
The dreaded Anima
KEYS: As a Veilwraith you are a remnant of what once was – an unearthly being sent back through the Veil by an impossible twist of fate. You must traverse the corrupted Vana, searching for and weaving together a series of disparate memories called Keys that can restore light, colour, and life to this broken, blackened world.
The Keys of the World
MEMORIES: But you are not helpless. Gifted with unusual talents you can avail yourself of powerful memories from the stories that came before; memories which are all that remain to lend hope to this ravaged land.
Let's keep this nice and simple and make sure we don't miss out on any juicy content. We're going all in on component quality as always, and we have all of the content ironed out already, so let's not hold anything back and just get this completed and uniquely gorgeous game into your hands!
As with all of our games Veilwraith is Solo Friendly, indeed it is a solitaire game. Unlike other games you don't have to manage multiple heroes, you play as a single Veilwraith against the world - or what is left of it. Multiplayer games are also possible too, allowing multiple Veilwraiths to adventure together, providing each player uses their own separate copy of the game (and expansion, if the expansion is used).
The relentless Archfiend
As many of you know, no one does art in games quite like Hall or Nothing Productions: there are over 100 unique and gorgeous images in Veilwraith, and even more in the Absolution expansion. The starkly beautiful black and white style is unlike anything we've done before - it seeks to immerse you in the colourlessness of the Veilwraith's desperate world.
To this end, we have an international team of mega artists working tirelessly to bring the broken world of Veilwraith to life, led by Mikhail Greuli and Jose del Nido.
Experience the haunting beauty of the end of the world
From award winning game designer Tristan Hall
Uniquely illustrated, broken world - hundreds of beautiful, unique images
Level up your deck of Memories over a gripping campaign
Addictive card play with many actions and options to choose from each turn
Discover the shattered beauty of the Vana lands
Bring peace to the Deja – troubled souls, trapped beyond the Veil
Vanquish malicious Anima – twisted wraiths and cursed spirits
Myriad encounters and Foes (bosses) provide unlimited replayability
1 Player, 30-40 mins (more players can join in with their own copy of the game)
120+ high quality tarot-sized cards
Veilwraith is played over a series of games or ‘Vignettes’ which together make up a Campaign. Each Vignette the player, as the Veilwraith, must collect 5 Keys, and defeat all of that Vignette’s Foes, all whilst evading the watchful eye of the Archfiend. Once they have collected all 5 Keys and defeated all the Vignette’s Foes, only then can they try to reach the Portal in time to escape back beyond the Veil and win the game.
Each game of Veilwraith is played over a number of rounds. Each round, Threats emerge from the Threat deck for the Veilwraith to try to defeat. On their turn the Veilwraith can...
Play Memory cards to improve their situation,
Combine Memories to significantly boost their available actions,
Tilt an action to make it more powerful,
Try to defeat a Threat, and
Use special Key abilities
... all in an attempt to find all 5 Keys and escape as quickly as possible to win. Each round consists of the following five Phases in which the Veilwraith does the following:
 Threat – adds a Threat card to their Threat area,
 Draw – draws a Memory card to their hand,
 Play – takes their turn, playing cards and powering up actions to tackle Threats,
 Spirit – loses Spirit, based on the Threats now in play,
 Cleanup – checks for victory, otherwise they get ready for the next round.
The base game has absolutely everything you need to play the game, but the Veilwraith: Absolution expansion box adds an insane amount of content to the base game too! In Veilwraith you can play a full 5 scenario (or 'Vignette') campaign, but the expansion adds a further 15 Vignettes in your campaign, with all new Threats and Boss Foes to vex you in your quest to restore life and light to the world. The extra 15 Vignettes follow on from the 5 basic game Vignettes, and come with their associated new Foes and Threats consisting of 138 gorgeous new cards:
15 Vignettes
69 Foes
54 Threats
The large (946mm x 446mm or ~37.2 x 17.5 inches) neoprene roll-out playmat is a stunning monochrome art print and will be in the classic Hall or Nothing playmat style on lovely, thick material, with nice, stitched edges for extra longevity. Each playmat accommodates a single player, so additional players should use their own playmats. Note that playmats are not required for play. This beautiful landscape is from the mind of the insanely talented Mikhail Greuli:  
And now, as a celebration for all of us and as a massive thank you to you guys for obliterating the £100K milestone the already magnificent playmats will now be double-sided! That's right - they will have a full gorgeous alternative art print on the reverse side, just like we did with the beautiful Shadows of Kilforth playmats...
Playmat reverse art (mock-up)
Veiled Wraith is a family-friendly alternative art pack. It is not included with the Hall In pledge as it is a separate add-on: it contains no new gameplay content, only alternative art where some of the characters are less revealing, and those who are happy with the original art should not feel it is a necessary expansion. But for those who might prefer more modest/family-friendly artwork, Veiled Wraith contains ~30 alternative art cards from the base game and Absolution expansion (including duplicates where necessary). We will offer it for £10 (it will be £15 RRP) during these final hours of the Kickstarter and for at least another month in the pledge manager too.
If you'd like to add Veiled Wraith to your pledge, simply click Manage Your Pledge at the top right of the Kickstarter page, and increase your pledge amount by £10.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is now the seventh project for Hall or Nothing Productions. Thanks to the amazing backers who successfully funded "Gloom of Kilforth", "1066, Tears to Many Mothers", "Lifeform", the "Gloom of Kilforth + expansions reprint", "Shadows of Kilforth", and "1565, St. Elmo's Pay" we have learnt a huge amount about the development process, design and file submission for the printers, and we will be working again in close partnership with our factories and fulfilment agencies to ensure the smoothest delivery of your games whilst keep you, the backers, updated at all times with monthly reports after the campaign.

Production of the cards and game boxes will take a couple of months. The art is complete already, so it will hopefully take no longer than 6 months to finish printing, but experience tells us to factor in delays outside of our control.

The final hurdle will be overseas shipping and customs, and any delays which might be caused by this process will unfortunately be outside our control. But fulfilment of all of our previous games has been completed successfully, and as with all of our campaigns: if this project funds, you will get your games.

A note on Coronavirus.

After much debate and consultation with our suppliers, partners and supporters about whether or not to launch this game right now, we have decided to proceed with this Kickstarter for these reasons:

* We have been extremely fortunate at Hall or Nothing to foster a friendly community of supportive and witty gamers - the opportunity to continue spending time with these lovely people and work together to deliver a creative project is a most welcome distraction from ongoing events. 
* We've had many requests from backers awaiting the launch of Veilwraith who we do not want to let down. At a time when we are all feeling the effects of isolation this is an opportunity for interested parties to come together and spend time doing something fun. 
* As many of us in the global community are confined to our homes we are all flocking to the internet even more than usual to engage in activities to pass the time - we want to provide a place of normalcy and 'business as usual' in the knowledge that once these horrible times are over things will return to normal. 
* Our manufacturers and fulfilment teams have strongly vouched for their ability to sustain production and shipping needs - and given that the game is ready to go there is nothing to suggest that delivery of our games would be impeded should this project be successful.
* We don't purport to be anything more than a business continuing to do business, but we do believe that coming together for a shared creative goal can make us all feel good, and also result in something cool for us to play in the coming months when tabletop games will perhaps see more action in people's homes than ever before. 
* In an effort to combat FOMO (Fear Of Missing Out) we have done away with stretch goals and Kickstarter exclusives entirely for this campaign. Also, we will do everything we can to make the game available to late backers who lack the funds or confidence to support the game at this moment. 
* Given the state of the world right now, we understand that uncertainty is rife in the global community, and if you have any reservations at all about supporting this, or any other Kickstarter - as always - please pledge responsibly! You might even consider a £1 pledge simply to join in with the community and chat for the duration (and we will be happy to refund you after the campaign should you wish).

Of the 3,000+ games released each year only a handful of games are awarded this title (basically 5 stars) and we are absolutely over the moon that TGM are already loving Veilwraith as much as we are. :D

Howdy folks!
The end of 2020 is coming, and whilst I know many of us this year feel a bit like...

Progress continues at a pace on Veilwraith as we plunge ahead through November, mainly sending files back and forth between ourselves and the printers for improvement and/or approval. We're just waiting for a second pre-production copy to be sent to us now, which will include several nifty updates. Once I approve this version we can commence and complete mass production, and we're right on track to make all of this happen before Chinese New Year and the various delays that that could cause.

 Experts in their field, years of hunting the rodents through the twisted streets of towns and cities, near and far. These mercenaries and peddlers of rodent disposal now stand on the precipice of fame and glory, all they have to do is their job, right?
OBJECTIVE
The Ratcatchers objective: To rid the city of as many rats as possible on their way to gathering as much Magical Cheese as possible.
WIN - The RATCATCHER is victorious if you achieve any one of the following criteria;
• The Ratcatcher collects 10 Magic Cheese or The Ratcatcher slays the Nemesis Rat
LOSE - The Ratcatcher is defeated if the Rats achieve one of the following criteria;
• The Rats consume 10 Magic Cheese or The Ratcatcher is reduced to 0 wounds

The Ratcatcher (Player) Turn: 
During your Ratcatchers turn, they’re seeking to vanquish rats & gather Magical Cheese. This can be done using the various skills and actions listed on the Character Board.   
Magic Cheese Tokens
Unlock/Upgrade:
Once the Ratcatcher can successfully gather some Magical Cheese then the fun of upgrading and customising your Ratcatcher can begin.  
By assigning a Magic Cheese you may unlock a chosen ability. Once active place the maximum number of the relevant tokens on the Character Board.
 The Rats (AI) Turn: 
Dependent on the type of Rat, the rats will either seek out the Magical Cheese or attack the Ratcatcher. White rats as the most numerous, and though simple in appearance their strength becomes apparent when they swarm towards pieces of cheese. Brown rats are vicious and ill tempered, set on attacking any who come close these rodents must be disposed of carefully. Black rats, are the breeders and with them comes even more rats. Each time a black rat is placed, additional rats are immediately placed. In addition to that each spawn phase Black rats count as a Spawn Point for even more rats! 
Peculiar Rats: 
The Magic Cheese can have wonderful and miraculous effects, this effect is not limited to humanity only. The rats are eating the cheese and it has had some peculiar effects on them.
The Peculiar rats imbue the power of the magic cheese forming a nasty mini boss style adversary that will complicate the Ratcatcher's quest but also offers a variety of tempting rewards should the Ratcatcher be bold enough to catch one. 
Nemesis Rats:
Nemesis Rats are true horrors of their species. The Magical Cheese has twisted their mind and body, into something spawned from the most terrible of nightmares. As catalysts of the Rat infection, destroying them is the of the utmost importance and seems the only logical path to freeing the kingdom.
Each Nemesis on top of having their own unique abilities, also has a varied Rat tracker. As the Rats collect Magic Cheese, this tracker will gain momentum, modifying the common rats, spawning Peculair rats and triggering the spawning of the Nemesis Rat. This makes each variant Nemesis a unique challenge.  
Expanding the Township:  
Township Cards - Tarot Sized Cards
The sprawling streets of Brie are the battle zone of The Ratcatcher. Filled with twists and turns it will require a keen eye to find the cheese & tactical choices to stay a head of the rat horde.  
If there are fewer than two Magic Cheese tokens in the city, then a mandatory Explore Action is undertaken. This will expand the city using additional township cards. Each new Township card will also add more cheese, opportunities to refill/recuperate & of course, more rats. 

 WHY PLEDGE NOW:
As with most projects using crowdfunding, The Ratcatcher solo adventure board game will not possible to publish without the financial commitment of backers. There are not only many costs to cover, but also the unpredictability of the market as well as gauging demand are all reasons Platypus Industries has come seeking funding via Kickstarter.

Unlock amazing via stretch goals such as extra content and quality upgrades for everyone!

Retailer Only

Keep track of the Ratcatcher's progress using Kicktraq
Aussie games design company set on creating top quality products that are unique, interesting & challenging.  
This is the first project to be launched by the company, but not our first game & definitely not our last. 
Matthew Aslin is the one-man show behind The Ratcatcher, Solo Adventure. He dwells in Melbourne, this is the first solo project but as with Platypus Industries it's unlikely to be his last.

Business Partners.
We are very lucky to be pairing with some amazing and very experienced companies to help us deliver our product in a way that is both high quality, swift & professional.

FAQ - Gameplay: 
 Solo mode only: Yes, that's right. This game is for one player only. During this Kickstarter campaign there are no plans for any changes regarding this matter. Although that is not to say future expansions will adhere to this ethos.
 Alternative Languages Rules:  Currently we have a Spanish fan made rulebook. At his time I am open to establishing French & German fan based rulebooks at this stage. These will be community based rulebooks. Dependent on demand we may seek professional translation to be available with the games commercial release. 
COMMUNITY TRANSLATIONS
 ITALIAN: A small group of Italian backers have started working on translation of the rulebook. If you're keen on helping out, head over to the BGG forum: ITALIAN TRANSLATION
   FRENCH: It looks like there may be a solution for a French translation in the near future but in the mean time, French fans, can we get a forum going for this?  FRENCH TRANSLATION

  FAQ - Pledging:
 Late Pledges: We will be partnering with Gamefound to assist with late Pledges, note that Late/Pledges & pre-orders will NOT have subsided shipping included. By backing at any level you will qualify for Free/subsided shipping should you choose to upgrade your pledge during the pledge manager.
 Stretch Goals: All Stretch goals unlocked during the Kickstarter campaign will be included FREE of charge in every copy of The Ratcatcher. Also where applicable, stretch goals will also be added to the Print and Play pledge level.  
 Multiple copies of the game: There are two options for the purchase of multiple copies, either by pledging at any level a backer will have access to the post campaign Pledge Manager (Gamefound.com), this will allow the backer to add additional copies of the game, shipping will be calculated & charged as a bundle (so you should save a bit of money). campaign.story:
A Mysterious, Magical Society...and their Website
The American Society for the Protection of Magical Creatures is a place for original, story-based online puzzle hunts created by artists, writers, and freelancers whose work has been affected by Covid19. We'll rally excellent teams of artist freelancers to push engaging, interactive content out to you as fast as possible so creators can have some much-needed extra income while you have some much-needed multiplayer, whimsical, family-friendly online adventures during the days of social distancing. A befuddled magical world for these befuddled magical times.
Our stories will relate to the archives of an old-school magical preservation society, trying to get their digital feet under them. Together we'll go through stories, explore fascinating content in existing museum websites, solve tricky puzzles, and bring the ASPMC (kicking and screaming) into the magical world of the 21st century! 
UPDATE! STRETCH GOAL at $12,000: Beginner-friendly puzzle track
Would you like to experience this game's immersive story and artwork but with more accessible puzzles? Are you worried that you - or maybe your family - could get stuck and spend too much time crunching on a particular puzzle? Fear not, our $12k stretch goal is to create a "Training Module for Beginner Magicals," a version of the game that will be easier to play for young people and non-puzzlers alike. With our ASPMC Magical Training, you'll get the same excellent content but with a lower puzzle threshold!
FAQ:
What is an ARG? 
Alternate Reality Games are immersive, interactive stories where the real world is the stage. While many ARGs are massive multiplayer, time-released events, this game is designed for a single player or small team and can be played starting at any time, at your own pace.
Explain those rewards to me again? 
10- A "thank you" on our site
25- A "thank you" and early access to the game
75- All of the above + a personalized membership induction with some extra puzzles
150- All of the above + a custom creature illustration from our artists
250- All of the above + access to all future games
500- All of the above + the knowledge that you've supported an artist!
Do you *really* have an organization with magical creatures??
We can  assure you, the Society is deeply committed to the preservation of the rarest and most magical of creatures.

We'll need to get this work out FAST for it to be helpful for you in this time of sheltering in place. We *hope* things will be back to normal in a reasonable amount of time, which is why this game needs to launch in April. It's a quick turnaround, but we're leveraging our resources and our skill sets. In fact - we've been pre-building trusting that you guys will support us and if we can get funding, we think we can have a beta out the door by the end of April.

updates.update_userinfo: Wherein we are so very close to being ready....
updates.update_content:
Hello dearest members, friends and supporters of the ASPMC. 
My what a wild ride it has been since we first made the decision to delve into modern, non-magical technologies to expand the outreach for our nonprofit! I admit we were quite ambitious and unaware of the amount of time and effort it would take to complete such an undertaking but as they say "a gamalama gets to the sworkle step by step." Indeed we have been hard at work despite an infestation of melodious warner bees, an unfortunate misunderstanding with a nest of ridgeback dragons and some minor issues with giant tunneling moskworms in the basement. Shockingly we've gone through not two but THREE groundskeepers at the ASPMC headquarters. (I can't see why other than it is exceedingly hard to hire reliable people these days.)

Greetings supporters of the ASPMC!
Alas we have been quite silent on our end but I assure you it is only because we have been so delightfully BUSY with our site and the adventures contained therein. In fact I must tell you, many things are happening and we're going to need your research assistance very soon: 
#1. Our intern, Jesse, has found an un-archived notebook while digitizing our collection which, while locked, does resembles other notebooks of Dr. T. Mandrakeseeker, a very prolific member of the society in the 1970's. Jesse is quite eager to connect with the public about this notebook and see if there's anything to discover in there. (Jesse is also extremely good with children and so we're building an alternate version of this scientific engagement for young magical people.)

Hello dear supporters and friends of the ASPMC, 
First of all I would like to thank you for your extreme patience as we furiously gather our resources to release the archives and website in a timely manner. We were hoping to have a beta by now but alas it seems that we are still a week or two away. (Jesse tells me it's called a beta, which I think is odd because it's our very first version so why wouldn't it be an Alpha? If we continue to add new things to the site are the new versions  subsequently Gammas or Deltas? But... I digress.)

updates.update_userinfo: We DID it!!! A GIGANTIC thank you to everybody!!
updates.update_content:
My Dearest Supporters of the Society for the Protection of Magical Creatures,
We are truly humbled by your generous support and we are honored by the responsibility you have entrusted in us, as stewards of the magical ecology, to do justice to these noble creatures by moving our archives online. When we started this endeavor we thought we may be able to pay 6 artists a few hundred dollars to digit eyes the collection but now with your support not only are we able to pay those 6 freelancers an honest salary, we'll also hire on 4 new artists for supplementary material and build a team of 5 new creators for the next round of adventures! And it is our intent to do all of this as expeditiously as possible.

campaign.story:
Murders By Mail is excited to bring Sherlock Holmes directly to your mailbox, in a new interactive murder-mystery featuring the greatest detective in the world!
 London, 1893.
A prominent paleontologist has been murdered, struck down by a fossilized dinosaur bone. A group of naturalists, gathered to hear the victim speak, provide an abundance of witnesses and potential suspects. The Royal Society is in an uproar and Scotland Yard is at a loss. Only the great consulting detective–Sherlock Holmes–can unravel this mystery.
Backers will become the first daring investigators to venture back to Victorian London and attempt to bring the killer to justice! The new case features:
An 18x24 map of 1893 London
  A 36-page city directory with over 500 residential and business locations
  A special edition of The Illustrated Police News, a Victorian tabloid featuring reporting on the scandalous murder
  A brochure and map for Burlington House, headquarters of The Royal Society (and scene of the crime!)
  Details on Sherlock Holmes’ hand-picked assistants and informants
  …and more!
 With Murders By Mail, you don't just read mysteries: you solve them! Part board game, part puzzle, part role-playing game, Murders By Mail is a new type of murder mystery game. Play alone or with friends–great for couples and families looking for a non-TV-based activity! All you need to play is a mailbox and a cellphone.
Gameplay is simple:
A box will arrive in the mail containing your case file. This includes a description of the crime, introductions to your investigators, plus maps, photographs, clues, and other important pieces of reference. The investigation begins here!
  Decide where you want to investigate–which leads to follow, which suspects to interrogate, which locations to visit. Each investigator has special talents, so choose wisely! When you’re ready, use your phone to send each investigator to their target.
  In a few days, a letter will arrive from your team describing what each of them have learned. New information, clues and suspects will be revealed, but remember... the killer is watching, and will do anything to avoid being caught.
  Return to the case file, review your notes, and send the team back out to new destinations. Repeat until you’re ready to solve the case!
To learn more, please visit our website.
Best of all, you can play at your own pace, taking as much or as little time between moves as you need. Cases tend to last somewhere between 8-10 moves over the course of 8-12 weeks, but everyone's game experience is unique.
Ultimately it's all up to your wits, attention to detail and deductive reasoning!
 This is a relatively simple project, without a lot of stretch goals or added features to pile on. We know exactly what's required to produce and deliver on this new case.
However, as a special offer for Kickstarter backers, we’re offering additional pledge rewards to add one or both of our two existing cases at a discounted price. They are: The Case of the Blinded Birder, an English Cozy mystery, and The Bloom of Hollywood, a noir mystery set in post-war Los Angeles.
We'll give you the option to have any added cases ship right away, or have them delivered alongside The Fellowship of Bones.
So what are you waiting for? There are murders to solve!

updates.update_content:
There's not a whole lot to mention in this update, except...
shipping has begun!
The USPS just drove away with the first flight of The Fellowship of Bones reward packages, with the second and third flights departing in the next few days. We expect boxes will start to arrive this Friday/Saturday and on into next week, with all shipments delivered by June 12.

Thank you!
We're thrilled to be able to deliver The Fellowship of Bones to you, our backers! Thank you all sincerely for your generosity and support. Now that the project is finalized, here's a short update to let everyone know what's happening now and what happens next.

As the project winds down (and nears 300% funded - amazing!), we wanted to share one more in-depth look at another investigator who'll you'll use to aid Sherlock in solving The Fellowship of Bones.
Investigator Profile: Mrs. Hudson
As we mentioned in our previous update, we wanted to stick with canon characters for Sherlock Holmes’ investigators. But why Holmes's long-suffering landlady, ? In large part because we love her so much. Not only as portrayed by Una Stubbs in the BBC’s , but also in other movies, TV shows, and in Doyle’s stories. She is a sensible and loving presence in Sherlock’s life, something of a grounding influence. She’s been a favorite character of ours since we first read a Sherlock Holmes story, and it seemed to us to be well past time for her to get more of the spotlight.

Our little project is into the back third of its funding timeline, and we're just thrilled to see it pushing past 200% (and even higher). Thank you all again so very much.
As we near completion of the project, we're finalizing many components and designs for printed materials. Many/most of these are nearly finished by the time we move to playtesting, but there's always some design cleanup and improvements to be made as we get things ready to send to printers.

Wow.
We've hit our funding goal in just four days. Thank you all so much for your interest and support, we're beyond thrilled to have hit the mark already. Our previous project successfully funded with about four days remaining, and while it was terribly exciting when it happened, the anticipation was, well... murderous. Funding on this end of the timeline is much less stressful.

campaign.story:
These quick jolts of extreme puzzling fun await everybody!
Every day (including weekends) for 13 weeks you’ll get a 9×11 easy-to-medium crossword whose answer contains all 26 letters. They will be written by Peter Gordon and Frank Longo on alternating days. The puzzles will be delivered to your email inbox in two forms: Across Lite, which can be solved on your computer, smartphone, or tablet; and pdf, which can be printed and solved on paper. All this for less than 11¢ a puzzle.
Sample Puzzles
Here are two sample puzzles. To try them, right-click on the image and open it in a new tab, and then print it. Or download Across Lite versions: Sample #1, Sample #2. (Answers can be found here: Answer #1, Answer #2.)
 Go here to sign up after the deadline.
About Us
Peter Gordon started Fireball Crosswords in 2010 as the first online-only pay-to-play direct-to-the-solver crossword. He has written or edited more than 50 puzzle books, with combined sales of over a million copies. He was the editor of the Post Puzzler, a tough themeless crossword that appeared in every Sunday Washington Post from April 2010 to March 2015. From 2002 to 2008, he was the crossword editor for The New York Sun. He is the editorial director for Puzzlewright Press, an imprint of Sterling Publishing, where he has worked for the last 23 years. He is also the creator of the iPhone app Celebrity: Get a Clue. Gordon was a member of the American Heritage Dictionary Usage Panel from 2012 until its demise in 2018. In 2017, New York Times best-selling author A.J. Jacobs called him “a six-letter word starting with MENS and ending in CH.”
Frank Longo is a full-time puzzle professional living in Hoboken, New Jersey. He creates the weekly Sunday Premier Crossword and the daily Cryptoquip for King Features Syndicate. His work also appears regularly in Games World of Puzzles magazine. His various puzzle books include Cranium-Crushing Crosswords, Mensa Crosswords for the Super Smart, Point & Solve Crosswords, The World’s Longest Crossword Puzzle, Vowelless Crosswords, Scrabble Crosswords, and over 150 sudoku and Wordoku books.
Together we’ve written Puzzlewright Guide to Solving Sudoku, Scrabble-doku, and Stupendous Scrabble Sudoku.

Do you already own my other fantasy RPG supplements that were created thanks to the support of Kickstarter backers? Then you're looking for either the $1 (PDF) or $18 (print, U.S. only) reward levels. All of the other listed rewards are for those gamemasters who missed out on my earlier projects.
Digital mockup.
While working on writing the remaining PDFs to fulfill the A Dozen Troubling Rumors Kickstarter campaign (see the project page), I ran into a mental wall and spent a weekend staring at a blank page. No matter how hard I tried, my brain was locked and I found myself unable to write. The stresses of today's challenges had, obviously, dug deep into my mind and was blocking my ability to create.
Sample page spread.
Whenever I have found myself suffering from writer's block before, I have discovered that shifting gears and working on something new is often the best way to get the creative muscles running again. So that is what I did, adjusting my focus to a collection of city sites that I thought would be both fun to create and a valuable addition to every gamemaster's toolkit.
Sample page spread, city sites.
Within a matter of hours, the outline for Fantasy City Sites and Scenes was locked down, and my fingers were jamming at the keyboard, quickly creating characters, places, and situations that were each designed to drop into a fantasy campaign. At times, I stitched together links between the newly-formed places and characters, doing all that I could to make the book a package that would instantly inspire gamemasters and add depth to any fantasy city.
Sample page spread, city sites.
City sites. Each of the sixteen locations detailed in the book is presented on a two-page spread (for a total of 32 pages worth of locations) and includes a few assorted details the gamemaster can use to add flavor to the site, as well as assorted other bits of info that vary from location to location to give the site a little personality. Hooks that may lead to adventure are sprinkled throughout this section of the book.
Sample page spread, city scenes.
City scenes. In addition to the city sites, the book also includes twelve pages of encounter ideas. Divided into two sections -- daytime scenes and nighttime scenes -- this section of the book is for those gamemasters who are looking to throw challenges at the party as they walk the city streets.
Digital mockup.
So that we don't accidentally cause project delays, there will be no stretch goals for this campaign. I'd much rather deliver on schedule than risk running late with delivery of the rewards.
I know that the lack of stretch goals will cause some of you to turn away, but I ask that you keep this in mind: The 52-page PDF reward is only a buck, making this a great deal for any gamemaster who enjoys running city encounters and adventures.
For those who missed out on the Dungeon Challenge Cards (details here), I am making those cards available as a part of this project. The Dungeon Challenge Cards final product is a 36-card deck, packed inside a custom tuck box. I am down to the last of the decks and currently do not have plans to reprint these cards. Maybe in the future, but not soon. 
The Book of Unusual Potions is a 64-page saddle-stitched work that is 5.5" (wide) by 8.5" (tall) in size and includes potions, potion ingredients, and more. Presented in a systemless format, this book is for use with many fantasy roleplaying games and is as colorful in appearance as it is in the descriptions of the many potions described inside.
Please see the Kickstarter page for more information.
Also available in PDF at DrivethruRPG.
Over the last few years, I have created four different decks of Outdoor Encounter Cards. Each deck includes 36 cards, and all of them share a common back so that gamemasters may shuffle the different decks together. For more information on this series, please see the individual Kickstarter campaigns:
Outdoor Encounter Cards
Outdoor Encounter Cards 2
Outdoor Encounter Cards 3
Outdoor Encounter Cards 4
Did you miss out on the Kickstarter campaign for A Dozen Sinister Rumors? Now's your chance to grab these 17 different PDFs and expand you collection of GM tools! 
If you wish to buy single PDFs, and not all 17 of these titles, you can find each one at DrivethruRPG.
Delayed Blast Gamemaster is a systemless fantasy RPG zine for use with most games. This gamemaster-targeted resource is packed with monsters, adventure hooks, and all sorts of random stuff. Please see the individual Kickstarter campaigns (issue one, issue two, and issue three) for sample pages and to learn more about the zine.
You can find the zine in PDF today at DrivethruRPG.com.

Digital mockup.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
After years of experience with Kickstarter, running and backing projects, combined with decades of experience in publishing, I think _most_ of the largest challenges and risks have been avoided. The book is complete, and all that remains is funding and the project review stage where project supporters are encouraged to crowdsource spotting and correcting the typos that are surely somewhere inside the work.

However, things can go wrong. As an individual, I do not have access to a company to assist with packing and shipping rewards (a friend helps!), and I have no control over life. Everything should ship on schedule, but things can (and sometimes do) go wrong. If something goes off the rails, I will post an update to explain the situation.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Do you like cute dogs? Do you want to pet every pup you meet, because every good pupper deserves pets? And do you like fun games with pretty art? If you answered yes to any or all of these questions, you're in the right place! Good Puppers is a cute game about gathering a yard full of dogs who all share the most important pupper goal: burying a nice stash of bones. A game takes about 30 minutes, can have 2-4 players (Age 8+), and is very easy to learn!

What's inside? 100 cards, featuring beautiful watercolor art of the finest puppers we could imagine. That's all you need to play! (Okay, fine, there's a rulebook too.)
As a bonus to our backers, we'll be adding a sheet with stickers to every Kickstarter copy. Do you want to put cute pup stickers on everything? Yes. 
We're starting with 1 cute pup sticker, and additional stickers will unlock as stretch goals!
How's it work?
Simple! Every round you will choose a pup from your hand, place it into your Yard and do whatever it says to do. Then, you'll choose a new pup from the Dog Park (a face-up line of pup cards) to draw into your hand. Whoever played the highest numbered pup  gets first pick! 
As your Yard accumulates these excellent dogs, they group by breed. The more matching pups you collect, the stronger their abilities become! The main objective of the game is for your pups to bury as many bones as they can in your Yard. Each bone starts out worth 1 point.   
Each group of pups has their own stash of bones. Some effects will let you upgrade (rotate) bone cards, so that they're worth more points! You'll have to cleverly plan your pupper plays to both bury lots of bones, and rotate them to increase your score.   
At the end of the game, each breed has its own bonus rule, which will give you one last chance to upgrade buried bones. Once that's done, simply add up the value of all your bones, and see who wins! (Spoiler: everyone wins, because you got to play with cute pups.) 
Rules / Print & Play:
The full game rules and a free demo print-and-play are available as PDFs, if you'd like to learn more about the game! 
Rules PDF (7MB)
Print & Play PDF (7MB)
All Kickstarter copies of the game come with the stretch goal stickers included. We ran a test-print of three of our finest pups for canvas (Wall-Worthy Pups Reward), and here's what they look like on our wall:  
With everything that's going on in the world right now, we know times are tough for lots of folks. If you are want pups and/or to support us and our artists but can't afford full price, you can back at this special half-price level with reduced shipping ($2), no questions asked. You'll still get the game + stickers, because we want to get cute pups on every table we can this summer. Cute doggos make the world better, and we're happy to be part of that! 
You can also support the campaign by backing for $1 and completing your pledge during the BackerKit pre-order phase this summer.  
 Every good woof deserves a good stretch (goal)! Our funding goal for the campaign is $10,000. If we reach that, we'll print the game, and include a fancy pup sticker in every Kickstarter copy. But what if more people like dogs? Well, then we'd have no choice but to add even more stickers! To that purpose, we have prepared a chart:

Artists
Behind the beautiful watercolor art of our pretty pups are Cari Corene and Amanda Coronado.
Cari is most interesting on Instagram and Etsy at: instagram.com/storyofthedoor and storyofthedoor.etsy.com
You can also find Amanda on Instagram and Etsy, at: instagram.com/cinnamoron and devilsbakery.etsy.com
Shipping Costs
Because of the quick nature of this campaign, and of the uncertain global situation, we're targeting this Kickstarter campaign only at the US and Canada. When we open the BackerKit for surveys and pre-orders, we hope to be able to include other regions! 
One game: $3 US, $9 Canada
Multiple items: $6 US, $15 Canada
Due to shipping uncertainties, the Support Pup and Wall-Worthy Pup levels are only available in the US.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We're keeping this project very simple to avoid pitfalls. One card game, with all its art already created and ready for print, and some stickers (we still have to draw some of those!). We don't anticipate any issues getting this game printed, but if there are production troubles we'll let you know as they arise. 

We have printing partners both domestic and abroad, so we're able to pivot should the situation require it. 

Because of the potentially volatile international shipping situation, we're keeping this campaign to just US + CA backers to keep things simple. We aim to have the game available in distribution worldwide as soon as possible!

updates.update_content: Many of you are receiving, or about to receive copies of Good Puppers! That is excellent, and a happy moment. Some of you have already received a copy of Good Puppers. That should be excellent, but has resulted in many of you actually opening the game to find a...misprinted rulebook. Somehow, a strange file-include error has caused every image in the rulebook of the card-back (with the bones on it) to be replaced with the card-front for card #00, the Loyal Lab. Don't get me wrong, he's a good pup. But he should not be in the rulebook 15 times. That is too many.

updates.update_userinfo: Time to send Puppers to YOU!
updates.update_content:
Puppers have arrived at our fulfillment warehouse, which means that soon, games will be on your tables. Games full of PUPPERS!

Supplies are arriving, and US fulfillment will be going on over the next 2 weeks. Our partners are a little jammed up with other things, but they're going to try and get the games out to you all as quickly as possible. US orders will be sent via USPS, and you should receive a tracking email when they're sent. Because of some quirks on the backend, your shipping confirmation email might list a canvas print as part of the package, even though those have already been sent. Databases, what a treat!

updates.update_userinfo: Lies, Dirty Lies, and Shipping Schedules
updates.update_content:
The only good lie is a pup, lying in the Spring mud, rolling around in defiance of its ten-minutes ago bath.

Unfortunately we are at the mercy of bad lies! The container containing puppers was unloaded at port in California on March 20. It is currently scheduled to arrive at our warehouse in Michigan on April 23.  You might wonder at this point: "Are these goods being carried by a dogsled?" And sadly the answer is no, the situation is not that adorable. Also, there's not nearly enough snow on the ground. For these two reasons, we wait.

updates.update_userinfo: Pups are close: But close enough to boop?
updates.update_content:
Update: pups are NOT yet close enough to boop, although they are in distant visual range. Things are about 10 days behind the schedule we were given, due to Customs and Oceans and Whatnot. Looks like we'll be shipping the second week of April right now, so if you've got address changes, get em in! 

We look forward to pups on your tables! They're very cute :)

Our intrepid army of replacement puppers games has made it to the ocean, this time with a better boat underneath them! Here's the schedule as I have it from the shipping partner:
At port: Feb 4
Loaded in container: Feb 11

A quick update to share info from our printing partners - we're on schedule to have the reprinted games on a boat at the end of January (2 weeks before the Lunar New Year), due to arrive at our warehouses at the end of February / beginning of March. 
Once I get a specific boat assignment + details we should know more precisely our shipping date plans. Happy New Year everyone!

The factory is immediately starting (today) on a new print run of 2000 copies of Puppers, enough to cover all KS backers and a few distribution orders. These will be on their way to us ASAP, likely arriving mid February.
So I've been on the phone a bunch this afternoon, because of this:

This means that you should've gotten an email indicating orders will be locked in after 48 hours have passed (I've also sent out a reminder email to the ~50 folks who haven't filled out surveys yet).
Once that's done, we'll start charging cards in BackerKit, and ordering shipping supplies for fulfillment later this month! Canvases will ship separately, probably before the games.

This is a short, but good update! All the copies of Good Puppers are on their way to our warehouses now, using the majestic Container Ship [REDACTED]. According to our freight partners, they should hit our warehouse the second or third week of December. As 2020 is, well, 2020, customs clearance could be weird or delayed, but we'll keep you posted!

campaign.story:
Sydney Australia in the 1920s is rife with sly grog, prostitution, cocaine, theft and fraud. Razor-wielding gangsters rule the streets, presided over by rival crime queens Tilly Devine and Kate Leigh. But you, the police, have not been idle. The holding cells are overflowing and now you must work as a team to bring together the evidence needed to convict each suspect. Take care - just one slip means a criminal walks free... 
Fallen Angels is a co-operative card game based on a unique deduction mechanism, and featuring startlingly candid mugshots of the real criminals of Sydney at the height of the Roaring Twenties. It's designed by John Kean, the brilliant mind behind the award winning solo game Black Sonata. Fallen Angels was also the big winner of the 2018 54 Card Game Design Contest, winning multiple categories including the Best Overall Game.
Rulebook PDF
Print & Play Files
Shipping will be charged after the campaign is completed through the pledge manager. The shipping rates listed below are estimates and may change based on 2020 shipping rates & final production weights.
US/EU = $3, Rest of World = $4
Note: Additional copies can be added to your pledge free of charge! Just add the appropriate amount to your pledge per additional copy.
Because of the small footprint & price for Fallen Angels, all fulfillment single copy orders will come from China either directly or through a local courier. This allows us to keep shipping costs low for everyone and get games out to backers even quicker than normal. We used this process for the fulfillment of Orchard without any issues.
For our EU backers who order multiple copies and backers in Sweden & Denmark, we will ship those orders from inside the EU to avoid any customs charges. If you have any additional concerns about customs please let us know and we can address them.
It would be an honor to have Fallen Angels on the shelves of retail stores! Please back our campaign at Retailer Pledge level and we'll contact you after the campaign closes to hammer out the details. If you have any questions during the campaign please contact us at orders@sideroomgames.com.
For Licensing/Localization inquiries contact michael@mobvanguard.com.
By day, John Kean is a mild mannered ecologist working to save the world from damaging bugs and diseases. By night he mostly sleeps. And in between he enjoys playing games, making music, juggling, mountaineering, trashy crime fiction and long walks on the beach with his family. Sometimes all at once. He doesn't like Brussels sprouts, but pretends to in front of his children.
Brett wasn't born loving board games like the rest of these nerds, but came to realize an affinity at a much older and saltier age. His appreciation for boardgames was born from a long history of video gaming. He may not be able to tell you the difference between an area-impulse euro and a modular board deck builder, but he brings a unique, somewhat outsider perspective to Side Room Games.
In the daytime Michael is a Software developer but at night he’s a gamer. He first started playing video games when his parents got him his very own NES for Christmas, and the rest was history. Some of his best memories as a kid was playing Chrono Trigger and Earthbound. The thing Michael looks at the most in a game is a theme that’s rich and well integrated into the mechanics. When he’s not gaming, Michael enjoys spending time at his home in the mountains, as well as kayaking and hiking with his family.
Alan is a software engineer during his day job, that translates into a fascination with game mechanics and the algorithms that power his favorite board games. He has been a life long video gamer and fell in love with the board game renaissance 10 years ago. He enjoys many different board game genres, and a good mechanic above all is his focus.
Dustin has been playing board & card games since he was beating his family at Pitch back in junior high. He's a highly trained Microsoft Office Engineer. He was also able to trick his wife, Christa, into marrying him and their 3 kids are too cute for their own good.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our fifth Kickstarter project and we have worked extremely hard to prepare ourselves for the task. We’ve learned a ton of lessons on our previous Kickstarter campaigns and we're even more prepared for this campaign. While we can’t guarantee problems won’t come up, we are confident we have done what we can to ensure things run smoothly. When it comes to the game itself, it’s ready to go! We're working to finalize all of the art and graphic design and we’ll be ready to send the files to the manufacturer shortly after the campaign funds. The game is small and super simple, so we don’t expect any issues with the manufacturing and shipping process. And, we're using the same manufacturer who did a fantastic job on Orchard so we expect the same high quality with no major issues.

Throughout the process we will be sure to inform all of our backers on how things are going and if any issues arise.
